I even made a few trips to Best Buy so I could handle and use each size to compare the two, as well as other brands.  I figured that the larger 8.9" size was best for me because I need reading glasses now and I was a little hesitant about the smaller screen model.  I also joined Amazon Prime when I bought my Kindle and the instant videos are fantastic.  I've had my Kindle about 3 months now and I've ordered more books than I ever would have thought because there are some great low prices (for me - $3.99 and under) on many wonderful books on Amazon.  I am wary of which games I download because of permissions but am totally hooked on the few I have which were either free or cost $1.99 or less.I bought my Kindle because I was going to be starting dialysis and I didn't want to use my laptop on a shared network and of course because the Kindle Fire is so much smaller and lighter weight.  It has proved to be no problem to hold for long periods of time and is very comfortable to use.  Movies are clear and beautiful and many of the ones I watch are subtitled and those are very easy to read.  Typing on the keyboard is easy and never annoys me unlike trying to use the tiny one on my Dell Mini 9".  I have not needed to purchase a stylus and doubt that I will.  Wiping the screen with a microfiber cloth keeps it clean and print-free, though I am very careful and protective of my Kindle.  I bought a strapless neoprene carrying case that fits perfectly into another neoprene carrying case with handles as my intention was for the Kindle to bounce when tucked inside it's protection if it ever falls and I think it just may do that.I ordered the charger with my Kindle because I didn't have any other that I could use and it is great, too and was only $10.00.  The only function that really seems to eat up battery power is playing games but in one 6 hour dialysis session, I can easily watch a movie, read a book, and play games all on one charge.The only drawback is mine, nothing to do with the Kindle.  I live very rurally and my internet connection is beyond slow, so I have to load movies when I visit friends who have high speed connections, but I just load 10 or 12 (at perhaps 2 minutes per movie) and they remain on the Kindle more than long enough for me to watch one per dialysis session (every other day).  Books load with no problem, despite my ISP.  An operator at Amazon said that he'd worked there for 9 years and never seen anyone with as slow a download speed as mine!I am enormously pleased with my Kindle Fire HD and still cannot believe I own it.  Furthremore, I bought it for $250 with free shipping on a special one day offer from Amazon and that discount made a huge difference to me.

Reviews.Title: Price dropped today! Amazon allowed return or price match!
Reviews.Author: Weesie
Reviews.Content: I opened my Kindle Fire 8.9" 16 Gig and then went online to get more information about the new case. I saw that I could have had the 32 Gig for the same price today as I paid two days ago. I called Amazon and they told me that I have 30 days to get a refund of the difference or upgrade to the model I want. I love Amazon! I will be able to upgrade to the 32 Gig 4G LTE for less than the 32 Gig Fire HD would have cost me two days ago. They will not allow a direct exchange, but they will email me a return label and I can purchase the upgrade. I am happy and love Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD rules
Reviews.Author: Crazy about Coffee
Reviews.Content: Now I can read my books, listen to my music, play games, download aps and watch tv shows and movies.  The picture quality is fantastic, great definition and it's the perfect size.  Best buy I ever made.  Everything about my Kindle Fire HD is user friendly. I can find ratings, descriptions and obtain new books, music games, download aps, tv shows & music when ever and where ever I am.

Reviews.Title: Excellent device
Reviews.Author: Daniel "God is my judge" "Cigar Man"
Reviews.Content: Purchased for wife for Christmas. She absolutely loves it. Has lots of features and free apps. Beautiful screen. Would purchase again.

Reviews.Title: A Convenient Companion
Reviews.Author: Airbus30B
Reviews.Content: The longer I have this Kindle, the more I love it. I read books with it, and love the way I can let the voice read to me while I follow along with the text. Although I have a Samsung HD Plasma TV in my room, I like most of the time to watch movies on this Kindle, the HD picture is so sharp. I use Amazon Prime, and also download YouTube videos to it. The internet works fine on it, although I prefer to do most of my internet surfing on my desktop computer. I'm 58 years old, this technology amazes me. I have downloaded many apps, most of them free, some fairly cheap to buy. Most of what I do download in the way of apps, I eventually clear out of the Kindle, finding many of them not so useful to me. One app however called FSWidgets is very useful to me, I use it in Microsoft Flight Simulator 2004. I have a customer review on this app if your interested. Never having owned any other tablet, I can only base my rating of the Kindle HD 8.9 on what I've experienced, the past month using it. I think the price is great, although I think Amazon should throw in the charger for free.

Reviews.Title: Better Than The Samsung Galaxy Tablet
Reviews.Author: Frank Turner
Reviews.Content: My wife has the Samsung Galaxy Tablet and loves my Kindle more. Crisp picture and great sound. Easy to use and a multitude of Apps. Sure the Ipad had more bells and whistles but to me it's not worth the $700.00. I love it at a fraction of thge cost of the Ipad or Galaxy.

Reviews.Title: It's Awesome and cost much less than the IPAD
Reviews.Author: PHIL WILLIAMS
Reviews.Content: Bought this item for my wife for Christmas. She loves and it operates awesome. No need to spend nearly double on an iPad, plus this has Dolby sound with dual speakes. Very Nice! Would recommend this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle.
Reviews.Author: Deiby Garcia
Reviews.Content: I bought this product because I bought last year the Kindle Fire 7" and was so happy with what it offered. I got my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" and couldn't be happier. It looks awesome. It's not as heavy as I thought it would be. Didn't have to overpay for it like I think you do when you buy an IPAD. This product offers the same thing withoug being overpriced. I love reading my books on it. I would recommend this product for sure.

Reviews.Title: Hesistant at first, definitely glad I bought it
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I wrestled with the decision to buy this. I am a broke college student and wanted to get myself something for Christmas and decided to give this a try, mostly because I looked ahead at my future textbook requirements and saw I could rent them on amazon prime and the tablet would pay itself off within about a year. I am so glad I bought this tablet. Had it about a week now, been glued to it since. It's not an iPad, but if you aren't planning on using it as a heavy duty work tablet and you are mostly going to use it for books (first thing I bought was a book and it is beautiful, feels completely natural reading it), textbooks, games, and watching movies and videos, this is the tablet for you. I love it and I am extremely glad I bought it. If you are hesistant, just try it. It is an excellent price for an excellent tablet.Also, I wanted to add that the sound is incredible! It sounds like surround sound when I am lying in bed watching a movie.

Reviews.Title: It's the best tablet at any price
Reviews.Author: Z. Guo "Z"
Reviews.Content: **Hardware**Kindle fire HD 8.9"  has 254 PPI (pixels per inch), and the iPad III is just 264 PPI. Kindle fire HD 8.9'' gives 33% more PPI than iPad mini. Kindle Fire HD also uses wide polarized filter and luminated the touch surface which makes it more colorful and reduces 20% glare.Kindle fire HD 2-core OMAP processor can do 12 billion FLOP (floating point operations per second) which is 50% faster than the 4-core Tegra 3 processor used by nexus 7. Kindle fire HD 2-core OMAP processor also gives 7.3 MB memory bandwidth which is 40% faster than Tegra 3 processor used by nexus 7. Please ask someone who knows computer architecture on the reason that a 2-core processor can be faster than a 4-core processor.Kindle Fire HD has dual speaker and Dolby sound. Both iPad III and Nexus 7 have just single speaker and no Dolby sound.Kindle file HD supports dual band wifi and has dual antenna which is 41% faster than iPad III and 54% faster than Nexus 7. Kindle fire HD also has MIMO which enhances signal strengths. Neither iPad III nor Nexus 7 has MIMO which means the echo of the radio frequency weakens the signal strength.Kindle Fire HD stands out easily with its superior hardware and it delivers better experience when watching HD movies and reading books and magzines.The 199$ 7'' Kindle Fire HD comes with 16GB storage while the 200$ Nexus 7'' comes with only 8GB. The 16GB Nexus 7 costs 249$.The 199$ 7'' Kindle Fire HD and the 8.9'' Kindle Fire HD come with 1GB RAM. Nexus 7 also has 1GB RAM. iPad mini only has 500MB RAM.The Kindle Fire HD (both the 7'' and 8.9'') has HDMI output. Neither iPad nor Nexus 7 has HDMI output. How painful it would be to link to a HDTV without HDMI?**Content**Amazon ecosystem has 20+ million songs, 100+ thousand movies and TV shows, and 1.7 million books (without counting free books). Among the books, 15+ thousands have audio companion books. Amazon also allows Kindle lending library. Don't forget Amazon also has Kindle Direct Publishing books, which makes 27% of the top 100 kindle books sold. Kindle Fire HD uses Android so it can run almost all Android Apps (just download the apk first and then install).Google's ecosystem has only 4+ million books (after counting free books), millions of songs and thousands of movies and TV shows.Apple's iTune has only 1.5+ million books (after counting free books),  millions of songs and thousands of movies and TV shows.** Software innovations **Kindle Fire HD has the following features (which I think neither iPad nor Nexus 7 has):  Whisphersync for books and games.  Immersion reading for audio books.  X-ray for books and movies.  Parental Control.** Cost **Kindle Fire HD 8.9'' costs 30$ less than iPad mini. Kindle fire HD 7'' 16GB costs 50$ less than Nexus 7 16GB.Kindle Fire HD does not force customers to buy a charger. The charger can be bought together with Kindle Fire HD for just 10$, and  20$ if it is purchased separated.** Customer Service **Amazon is very customer centric.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Big D
Reviews.Content: I have had my Kindle Fire 8.9" for about a month now & I love everything about it. It exceeds all my expectations. I wanted something bigger than the 7", yet smaller thatn the 10.1" of larger tablets. It's still small enought to carry in a purse. All features are great!

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd 8,.9
Reviews.Author: deaneane delong
Reviews.Content: this is the BEST gagget ever invented !!! I never thought i would have to have something other than my cell phone to play when i was board but now i have my kindle and i NEVER leave home without it !! Ive got games and movies always ready when i am & the perks of prime is awsome love streaming free movies

Reviews.Title: Great tablet at a great price
Reviews.Author: Walter Gross
Reviews.Content: I just got this tablet and I love it. I have the old kindle fire and this is a very big improvement. The screen is fantastic but in my opinion the biggest improvement is the faster processor. The old kindle fire could be unresponsive at times. That problem is gone with the new better processor. Also the wifi is wicked good. It picks up five or six networks where other tablets pick up just one. Finally, the old kindle was a little thick and clunky.  This is very thin and light. I was thinking of getting the 7 inch Kindle Fire HD. I'm very glad I spent the extra 100 dollars and got the 8.9 inch version instead. It is totally worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: Love this bigger and brighter Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Barbara T. Canario "Bobbie C."
Reviews.Content: I bought the 1st Kindle Fire 7" and let my sister try it and she wanted one so I ordered her the Fire 7". Passed my original Fire 7" to my granddaughter who encouraged me to go bigger if I was going to order the Fire HD.  I'm so glad I did. Love everything about it and can hardly wait to watch a movie on it this week on my long flight to Florida from Hawaii. I've owned every Kindle that was made and I keep on upgrading and passing on my used ones which family and friends are happy to receive. So far Kindle readers have never let me down.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Awesome Tablet (added more)
Reviews.Author: Haywood "Haywood"
Reviews.Content: My short initial take on the new generation of Kindle. My Kindle Fire HD 8.9 arrived earlier today. I was very anxious to open the package and get my hands on this baby to see how it felt. First thing I noticed is the quality of the build. Excellent all around. I fired it up, using the optional quick charger I bought with it. Had it registered and software updated within 10 minutes or so. The images on the screen are crystal clear with vivid and true color. I played an Eric Clapton YouTube video right out of the box to see how the picture and sound quality were. Very impressive, to say the least. The speed between my WiFi and the Kindle is great. No flutter, no hiccups, just a fast and consistent connection. I surfed the web a little bit and this new Kindle HD moved effortlessly through the pages I browsed.I have many more things I want to try on this new tablet, and I'll get around to it when time allows. That said, my early impressions are WINNER WINNER Chicken Dinner. This thing is top notch. We have a first generation Kindle Fire and use the heck out of it. The new generation is everything I expected and so much more. I also bought several of the Kindle Fire HD 7" tablets for family members. I fully expect they will enjoy them a bunch. I have an Apple I-Phone 4S and think it's a very good phone. I tried the I-Pad out, and while it impressed, for me, it was severely over priced given what you get. I'm not bashing the I-Pad at all, so please don't you Apple FanBoys come out and attack me en masse. LOL I know how sensitive Apple users can be. Look, they make very cool stuff, no question. My problem is this. Simply put, it's way over priced. All you have to do is look at their profit margins. For me, the new generation Kindle HD is right in my wheelhouse. It's priced very well for what it delivers. I am a BIG time Amazon junkie too. I buy a ton of stuff from Amazon and have never once had a bad customer service experience. Buying the Kindle HD was a natural fit for me. I am looking forward to using it a ton.I'd like to take a second to thank Jeff Bezos and his great team for bringing us an affordable tablet with top notch quality and features too numerous to mention. I love Amazon. I'm a customer for life.More to come, stay tuned.Added this >>>>>>>>Battery life on this 8.9" Kindle Fire HD is simply outstanding. I seriously can't believe how long the juice lasts. Outstanding!!!As I add apps to my Kindle, I am even more impressed with the flexibility of this tablet. And whoever said the app store is lacking is seriously mislead. there's a huge variety of superbly done apps.I use my Kindle a TON. I can't tell you how impressive this tablet is. And when I consider what I paid for it, I can only once again say a huge Thank you to Amazon's Team kindle. This tablet is everything and a lot more than I expected. The scary part is, I'm just getting to know it. Thank you Jeff and team. I'm a thrilled customer/user of this tablet and of course, Amazon in general.

Reviews.Title: Nice Tablet
Reviews.Author: Dianne A. Van Voorhees
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to get the new Kindle Fire HD. I use an iPhone and have iPads in the house. I also have a Kindle with keypad that I love. This new device is well made and has a beautiful display. The web browser is awesome. I was surprised at how many apps were available for the Kindle Fire. I set it up with my multiple email accounts, calendars, and contacts. This lead to my first real disappointment. It's not possible to sync my Outlook contacts or calendar from work. While I don't need this device for work, it starts getting annoying when I have to put it down and reach for my phone to see all of my calendars and contacts in one place. The next issue I had was the power button. It's hidden so well in the frame of the device that I really have to search and almost need to actually look at it to find it. What's the big deal? Well, I like the iPhone and iPad's obvious wake button because I can get to it right away without searching for it. And, since I thought this new Kindle with its backlit display would be nice for after dark reading in bed without waking my husband, I would appreciate less awkward fumbling in the dark to turn the thing on.That leads to my next complaint- this thing is too big for reading in bed. I can't lie on my side and hold it propped up with one hand comfortably. And, it's a spotlight shining at my husband's side of the bed when I do.Finally, though it has a lot of apps, most aren't free. So, to have apps I use on my iPhone or iPad on the Kindle, I have to pay. That's jarring since I've used many if them for free on the other platforms. And, the app I use most often is Facebook. The Facebook app on iPhone is annoying. But, on the Kindle Fire, it's nearly useless. And, if you think that autocorrect is frustrating on iPhone/iPad - you will be as frustrated by Kindle's auto correct spell checking feature. And, possibly frustrated with what seemed to me a slower keyboard.If I didn't have a familiarity and daily reliance on my synced email, calendars and contacts, or constant need to check FB, I'd be completely satisfied with this Kindle. Alas, I don't like putting a fancy expensive device down to use another to get information I need/want. So, it's a 4 not a 5.

Reviews.Title: Media Consumption Monster--get this tablet!!!
Reviews.Author: Thorr
Reviews.Content: Not going to go into a long detailed review of the Kindle Fire HD.  There are many others out there since this model has been out for quite some time.  But I will add that this device does exactly what it advertises.  If you are looking for a "media consumption device" then the Kindle Fire HD is for you.  It is NOT a productivity device!!  I repeat...do not buy this if you are expecting to get caught up on your spreadsheet building, PowerPoint presentations, Word documents or photo editing.  It is not designed for that nor is it marketed for that purpose.  The Kindle Fire HD is a media device and that is all.  It excels at playing high quality HD videos/movies, music, games and works wonderfully for browsing the net.  Can other devices do the same stuff and maybe even more...yes.  Can they do it at this price point...no.I have not signed up for the 4G LTE service so I can't speak to that.  I only use mine on Wi-Fi and it works great.  I got the 4G LTE model because it was so discounted as a refurb and I wanted the option of signing up for the 4G LTE service in the future.Also, if you are like me and already very involved with the Amazon ecosystem, there is no better tablet.  I believe it would still hold it's own even if your not heavily involved in the Amazon ecosystem but it probably won't be the shining star when separated from the ecosystem.  Overall, a solid 5 stars and I would recommend this to anyone ans especially people involved in the Amazon ecosystem.Oh and the refurb Kindle Fire HD that I got was new.  I mean I even inspected the entire device with a bright flashlight specifically looking for a blemish of any type.  Nothing.  This is a new device and works just like new.

Reviews.Title: Very well pleased met and it exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: Joe  J
Reviews.Content: I had the smaller Kindle reader with 3g since it first came out so this was an amazing upgrade.  All my books in the smaller reader (which I find I want to keep) were readily available in the 8.9 in fact they sync between the two and both readers remained activated, all at no cost to me.The 4G is good stuff to have and fast, also!  I Skyped from a hospital room so my ill wife could talk and see her son.  I made a quick check on an important prescription availability from my car.  The browser is powerful and easy to use.Reading on this Kindle is a treat.  I bookmark and highlight when I read, and it is so easy to do on this one.  There are lots and lots of good apps for this.  Unless I need online services, I read in airplane mode and battery time really gets extended but it's very easy to switch back online, it only takes about 5 seconds.I could go on and on but there is nothing that I don't like about this.

Reviews.Title: Tablet Novice here, read on if you identify, leave if you're a know-it-all
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoMan
Reviews.Content: So I pick up on technology a bit late, usually a few years late. This review is meant for late comers like me, people who are tech savvy but choose to wait out for the new tech to mature and then spend 25% of the initial cost.Was hearing a lot about everybody replacing their notebooks/home PC's with tablets and upon seeing Asian tourists takingpictures at Hoover dam with these instead of their cameras, I decided to enter the 2010's.After doing the exhaustive research as you have to do for any buying decision nowadays, I narrowed down my choices to Kindle 8.9HD, Nexus 10.1" and the iPad 10", felt like a cheat at BestBuy where I went to check out all my choices without any intention of buying them there.  I decided to go with FireHD as the intended use for me is to watch videos, read emails, view PDF's and light spreadsheet work, the deciding factor was the price, stereo speakers and most importantly the screen resolution.Must point out that the Amazon AppStore does have very limited offerings, I hate that the kindle OS does not let me read my gmail emails on the app I downloaded from the 1market store, the other apps I downloaded from there do work, including the google maps which saved me from returning this tablet.So, in conclusion, here's the gist:1) Great product for Amazon-Heads, people who are married into their system with prime membership and so on2) Great product for limited use like basic email/spreadsheet/doc work, watch video on netflix/prime, view PDFs etc., NOT a great  product if you're designing the next city center or the next new gen car...sorry had to take a dig at the reviewers who make it  sound like these are the reasons they are buying the higher end tablets3) Great product when looked at as an alternative to the more expensive and a bit bigger screen sized tablets, which by the way  are only about an inch bigger, I'd rather save the $2004) Now if you are an advanced user and still reading this review, you know there are ways to root the latest Google OS on this  devise and have it run just as efficiently and smoothly, this bit of info is only meant for tech savvy novices who like me are a bit  lazy but do want the newest OS to run on their investment :)

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I was looking for.
Reviews.Author: Multi Media Addict
Reviews.Content: I have had my Kindle Fire for about a month now and have no complaints.  It is exactly what I expected and wanted.  It does not have all of the functionality of an iPad, but it is not supposed to.  I use my Fire as a media delivery and communication tool.  If you want to do work or have a replacement for a laptop, this may not be for you.  I wanted something with a great screen and sound for video for watching movies on planes and while traveling.  Movies look and sound fantastic.  As far as other online activities, I use it for e-mail and general web surfing and it does all of these exceptionally well.  Now that Amazon has auto-rip for CD purchases, I have the majority of my music available via the cloud as well, which was an unexpected benefit!

Reviews.Title: It Does What I Want!!
Reviews.Author: James Gilbert
Reviews.Content: I researched affordable tablet options and upon a great offer on the Kindle I pounced.  I enjoyed reading the reviews of some users..massive litanies...with some helpful information.I really did not know what to expect from this tablet.  But I think one must ascertain what they expect and want from a tablet or any device.  I realized that I wanted a device that had good battery life, web browsing, music, movies and book availabilty, maybe some games...sort of a media device.  The Wi-Fi reception was a great selling point.The Kindle has exceeded my expectations.  An example:  I was watching Amazon Prime Movies via my Blu-Ray dvd player with wi-fi and the signal faded for some reason.  I picked up my Kindle and the movie was there at the same point it had stopped on my dvd  player..I resumed watching on Kindle.Another example:  I purchased a CD from Amazon 6 years ago..and to my surprise I received an e-mail that the CD was being added to my Cloud Player for free.  I didn't even remember I had the CD! Nice touch.I had some questions and some slight user issues.  I emailed Kindle service and I will tell you, the customer service wasamazing.  Very helpful resolution. One issue was with my email account that I had changed password on.  I could not get the Kindle to accept the password.  I sent an email to service and they advised I should call them to resolve the issue.  I requested a call from them on the Amazon site..within a split second my phone rang and I was assisted very professionally.I am still discovering my Kindle.  I'm not sure that books will be easy to read.  I must adjust brightness and perhaps chose a different background or font.  The HD resolution is outstanding.I recommend th Kindle Fire HD 8.9 very highly.

Reviews.Title: Blown Away by Display
Reviews.Author: Doc Wittmer "DocWittmer"
Reviews.Content: This is one fantastic device.  I have had several others, including the newest iPad and Motorola Xoom.  I sent the iPad and Xoom off to Best Buy exchange to get gift cards.  I ordered the Fire because I wanted something that was more portable and easier for my wife to use with little computer knowledge.  I think I am going to keep it instead!!  HA!  The device is so easy to use and the picture quality is exceptional.  The screen is large enough for 2 to watch a movie in bed without discomfort.  Yes you need to buy a charger or use a USB charger.  If you have any USB charger for your iPod or iPhone or other electronic device it will work and they are really cheap anyway.  Also, if you want to watch movies on your TV through the micro HDMI port then you will need to buy a cable.  Make sure you buy the micro and not the mini as the mini will not fit the Fire.  They also make converter tips for a standard HDMI cable if you don't want to purchase the cable.

Reviews.Title: Best tablet for a college student
Reviews.Author: Anne Gray
Reviews.Content: (Writing from my moms amazon account)This is by far the best tablet that you can get for a college student. Yes it is not an iPad people...but through that it allows me to not be distracted as much as i would be with an iPad or an actual android tablet. The fire definitely contends with all other tablets and is plenty powerful. I myself and a computer junkie and i use this tablet over my macbook pro whenever i can for the portability as well as functionality. I love this thing and take it to every class and have it due everything for me simply a must have for any college student.

Reviews.Title: Glad I held out for this product
Reviews.Author: Sharon Mcdonald "Travel mom"
Reviews.Content: I am loving my new kindle. I had the second edition, i think it was the 2nd.  I had the one with the keyboard, I loved this one and took it with me every where.  When I heard about this larger screen with HD I started saving up for it.  The larger screen is awesome.  I love reading my magazines on a tablet now.  The display is crystal clear.  Amazon Prime movies are instantly available to watch.  Great investment.  I am so glad I got the 4G LTE wireless edition.  I love being able to search for something right away and not having to wait until I get home. I was hedging between an iPad or this.  I selected the kindle because the library of books I already had with my older kindle.  I am more a reader then internet surfer but with this product I can do both anytime, anywhere!!!  I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with the product.
Reviews.Author: Encourage thinking "xena"
Reviews.Content: I purchased 3 for holiday presents for my hubby, son, and myself.  At first, we were happy, but a bit confused since there was no manual.  Our initial impression was well... they look nice... but what do they do besides look pretty and you can read books?  I purchased a manual and now we're thrilled.  Love them! I had read the reviews before my purchase and knew enough to go ahead and purchase the charger.  Surfing the web is a little strange, but I expected it to be different than a PC or laptop.  It's fine.  The facebook app is a little less than wonderful, but it's fine.  What I've been so impressed by is HD screen.  It's everything promised.  We haven't owned any of the previous Kindles so I have nothing to compare my experience with, but I love reading a book with the Kindle HD.  It took me forever to struggle with my feelings about e-readers because of my fear of publishing companies losing jobs, etc., compared to my wish to save some trees.  Quite a problem for my deeply held convictions, but I talked myself into it.  I LOVE IT for reading books.  Yes, I will still order books (it's the only way I can justify it in my mind) but when I've finished a book in a series and I don't have the next, or the e-book only novellas or supplements, it's great.  I can read after my husband has gone to sleep without having a light on.  Lamps never seem to put out the correct light for reading or you have to sit where you're not comfortable.  No problem with the Kindle.  You can read anywhere.  My son loves the fact he can read out of print or free books.  I got one for him especially because when he goes to college next year he will have no place to store all the books he reads.  Trust me, you can hardly find his bedroom furniture under all his stacks of books (he has filled up his bookshelves to maximum limit).  So, for college students who read a lot, it's perfect.  My husband does a lot with facebook, surfing the web, and playing solitaire.  He is thrilled he can use his Kindle as opposed to sitting with his laptop on his lap.  They're perfect.  We are all thrilled.  Just make sure you get a book so you know what all the Kindle contains.  There's a lot of stuff you won't even know you have.  It's pretty loaded.  But you have to have a manual to tell you where to find them.

Reviews.Title: What a wonderful upgrade
Reviews.Author: C. Bowman
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying the Kindle came right on the day it said it would. Thank you, Amazon. You open up the box, and there is your new 'toy'. I bought the charger when I purchased the Kindle so I was ready to go.I have had the Kindle Fire 7" since last October '11 and loved it.  I used it every day to read, check mail, search the web, play games and watch movies from Droid TV. (great app). I also have a Galaxy tab 10".When Amazon came out with the HD 8.9" I couldn't resist.  I received it yesterday and cannot put it down.  The HD is wonderful.  Sound is much better than on the 7".  I don't have to strain to hear music or movies.  Over all, it is a wonderful upgrade from the regular Kindle Fire 7".  As for the ads people mention; I don't even see them.If you are considering buying a Kindle, this is the one.  You will not be disappointed.Also, I needed some questions answered about transferring my old Kindle 7" to a family member, and the email service I received from Amazon was awesome.  Very quick to respond.  Thank you again. Also the Swype for the keyboard is a great time-saver.

Reviews.Title: Fills a great niche
Reviews.Author: Edward Hrybenko "Ed H NY"
Reviews.Content: I love my iphone, use my wife's ipad and have owned the first nook and nook tablet.  After a week with the Kindle Fire 8.9, I have very few complaints and far more praise:The great:- Perfect size for a commuter:  Can be held easily when sitting and standing on the subway.  Very light.- Perfect size for content:  WSJ, Sports Ilustrated, GQ, movies, books all look great. Love the easy navigation for digital publications- Nice, simple layout:  Didn't need much of a tutorial.  Carousel, simple settings page, top navigation all easy to use- Amazon Prime: A great deal if you order often from Amazon and want free content for your Kindle- Price:  I bought during a one day sale for  about $250.  With the free content, can't be beat.- Screen: Text and video crisp and clear- Sound: I used to have to take my nook tablet out of the case to hear.  Not with KindleThe ok:- I haven't paid to avoid ads yet, but I'm close.  Not great with random things popping up as your home screen- App selection: Hoping it improves.  Strong with medai, weak with games. Not much out there.The rest:- I was torn about buying the Amazon case based on mediocre reviews, but I think it's fine.  About as slim, sturdy and light as possible, which is exactly what I was looking for.  If you want more functionality and visual appeal (better stand, leather, etc) you'll end up with extra weight and bulk.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my new kindle fire HD! I'm personally not an apple kinda gal but did consider getting the ipad since it's one of the top tablets out there. My bf loves his ipad but playing around with it I learned that I do love the menu buttons that the ipad lacks. I did also look at the nook, asus, and other tablets and decided to go with the fire hd and couldn't be happier. I already own the samsung galaxy s powered but android and this kindle runs in a very similar was so the transition wasn't that hard. the graphics are great and the battery life is awesome. I play sims on it a lot which tends to drain the battery when i play on my phone but with my kindle it lasts a few hours of playtime no problem. I'm able to download most of my phone apps on my kindle and skype works great on here too. Very satisfied with my purchase and the price couldn't be beat. I bought the wall adapter in the same purchase as my kindle to save $10 on the adapter price (when purchased together). If you're debating on which tablet to get. Get what's best for you, not what's popular. For me, the kindle suits all my needs.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 32 GB!!
Reviews.Author: CK
Reviews.Content: I am having so much fun with this Kindle Fire HD 8.9 32 GB!I already have the 3G older Kindle which was great for reading books but when my 83 year old Dad showed me his 7" Kindle fire, I fell in love with the idea of being able to play movies and look at photos on a Kindle.A year later my husband asked me what I wanted for Christmas and so I started my research on Kindles!I chose the larger size KIndle Fire HD because of my less than stellar eyesight and the speakers sounded better than the 7" version which I tested at BB. I chose the 32 GB version since you can never have too much storage space and doubling the storage was worth the extra $70.I also chose the Kindle over its competitors because I love Amazon and their products and their super easy to navigate website. After I discovered the location of their free ebooks, I have oodles to read and for free and Amazon also offers lots of ebooks under $3.I connected my new Kindle to my PC and it was very easy to transfer my photos and favorite music to the new Kindle...did all this without reading any instruction manual just the old trial and error method.My personal videos were harder but found a free converter link to convert my videos to mp3 so they could be viewed on my kindle:  [...] The Freemake converter was the only one I found that was totally free and didn't put a watermark on your video and was super easy to use too!I also transferred from my PC some of my adobe format ebooks. Still figuring out how to move them to the books tab but for now they show on the kindle carousel and read just like the regular Kindle e books.I chose the Defender Otter box to house my kindle since it comes with the screen protector already in place.It does make the Kindle heavier but makes up for the weight since I just rest the kindle in the otter box tray on my lap. The otter also makes the volume and on/off button easier to see and the touch screen works perfectly with the Otter screen protector in place.The only defect I found on my Kindle was a tiny pin prick sized hole in the center of the glass. The screen protector from the Otterbox makes the tiny hole invisible. I hadn't noticed the pin prick hole in the glass until I had already downloaded all my stuff so decided to keep the kindle since the hole has not affected the performance or appearance.I clicked on the "web" tab and was easily able to bookmark my favorite websites. I had no problem accessing them and didn't have any freezing problems.I purchased the DVD Hunger Games through Amazon and was delighted to find it also in my Amazon cloud. It was very easy to also download onto my Kindle device. The picture was crystal clear...truly HD quality and it was a blast to watch the movie on my kindle...speakers worked great and it also worked great with the ear phones I already had.I joined Amazon prime and loved watching the free streaming tv shows...watched the first Star trek episode and several episodes from Glee so far...all free and easy to access. Also "borrowed" my first book and am reading it now. Only downside to the book per month that we're able to borrow is that they're not new books.As for the "advertising" shown on the kindle it is ONLY on the lock screen and did not distract at all from the kIndle so save your $15 and leave it on!I've been using my Kindle since Dec 23rd and absolutely ADORE it.I highly recommend the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 version!

Reviews.Title: Family perfection
Reviews.Author: Huckleberry
Reviews.Content: We have (too many) kids, and the youngest are not quite ready for unfiltered internet access or admin-level privileges on any device, so the deciding factor in our purchase was the Free Time.  We're a pretty digital group, with many PCs, an assortment of laptops, this Kindle, iMacs, several iPod iterations, a smaller Android tablet and a Transformer, and a very wide, full assortment of smart phones (S3, G2x etc.), so a weakling is quickly routed out and abandoned.  And yes - they are all capable of playing nicely with each other on our network (no easy feat).The Kindle is simply perfect for what it is, and performs at least as well as we had hoped.  The display is rich and compelling and the ergonomics are good.  The Amazon flavored Android is glitch free, and while some settings are veiled, with some time they can be found and optimized.  For Amazon content, it is very nearly perfect; the delivery speed is excellent and the chance of a kid or uninformed adult accidentally screwing things up is minimal.  The Free Time is what sets it apart, and in a VERY good way.  Our teenagers have Android tablets also, but the younger kids would have no idea how to manipulate settings or install anything if it involved anything more than a click, so we got this purposely for a 7 (8 in days) and a 9 y/o to be able to read books, watch appropriate videos, play some learning type games and, in a perfect world, learn something while having fun.  They continually bicker over my wife's iMac and tie up the main TV on Netflix, so we wanted to get them their own devices, namely this and a Win8 laptop.  In retrospect, the jump to W8 at the same time as adopting a distinctly flavored Android variant was a little taxing, but we're working through it.  The trades between the new laptop and the Kindle are carefully negotiated affairs, and the only user complaint is the time it takes to recharge when the battery dies (and it IS used until the battery dies every single time).The one disappointment (beside the missing SD slot we knew about beforehand) is the difficulty of accessing the PlayStore on the Kindle.  It was fairly easy to get the Amazon content onto the Asus tablets, but another thing entirely going the other way.  This brings to light the main difference between the Kindle and any other tablet; while the Android units are more or less designed to be easy to change, root, mod, and restore if it goes south, the Kindle is not.  Being under warranty has prevented  any attempt to root it, and they've done an admirable job of making the garden walls high and sturdy. I'm sure that at some point a non invasive method of getting PlayStore apps to run will be figured out, but for now (given the ages of the main users), Amazon has everything we need on this device, and with Free Time, there is very little chance they'll access inappropriate content or brick the unit itself.  We also have iProducts galore, so the notion of controlled access and throttled content is not new to us, but at the same time, there ARE some things on PlayStore that have no equivalent on Amazon, and it would be nice to be able to access them on the Kindle too.The sound is MUCH better quality than any other tablet (and 99% of the laptops), but due to the sheer number of devices in use at any given time, headphones are the norm here.The bottom line is that the display is absolutely gorgeous, the download speeds are excellent, the content is great (and growing), and the technical skills needed to use it are nil.  For tech averted adults or growing kids, this is the ideal tablet.  It never hangs, crashes or misbehaves like it's speedier, more adaptable but less stable counterparts, and Free Time alone should warrant a very close look if you have younger kids (or a technophobe) in the house.

Reviews.Title: 20 3/4 stars!
Reviews.Author: Shanks
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife... Wish I hadn't. Now she's been sucked into the world of Kindle. The house will never be the same again.

Reviews.Title: Ooooh Boy!!!!
Reviews.Author: Mike in Illinois
Reviews.Content: I LOVE MY KINDLE!!!  I have an original Kindle Fire as well, and I use them both every chance I get.When I was first introduced to the "Amazon Experience" with the original Kindle Fire I was impressed. And after viewing the Hi-Def  display of the Kindle Fire 8.9" I am amazed. It has gorgeous bold colors, a crystal clear picture, and GREAT Dolby sound! What's not to love? Oh, and if you love to read, you can easily personalize the page color and font size so it looks the way you like it, making reading anywhere a joy.... If you want the best in content and really solid hardware, you can't go wrong here! Find a friend who has one and take it for a spin, you'll see!  I have other tablets, both Android and Apple, they are great as well, but the "Amazon Experience", in my opinion, is best enjoyed on a Kindle Fire... I LOVE MY KINDLE!!!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful design!
Reviews.Author: Sally Balmer
Reviews.Content: This tablet is sleek and feels nice in your hands. The back has enough tack to keep it secure on your lap. The gorilla glass should stand up to any punishment. The HD display is crisp, colorful and it's connected to Amazon. What more do you need?

Reviews.Title: Beautiful tablet but disappointed
Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: What I do Love:The size is perfect! Feels great in your hands. Not super heavy. So you can comfortably read without your arms hurting from holding it.  I do love the picture, It's beautiful. I like the speakers, and the case I bought to go with it fit perfect, looked good and functioned great. The carousel was a nice feature to me. I'm a prime member and I buy a lot of stuff from Amazon. I already have two of the Kindle readers and love them!. I really wanted to love this tablet but I just really don't . I hope the bugs get worked out and I will buy again. :( I was so looking forward to this.I don't like:The Silk browser doesn't give a very good user experience. It crashes often. i was  being asked many times to restore tabs. There were times that the whole tablet was unresponsive while using Silk, and it reboots after 2 or 3 minutes of being frozen.  Silk slows down a lot and begins to shutdown your previously opened webpages. When you return to them it reloads everything again so you lose information you've already typed in. For example: filling out forms or cc info. The Facebook app stinks. You can only see a few posts and the rest is blued out. You can access just fine by the browser but that brings you back to the browser problems.  Plus No Instagram.... BOO

Reviews.Title: Kindle Loving Momma
Reviews.Author: C. Sanabria Damron "smart shopping momma"
Reviews.Content: Love this! Have had my new Kindle since Christmas. Still love my Fire but this one is amazing.  The sound quality is great, images are amazing. I have watched movies, played games and read books to name a few things. I also ordered the Bluetooth wireless keyboard and quite frankly I enjoy this more than my Laptop. Am still trying to set up my printer to this, probably just operator error lol No question this is amazing and I know a few people that are envious of the quality for the price and they spent lots more for an IPAD... so sad.

Reviews.Title: Had to side load flash player but once that was done just as Satisfied as my first fire purchase was.
Reviews.Author: todd kross
Reviews.Content: After having the First generation Kindle fire that came out in 2011 and loving it for all of 2012 I decided I wanted the 8.9 kindle. The 7 inch was perfect for reading but a little small for surfing the internet. A ten inch tablet would have been to big for reading comfortably in bed but great for the internet. Amazon introduced the 8.9 inch which is perfect for reading and perfect for the internet.The only issue I had was it would not open my email due to the lack of flash player. So I had to sideload flash with the dolphin broswer. This is very simple to do and YOU DO NOT HAVE TO ROOT OR JAIL BREAK THIS TO DO THIS. So you still keep the manufactures warranty. You just have to check the box under your settings to allow 3rd party applications. Then download dolphin and flash, or safari and flash or whatever android browser you like to use as the flash will not work with the silk browser. The kindle still updates with all of amazons new updates. Picture quality is amazing, touch screen is ultra responsive, browser is very fast, and sound is clear and loud. The weight of this kindle is the same as my older first generation kindle fire, that my 2 year old now inherited.I also purchased a blue tooth keyboard and a stylus for this one so I use it like a netbook. I purchased the ad version that displays an ad everytime you take it out of sleep mode. At any time if you don't want the ads you can sign into your account and pay to have the ads removed. They don't bother me so I left the ad's on. Thank You again Amazon for another amazing kindle. My only hopes for the future of this kindle is that an update for flash will come out and I will be able to once again check my email from the silk browser instead of the dolphin browswer.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant!
Reviews.Author: Big_Mike
Reviews.Content: Did side-by-side comparisons versus the iPad mini and Nexus 10 before deciding on the Kindle Fire HD 8.9". Great value for the money!I bought one for myself and one for my 26 year old daughter and we're both very pleased. We decided we didn't need a full featured tablet, since we already have powerful ultra-light notebooks and top-of-the-line smartphones, so this fit nicely into our needs. Great as an eBook reader, with very good media options for listening, watching, and generic internet access (including emails).The initial set-up of the Kindle HD Fire was fast, easy, and intuitive. My daughter & I both downloaded books from Amazon's library and were impressed at the ease & speed. I downloaded a 6 novel set of Tom Clancy books (7-12) in a matter of seconds. We also "upgraded" the Kindle to 32GB, paid $15 more for the "without special offers" option, and glad we did.The only (minor) complaint I have is the PowerFast charger is extra and not included in box, Fortunately I already knew this, with some advanced research, and we made sure to buy the charger (at a discounted price) with when buying the Kindle Fire HD 8.9". Being able to charge the Kindle using a USB port on another pc is ok, but being able to charge it with a standard electrical outlet makes better sense.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift
Reviews.Author: Rhino
Reviews.Content: I bought my wife Kindle Fire HD for her BD and after she started using it, I fell in love with hers.  I couldn't get her to trade my Nook Tablet for hers!! (I thought it was a good idea, she didn't think much of it) Then for Christmas she gave me a box and inside was my own Kindle Fire HD.  WOW, was I happy and surprised.  I am really enjoying it. Great for movies. I like the idea it has a bigger screen as at 76 I do have some seeing problems and I can make the print even larger.  I am even more pleased now that I have my own.

Reviews.Title: Real Nice Tablet
Reviews.Author: Thomas E. Bennett
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Fire HD 8.9 with 32 gb of memory, without the ads and with the plug in charger and I am pleased with my tablet. I might have given the tablet 5 stars if it were not for the ads and plugin charger. Note to Amazon: just increase the price up front and take care of these two complaints.My family has five Kindle products (Keyboard, Paperwhite, Fire, Fire HD 7" and, of course, the Fire HD 8.9") and we like all five especially the Fire HD's. On the 8.9" the extra screen size really makes watching movies more enjoyable and reading is better. I was really surprised by how much more I enjoyed reading because of the screen size (not to mention the HD resolution). It is just easier on the eyes. The new screen also has less reflection than the old Fire.The camera addition is a good one. We enjoy using Skype for family contact and find the camera resolution to be very good.The dolby sound on the 8.9" is great. You can enjoy movies, music or games without earbuds and/or sound boosters. The dynamics are super, too.As this tablet has the best processor of the Kindles it is more responsive even though I find surfing the web to be a bit sluggish at times. Still a nice improvement over lesser Kindle models as one would expect.This is a good size for a tablet for the things noted above, but I find it a bit large and heavy for reading in bed. You will agree if you doze off as I did and have it thunk you in the head. That is where the Paperwhite shines with its reduced weight and size.Overall, my impressions of the Fire HD 8.9" are very favorable and I recommend it if you are not tied to the Apple world. There are better tablets out there but I think you will pay more for them.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Shannon Curran
Reviews.Content: I initially bought it for myself, but my husband is enjoying just as much as I am.  I have not downloaded any books yet.  I use it for the games and the internet mostly.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TABLET FOR RETIRED BEACH BUM!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: ONE DAY AT A TIME
Reviews.Content: I've had a 2nd generation Kindle for 3 yrs. and with the boom of tablets now available I knew I wanted more than just an E-reader.  In comparing the top brands my choice was the Kindle Fire HD 8.9".  I had an Amazon gift card for $50, so I upgraded to 32 GB.  This was my Christmas present to me.  In the past three weeks i've been having a ball.  First off all the books from my old Kindle where added to the Kindle Fire HD.  Set up was so easy.  Leaning to use my new Kindle and all it's functions have not been difficult.  I have become a Prime member, so the Movies and TV shows that are availabable at no cost to me are wonderful.  With nothing on TV but reruns at this time, I've enjoyed several movies and whatched all of Downton Abby.  I set up my E-mail and Facebook accounts, even added a few games (had never played video games before) and downloaded music I like for $2.99 an album.  Books are my  # 1 with me, so it's great to see them all lined up by their covers on the Kindle Fire HD bookshelf.  I am far from a "Teck-Geek".  If you are able to do E-mail on your computer, operate a cell phone, and can read and follow directions, you can operate a Kindle Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: Great Kindle, poor app selection
Reviews.Author: Richard K. Bruns
Reviews.Content: The kindle itself works great but, the app selection is VERY poor. I would of given the kindle 4 or even 5 stars if the app selection wasn't so misserable. I bought this primarily for my wife who wanted it for the books and it's great for that, so is sound. The product as a whole is awesome and works fantastic. had I known the app selection would of been so bad though, I probably would of bought a Google Nexxus tablet instead. But, with Amazon Prime, the books and movies will be a nice addition.

Reviews.Title: It does everything i wanted, and More!:)
Reviews.Author: carole gray
Reviews.Content: I like everything about it!!  light , easy to use,  . All I will ever need! very pleased!  Thank You!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Joan Gooder
Reviews.Content: This newer version is so.... much nicer.  The speed is smootherl, the visual aspect is cleaner and clearer.  This truly makes reading books and viewing movies more enjoyable.  The web access is almost seamless.  Received item before the deadline time.  Support staff very friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: Love my new Kindle.
Reviews.Author: D. Kremer
Reviews.Content: Got Fifty dollars off and love this new Kindle. I own a smaller one but this one is so much better

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Alan Golden
Reviews.Content: It is a perfect size and weight to carry on a plane and watch movies as well as read books

Reviews.Title: kindle fire HD 32mg
Reviews.Author: Joshua
Reviews.Content: I purchased my new kindle hd because I fell in love with the kindle fire.  I love to read but hate carrying around books as I travel.  Now I do not do that any more with my kindle.  I still have not used all of the features but the ones that I have are more than awesome to me.  This kindle like the others are so user friendly that anyone over 60 can use it without any issues.  I had asked if the HD would  have a camera and when I received the "YES" answer then  I was sold.  When it was time to pre-order.... I jumped on that wagon and put in my order and now i can skype my family and  look at movies and listen to my all time favorite music.  I am  in HOG HEAVEN....  I highly recommend this device.  Enjoy your time learning all about its many features.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: matc mans wife
Reviews.Content: I previously had 7" Kindle E- Reader, which I loved so much that I upgraded to the Fire HD .  This is much bigger and does a lot more than the reader. The picture quality is amazing and it is very easy to use. I find myself watching TV shows on it. Sound quality is very good as well. The only complaint I have is that I spend too much time playing games!

Reviews.Title: Great present
Reviews.Author: Kimberly
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my husband for Christmas and let him have it early....he loves it will definitely buy another Kindle

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Joe Pennington
Reviews.Content: I LOVE MY KINDLE! No I won't give it up ever! This is a awesome little computer and I wish I had bought one when they first came out instead of waiting.

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire HD 8.9!!!!
Reviews.Author: Kim Hruby
Reviews.Content: I had been anxiously awaiting my Kindle. I wasn't disappointed. There is so much more to this than just being an e-reader!  I love it that it has audible capability while reading books. I also love the sound on this thing. It's like having surround sound. I love that you can access the web easily and I absolutely love the larger size. It is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: my 3rd series kindle
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: this is my 3rd kindle, 2nd fire. i am very happy with the 8.9, the sound is alot better than the 1st edition fire.  at 1st i was worried about the ads, but they are only on the start up screen (the one with the slide lock), worth saving the $15. i have been an amazon consumer for about 5 years now, and i will stay with them. the customer service i have received from them has always been great. and that is the reason i will stick with them in the future.

Reviews.Title: My Two Cents
Reviews.Author: L. Rubin "Larry"
Reviews.Content: I have had my kindle HD 8.9 for about two weeks and delighted with the quality of the product given the its relatively modest cost.The kindle HD 8.9 excels as a media consumption device for kindle formatted books and audio books. I did have an issue with the audible website not recognizing the Kindle HD.  I was able to download the audio books from the kindle, but initiate the download from audible.com.  I'm not sure if anyone has had that problem, but it's not a big deal pulling the books down from the kindle.I was able to easily side load Maxthon as an alternative web browser to Amazon's silk browser.  I run several other androids app including New 360 and YouTube, and Netflix.  Netflix performs very well which is consistent with what other reviewers have reported.Rather than go with the $499 and ATT plan, it has made more sense to use my smart phone's Hotspot feature so I can browse the web when I don't have WIFI available.My advice to prospective buyers is to define your goals and make sure the kindle features line up with what you are trying to do.  Also, read the description of what you are getting so we don't get any more reviews complaining the charger is not thrown in and you the kindle doesn't support flash. Also, I can't see myself taking pictures with a tablet so personally back facing camera doesn't seem that important.Overall, a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: First Tablet
Reviews.Author: lizbeth
Reviews.Content: I have only had it a week but it is becoming as easy to use an my regular Kindle. I am a reader and I like the double page format. It is like reading a hardcopy book. I'm glad I spent the extra to get the 8.9 screen.

Reviews.Title: This is a great tablet
Reviews.Author: Smart Shopper
Reviews.Content: I truly do love this tablet.  I have been a dedicated kindle reader since the first ereader ones came out several years ago.  I thought about buying a tablet but the cost of the apple was just too high, especially when you can buy a laptop for less.  Finally Amazon released the 8.9" tablet and I decided it was time.  You can't beat the price, the quality, or the functionality.  I have shown this to several of my friends who own the apple product and even they are impressed.  It is a great reader, web surfer, mp3 player, game player, and even movie player.  In the end it boils down to is if you are looking for a reasonably priced tablet that can do anything you want then you need to get a kindle fire.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Mimi
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle but my grandkids love it more.  I wish I could buy two, as the 2 boys are constantly fighting over who can play which games (which are free!).

Reviews.Title: I love my kindle
Reviews.Author: Kimberly
Reviews.Content: I got the 8.9inch 32G Kindle Fire HD  with wifi and its the best tablet available. The price is also fair for all that you get. The picture quality is top notch and  I can plug it into my Tv with an hdmi  reg to micro cord to get prime or netflix shows or movies with smooth streaming. I have had my regular kindle for over a year now and I still love it for reading because it is not backlit but I use my Fire for everything else. I would recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: jc
Reviews.Content: This was the best purchase that I made this year. The comparison chart with ipad was very helpful to me also helped me with decision to purchase. Easy to use and happy that no setup required. I had forgotten that no charger was included and will need to purchase asap.Love every detail about product and show everyone that have a desire to purchase a tablet my Kindle.

Reviews.Title: great device
Reviews.Author: Christopher Walker
Reviews.Content: I am now using my Kindle Fire way more than my IPad 3. I find since I am a prime member I get more from it than my ipad and the screen quality is not that much different and the sound is better. I how ever feel the back is a bit slippery.

Reviews.Title: To Fire HD or not to Fire HD
Reviews.Author: jaldeuce
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying I am moderately tech savvy.  I could not blog for hours on nuances of android operating systems or systemic differences between Nexus 7 vs. Fire HD.  I am the average user that wants a tablet but hates to be tied to Apple and its runaway proprietary chain that comes with all of their products.  I had the original Kindle and the subsequent Fire and I liked both for what they were, simple...more so for Kindle, a little less so for the Fire.  The Fire was buggy.  I have found my Fire HD is also buggy.Problems:Web Browser: I received the notice that my web browser was not responding, this happened 7 times within a few minutes until I was forced to restart my browser.  It was a nuisance out of the gate when I am simply trying to read the news.Google:  It appears the only way I am able to voice/video chat is through Skype, which means I have to subscribe to another service and pay a fee for a number.  I know Skype is great and useable around the globe...so is Google+/video chat.  There is no Amazon App to use Google+/video chat.  Also the web browsing version is scaled down to the point where I cannot actually web chat through the browser.LTE:  My mistake but, I thought part of the increased payment for the HD W/4G LTE was the initial year of 4G service for $50.00; a great deal.  I did not know that I still had to pay the $50 after the fact.  Small sure, but all these small things begin to compound.Not problems:The screen is so much more vivid.  External controls are a major plus.  Sound is fantastic, and battery life is quite good.So if the above problems do not factor against you, I think you will be pretty happy with the Fire HD.  If you are like me and stopped using ITunes, have a Prime account, and order almost everything from Amazon, the HD is a great purchase. Unfortunately Fire HD is less functional than I need it to be.  Otherwise it is a great piece of gear and you should Fire HD!Some updates after further use:Problem:Power and Volume Buttons: Simply put they are too close, I shut off the screen a couple time while trying to adjust the volume.  Perhaps in the next iteration, these buttons are on either side of the tablet.Not Problems:Ads:  I have noticed the ads but not found them to be a major distraction to my use of the Fire HD.  I get the ad at start up and I believe I have seen the ad one other time but it was not a distraction from my overall Fire activities.Silk:  Since the initial bugginess, I have not experienced any further problems...I don't browse a lot with the Fire (thus far).  I am a creature of habit and go to the same sites or apps over and over again.Apps: yes, I do miss some of my Apple Apps, mostly I miss AutoBlog.  I am not a real car guy but that app excited me because it distills the important car info that has come out without having to trek through a dense website.  Other apps, I don't miss and most of the good ones I get: Stumble upon, Flipboard, Shazam, etc...Google integration:  I like the instantaneous integration on my Google calendar, address book, Gmail throughout my Samsung galaxy III Smartphone, Fire HD, and Apple Computer.  I still miss Google+ video chat on the Fire HD, I have to do that on my phone.WiFi Streaming: I watched a full HD movie last night via Prime, I have the lowest data speed via my internet provider...no buffering, no diminished picture; it was a fantastic experience.  The image quality of the screen and the movie was simply amazing.  The volume never distorted through the speakers during loud scenes or heavy bass.  Same goes with streaming music, never a problem, fantastic sound quality.HD Port:  I have yet to try this but, I like the idea that I can plug this into my HD TV and stream Prime, I will let you know how the picture quality translates.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Victoria I. Reeve
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and fun!This is my first Kindle so I'm still exploring.I would recommend this for a friend or loved one for Christmas!

Reviews.Title: Love the kindle fire hd 8.9
Reviews.Author: Susan Hildebrand
Reviews.Content: love the kindle fire hd.like the bigger size. It,s much like the IPAd but at a much better price. I wish the camera was a a flip camera so I could take easier pictures.

Reviews.Title: An Excellent Alternate to the Apple iPAD
Reviews.Author: Stephen Kovac Jr.
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9 tablet is an excellent inexpensive alternate to the Apple iPAD. I am very please with the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 tablet. I use it in lieu of my Asus thin notebook. It works great for email and the silk browser is fast to search on the internet. I also do online banking when I am connected to a secure Wi Fi network. It is easy to shop online with this tablet. If you are looking for an inexpensive alternate to the Apple iPAD take a look at the Kindle Fire HD. It is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: Improvement from Original Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Sarah L. Bernardo
Reviews.Content: I have used my original Kindle Fire EVERY single day since I got it. I just stopped using it when the new one arrived. So let's talk pro's & con's between the Original Kindle Fire 7" and the new Kindle Fire HD 8.9PRO'S:*Bigger Screen*Vibrant HD Display*Slimmer design & more comfortable to hold.*TV & Movie's sound amazing with the dolby audio.*The keyboard is bigger and more comfortable to use. And now it even underlines your miss spelled words in red so you can correct them!*Amazon Silk browser is faster & more compatible with different websites. On the older model some websites wouldn't cooperate and let me scroll so I would have to use Opera Mini browser to get around that.*Volume controls on the outside now!*Speakers are spaced out better*Finally a webcam & mic to Skype or take pictures and videos.*HDMI connector.CON'S:*No more Adobe Flash. Which means I can't view videos on some websites, because Adobe is no longer making it for Android or mobile devices. Which means on older websites that still use flash instead of HTML5 you cannot view videos. (Original Kindle Fire had flash installed).*Certain games that you may have purchased for the original are not compatible yet with the Kindle Fire HD 8.9".  (Facebook App is not loading newsfeed correctly on the 8.9, it stops loading after about 12 newsfeed updates).*Silk Browser seems to crash more often if you have 'Accelerate Pages' box checked in browser options. (Maybe an update will address this).*TV & Movies sound amazing with the dolby audio, but I found playing music through the speakers didn't have the same quality. And there's no equalizer in the newer model.*Lot's of Ad's. Supposedly you can pay $15 to disable all the ad's permanently. But, I did find in settings/applications you can turn off some of the recommendations. The only thing you can't disable is the ad's that show up on the screen when it's locked.All in all I'm quite happy with my new Kindle Fire HD 8.9. There are a few bugs that need to be worked out with different App's and the Silk Browser, but hopefully updates will correct those issues.

Reviews.Title: Coming into the 21st Century
Reviews.Author: Janice M. Burns
Reviews.Content: Well, I finally decided to go for an electronic device that I could use as a reader, as well as, giving me access to my apps. I love the Kindle Fire. It's easy to read, get and use apps, and access my internet accounts. And the HD screen is incredible.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire hd
Reviews.Author: Valerie Jones
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my kindle fire.  I have already downloaded books, magazines, games and watched a movie.  Love it, love it, love it!!!

Reviews.Title: Best $299 I have spent in a long time!!!
Reviews.Author: T Teel "T Teel"
Reviews.Content: OK - This is my 4th Kindle. I had two b/w kindles and the 1st gen Fire and now the 8.9. For the cost - I am very impressed. I wish the on button was not next to the volume button and I am not really sure what that other connector next the the USB isfor - Video??? - but it runs all my apps much faster and since I have already loaded then on my Fire - they are ready to load on the 8.9 - very cool! If you want to upgrade from the Fire - this is a no brainer!!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle FIre HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: R. Jones
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews of the 7" KFHD I have no complaints about the lack of a charger or Flash.  I already had a Kindle KB charger and a cell phone charger both of which work fine with my 8.9" device.  That said, I am really liking this device.  The color is fantastic, sound is great and have learned very quickly how to navigate on it.  The only thing I don't like is the carousel.  I would prefer to have a desktop like on my PC and have apps and websites represented by icons.  Tapping would open an app or connect to a website.  I sent feedback on this to Amazon today.  One minor complaint about a couple of apps I downloaded:  tried to open them multiple times but each time they would quit working.  I paid a small charge for one but the other was free.  Have not watched any videos or movies but probably will over the Thanksgiving weekend.  All in all, Amazon, a great device!  Oh, and one more thing, somebody please, please make the Scrabble app work on the KFHD.It is Dec 7 and I have had my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" for 3 weeks. I had a few minor problems figuring the device out but managed fine on my own (I am 83) and have everything resolved.  The Battery HD app works well to keep up with battery charging.  I am enjoying game apps and have watched movies (since my earlier review).  My only difficulty is that my hearing is very bad and I have to use earphones to be able to hear dialog in movies. The control buttons are not a problem and I know exactly which port is for the USB charger. I still give it 5 stars.  There have been too many complaints about the design of the KFHD but no device will ever please everyone!  Still want good quality Scrabble game for this device.

Reviews.Title: Super Tablet
Reviews.Author: The Patster "Pat"
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet great! It automatically connects to my wireless router and brings up my home page very easily. And it is really fast. Checking my e-mail is a breeze as well as surfing the web. My games are so much more fun on the larger screen. I have 3 Kindles of various types and sizes and use them all depending upon what I am doing. I love them all!

Reviews.Title: Great product, but has WiFi issues
Reviews.Author: Glenn Robinson
Reviews.Content: I love the size and weight of the Kindle Fire HD.  The display is outstanding.The only real issue I have is that the WiFi seems to freeze for up to 30 seconds, especially on Facebook (both the app and web), as well as some of the news apps (CNN and USAToday).  With the CNN app, I get a "stopped responding" message, which then reloads the app.  I've tried disconnecting and reconnecting the wireless connection with no improvement.  I haven't been able to find anything online that addresses this issue.  This happens once or twice every 30 minutes or so.  If I could get this problem fixed, this product would get 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Seniors Beware!!!!
Reviews.Author: Spokane WA
Reviews.Content: My first ever tablet so thought I was buying the best for the money I had to spend. For all you guys used to electronics you are going to think I am sooooo dumb but I am going to be honest as maybe someone else out there has the same issues.Package arrived and I was so excited, I bought this mainly to skype with my family in Europe but also to have internet at home. Well turned it around and looked everywhere, could not find the on/off button! Nothing on this tablet is obvious if you have not experienced a tablet before.I do not have the luxury of young ones at home to help me I had to figure this out by myself. As I had paid with foreign currency, even thought the kindle was delivered to an American address, it was all set up for a British user. Really?One has to go through Amazon to get this sorted out and it did take almost 2 hours and 3 agents on the phone!OK, for starters I am thinking this is not a good idea!I had purchased a keyboard and charger after reading the reviews, thank you people. Using the screen is awful, as someone said it keeps typing wrong letters and no matter how careful you are it still does it when you are hitting the correct key, words and forgetting spaces!!!! This is not user error as I spend all my day on a keyboard and know it well.....I ended up bringing it in to work and let our techie look at it to try and help me out. To dumb it down, he regrets recommending this for me as he was not aware how proprietary the aps are. Meaning I cant get chat on facebook, other reviewers state the same thing, many of the aps are not available on the kindle.I have had it for almost a week and am no further forward than when I received it.Granted the screen and volume are excellent but so is my computer, it is very slow even with a great wireless signal, it freezes often and for a senior not user friendly.So, I have a professional computer guy arranged to help me set up the sites I need and skype. If this does not work to my satisfaction I will be returning it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet for movies and reading books/magazines
Reviews.Author: gusdpr
Reviews.Content: I bought my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 in Best Buy more than one month ago and I definitely like it very much. Using Amazon prime to shop and watch videos is totally a pleasant experience. Using the micro hdmi cable plugged in your TV is an amazing feature to watch videos. Performance is OK, not the fastest tablet but for reading a book, watch movies and shop Amazon goods you don't really need a huge power house, and it is not expensive compared to other tablets. It has a vivid screen with excellent resolution ideal for reading books and magazines and watch photos and movies in full HD. I like the speakers a lot, they aren't very loud but sound quality is way superior to other tablets I have. So far this device has become my primary tablet, I use it every day to read the news, emails, books and browse the web instead of using my smartphone.The reason I'm giving 3 stars is because unfortunately the tablet is still plagued with bugs and crashes easily with the Silk browser. So far the bugs that I have caught are the following:+ The Silk browser delivers a very bad user experience. It crashes very often even if you just leave the tablet idle while reading a webpage, you will be asked many times to reload your tabs. In some cases, the whole tablet is unresponsive while using Silk, and it reboots after 2 or 3 minutes of being frozen. If you try to open more than two websites with the tabs, Silk slows down significantly and begins to shutdown your previously opened webpages (when you return to them it reloads everything again so you lose track of what where you doing) this is really bad if i.e. you are filling a form or making a payment (you need to enter all the information again), I would expect this behavior to happen when you open around 5 or 6 websites to prevent running out of memory perhaps, but not 3 tabs. You can side load Dolphin browser to mitigate these issues, however there is no excuse of why Silk performs so poorly.+ The keyboard input has a considerable lag, you can't write too fast since it will begin to miss key inputs, this forces you to write slowly (lag is less/more depending on the application you are using). Also something quite annoying I found is if I press the space key in the left/right edges while in landscape (just below, the 'x' and the 'b' keys respectively) it doesn't register any input even if you get the sound feedback you did press the key, to make it work you need to press around the center of the key.+ If I transfer 1080p videos from my smartphone they don't play properly. However 720p videos work fine.+ Sometimes the calendar app is shown as a gray empty rectangle in the carrousel instead of showing the correct date.+ It happened to me that while using the Shop application and the Silk browser sometimes I see black rectangles randomly in the screen (seems like a rendering issue from the graphics processor), most of the time going to the homescreen and returning to the app fixes the issue. In the case of Silk, reloading the webpage makes the trick.In summary, the tablet excels at watching movies, reading magazines, reading books, playing games and shopping amazon goods. Up to date it performs poorly as a web browser so if this is your priority task you may need to look for another tablet or wait until this is fixed by Amazon (I would rate 5 stars if the previous bugs where not present).Note: All the issues above have been reported already to Amazon, hopefully they create an update to fix them.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Nat
Reviews.Content: I thought this would be daunting, book to read, all kinds of technical stuff, nothing.....you just need to sit with it, play with it and in a couple of hours you're moving around like a pro...very simple for someone who is technically challanged like me.  Great gift.Voice is great, picture is great.  I can sit and read in the dark unlike my original Kindle...I love it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Greqo
Reviews.Content: I ordered two of these and they were delivered to my house on the 20th of November.  In my opinion, these tablets were best value compared to others I looked at while shopping for tablets.Screen operation is smooth and seamless. For the most part, things were pretty user friendly as the initial start-up of the units took us through a simple tutorial of the basic function.My only "con" to this product was the USB cable that was supplied with the unit which is the primary charging cord for the tablet. Neither unit would charge off the packaged USB cable. After 3 calls to Amazon Customer service I had come to the conclusion that if this was working as intended, I was going to re-package both units and send them back to Amazon for a full refund. If I couldn't charge the tablets with the supplied USB cables, there was no point in keeping them.As was always the case with Amazon, they were willing to supply us with the adapters that plugged into the walls at no cost to us. I am no expert but I have come to the conclusion the USB power stream is not enough to push power into the Kindle Fire 8.9" battery.  You may convince me of that if it were not for the fact that I had two brand new units, both with the same charging problems.
