This may be something Amazon will wish to address in the near future.As long as the outlet adaptor and cable they are sending me work in charging this device, I will gladly recommend it's purchase to anyone. I will give and update to this in the near future.***Update*** Change from 4 stars to 5 due to Amazon's Customer service and how great they were in resolving my issue.

Reviews.Title: I am in love!
Reviews.Author: Jill Genn
Reviews.Content: I received my new kindle on Friday (earlier than expected) and it has exceeded my expectations. I  was very happy with my 1st generation fire, but this is a huge upgrade! The picture and sound quality are amazing, the browser is lightening fast, and the reading experience is excellent with crystal clear print and images. Having done some research before purchase, the lack of an included charger was not a big deal. The ads are not intrusive and I enjoy browsing the recommended books and  apps as many of them are of interest to me.As with any new device, there are a few minor issues that could be addressed. The e mail app that is preloaded will not work with my verizon account, although tech support tried everything to help me. I was able to use another email app in the app store an  that worked well, so the  problem seems to be with the app, not the fire.

Reviews.Title: Happy,happy,happy.
Reviews.Author: Glenna Ernst
Reviews.Content: I have a 7" Kindle I purchased three years ago.  I didn't know what a tablet was,but thought it sounded like fun. I purchased it to be able to listen to the audible books as my sight is really bad.  Oh my what a wonderful purchase this was. This past fall I purchased the 8" , and I am happy,happy,happy!  I'm 79 years old and have had surgery on my right eye.  With the Kindle I am able to listen to books AND able to read them as well.  I am so "happy". Seriously, this tablet has opened the door to a world I thought was gone for me.  Not only do I read and listen to books, but use it for everything I would do on my PC.  Why? Because I can!  Love it, and my friends now have the Kindle fire.  We are learning new things all the time. I have looked at other tablets, but they do not come up to the standard of the Kindle. Would not purchase any other brand.

Reviews.Title: Still has issues
Reviews.Author: Mary Miintline
Reviews.Content: This is my third one, the first two were returned for multiple problems. So far, this one has fewer issues, but still,they are annoying. It locks up constantly and the keyboard is horrible. Not sure what I will do with this one. I have two earlier models and thay are fantastic,no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: Not that great
Reviews.Author: Charles E. Guess
Reviews.Content: Bought a new one as a Father's Day gift for my husband while he was going through chemo. We have had it for less than a year & for several months now Silk browser either freezes or shuts down.  When calling Amazon, they tell us to clear the data but it continues to freeze & shut down.  I have an Apple iPad & have had zero trouble.  Highly recommend the Apple iPad.

Reviews.Title: I like the 7" better
Reviews.Author: mlm22 "mlm22"
Reviews.Content: I own both the 7" fire HD and the 8.9" fire HD, and I have to say, I like the 7" better.  Of course, this is just my opinion, and it really depends on what you use it for, but I will point out a few of the contrasts between the two in my opinion.  First, obviously since the 8.9 has a bigger screen, I found it more difficult to use for games, because the screen is larger and to swipe or slide your finger around the screen requires you to cover more real estate, so to speak, and therefore it's a bit more tedious.  I also found it to be less responsive than the 7" version.  I found myself having to tap or slide sometimes more than once on the 8.9, which never happens on the 7.I understand the the screen resolution is higher on the 8.9, but quite honestly, I really can't tell the difference, even when watching high def movies or videos.  If there is a difference, to me it's not really noticeable.  One other downside is it really takes a long time to charge.  of course a bigger screen requires a bigger battery which explains the extended charge time, but for me, I am always on the go, so I don't always have 8 to 12 hours to wait for it to charge.  Also, the 7 fits in my pocket and I mostly can't even tell it's there most of the time.  The 8.9 is of course bigger and more cumbersome.So, my bottom line is that if you watch a lot of videos and a larger screen is a must, then go with the 8.9.  Otherwise, I prefer the 7 for everything else, including the price.  So for me, that's what I do with them.  Watch videos on the 8.9, and use the 7 on the go and for everything else.

Reviews.Title: Worst product I've ever bought through amazon
Reviews.Author: Jay O
Reviews.Content: I've been a long time customer so I THOUGHT the HD kindle would be a good investment.  It wasn't.  Not only is their market extremely compared to any normal android device, but they completely block google play store and google related apps.  it doesn't sound like a bad thing until you realize that you can't use google maps or any of the other google aps you may be familiar with.  If you want any app released in the past 4 years don't buy a kindle HD

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Silvan Johnson
Reviews.Content: I like the Kindle Fire HD.  I've only owned one other tablet and compared to that, this has a much better resolution to the screen.  It serves my purpose (reading, streaming radio,some net surfing, FB) and is easy to use, but I find it doesn't hold a charge very long and takes quite a while to fully charge.  There are plenty of apps for free or low cost that I've taken advantage of.  The "Special Offers" are basically ads that appear when I first turn on the tablet....once I've unlocked it and start whatever I'm doing, they disappear, making that well worth the discount to the overall price.  I would recommend this tablet

Reviews.Title: Slow refresh
Reviews.Author: Gail
Reviews.Content: I have owned a Kindle Fire for over a year and love it. When the Kindle 8.9" went on sale for Valentines Day I decided to get one. Well it's much slower to refresh the screen. When I run a weather app to see the radar the picture jumps. It's no where near smooth. Also I was playing music and trying to search the internet and it shut the music off. Guess it couldn't keep up or something. I am very disappointed in the 8.9" Kindle.

Reviews.Title: not what I expected
Reviews.Author: Eric C. Byron "wildmedic"
Reviews.Content: I sort of wish I kept my old kindle. The silk web browser freezes up every other use. The kindle itself freezes up every so many uses. I was trying not to buy an iPad but if this keeps up I probably will. even though I love amazon I'm very close to switching!

Reviews.Title: Dead Battery
Reviews.Author: kath
Reviews.Content: Purchased Dec 10, 2012.  Battery dead January 2014.  Return deadline December 14th, 2013!!!  Battery Plus says no to replacing battery.  Online reviews for replacement battery are very negative.I got a call from Amazon from tech support after posting the above review.  Adam fixed the Kindle over the phone.  He walked me thru a hard re-boot. If you have a problem with your Kindle, call them.  I never had ANY idea how to contact anyone at Amazon for tech support.  Thank you Adam. I am a happy Kindle user again...and just downloaded my second Caroline Oceana Ryan novel about Ireland. Brilliant! Adventures in Belfast: Northern Irish Life After the Peace AgreementAvailable in the Kindle Store at http://www.amazon.com/dp/B00I9OL68YHere is the contact information for KINDLE as they gave it to me:If you have any questions or need any help, you can reach us by phone directly and toll free from many countries by clicking the Contact Us option in the right-hand column of our Kindle Support pages:http://www.amazon.com/kindlesupportWhen you visit our website and select the Contact Us button on any Help page (www.amazon.com/help), click on the "Phone" tab, enter your number, and we'll call you right back. We're available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.Contacting us through the website allows you to verify security before a call is placed and ensures we have your account information ready when we call you. If your country isn't listed or you're unable to take advantage of the Contact Us feature, you can call us directly at 1-877-453-4512 or 1-206-266-0927 (if you're calling from outside the U.S.).Please note: this e-mail was sent from an address that cannot accept incoming e-mail.If you need further assistance, please visit: http://www.amazon.com/help

Reviews.Title: Freezes constantly when trying to read an article.
Reviews.Author: G. hudson
Reviews.Content: To be very blunt, the silk browser is very crappy. It constantly freezes, even if you clear the browser data and closes and reboot.  It gets very irritating when it freezes every 30-45 seconds and it tell you silk browser not responding .  It freezes no matter what articles you are reading even Facebook. I  wish I had taken the money I spent on this tablet and purchased an iPad instead.

Reviews.Title: Has a major problem with charging
Reviews.Author: Janet
Reviews.Content: I bought the 8.9 and 7" inch Kindle Fire HD.  After a year of use these kindle have a big problem with the charging connection.  I have had to have the 8.9" inch kindle replaced and even the replacement is starting to have the same issue.  Its very frustrating when you plug in your kindle to charge pick it up hours later and nothing.  You have to wiggle the cord until you make the connection then you pray as you close it and put it down it did not move, even slightly.  My two kindles spent more time on charger then they are used now.If I didn't have this charging issue I would give them a five stars.  Love the Kindle, but if you cant use them they are worthless.

Reviews.Title: I was afraid of this
Reviews.Author: angela
Reviews.Content: My Kindle one day just stopped charging. Actually it says charging in one second then goes back to not charging. I think something is lose in the device because it will not charge anymore and I swear I did not mistreat my kindle. It has never once been dropped, tossed, or been under any kind of stress. I used to love my kindle but not anymore. It breaks too easily. I only had this kindle for a month!

Reviews.Title: Amazon - include a CHARGER with Kindles.........
Reviews.Author: C. Franklin
Reviews.Content: I have owned a Kindle Fire 7" for several years, decided to give it to my husband & treat myself to the Kindle HD 8.9".  It is very much like the 7" - picture is better, of course bigger screen - I would give this 5 stars IF & this is a BIG IF a charger was included & not have to be purchased separately to the tune of $20.00!!!  Outrageous....... my other complaint is there is NO CHARGING LIGHT.  As on my 7" - I like looking,once it's plugged in, for the red charging light, then seeing the green light when it is charged.  Honestly, what were you thinking Amazon when you decided to pass on this simple option????  Major oversights in my opinion - no charger & no  charging light........so disappointing.....

Reviews.Title: browser
Reviews.Author: Paulette Lane
Reviews.Content: the silk browser freezes up and goes down alot.  You have to close out.  This makes surfing the web difficult and frustrating.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire Hd 8.9 is my constant companion
Reviews.Author: Joan Shulman "Owlnut"
Reviews.Content: Other than having just the books to read, the apps for games and such, a delightful camera that takes fair pictures, and magnificent storage for all my books, music, apps, etc, etc, etc., this Kindle Fire is  a marked improvement over my last one.  I am better able to access the internet, quicker and with fewer problems.  I can easily add my favorites (there is now a star that you can tap and it will give you pictures of your favorite apps, books, or whatever.  I can take pictures and send them via email, without having to upload to my home computer.  I am able to use email, Facebook, Google, etc, with no problems.  And, I can do all of this while listening to music either stored on the Kindle, on the "Cloud", or with Radio Apps that have stations to which I can tune.  This tablet is my constant companion, a solution to long waits at airports, the doctor's office, or just when I feel like playing a game or reading.  Although I haven't had the opportunity to try everything (I've only had it a month), I feel that it is one of the best birthday presents I've ever received!

Reviews.Title: Paying bills !
Reviews.Author: Gramma
Reviews.Content: My husband has always been the "bill payer" of the family but now he's in a rehab unit and can't have a computer so my Kindle Fire has been a real blessing --our son taught me how to get on line and take over the payments !! I'm in my 80s and if I can do it anyone can ! Of course I love the other options too but the bill paying really "sealed the deal" for me !!

Reviews.Title: Good, versatile tablet
Reviews.Author: D. Steinborn
Reviews.Content: I converted to the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 from a Nook HD+, which had been my second Nook tablet.  The Kindle is slightly smaller and lighter and, therefore, is more comfortable to use for longer reading sessions.  E-books are generally less expensive on Amazon than on B&N; and I was able to find an android B&N; reader that works and is able to access and display all of the books I have in B&N;'s cloud. The interface for reading newspapers and books is easy to use.  The browser is noticeably faster and has a more convenient system for bookmarking  sites.  It also supports a much larger selection of android applications.The e-mail app requires the installation of a patch in order to work with gmail accounts.  I found this information in the discussion forum, which is quite helpful.I purchased the charger and leather case with the unit and they both work well. I do charge the battery over night each night.  I would note that, like other e-readers and tablets the screen is unreadable in direct sunlight.

Reviews.Title: My favorite electronic!
Reviews.Author: sandra jacobs
Reviews.Content: I love, love, love my new Kindle HD.  I read lots of reviews by previous buyers and they all had helpful comments to make.  I purchase lots of books (both real and electronic) and have always appreciated the prompt delivery by Amazon, so when deciding to buy the Kindle HD that weighed heavy with me.  I am so pleased with my new Kindle HD.  It has beautiful video, quick streaming from the web, super audio (however I do wish that I had some "ears" for the speakers), and great gaming ability.  The price was a pleaser as well.  I love the carosel concept when starting up.  Kindle Free Time has been a good addition for my grandchildren also.I know the ipad may have a better camera set up, but I like taking pictures with my "real" camera.  Have you seen people taking pictures with those big ipads?  It looks ridiculous.  "Hey, down in front already!"All in all, I love everything about my new Kindle HD.  It has been my best electronic purchase ever!

Reviews.Title: My wife and I really enjoy this product.
Reviews.Author: Tom Everidge
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product with the includes special offers; if you buy this product do so without the special offers, they are commercials and not worth the 20-30 dollar savings.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet at a great price
Reviews.Author: Steve Knowland
Reviews.Content: I love this thing!I'm writing this review to hopefully save some folks time on deciding what kind of tablet to get.  I did a lot of research before making this decision.First, I ruled out Apple because I don't like Apple so my research did not include them other than a comparison of the Kindle Fire to the iPad 7.My only previous experience with a tablet has been my HP Touchpad, which I got in the fire sale. I loaded Android ICS on it and for the most part it worked fine.  My wife had one as well but both started getting buggy and I wanted a `real' device.After doing a lot of reading on forums and tech sites about `the best Android tablet' I narrowed the choice to two: the Kindle 8.9 and the Asus TF300. Both fell into my price range and got good reviews.What the TF300 had going for it was being a 10" tablet running Android. What it had going against it was a proprietary charging system (not mini usb) and some reports of bugginess. The charging thing ultimately killed it in my mind. I have tons of mini usb chargers in my house so I can plug in practically anywhere. And when I travel, I only need one charger for my tablet and phone.So I took a leap of faith and went with the Kindle 8.9. My impressions over the last couple of weeks:The screen is smaller than a 10" tablet, but it plays Netflix and Hulu at the size as my Touchpad does because there is less letter-boxing top/bottom, so that isn't a problem. It did take me a week or so to get used to a smaller screen when visiting websites though.The first day I had my Kindle, Silk (Kindle's web browser) crashed every.single.time I tried to use it. I rebooted and I've only had one crash in the last two weeks. My wife also has a Kindle 8.9 and has never reported a Silk crash happening to her. Others have noted this problem so hopefully a patch will coming along at some point.Amazon did their own thing and layered over Android. The App store isn't as large as Android and many of the apps I had free on Android cost on Kindle because the vendor only offers the pay version. Not a deal breaker given the general cost of apps and you can side load apps if you really want to. "I Love My Kindle (fire)" is a good blog about the fun things that can be done with a Kindle Fire.It is smaller and lighter than my Touchpad. The screen is amazing and it has good sound overall. It's a very responsive device; opening apps quickly. I've had no problems with any apps.Battery life is amazing. I find myself forgetting when I charged it last, even after streaming movies.You have to buy an outlet charger separate. It's $19.99 but sometimes you can get it for $9.99. I assume not including one was a way to keep costs down but seems silly.I bought one without ads. My wife has the ads and doesn't mind them but it kind of annoyed me. Costs $15 so it may or may not be worth it to you.Since we have a Prime account, the integration with Amazon is really nice. I can easily access all my books and videos from the top menu bar. No more logging into Amazon to get to my videos and I don't have to open the kindle app to get to my books. These are all a swipe away.The Kindle has its own desktop, using a carousel and bookshelf. The thing I don't like about this is everything gets ordered by last use, making locating things a bit of a challenge because they are never in the same place. But there is a "favorites" where you can put stuff so this isn't a big deal.  And if you really hate it, you can side load a program that gives you the Android option of multiple screens. I initially hated the carousel and bookshelf but have gotten used to them.

Reviews.Title: Great for most needs
Reviews.Author: S. Gordon
Reviews.Content: Love the display & ease of use.  My son has a 1st gen Kindle Fire so I knew what I was getting.  No regrets.  Still need to sign up for the $50 1st year data service - been using wifi so far.  I do wish it was open to the Google Play store since I have many apps that are on my phone that can't be accessed on the Kindle but I knew that going in so I can't really complain.  I wish Amazon would start getting more high quality games & apps though.  There are several that I really would like to be able to get on the Kindle (games mostly).  All-in-all it is what I expected and works really well.  Go ahead and get the Amazon cover with auto on-off for it.  It's expensive but lightweight and works really well.  I have dropped the Kindle on pavement with no damage (corner hit) - only a small scuff that I didn't notice until now.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Arlene F. Brauckmuller "Arbrauck"
Reviews.Content: Being a IPad user for the past couple of years.....mine was a first generation, was getting a little testy, and I needed a new one.  However the prices of the newer ones scared me off.  I ordered the Kindle Fire (at $300 less) in hopes that it would come close to my usage of the IPad.  Believe me when I tell you it has surpassed my expectations.  It took a little time to get used to it,..... wasn't sure at first it would give me everything I wanted out of it......but little by little I started getting out of the "IPad" mode and into the Kindle Fire mode.  It has all the things I need and want, just had to learn how to find them and use them.  If I had gone by my very first impression (I didn't feel like it was user friendly at first) and not tried to work things out, I probably would have sent it back.  So glad I didn't....I love it.

Reviews.Title: Just cracked the Kindle box
Reviews.Author: canesfanPBC
Reviews.Content: Hi, So far I like this thing. I am not a super techie, but fairly tech savy. The picture is stunning, the audio with phones is fantastic.Out of the box, in a few minutes, I was watching Xfinity, and enjoying "Walking Dead". There is excellent support from both Amazon ( as always) and very active user forums for more help. The big knock on this product is you can't view Flash content, after a 30 second search on a forum I found a fix for this. It took 5 minutes to download and install the needed files and another browser, and I was veiwing You Tube without a hitch. So far,  after about 20 hours into owning this, I have the opposite of buyer's remorse! I am loving it.

Reviews.Title: Learning curves in old age
Reviews.Author: Josephine
Reviews.Content: Its a great device, and the best part is the super support provided by the Kindle agents.  At 87 yrs. I'm a bit of a slow learner, and it was, at first, quite a challenge to learn how to use its many aspects.  But Kindle people were kind and patient and helped me over the hurdles.  I love its portability and the many apps that give me a new window on the world.  Thank you.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: A very nice tablet that is much better than the iPad mini that I recently bought.  Great stereo speaker placement and superb screen resolution. It continues to be my favorite tablet compared to others on the market place.

Reviews.Title: Ipad move over, your beat on price and quality.
Reviews.Author: Brent P. Mayeux
Reviews.Content: Recently received my Kindle HD and love everything about it. The display is amazing. It is just the right size, and the price was unbeatable. The ability to put my music, movies, etc, without going through another program service like itunes is fantastic. My wife has an Ipad 2 and wants to sell it to get herself a Kindle. Combined with Amazon Prime, it is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: If you're still shopping around for a HD tablet, just do yourself a favor, and buy this one now...
Reviews.Author: John A Waterbury
Reviews.Content: ...and let me tell you why.Not only do you get a well made, highly capable, HD tablet, you also get the world of Amazon support and services with it.The controls, subscriptions, and other services available just from "Your Account" for the Kindle, makes it easy for parents to ensure acceptable access to content, regardless of age.May I also suggest signing up for Amazon Prime, it provides so many free movies, books, benefits, and perks for the low cost of a membership, it will make your Kindle Fire HD into something you won't want to put down.

Reviews.Title: Kindle HD 8.9 Lite
Reviews.Author: Jan Barke'
Reviews.Content: Excellent! Kindle 8.9 Lite is unbelievable!! It was a gift for my daughter, Brittany for Christmas! It is even better then the iPad! She has friends with the iPad & her Kindle exceeds the quality & the performance of the iPad!!Thank you Amazon!!

Reviews.Title: Short and Sweet
Reviews.Author: Rhonda Mulkey
Reviews.Content: I could ramble on and on but you really just want to know if I like it or not. I love this product, I have the original Kindle Keypad and now a Kindle Fire. If you are really looking at this product and are trying to make a decision if to buy it or not, I would say 100% buy it! Its top quality, runs great, speakers are fantastic, high speed and fun. Every device runs through some company or other, this one runs on Amazon blood, so you buy your apps (and there are many) from Amazon. I Like the fact that you have Amazon Cloud so I can buy books, albums, apps, whatever and delete them and they stay in the Cloud.Any way. that's my 2 cents. I love it.

Reviews.Title: love it love it loveit
Reviews.Author: T. Engle "toni"
Reviews.Content: I really liked my original Kindle but this one goes so far beyond it in capabilities- I had to adapt to the touch screen but that was easy too even for an old lady --I'm 65 soon--so don't be afraid to try it

Reviews.Title: This is my second Kindle purchase and I love it!
Reviews.Author: weedqueen1
Reviews.Content: My husband kept asking me if I wanted the new Kindle Fire and I kept saying that I was quite happy with my original Kindle keyboard. Then I happened to be talking with a couple of the girls that I work with, they each had Kindle Fires and raved about them. Then the one girl said that she was getting a new one because she wanted the HD and I thought that was a waste of money because she already had a Fire. Well; long story short, the other girl brought her Kindle HD in for me to see. I was hooked and ordered mine within days. I love both of my Kindles. Originally I thought that I would sell my old Kindle when I got the new one but I use them both daily! My husband thinks I am a bit nuts to have two or three books and 5 or 6 games with friends going at the same time but I love it!

Reviews.Title: better than expected
Reviews.Author: Bipfog2
Reviews.Content: I have two kindle fires already so I knew the operating system would be good .I got this for the bigger HD screen and absolutely love it. I travel all the time and I use Netflix on it for my tv and it does excellent. better sound quality as well.

Reviews.Title: awesome! love  my kindle fire.
Reviews.Author: Peggy Smith
Reviews.Content: Never realized how much I would use it. I love the clarity, the size of the key board and the helpful words scrolling across the screen that make writing so easy without mistakes. I can take it everywhere with me, it fits right in my handbag.  Most restaurants I eat at have WiFi so getting my emails that are so important to me I can do while I eat.  The most important thing to me was how complicated would it be for me to use? I have to say at 66 I even impressed myself it is simple to use. Good weight and handling,love it.

Reviews.Title: What would I do without it?
Reviews.Author: Mimi
Reviews.Content: I am legally blind and this (along with my other two kindles) is truly a gift.I take it everywhere.  The screen is clear and I am capable of seeing the wordswith my glasses.  Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: MikeyS
Reviews.Content: So far I love it. Great screenSound pretty goodWifi is fastCon, my wife wants to trade her 7 inch Fire for a 8.9

Reviews.Title: Bigger and Better
Reviews.Author: Big Ham
Reviews.Content: Although not much different than the 7 inch Kindle, I love the screen quality and the digital sound on my Kindle.  Good purchase.

Reviews.Title: It has some glitches
Reviews.Author: D. Friday
Reviews.Content: I find for the most part that I love this, however, it has some glitche's  that need to be worked out.  The tabs stop working at times and the screen freezes.I know that some of the issues are user problems.... lack of knowledge.  Saving downloaded info seems to be an issue for me.  Not with books, but with pics and crochet patterns.Otherwise, I can see how much I'm liking this.  Great to take along when going to have to wait at an office or in line somewhere.

Reviews.Title: Video
Reviews.Author: Eva McGhee
Reviews.Content: I am a kindle fire fan. I purchased the 4G for my son. We can't watch movies from amazon prime on the 4G but can movies from amazon prinme when connected to Wi-Fi. He is able to watch Netflix when on 4G. So I am not sure what's going on. But other than that issue, I really do like the New 8.9 Fire HD. And i plan to purchase the 8.9 Fire HD Wi-Fi for myself. I have the 2 first generation kindles and still enjoy those kindles as well.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have had this for a month, and really like reading on it/ playing a casual gave from time to time, watched several movies on it. the sound for the movies is faaaaantastic. What a nice media piece. I Read two  magazines on it  for 1 dol a month. nice price.  Good number of quality apps.

Reviews.Title: Super TABLET
Reviews.Author: Rhonda
Reviews.Content: This has got to be the GREATEST WI FI Tablet EVER! Crystal clear pictures, sound and overall quality is beyond the other brands that cost two to three time what my Kindle cost and are not as good.

Reviews.Title: Amazon ROCKS!!!
Reviews.Author: RollTideGrl
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kindle fire, but first HD and I am loving the first few hours of owning it.  I have noticed that it is much faster than my last Kindle Fire and the touchscreen is better as being responsive.  You guys will not be disappointed with this purchase.  I own a Ipad with retina display and I love my Amazon on some many levels better.  I think music and books are cheaper and better deals on Amazon than Itunes. After all, on Amazon ecosystem you can buy groceries, household and everything else in between on your kindle.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Tina Leanne"
Reviews.Content: I can't seem to get enough of my Kindle! I miss it when I am at work and physically look for it when I don't have it in my hands.  I can use the keyboard like a typewriter...it is so awesome!  Love!

Reviews.Title: LOVE  LOVE  LOVE
Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: THIS KINDLE IS AWESOME!!  SO GLAD I PURCHASED THE KINDLES FIRE HD..HAD A NOOK BUT THE KINDLE IS 50 TIMES BETTER.  GREAT PICTURE AND EASY TO USE.  I CAN'T PUT IT DOWN.  GREAT VALUE FOR ALL THAT IT IS CAPABLE OF DOWNLOADING AND DOING.

Reviews.Title: Awesome....
Reviews.Author: Vic Gonz
Reviews.Content: I must say this little item is a keeper... and I'm not even  an avid reader... But I'm getting there... lol... Sooo many thing you can do on this Kindle Fire H.D 8.9... I don't complain when i have to sit and wait at the Doctor's office anymore...lol... And everywhere I go I get asked about my kindle and I end up doing demonstrations and basically helping others buy one and it's needed accessories....

Reviews.Title: happy happy
Reviews.Author: redgirl
Reviews.Content: bought for husband for xmas and I bought the smaller one; love it,,, hard to put down,,love amazon..good deals ck it out

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Alyson K. Magowan
Reviews.Content: I love my KINDLE Fire HD 8.9...its everything i hoped it would be.  I recommend it highly.....battery is great too :)

Reviews.Title: My latest Kindle
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Jane Kaufmann"
Reviews.Content: So far I love it.  The battery lastslonger then my previous 2 Kindles.  The color is great. It is easy to use. I do have two small disappointments.  The fact that there were ads on the home screen and it costs more not to have ads.  Also I didn't like that I had to buy an app to use the phone on this Kindle.

Reviews.Title: superb
Reviews.Author: kiran desai
Reviews.Content: I just love this kindle as is as good as an ipad if not better. It does everything that i would want it to do and more. It has a brilliant display and real beautiful sound.

Reviews.Title: Great Amazon Product!
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle!The HD screen is very very crisp! Love it!The convenience of the prime benefits with the device make it totally worth it!There are a few "drawbacks" to make you aware of for me even though it doesn't make me regret my purchase one bit...it's a little heavier than I expected.when opening different apps or even browsing the web, it might become glitchy. Don't get this if you want an internet browser...this device is more meant for amazon content of books and videos and shopping..ect.being limited by the amazon app store is a little disappointing. theres a way to "root"/jailbreak it, but I have not done that because it's not so easy (fyi)but, i do love the device!free book rentals and video streaming with prime membership makes it AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: great item
Reviews.Author: Russ T
Reviews.Content: I have had a blast using my new kindle, it does much more that I had imagined. Love using it with my Amazon prime and watching movies, playing games and reading books

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd 4G
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet.Data plan much cheaper than the Ipad data plan.I will be carrying this everyday and leave my Ipad at home.Real fast when surfing the net.Love reading books on it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Cindy Mae
Reviews.Content: The kindle fire HD 8.9", is my 3rd Kindle, and I love it.  The picture quality is great, it's very user friendly. The sound system is great.  I would recommend this to anyone who likes to read, play games and watch videos.  I am not a real big internet surfer. So this Kindle has everything that I need.  I take it everywhere with me.

Reviews.Title: Awesome sound and color.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kindle.  I like to read - a lot.  This Kindle Fire H D 8.9" is so much fun.  The colors are vibrant and the Dolby sound has the other guys green with envy.  Although I had the Kindle Fire, I never really learned about the features.  Now with the H D Fire, I am learning how to download music, listen to the audiobook feature, watch videos, and now taking pictures.  As much as I enjoy this new Kindle Fire H D 8.9, I am so disappointed with the camera feature, I could cry.  With such lovely, vibrant colors, pictures of the ceiling fan was not my plan.  Nor was I excited about a picture of my nose as I tried to take pictures of my poodles.  I truly appreciate Amazon's customer service.  The Kindle product has changed my life in several ways.  The camera may be a deal breaker, however.

Reviews.Title: Good fit for most needs
Reviews.Author: Elliot
Reviews.Content: This is my second tablet replacing a Motorola Xoom  that was lost. In choosing a new one I considered what I actually wound up using my old tablet for. That turned out to be primarily as reading tablet using the Kindle app, light web surfing and social networking while watching TV or traveling and as a music streaming device. Although I have my Android smart phone loaded with apps I used relatively few on my old tablet. The Kindle seemed a good fit for the price essentially splitting the difference between a reader and a tablet. I chose the WIFI version because I didn't want another charge from my wireless company and found with my old tablet that I could usually find access to a WIFI connection when I wanted to use it. To get the most use out of it one does have to commit to a content relationship with Amazon but there is no fees or contract; just pay as you go. If you already buy your content on Amazon it's really no change. It's cheaper and more flexible than being joined at the hip with Apple ITunes etc.Pros:* The HD Screen has beautiful resolution and streams video nicely.* The lightweight .5 device is a manageable size that has enough real estate to read,  view video, or view photos while still light and comfortable in the hands.* Works well as a Reader, Web surfing and Email as well as social networking and of course shopping on Amazon.Cons:* The User interface is kind of tacky and commercial reminding you constantly that you are connected to Amazon.* App availability is and will be low* Like most tablets it is awkward to view and manage documents.All in all a good fit for me and I suspect many usersUpdate 1/29/2013: I have lived with and traveled with the device and am still reasonably happy with my choice.Pros:* Performs well, no crashes so far.* Ease  in accessing content is excellent* Great for streaming videoCons* The Carousel Home screen interface is REALLY REALLY ANNOYING. Every one I know with a Kindle hates it. It quickly clutters the home screen with an icon for every book, app or website you have visited even once. It cannot be turned off and individual icons have to be removed one at a time; a very tedious process. This is a user unfriendly coercive feature that I hope Amazon will get rid of and soon. It sucks the joy out an otherwise pleasant device.The user blogs are chock full of others who feel the same way but I ahve yet to find a satisfactory remedy if there is one.* The power an volume contact switches are poorly marked, difficult to see/find, and have such a shallow detent that they can be deployed inadvertently. A latched power switch would be much better.So  all in all I am still happy with my choice especially at the price. If Amazon would get rid of that godawful Carousel feature it would be a solid win.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: L. Belasco "belascol"
Reviews.Content: I just got it, and I haven't tried out everything that I can do with it yet.  I love the bigger screen than the original Kindle Fire, and I love that Amazon is giving us more options with movies--renting as opposed to buying.  But so far all my books, movies, newspapers and magazines are all coming through fine--great picture quality, and I can adjust the print for my books so that I don't need my drug store glasses.  I may review again--but for now 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE MY KINDLE
Reviews.Author: b
Reviews.Content: I LOVE IT! The HD is awesome and I can play all types of games and the color is amazing. The only down side is that about four times a day it freezes and I have to turn it off. The battery lasts all day (I'm sure it would last longer if I wasn't on it all day long) but it is awesome. It is my first tablet and I wouldn't trade it for anything.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Lena Grey
Reviews.Content: I'm still learning to use my Fire, but so far I like it a lot. It's definitely worth the money. Thanks Kindle!

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Tina
Reviews.Content: Was very excited to get my new Fire. Love the larger screen size. Video is very crisp and clear. Sound is good. Haven't had lots of time to play with it yet, but so far it is everything I've come to expect from Amazon and Kindle. It is a little heavier, which was expected because it is bigger and the case I bought with it adds a little weight. Adding my email account was a snap and it linked me with my Facebook account as part of the registration process.... however, I can't seem to find the Facebook app now. Don't know if I inadvertedly deleted it or what, but it seems to have disappeared. Has anyone else had this problem?

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9" HD is all it is advertised to be!!!
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: The Fire 8.9" HD is everything I hoped it would be and more.  Picture quality is excellent and sound quality is very good, considering the size of the speakers. Surfing the web is very fast.  All in all, a great return for the money.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: The Pros:Amazon Prime Instant Videos - awesomeExtremely sharp picture. I did a side-by-side comparison with my Samsung Galaxy Tab. I froze the pictures in the same spot while streaming. The Kindle HD won hands down.The build is very solid, however this Pro comes with a caveat (see below).The software, with one exception (see below) is very solid-responsive and quick.The sound quality through the on-board speakers or through headphones is quite good. The Cons:It boots up slowly.It is too heavy, in my opinion, in relationship to it's size. It has a smaller footprint than the Tab or the iPad, but weighs more (the caveat mentioned in Pros).Buttons are too small, poorly placed, and unresponsive, in my opinion.The software issue I mentioned in Pros was the email app. I use Gmail and the interface presented in the mail app is lacking in functionality and lacks the simplicity Gmail usually presents.It takes a LONG time to recharge, even plugged in to the wallNo access to the Play Store. I realize it's a closed system but it is too closed. Apps I use often that I am unable to access on the Kindle include:DropBox, Directv, Delta, an actual Gmail app, Google drive, Logitech Alert, American Express, and Scrabble. Summary:A well built, albeit heavier machine. As mentioned, the picture, sound and content purchase options are great. The buttons need work, the apps need work, the closed system needs work. If you are looking for a device to mostly consume items from the Amazon storefront(s)and do not mind some functionality trade offs, this device will work for you.

Reviews.Title: Mostly good, room for improvement and all about usage
Reviews.Author: Caveat Emptor
Reviews.Content: Kindle's HD 8.9 is a product I had waited for since before it was even a rumor.  On balance its actual performance should please some, displease some and mostly be found a welcome addition for those whose digital world is centered in the Amazon eco-system.  It all rather depends on what you are looking for--- even within the Amazon system.  As an owner of the iPad's every generation, a couple of iterations of various android tablets, iPods/iPhones and the odd e-reader, including the original kindle, I believe I have a better grasp than many on the real world factors which judge success and failure in such devices generally.Without trying to reinvent the wheel in this review or go too far afield in measurements and techno-speak, I feel a select group of factors are to the point particularly with this specific item and I will confine comments to those, so that a concise and understandable comparison with not only choices of other devices, but most importantly the unique and singular needs this one fulfills best.Specific factors: size, screen quality, form factor, durability, flexibility, value (cost/what you get) and continued satisfaction in longterm.This version of the Kindle has a number of capabilities: as a limited personal computing device for web-surfing, document handling and light office duty, as an ebook reader, streaming media player, etc., but not to get into the weeds of such a shopping list I will jump to the end and simply state that what it is or should be seen as is as a media player which occasionally is used for some of these other  tasks.  A laptop, even a lightweight and inexpensive ultra-book is going to do office jobs and web-surfing better, a couple of tablets, most notably the Nexus and the iPad are more flexible and higher powered for running apps, with greater libraries of apps to draw on even.  A smartphone is lighter and more portable.  However--beginning with a screen that is absolutely comparable with the deservedly touted retina display, a nimble combination of hardware components that make for stellar responsiveness-- especially for those persons within the Amazon Prime family, this tablet leaves all others in the dust for the breadth of high quality media (movies predominantly) delivered.As a streaming media device the amount of storage is of relatively minor impact as what is left of the baseline 16 gigs should absolutely be more than enough for a few apps, pictures, a moderately robust collection of audio books, books and music (think of this device as the equivalent of your everyday carry bag or commuter backpack for your media).  Since you are streaming your movie content from Amazon and have an infinite storage space for your Amazon content: books, audio books and music; you really shouldn't be storing much on it.If you are more about a purse or a briefcase or if what you are predominantly doing is reading ebooks then you need to look to the 7" little brother with its lower price, as the greater real estate of the 8.9 inch doesn't do for you or doesn't appreciably add, respectively.  Similarly, if your primary thrust is for your children, since it is easier in smaller hands and comes with all of the same services, the smaller/less expensive version is your sweet spot.It feels solid and sturdy, much more so than a number of similarly sized android tablets.  It has a nicely finished surface for gripping and has an edge to edge glass screen which is scratch resistant and tolerably low in reflective glare.  Though some reports have contested the claim of its speedy wifi connectivity, for streaming video it is second to none and flawless with no discernible stuttering, freezing or hiccuping for buffering.  The pricey, optional Amazon tablet cover/case preserves all the physical aspects of the tablet including its svelte lines, further extending its durability without turning it into a giant plastic brick.Finally, while including most every nicety you find on other tablets bluetooth, hdmi out, support for Exchange based corporate email, Skype and social media integration--- it adds a few of its own, Amazon specific extras like Read to me, Whispersync, integration into the Amazon shopping experience including product suggestions etc, the new X-ray function for most consumable content, a huge lending library of free books and a gigantic and heavily discounted textbook rental library-- making overall value untouchable (again for those in the Amazon system) by any of its tablet competitors.The single, largest deficit is the battery life.  While an improvement on the earlier version of the Fire, the 10 hour claim is pure marketing fantasy.  One of the real pluses, its thinness, doesn't leave enough room for a sufficiently sized battery. The real world battery usage will run between 6-71/2 hours depending on screen brightness being set anywhere from 50-100%.  While minimally acceptable, in the age of similar devices running in excess of 10 hours, this is far from ideal. On the flip side of that, with the speedy charger (which should be free, but isn't) the recharge time from near 0 to fully charged is considerably under the 5 hours they promise---taking roughly 3 1/2 hours or around 2 1/2 hours for 80%.The single biggest asset of the device is Amazon, itself.  Its track record, its overall services, but most of all its customer service--which in my considered opinion is not only light years ahead of its nearest rival, Apple, but in a consumer world of deception, built in obsolescence and recorded telephone loops...the closest thing to absolute perfection any of us will ever see from a business.  For this alone you may bank on the long term reliability and value of your purchase.Final thoughts:  I underscore that this is a media streaming device, if your primary thrust is something else, look elsewhere (though as an affordable electronic babysitter or a way of cutting textbook costs it may likewise prove the singular touchstone for those strongly of those needs).  The 4G LTE option is potentially a killer for Amazon, but not as it exists now.  Until Amazon can work out a deal with a cellular provider based upon the muscle of their client base so that an unlimited or at least a very large allotment per month (5-10 gigs) for a reasonable, flat yearly charge, it is all but useless.  For a media streaming device, what does the present allotment buy you in terms of streaming--1/2 of one movie?  Why would you pay double for the LTE version, essentially so you could do email and download that book which you JUST can't put off another 15 minutes until you reach home, office, Starbucks or the train? I don't think so!!If there were a percentage rating possible I would have given something in the mid to upper 80s, even with the very disappointing battery life, but with stars it has to be 4 until that one problem is substantially solved.  On balance, I love this device.

Reviews.Title: WOW!!!
Reviews.Author: V. Woyak
Reviews.Content: I am a first time ereader/tablet owner.  All I can say is, WOW! Oh, and now what do I do with my almost new laptop that is now going to collect a LOT of dust!!!  The Kindle's screen is so sharp and clear it's just amazing!!!  2 complaints however.  first, this is going to cost me some money because I want EVERYTHING it can do and all the books!!!!  Many of the coolest apps are free!!!  I love the "toys" on it as well, like the autoharp and piano. My only serious complaint is the inability to upgrade the flash player so I can play my favorite FB game on my Kindle.  I know this is not Kindle's fault, but am wondering what this will mean down the road since Flash player is no longer supporting the android format. Not seriously concerned however because I am sure someone will quickly come up with a fix, they always do :)Overall, any one considering the Kindle Fire Hd 8.9, WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR???

Reviews.Title: ATT service does not activate
Reviews.Author: caroline a strachan
Reviews.Content: I had to go to 3 different wifi locations to activate the Kindle but the ATT service never activated. I called Amazon twice and they said call ATT. So I called ATT and they said call Amazon. I have been bounced back and forth but no one can help me. I spent $500. for something that does not work.

Reviews.Title: Not a smart purchase
Reviews.Author: ChadK
Reviews.Content: Had a terriable experience.First problem. It is loaded with intrusive adds to include the lock screen. There's an option to pay $15 to remove adds. That's only for the lock screen there are still all over once you get past lock screen.Second problem.You can't customize anything. Lock screen back ground, nothing. Even if you pay to remove the adds.Third problem.It's slow and doesn't play a lot of videos on websites such as ABC or NBC for shows like SNL.Fourth problem.It wouldn't charge past 80 percent when it would charge. I had to send it back and told them to keep it.

Reviews.Title: this kindle is not worth the money
Reviews.Author: Janice  Fraser
Reviews.Content: It  freezes and becoming unresponsive and takes awhile to respond again . I should have insisted to have money refunded when the first one did the same thing. I probably would have spent my money more wisely on a different tablet as my friend. When hers starts to give problems at least  she will  not have lost over two hundred dollars. This is the second  kindle for me in less than five months. The first one broke in less than three months. When it would download it would not open it afterwards when it did try to open it then it would close out..so amazon replaced it with a refurbished one which I have had approx one month now it is starting to freeze up. I do not recommend anyone to spend the money. At least when you call amazon they  do respond quickly and try to correct the problem. I bought the first one as a today's special value from a home shopping network which it didn't matter in the long run since then you have to deal with amazon since the network will not accept its return after thirty days.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Biscuit 08
Reviews.Content: I am a very happy with my new kindle fire hd 8.9. I have an ipad also but I am happier to have my kindle. The kindle makes things so much easier and I am not tied down or limited by apple and all of their restrictions on which apps I can use and apps that apple can't run.Thinking of selling my ipad now, that is how much I love my kindle.Amazon comes through once again..

Reviews.Title: fun to use
Reviews.Author: Robert T. Potter
Reviews.Content: very convenient, very fast. needs some sort of magnifier for visually challenged. Had problem using voice guide. causes unit to freeze.

Reviews.Title: No Battery light
Reviews.Author: Marilyn Kesterson
Reviews.Content: I really love my Kindle Fire HD EXCEPT there is no indicator light that shows you when the batter is completely full.  You have to unplug it from the battery charger, turn it on and THEN you have to look at the little tiny battery indicator on the Kindle itself to see how far it has charged!  BIG PAIN IN THE neck!  Why would you not put an indicator light like they do with even the lowest black & white Kindle??  I don't want to have to buy an upgraded Kindle, just so I can have this inconvience....

Reviews.Title: A Very Good Value
Reviews.Author: dannman57
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife's birthday and she loves it! It appeared brand new. Only downside is that the device appears to have some built in advertising that is a small nuisance.

Reviews.Title: freezing kindles
Reviews.Author: Robert C.
Reviews.Content: I have problems with it. It freezes up a lot. I have had it replaced twice and still having problems. Tried to sell for  up grade but Amazon would not do it. Had kindle 1st generation and kindle HD  not sure I would purchase another.

Reviews.Title: I am not pleased
Reviews.Author: mary
Reviews.Content: I am not pleased with my Kindle Fire because it keeps freezing up on me, and all I am doing is scrolling on Facebook and playing Words with Friends.  I got the new one this winter to replace my old one which was no longer charging unless I jerryrigged it to keep charger in place. so  I called to see what could be done about the new one and was told to reboot it which I had been doing, so they told me to return it and a new one would be sent.  Got that taken care of and now this new one is also doing the same thing.  Called about that and was told the same thing, reboot it.  Still doing just that.  Not pleased at all.. also do not like that I am trying to explain all this to someone who does not understand me or that I have a difficult time understanding.  I like that I can take a Kindle on the plane and out visiting with family who can then see family events that are occurring with grandchildren and such, my parents are elderly and I am beginning to think I am too!!  I bought your product thinking it would make things easier and it has been harder.

Reviews.Title: Loved it at first... but it died 3 months after the One Year Warranty
Reviews.Author: ShellyP
Reviews.Content: I loved my Kindle.  But I am very disappointed that 3 months after my warranty was up - my Kindle froze on the Kindle Fire screen with no apparent reason (I am very careful with this as a I use it every day).  When calling Customer Service, after trying to re-set it 900 times to no avail I was told that basically I can have a "discounted" price on a refurbished Kindle Replacement... and a $30.00 off certificate.  For me, that answer was not good enough and it never will be.As a pretty loyal customer to AMAZON I am extremely disappointed and am considering cancelling PRIME and finding other avenues for online ordering that have nothing to do with AMAZON.  This includes Zappos I believe.  Anyway, unfortunately there are few things I still need so I will be placing a couple more orders - but I'm not sure about after that.Also, why would I want the same KINDLE back when it only lasted a year and a half.  I think now I should have just taken my $300 and put it towards the iPAD.  Although more expensive, I know it would last and there would be more technical help available.  However it probably wouldn't be needed as I most likely wouldn't have this issue with it.I am appalled that I have read numerous complaints about the same issue with the Kindle, but yet AMAZON doesn't seem to think it's a problem with their Software.Pay the extra money for a table that will last.

Reviews.Title: What a disappointment! Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: C. Fletcher
Reviews.Content: I cannot for the life of me understand the positive reviews on this clunker. I got it for my birthday last year and noticed soon thereafter that it had a tendency to freeze. "Silk browser is not responding, would you like to close?" So I would close and restart and it would happen all over again. After putting up with this sorry state of affairs for several months, I wrote about my frustrations using the feedback feature. Customer service was prompt and worked with me for about two weeks resetting and registering etc etc, before offering to replace the device. But guess what - this new one is doing the very same thing! Could I possibly have received two lemons? Aaaargh!

Reviews.Title: kindle fire review
Reviews.Author: Patricia Berry
Reviews.Content: The worst.  I returned three times and still all three would freeze.  The silk browser is terrible.  For 449.00 I expected convenience.  It was not reliable.  Recommend staying with regular old kindle for reading only.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire hd 8 in review
Reviews.Author: Dawn Hinesley
Reviews.Content: I have had a number of problems with this version. I have the original kindle fire 7 inch and the new Kindle fire hdx 8.9. This particular item I have had to replace several times and I am still experiencing problems since replacing it twice. Would not recommend this version.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Tony Roby
Reviews.Content: I had to send it back 3 times. Device would just stop working. The last one I received is still glitchy, so I just bought my daughter another brand tablet that works. Don't waste your money or time on the Kindle!!!

Reviews.Title: I am not happy with this product
Reviews.Author: myrtle "DP"
Reviews.Content: I am on my 3rd Kindle Fire HD 8.9. It still does not work properly. I have done all the fixes Amazon has provided to no avail. The Kindle shuts off and  knocks me off the internet constantly. It gets really hot and freezes all the time. I don't even enjoy using it. If I had to do it over I would not purchase this again. I also have the 7 inch and I have no problems with it. I have asked Amazon for a credit  or a refund to use on something else but they refused. They just want to keep replacing it with a new one and it still doesn't work. So I guess I'm stuck with it.

Reviews.Title: Not working that well
Reviews.Author: Tajohnna ulmer
Reviews.Content: I say a one star cause it continue to shut off when I make a movement and that's starting to work my nerve the volume is not loud even tho it's on high

Reviews.Title: this product is very bad
Reviews.Author: xavi zhou
Reviews.Content: I use this product for few day but I discover many problem, The Battery life is to short, the front camera position deviation original position let me can not To accurately use it, the speaker play sounds has cracking voice and the most importance thing is the the touch screen has several especially dazzling light-spot. it's system is very slow and always has system halted.

Reviews.Title: Watch out IPad.
Reviews.Author: Book girl Eva
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, Apple is a great company that makes great products, and I even own a IPod, but I have always found the IPad lacking for the amount of money it cost.  This tablet has not disappointed, and neither did my first gen fire, and the price cannot be beat.  I have told everyone that I know who is thinking of getting an IPad how much I love this device, and the kindle is the way to go.  I am a self proclaimed Amazon junkie, and rarely does a day go by that I do not visit this website.  This device goes to show that loyalty to a brand can be rewarded.  I will continue to show my loyalty to Amazon as long as they continue  to make great products like this for prices that regular people can afford.

Reviews.Title: Lacking in Apps
Reviews.Author: Rasheed Abdullah
Reviews.Content: I've had the Kindle Fire HD for about a year now.  I bought it as a viable and inexpensive alternative to the iPad (which I now have but more on that later).  I found it very intuitive and easy to use.  Aesthetically it is very nice, clean and durable, although I don't like the position of the power button nor the position of the power port.  Many times I've accidentally pressed the power button while moving the device and because of where the plug in for the power is I can't set up the Kindle landscape while it's charging.  Within the first week I had a problem with it.  I would be watching something or doing something and it would shutoff.  After referring to the forum I found out the problem was the case.  I called Amazon and their customer service was superb.  They sent me a new case right away with a return shipping label for the defective case and that fixed the problem.  They requested me to ship the defective case back by a certain date or I'd be charged for it ($50).  I actually missed the date which was about a week or two from the date I received it (I know, my fault).  But they still didn't charge me.  In fact, they sent me another notice giving me an extension.  I made the second date and everything was fine.  The Kindle Fire HD was great for watching videos, checking e-mails and reading ebooks.  It wasn't until I tried to watch programs via Comcast.net that I experienced my first problem.  Apparently, Kindle is missing an essential Adobe Flash Player for watching certain things via a web browser.  I think you can download it but I never looked into it much.  It was a bummer but not that big of a deal.  Well, that also affected Youtube viewing, for which there is a terrible app.  So, speaking of apps... that was the true killer.  Kindle has a terrible app selection and some of them don't work well.  Even though Kindle is an Android device it doesn't allow access to the same App market as other Droid devices (I read that it has something to do with not paying Google that extra money).  So Amazon has a slightly different version of a lot of the popular apps and/or it may not have the app at all.  That really sucked.  It was at that point I decided that I'd get the iPad instead.  In summary, I think the Kindle is great if 1.) you're an Amazon Prime member (as I am) or you peruse Amazon.com a lot (as I do) or 2.) you're using it for videos, books and e-mails.  The Kindle is not so good if you are a heavy app user or if you watch things via your browser.****UPDATE*****This is an update per one of the comments (or only comment).  The app I can think of right away that didn't work for me was the Despicable Me Minion game.  Another app I had issues with was Monopoly.  Besides the fact I couldn't play Monopoly with others in the house because they have Apple devices, it didn't work well for me.  I've yet to try the Netflix app, but the other standard apps seem to work fine.

Reviews.Title: I love it, but...
Reviews.Author: Craig Naset
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying, "I have 3 Kindles". Someone gave me the original Kindle several years ago and I loved it. I talked about it so much that the same person gave me the Kindle Fire HD 7" when it came out. I loved it. Then I made the mistake of assuming that a Kindle could pretty much replace a laptop, and bought the Kindle Fire HD 8.9". Overall, I am happy with the purchase because it does what it does extremely well...but it doesn't do EVERYTHING!It does everything EXCEPT:1) Replace a camera. The built-in camera is only front-facing, which means it is designed for Skyping or taking photos of your own  face. It is prohibitively annoying to try to photograph anything else, especially if the object has text on it, which will photograph backwards, like a mirror. You will not be able to transfer photos directly from your camera to the Kindle with a PC in between or an expensive eye-fi sd card.2) Because the Kindle doesn't natively support Adobe Flash you'll do a lot of jumping through hoops to view a lot of web content without finding and using external apps. It's rather difficult sometime to upload things from the Kindle to the cloud without a PC in between.3) It has a lot of great apps, but not all Android apps work. There are some workarounds if you're at least a little computer savvy and good at searching the web4) No matter what the hype says, the battery in the 8.9 can't handle the load. It runs down much quicker than the 7" and takes FOREVER to charge, even with the much hyped special Kindle charger. Lots of crap is going on in the background that you don't realize. Always turn the wireless off if you are not using it. Don't rely on standby, shut the system down if you are not using it.If any of these things disturb you, please spend a few more hundred dollars and get an i-Pud, oops, i-Pad.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: The Butterfly
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love it because it meets my needs. It's a great product! I am satisfied with my upgraded Kindle.

Reviews.Title: TURN OFF ADVERTISING
Reviews.Author: Dennis Schwarm
Reviews.Content: I actually like how the kindle functions butREALLY DISLIKEthe advertisements that are all over including when i turn it on!!My ipad and surface doesn't!For this reason alone I would not recommend or buy another

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire bricked, Amazon offered a terrific deal on a replacement
Reviews.Author: Shelley R Wiltrout
Reviews.Content: When my daughter's Kindle Fire went toes up, Amazon customer service offered an outstanding deal on a new Kindle Fire HD 8.9" The price was 25% less than the first generation Kindle Fire I was replacing. They promised it in two days, it showed up at the door less than 12 hours later. Shipping was so fast and efficient that I was unable to register and sync to her account as it wasn't to be delivered to the next day. Customer service was able to correct the shipping status so I could complete the registration. If you have a non-functional Kindle of any model or generation, give them a call they may offer discounted replacements.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed.
Reviews.Author: lindamar
Reviews.Content: You didn't include the charging cord that plugs into an a/c outlet.  How can you manufacture an item and not include that as part of the purchase.  Very disappointed.  I called and they said it would cost an extra $20.00 more.  I was very impressed with amazon before always and having second thoughts about purchasing amazon electronics in the future.

Reviews.Title: This is awesome!
Reviews.Author: Jonathan G.
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and I was torn between buying this, the Windows Surface, and the Ipad. I have used Ipads frequently, and have an Iphone so I'm used to the operating system so going that direction seemed the most logical however they are just so damned expensive. Upon reading lots of reviews, as well as trying out a few of my friends different tablets I decided I was going to get either the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" or the Kindle Fire HDX 7".  I liked the idea of having both the front and rear camera as well as the ability to download videos for prime in order to watch them without wifi, but decided I would try this first and upgrade in the future if I thought it was neccesary. All I can say is this does everything I need an more. I use it so much it has completely replaced the use of my PC. If you do your research there are plenty of "must have" apps out there that let you get the most out of your kindle fire.  I would also highly reccommend that you have an Amazon Prime account, otherwise you won't be able to fully utilize this tablet.You have have read reviews complaining about the advertising, that had me somewhat skeptical to begin with, but the complainers neglect to mention the advertisements are only on the locked screen. Whenever you turn on the kinle you see an advertisement and an unlock Icon. Once you swipe into your home screen there are no more ads to worry about. To me this isn't a big deal, and occasionally the ads are very interesting, such as a book or movie that Amazon wants to reccommend.As far as screen clarity, I can't tell a difference between this an ANY of the Ipads I have used (I haven't used the newest Ipad air yet) and the resolution is crystal clear. The volume is impressive for a device this size, and its amazingly light weight. I was suprised by how little it weighed when i first picked it up. The battery is impressive, when they say it lasts ten hours they mean it. I watched 6 hours of a TV series from the netflix app over 2 days without charging it, and still had about 20% battery life left.If you are new to the world of tablets and aren't going to be a "power user" this should be more than enough for you, and at a price that is much better than most of the other's out there.  Just remember to buy the "Amazon Kindle 9W PowerFast Adapter for Accelerated Charging" (the adapter to allow you to charge from an outlet rather than your computer) because it doesn't come standard with it.ENJOY!!

Reviews.Title: Love my kindle but battery life short!
Reviews.Author: Laura Loyd
Reviews.Content: I love my new kindle, it is great for surfing, games checking email in a flash. Very convenient and easy to use. The only downside is the battery life, not what I expected. The battery lasts more like 3 hrs instead of six or seven. As much as the kindle costs it should have came w/wall charger. Because I'm new at this  I wasted money on two usb chargers, finally went to Radio Shack n got a wall charger for $17. Charges way faster.

Reviews.Title: Silk browser is the worst
Reviews.Author: Kevin Neathery "klneat777"
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to receive my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 on Father's Day 2013. I wanted it for its reader capacity but looked forward to using it to surf the Web. Boy, was I disappointed! Silk Browser freezes more often then works. There is certainly nothing "silky"about it. I have seen many others write the same criticism. Why will Amazon NOT address this issue with some sort of fix? I suppose their solution is to replace the whole thing with a new device and expect we who are stuck with one that will not access the web without freezing to buy the newest one. I would be most pleased to give this device 5 stars IF Amazon would update or replace this software since many, many people have this problem.

Reviews.Title: A progressive learning experience--like it more everyday--anticipate to love it in near future
Reviews.Author: Maria
Reviews.Content: It will take time to learn to use all the features available, but it is worth the effort. I enjoy learning, so I'm up to the challenge and it gives me something to do during TV commercials:) I recommend downloading one of the free manuals for new Kindle Fire users. I'm using "Kindle Fire HD Manual--The Ultimate Kindle Fire HD Gide for Beginners" by Amber Norato.I bought the version with the Amazon ads, because it was less expensive and have no regrets. They only appear when you turn on the Kindle and once you unlock it they don't reappear.I took my time deciding which Kindle to purchase. I finally decided to buy the 8.9. I expected that it would do so much that it would replace my laptop, I was extremely disappointed within an hour of using it. It seemed that I could have gotten the same benefit with the $69 Kindle reader. Then it happened--Amazon began sending me offers for additional Apps--now I can do so much with it.There are many, many free Apps--games, printing, streaming, etc., etc. etc., so explore those first. I also got "tokens" for buying it that I can use to buy more apps. I'm also trying Amazon Prime for 30 days--movie and TV program streaming, but still undecided about it.I like that my Kindle has built in speakers, a great picture--I find it sharper than my HD TV. I leave the music playing in the background, while I explore other apps. Now what to do with my laptop???If you are buying this for a child, don't set up the "one-button payment" feature. It is easy to run up a large bill.You'll need to buy a charger, because it only comes with the USB cable.The next challenge was getting a case for it, without breaking the bank. I'm still waiting for the one I decided upon--$5.95 vs. another I saw for $54, so I can't make a recommendation right now. I also bought a stylus, because I hate to see fingerprints on my screen and because I press the wrong links when using my fingers. I sent for the Marware Stylus, based on reviews. It is expensive--$15, but sounds like the best one. I'll review it when I get it.I recommend assessing what you will do with the Kindle and using the comparison feature on Amazon, before buying. If you just want it as a reader, buy the $69 Kindle. Although the Kindle HD has beautiful color, the reader is black and white, which I like.Enjoy your Kindle, whichever you decide to get--I'm enjoying mine.

Reviews.Title: Kindle FIre HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: C. Osman "Grandma"
Reviews.Content: I am quite disappointed with the charger.  I have it plugged in all night and open it and use it less than 1 hour and it tells me I need to charge it.  I had it replaced once and an finding the same problem with the second one.  There seems to be a known issue with this item.  If this is the case, it may have to go back.

Reviews.Title: one year in and i dont leave home without it
Reviews.Author: Darren Gears
Reviews.Content: I did not need a tablet...i have a very new laptop and never found a need for a tablet. I decided i wanted one after playing with a display model in office depot simply wanted it to be "in" with the new app phenomena.  One year in now i look at my laptop with its inch of dust on it and just wonder why i didnt get a tablet sooner. The kindle fire hd is just awsome! It surfs thw internet fast. Netflix streams without a hiccup. Ebay is simplified,and ofcourse you got the kindle app store whixh has jsut about anything you will ever need.thebkoolest thing is i gave my tablet to my 56 year old stepdad and told him to have fun. He is a total tech novice and he got the hang of the kindle within 30minetes. I bring my tablet to work with me every single day to catch up on reading. I am a little sad to say i have read literaly 10 times as many books this year then in the last 7 years since i graduated from high school. I would recommend this for anyone who wants a great tablet but on a budget

Reviews.Title: Happy!!
Reviews.Author: rae
Reviews.Content: I never leave home without it.  It's amazing all I can do on this device!  My on the go one stop entertainment!

Reviews.Title: Best for the Dollars Spent
Reviews.Author: Tomas
Reviews.Content: After owning and using a 7" Samsung Galaxy Tab 2, 9.7" Ipad, and now the 8.9" Kindle Fire HD I have to say with out a doubt, that the kindle is definitely the best machine for the price. Don't believe what others may say about android and apple having more apps. Kindle may not have as many in terms of shear quantity but it has everything one would need and the majority perform better than android. I still like some of the specialty apps ipad has but the need for most of them are very individualistic (your neighbor may need it but you don't). I rate the Kindle display the best of the them due to its color, definition, brightness and responsiveness. I also rate the network ability of the Kindle the best due to the MIMO built into it along with it's dual band ability. It can be put on your routers 5Ghz band while the other machines are using the 2.4Ghz band your in video and internet response heaven. Ipad has always been know for having difficulties in the dual band arena. The Kindle runs dual band with out any problems. It can even run both bands simultaneously switching between them to gain the best performance. Android gets a low third place.

Reviews.Title: Otherwise Good Machine Wrecked by Stupid Cramming Policy
Reviews.Author: Arthur G. Broadhurst
Reviews.Content: It has a clear screen and it connects to wi-fi with no difficulty.  I bought the $15 reduced price "with offers" and that was a bad mistake that I now regret.  On my earlier B&W; kindle the ads are not annoying, but on the Fire there is no way to get rid of the ad without clicking on it and then closing the web page that opens automatically.  You cannot get past the "unlock" screen without clicking on "buy this."  So I was already irritated by that inability to get past the ad, when the biggest irritation of all came with an "upgrade" download a few days ago.  Now my library contains 11 entire book length foreign language dictionaries from Chinese to Japanese to German to Polish.  They clutter up my library and make it hard to find things, and moreover an email from Kindle Support admitted that it was intentional and there was no way for the user to delete those useless dictionaries from the account.  It certainly doesn't help Kindle to have them there and it is irritating to have dictionaries that I have no use for cluttering my library so I do not see what point there is other than being irritating.  I WOULD NOT BUY ANOTHER KINDLE KNOWING WHAT I DO NOW.

Reviews.Title: Short Life of 16GB Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Nana "Nana"
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9 was a replacement for my original 7" Fire when it failed after two years. I am giving this Kindle #2 only a 2-star rating because it froze and failed to boot up within 5 weeks of receipt and I cannot obtain a refund because I am a week over the 30-day refund period. My only option is like-in-kind replacement. I was told by customer service that my problem was unusual; that they rarely have problems with this model, yet I opted to think about it until after Christmas and do more research. Winter storms have me snowed in. I find the reading and game apps addictive and really miss my Kindle. I also found the new screen responsive and easy on my eyes, I think it responded better than my first Kindle. However as I stated earlier, in a short time the screed started freezing and it failed to boot up after an overnight charge.Needless to say I was very unhappy with the turn of events. As I am reading customer reviews, I now find that I am NOT the only person with failure issues within a short time of purchase. However, I will probably request replacement for #3 after the holidays because it appears to be my only option. I will not purchase a newer device until I see more positive reviews. I decided on 1 star for the product and added the 2nd star for the prompt customer service. CS was accommodating but I didn't get what I wanted so my frustration remained because I have cloud investment with Amazon that I can't recover if I don't keep some type of Kindle device.

Reviews.Title: Best buy in electronics
Reviews.Author: Beverly J. Kester
Reviews.Content: Best buy I have ever made in electronics!  I can highly recommend this version of Kindle Fire.  The larger screen is much better than the 7".  A good buy for older (I am 70) people like me, easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Kindel Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Marlou
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kindle.  I upgraded  from the original Kindle Fire.  You can not go wrong with the HD of this Kindle.  From movies to games and going on the web.  Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: I didn't know how much I needed this Kindle!
Reviews.Author: lin
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HD, I got it for Christmas last year. I have called the help service at Amazon a few times in the past year for technical help. They are patient and walked me through any issues I needed explained, I'm not very tech savvy. I am  very satisfied with this Kindle, it was money well spent, it is so handy when, (somebody else hogs the computer). I use it every single day, now I  couldn't do without it.
