I send and read my emails from it, I watch old movies no one else likes on hulu while I do dishes or listen to my favorite radio station ( like right now!) while I wright a review  about my Kindle. I can see things enlarged on the touch screen better than on the desktop, ( great for Pinterest)!

Reviews.Title: One great tablet!
Reviews.Author: Avery Gordon "muse77"
Reviews.Content: I traded up to this from my first generation Kindle Fire 7". I am so glad I did! This thing is a joy to use, and there are many great apps available as well. It's easy to set up, it will automatically transfer all your Kindle books and music over with no fuss. The HD is truly eye-popping, and on top of that the sound in the unit itself is great without using ear buds, but of course with ear buds it's even better. It has an Office Suite for work, too. There's a camera installed that I haven't used yet, but it enables you to Skype, which is a great addition! I am simply thrilled with this trade-up!

Reviews.Title: Perfect Tablet for anyone and everyone
Reviews.Author: dan
Reviews.Content: Amazon. You've done it again.  Try a Kindle free for 30 days is unbelievable. I actually couldn't believe what I was seeing. I was able to get a Kindle for doing my work and play on, while allowing my family the time to save up the money to buy this for me for Christmas.I was a first generation Kindle Fire owner, and a huge fan ever since. The Kindle Fire HD is great, the web browsing is fast and simple, the sound using DOLBY sound is just what I expected from the Kindle. The screen is fabulous, and the weight and size is great. Anyone who doesn't have the money for a more expensive tablet, know that you will get everything you would out of a more expensive model out of this Kindle Fire HD 8.9

Reviews.Title: Love hate that it had no charger!!
Reviews.Author: G. slone
Reviews.Content: love it only thing that mad me mad was the fact that it didnt come with a charger that is stupid i paid a lot for it ...why souldnt amazon throw in a freaking charger come on amazon a charger would cost u all mere pennies why not make your customers happy 100%

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD does not work properly outside the US
Reviews.Author: Ilona S.
Reviews.Content: Not working properly outside the USTook it to South America.  I could not see any of the movies I had downloaded, not Amazon Prime nor Netflix.  Could not download any of the free books either.  I installed Magic Jack on it.  After five days it stopped working, it shows Beta on it.  Have not managed to make it work again.  My main purpose for the Kindle was to use it while traveling.  It is not working.  It only works in the US

Reviews.Title: A tablet to consider
Reviews.Author: E. Pope
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife, who wanted a tablet large enough to use the virtual keyboard for emails and web browsing.  She primarily uses the internet for searching for information, shoppiing, email, Skype (with video) and reading books.  This Kindle does exactly that and more.  Easy to use right out of the box.  Definitely recommend it for such users.

Reviews.Title: Dont even consider it for cruising the web
Reviews.Author: hodad
Reviews.Content: Bought the HD Fire 8.9 when it first came out.  Wanted something to watch music videos and movies.  Works great for Netflix and Amazon Prime, but accessing anything on the internet is a collosal nightmare!  I love to watch youtube music videos.  While typing in on the touchscreen, you'd better get it right, or the browser will send you off into the stratosphere, and most often not even let you find your way back to the previous page.  The apps are a huge disappointment as well.  Most of the apps will also send you off somewhere that you never even thought possible if you hit the wrong button.  Absolutely frustrating trying to navigate.  The apps are terrible, period!I use both Windows and Linux, and have lots of experience with computers in general.  I was hoping that this would be a good internet device, but WOW, was I wrong!  Don't get this if you like browsing.I got a "standing leather case", and I couldn't plug in a headphone until I carved the hole bigger so the normal sized plug could plug in. Still, it does automatically turn the unit off/on when closed/opened, which works well.The power cord goes into the bottom of the unit, so it won't sit up straight unless I prop it on two separate pads, and the cord gets in the way when you're sitting with the Kindle in your lap.Before I got the case, the Kindle would turn itself on in the middle of the night, often waking my wife and I up.  Inevitably, I'd find that the battery was dead.  The case mostly (but not completely) solved that problem.Half of the time, when I try to turn volume up or down, I hit the power switch, and have to restart.  Still have this problem after several months of use, even though I consciously try to avoid turning it off.Great for ebook reading.  It's nice to turn off all of the lights and read a book.  I'm constantly turning it off accidentally as I move around to get comfortable, though  (also have this problem when watching movies).

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: I got this as an inexpensive alternative to our family Ipad.  I wanted something that I could hoard for myself.  I've been pleasantly surprised with this item.  It does much of what I used my Ipad for (music, books, news, etc.).  It is apparent at times that this isn't quite the processor powerhouse that the Ipad is, but then again, I didn't pay as much.  The keypad on this thing sucks compared to the Ipad; it is glitchy, slow to load, and much less sensitive.  The internet browser also crashes from time to time, and sometimes the apps freeze up.  These were all issues that I did not experience on my Ipad.  Nonetheless, for the price, I'm pretty happy with this purchase.  For listening to music, reading books, and surfing the web, it works pretty well.

Reviews.Title: My new big,beautiful KFHD
Reviews.Author: ellafan
Reviews.Content: I received this new kindle because the price was right,and I wanted to check out a bigger screen KF.I have had a 1st generation KF since it was offered.I loved it right away,and actually used it more than I did my computers.I loaded a gazillion books and magazines and  movies, enjoyed every second I spent with it.Then,I just for grins, I checked out this particular version.Love at first sight!! Setting it up with my Wi-Fi network was a snap.I registered it,and was immediately connected to amazon.I chose a few books from my cloud,and the transfers were blazing fast. I love apps,youtube,amazon prime,and Pandora.And I buy everything the Rifftrax guys put out.All of the above look beautiful on the big screen(for me) .I am still experimenting with the camera,but the few shots I have taken look pretty good.I installed a battery-use app,and a few otherz.Everything works fine.And the audio sounds fantastic,even using a set of ancient headphones.I am completely besotted with my KFHD.Check one out!!

Reviews.Title: Pretty darn nice tablet, once you install N2A!
Reviews.Author: Peter Naus "Spd Rdr"
Reviews.Content: I struggled with the awful Amazon software and crippled operating system for nearly a week, before I gave up in total disgust.Look, for the vast majority of folks, it's fine as a simple e-reader, with a slow but adequate browser and some pretty addons. But if you're outside of the US, and you're barred from the Prime content, you will lose nothing and gain everything by spending $20 extra and getting the N2A software installed.It takes about 25 minutes, and at the end of that time, you'll have a gorgeous looking AND working operating system, with all your kindle ebooks easily downloadable - you won't even lose your page position!The only thing I wish I'd done was to do it before I bought a bunch of useless apps in the Amazon store!I don't go in for hacking stuff if there's no need - but there's a need on the Fire HD, believe me. Faster booting, smoother scrolling, faster apps, better and more useful apps, real web browsers, and of course the sensational graphics.After more than 10 years, I'm never buying another bit of Amazon proprietary hardware. Period.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: anonymous
Reviews.Content: I have a Kindle Fire 7" and really enjoy it.  Ordered the Kindle Fire 8.9" and I am so very disappointed!  Could not download apps and some of the apps that downloaded from my 7" Kindle would not even work.  I called Amazon several times to try and get this fixed and they didn't even seen to care to help me.  So I sent it back.  Only Sunday when I once again called Amazon to make sure the return was correct did a employee ask if I wanted to exchange for another 8.9".  I said no because I was tired of having to amazon all the time.  Also, I did think of returning the 8.9" for the new HDX 8.9" to come out soon but after all the trouble I had with the HD 8.9" I don't even want to try another one.  I am also very disappointed with amazon not caring if they could help me with the HD 8.9".  They have a very dissatisfied customer who thought amazon was so good!

Reviews.Title: Great Device - Operating System Needs Work
Reviews.Author: Terp Allan
Reviews.Content: We have owned many apple "i"devices over the years and we finally decided that Apple has lost its edge but not its price tag.  So we bought a Barnes and Noble Nook.  The nook quickly proved to be a poor tablet.  Very limited utility and awful to configure and use.  And exceptionally difficult customer service (bought at a university bookstore three hours from our house and the local B&N; store could not accept the return - return was expensive and difficult).So we bought a Kindle Fire HD.  Now it is worth noting that we have three black and white kindle devices in the house.  The Kindle Fire HD is a whole new device - it is a computer.Good Points*Fast response times - operating on our "n" wifi network the machine is very fast*Good selection of apps and media (our interest is movies)*excellent screen quality - movies really pop*great battery life - generally runs eight hours before next charge*My son is dyslexic - the "immersive reading" option for many books is fantastic - my son hears the book being read, by a talented human not a computer, while he watches the words highlighted - can be run at slower speeds without materially changing the comprehensionWeak Points*The primary interface is poor - the apps are (apparently) only offered in a "ribbon" which is fine until you have tons of apps, books, etc.  There are favorite lists and other ways to search but all are a pain.  I don't know why they can't use the accepted device of having all the apps in small pictures on sortable pages for quick location and use.  This is an "Achilles heel" for the device and must be pushing away potential buyers.*The charger is extra - who sells an electronic device without the charger (it runs off of any USB charger so we are able to use our own kindle chargers and the computer)Overall for the price this is a very good value.  It accomplishes our goals of being a well rounded entertainment device at half the price of a iPad.  In general the only advantage of iPad is a more user friendly interface.  If, and when, Kindle fixes this issue, there is little advantage and certainly not for an extra $300.

Reviews.Title: Joy writ LARGE!
Reviews.Author: Greg C.
Reviews.Content: As an up-grade to the Kindle Fire my wife purchased for me over a year ago, I couldn't pass up the opportunity to purchase the Fire HD. Even though it's marked as "refurbished", you'd never know it. The device is immaculate, the image is crystal-clear, and the layout of the homescreen is, quite simply, logical. I've had other e-readers in the past, but the versatility of the Fire (and Amazon's exceptional customer service, product reviews, shipping policies, etc.) is what pulls me back again and again. So, give it a year, and I'll probably be upgrading to the newer Kindle addition which recently came out. I am THOROUGHLY satisfied with this product; even the larger, 8.9" screen is a joy to behold, and the price couldn't be beat for the value it brings.

Reviews.Title: Not recommended for ordinary reading, but good for pdf files, complex images movies and much more
Reviews.Author: Robert S. Hanenberg "Bob"
Reviews.Content: For normal reading I use the Kindle Paperwhite.  I like the fact that it looks like paper.  Like paper it depends on an external source of light.  I do not like reading on screens where the light shines at me from behind the screen.Which is what the Kindle Fire does.  However, the Paperwhite is not useful for books which are colorful, or which have irregular fonts or complex formatting.  I originally bought the Kindle Fire because I wanted to own a certain book on plants.  This book was full of pictures.  A friend of mine owned it, but I could not find another copy anywhere.  It was an old book and out of print, the author had long since died and there was no copy in any library in the state of California and none for sale anywhere on the internet.So I borrowed my friend's book, bought a Kindle Fire and scanned the entire book into a group of PDF files.  There is a fine app for viewing pdf files on the Kindle Fire.  The photographs were perfectly clear, and using my fingers with a reverse pinching motion, I could enlarge any part of a photograph.  You could get the same effect with a paper book using a magnifying glass, but this was easier.Later I found similar uses for the Kindle Fire.  I had always wanted to own a facsimile of the First Folio, but I never could bring myself to buy one.  However, there is a free pdf file of the First Folio on the internet.  Now I have it on my Kindle Fire.  To my surprise, I found it was more satisfying to read King Lear in the First Folio than in a modern, annotated version.  I had also wanted for a long time to own a facsimile of a medieval book called the Tres riches heures du Duc de Berry, but it would have been too expensive to buy one.  I could not find the whole thing on the internet, but a found a part of it as a pdf file, and now can look at it on the Kindle Fire.  Or: I was helping my nephew apply to college.  It turns out to be an easy thing to download an entire college handbook of several hundred pages, and read it in its original formatting.  Later I wanted a government report on the economic value of college majors.  They give this out for free as a pdf file, and with the Kindle Fire I could read the whole 200 page book in its original formatting.I read magazines on the Paperwhite.  But certain graphs, tables and pictures do not show up in the Kindle Paperwhite.  Images, even at their best, loose much of their value on the Paperwhite. Sometimes, as in the Economist's edition for the Paperwhite, the images are skipped altogether.  I keep finding something like "See figure 1" and there is no figure 1.  Or, you might have a tabulation, but when you zoom in on it, all you get is a blank screen.So when I find it absolutely necessary to look at a graph, table or image, I open the same magazine in the Kindle Fire, which has no trouble displaying any image, tabulation or graph.The Kindle Fire is also a tablet.  Young people will like it for this reason.  You can do many of the things you do on a laptop, such as write documents and send emails.  I read my email in the morning, and look at the weather forecast, before turning on my computer.  But I do not do complicated work on it.Movies are a joy on this machine.  Netflix (the movies which are streamed) and Amazon's Prime videos come through flawlessly.  I find the speakers of the Kindle Fire adequate for most movies.The main problem, aside from the fact that the Kindle Fire is useless in bright light and irritating when reading long texts, is that it is heavy when reading in certain positions.  I like to read lying on my back, but the Kindle Fire is too heavy to hold in front of my eyes for very long (I have the larger 8.6 inch display).So I bought a stand to support it ("LEVO Deluxe iPad Floor Stand for all iPads Galaxy Xoom Nook and Other eBooks and Tablets").  You can attach any eBook to this stand.  I often fix the Kindle Fire to the stand, which has a long arm which can position the device at any point in space.  I lie on my back in bed at night and watch movies.  I use the same stand for reading on my Kindle Paperwhite.  You cannot use the stand to read a paper book, because there is no mechanism for turning the pages.  But with an eBook you can swipe the screen to turn a page.There is something very decadent in all this.

Reviews.Title: I use it every day....all day long
Reviews.Author: Pepper
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased with this item.  I got it mostly because I love to read and am losing my vision.  This has brought something  back that I love, and thought I had lost forever.  A few months after I purchased my kindle, I was having trouble with it, and in trying to get it going again I had hit something I shouldn't have I think, and it froze up.  I couldn't get it to do anything.  I was heartbroken.  I called the help number and a very polite and patient gentleman (who spoke clear English, I might add) walked me through several steps to try to get it working again.  When that didn't work, he told me that it needed to be exchanged.  It was still under warranty, so he sent me a new one out that very day, not waiting for the old one to be replaced.  He emailed me a return label and when my new one came a couple days later I shipped the old one back at no cost to me.  Not only that, he called me back twice to make sure that I had received everything and it was up and running.  I have never received such stellar customer service before.  Thank you so much.

Reviews.Title: Must be a QC problem somewhere
Reviews.Author: Daniel E. Klingler
Reviews.Content: Received this yesterday.  Initialized and registered it today.  Never got around to installing any apps.  Spent 4 hours trying to get simple gmail to work, including 3 lengthy calls with Amazon tech support.  Appears to be a software version problem/incompatibility (?), but no amount of "sleep"ing, rebooting, synching, etc would fix it.  Amazon is shipping a replacement.  May be time consider a new iPad.  Lesson seems to be you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this KIndle Fire HD Tablet
Reviews.Author: jaap schuiling
Reviews.Content: Bought this Kindle Fire HD Tablet in the first place to be able to read the books i bought and will buy in the Kindle store everywhere i want.I am very happy with the quality and all the options for reading.Also listning to music and watching videos is of high quality.It's only not possible to buy music and movies from Amazon because i don't live in the US,that's the only reason i didn;t rate 5 stars.Perfect Tablet!!

Reviews.Title: Better than the original Kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Phillip Centola
Reviews.Content: Unit is better than the original Kindle Fire. I was hoping for a better charging system. I had trouble with the original Kindle Fire charging system. The connections became loose on two different units. I still think that Kindle is number one for E-Reader type systems, and will continue to buy Kindles.

Reviews.Title: Not so great.
Reviews.Author: brainless
Reviews.Content: The internet runs really slow and some of the videos stop right in the middle and have to start all over again.  It's not my internet because I don't have that problem on any of my other devices.

Reviews.Title: It's OKAY
Reviews.Author: Glenna J Dooley
Reviews.Content: I purchased my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 about 4 months ago.  I've given it a pretty good test, but I find I keep going back to my iPad.The biggest issue I have with the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 is using it to actually type something.  I hate the keyboard.  It does not seem to be calibrated at all and I haven't found a way to calibrate it.  You touch on a key and nine times out of ten you get one somewhere around it and auto-correct inserts whatever word it wants to.  I have turned auto-correct, auto-capitalization and next word prediction off but it still seems to throw in whatever word it wants to. I spend more time correcting auto-correct changes than I do typing a document.  I don't want to have to watch the screen when I'm typing something.  Here is what the Kindle fire typed as the first few words of this paragraph:  The biggrdt isshr i ba  eithtbr Kidke fiI read a lot, so I am amassing a large library - some of it replacing my hardback/paperback books which I am donating to charity.  It is lighter than my old first generation iPad, but I've been using the Kindle app for years, and an eReader is my choice for reading now.I purchased the WiFi enabled version because I don't take it anywhere that I would need 3 or 4 g connectivity.  Even with WiFi it seems a little slow to connect to the internet, but that's okay.  I'm not impressed with many of the apps out there - I've tried a few of the free ones because I won't purchase any apps until I test them out.I do not regret purchasing the Kindle Fire, but if I could have afforded it, I would have purchased another iPad.

Reviews.Title: It is a cut above many higher priced tablets on the marketplace!
Reviews.Author: Terry Ayers
Reviews.Content: We have both an iPad as well as the Kindle. The Kindle Fire HD is hands down the clear cut winner!

Reviews.Title: new 8.9
Reviews.Author: Maria G. Medina "FOOFAH"
Reviews.Content: i love it. the screen is so much better. the games are bigger. for people who need larger print because they can't read small print this is perfect. i love watching films  on this screen. the picture is so clear. the sound is amazing. i workout to music on my kindle.i do my banking. i contact my family with my kindle. i take pictures with my kindle. my cousin works for apple and she is trying to get me to buy an ipad. no way. leave me and my kindle alone.  i'm a kindle girl through and through.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: D. M. Nicol
Reviews.Content: I enjoy my Kindle and find it easy to operate. I was hesitant to buy one but now I'm very glad I did.

Reviews.Title: horrible touch screen response
Reviews.Author: ASG "angryshortguy"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my father in law who is in an assisted living home.We wanted him to be able to go online and get the scores from all the state high school football games, and play some card games to keep him occupied.The interface is really not very intuitive.To get out of a game, he had to touch a very tiny tab on screen.I even had trouble hitting it just right to work.Ads, ads, everywhere.And not just ads, annoying and confusing ads came up from the opening screen to the confusing row of apps under the favorites I set up for him.Touch screen with no touch.I had this thing set up and ready to go.I sat down with him to make sure he could use it.tapping icons were difficult for him.He kept tapping and tapping, but nothing happened.He started to get frustrated.I took over to show him how to do it, and it wouldn't work for me either.I must have tapped an icon 6 times before it finally registered.If the touch screen doesn't work, what good is a tablet.Taking it back for a full refund.You really DO get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: As always ... Great Device ...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I started with a Kindle 2 keyboard device and used it faithfully for several years until it started to do freaky things like suddenly going back to the beginning of my book or shutting itself off and refusing to turn on.Then I got my Kindle Touch which I am still using for outdoor reading and reading while I walk on the treadmill.Next I received as a gift the very first Kindle Fire ... that is now starting to act a little strange at times.So here I am now with my brand new Kindle Fire HD 8.9 ... and so far so good ... I'm quite happy with it. The picture is very clear and it makes the game graphics pop. I also love the 2 page viewing option for reading and the fact that it tells me how many minutes it will take to read a chapter. This way I know right away if I have the time to finish it or not and can decide if I want to start to read it or stop where I'm at. You can also choose to have it show the time it will take to finish the entire book, the page you are on or the location #. It's so nice to have the ability to choose what you like the most.Barbara GarberPottstown PA

Reviews.Title: They just keep getting better!
Reviews.Author: Marte Holley
Reviews.Content: Kindle products are the best.  Easy to use, and ample choice in product store online.  I am on my 3rd.  Love the Kindle Fire HD 8.9".  Good size, brilliant visuals.  Be sure to get the case.  It turns off, or puts in sleep mode, when not in use.

Reviews.Title: It was a FATHER's Day GIFT
Reviews.Author: Javier
Reviews.Content: For my father in law. He loves it, it's his first ever computer phone/tablet type device. He is 66 yrs old and has never had an email account. Nice to get him out there into CYBER SPACE.

Reviews.Title: I absolutely love it
Reviews.Author: Catherine Graham
Reviews.Content: I really love this tablet. The sharp precise colorful images, the size, the sound. I purchased it recently and i am enjoying it. So far I do not have any negatives about it. I do not regret purchasing it.

Reviews.Title: Upgrade, correct choice
Reviews.Author: Melissa Starry
Reviews.Content: I considered the upgrade for over a year, until I decided it was time.  I love my original Kindle, passed it along to my daughter, but enjoy now being able to see color and watch movies.  Meets all my tablet needs.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Shelley Fernandez
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire HD....I have a 2nd generation kindle that I've had for years, loved it. so when I decided to upgrade, it made sense to get a Kindle Fire. Now I can read, play games, watch movies and surf the web. Kindle Fire does it all. Very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: great size but needs some work
Reviews.Author: Linda V. "Linda V."
Reviews.Content: Text to speech has nice sound but stops or skips at times. This is a great feature that only Kindle has.  You can listen to your books while doing other things & then go back to reading when you want.Picture is beautiful.Apps don't work as well as on my iPhone.  Example is on phone I can manage my Etsy SHOP, but on Kindle app I don't have ability to do that.I can't seem to get PODCAST app I bought to work since Google play went down, but iPhone app running smoothly.There is a lot to learn & gets frustrating if you don't have tech knowledge as it seems like too many steps which don't always workThe major issue I think is no way to organize books as on original Kindle.  When I finished a book it got put in separate place you can name, so only unread & those items such as reference books remained on home page.  Now, there is no way to mark books as read.  I don't want to have to hunt my entire inventory to find a book to read & figure out if I read it already.  I read lots of books & don't remember them all'  please fix this!Last, I had to have a replacement as battery was overheating when charging.I would love this Kindle if it would do all it is supposed to smoothly.  I love so much about it.

Reviews.Title: It`s okay
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: I only gave it 4 stars as I had to return my first one after only 5days.  It just was a lemon and would not work correctly.  I wish it came with a printed manual which would be extremely handy instead of the online one.  Also the lack of a true camera; what`s up with that?  I actually had thought it came with one.

Reviews.Title: Abaout the micro HDMI port...
Reviews.Author: Musa
Reviews.Content: I've owned the Fire HD 8.9" since December 2012 and like it a lot.  Instead of a general review (of which there are already too many to read) I am posting some specific comments on the micro HDMI port.The FireHD has a micro USB not a mini USB port. I think the micro tends to be used more by tablets and smartphones and the mini tends to be used more by cameras and videocams.The micro HDMI port on the Kindle Fire HD does not deliver audio, it delivers high definition video only I don't know whether this is a limitation of the micro HDMI specification but in any case Amazon has elected to crippl the FireHD HDMI capability to video only. Like so many limitations it is probably related to "protecting" digital content "property rights." Amazon has never claimed that the micro HDMI port delivers audio but you sure have to dig deep to find this out...Amazon markets the HDMI capability of the Fire HD 8.9" to gamers and movie watchers and says nothing about its value for other uses.  One nice feature of Kindle Fire HD's HDMI implementation is that it does deliver the text of Kindle books to a large screen; at least it does on my setup. Before I bought my Fire HD 8.9" I called Amazon Kindle support to specifically ask about this and after some earnest fumbling about they said it probably does not. Lo and behold, when my Fire HD 8.9" arrived I found that it does. This was a very nice surprise as one of my main uses for My Fire HD is "immersion reading" and it's great to "follow the bouncing ball" on a large screen  When I'm doing this I rely on either bluetoth or the headphone jack (analog out) to hear the "professional narration."

Reviews.Title: Made for Amazon Prime
Reviews.Author: Daniel M. Goen
Reviews.Content: My wife has the Kindle fire 7" and she never buts the thing down. So I sold my Kindle fire, and got this. WOW!!! Combined with Amazon Prime, this baby is incredible! I work nights so I don't get to watch much tv. With the Kindle Fire 8.9", and Amazon Prime, I have been watching shows I didn't know existed. Not to mention reading books, playing games, and....well... now I can't put it down either. So much for making fun of my wife anymore!!! :-)

Reviews.Title: Just two hairs from Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Birdie Gee
Reviews.Content: I am hung up on Amazon Kindle, but, this one disappointed me a bit.  I take Blog pictures and the Camera was hard to hold, the camera picture (not good) and I ended up buying another camera. I thought the 4G would be free (not so fast!) you have to purchase it through AT & T.  "The Great Stuff and Reason I like it?) I got an app for typing documents and printing, the book reading is fantastic (I can see my patterns in color). It has a lot of other functions (e-mail, web surfing, gaming, etc.) In the long run, it's a keeper! Birdie Gee

Reviews.Title: like it, don't love it
Reviews.Author: rosita's mom "judy"
Reviews.Content: I can't compare it to an I-pad.  It is a great little machine.  The first one quit after 8 months but Amazon replaced it, no questions asked.  Amazon is working on an experimental flash player so you can watch some videos on it now which is great.  My only complaints are that it seems slow and that the battery on both kindles I have had do not last more than a couple hours between charges no matter how many things I turn off.

Reviews.Title: Pack that Kindle Fire HD 8.9, Dolby Audio, Dual-Band WI-FI, 16 GB!
Reviews.Author: MT on THE mountain
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 because it has a larger screen compared to the "standard" 7 in. Kindle Fire HD.  It works well for 66 year old eyes, but is still portable.  It fits easily into my medium sized handbag.  I use it while waiting for appointments; the KF HD contains grocery lists from the three major groceries I frequent (nice little app, that one).  The KF-HD goes to church with me so that I can follow along when the Bible is read in our worship services.  New apps which can keep cranky 5 and 6 year old grandchildren occupied on the drive home to their house are appreciated by this grandma.  I haven't watched any KF-HD movies yet, but I will do so eventually.  The HD screen has crystal clear images. And, might I add, without coercion, going for an Amazon Prime membership annually is more than worth the funds spent on it.  With Prime membership I receive free shipping, free Netflix videos.  All my birthday, wedding, and anniversary shopping is done on my Kindle HD.  It sends me reminders, audible and email, about recipes to be made, dry-cleaning to be picked up, and notifies me when those out of town guests are coming so that I may dust the guestroom.Recently my husband and I left our hometown by automobile for extended visits to a conference, with side trips to grandchildren and their parents.  We packed carefully.  Unfortunately, 10 minutes into the drive, I asked my husband if he had seen my KF-HD.  He said, "No, I haven't seen it today." While speaking he made a 180 degree correction to our course.  I asked, "Did YOU forget something?"  "No," he replied.  "We're returning home for your Kindle Fire.  I'm not spending 10 days away from home on this trip, with you, if you haven't packed it."He's a smart, smart man!

Reviews.Title: excellent choice
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: I spent considerable time looking for what I wanted and needed in a tablet. At times I was so confused and frustrated that I consider getting another laptop instead. I shopped on line and in store, talking with others, reading articles, getting as much info as possible. My needs are basic and I live quite happily without Microsoft's products.I'm a housepainter who loves to read, plays guitar, loves rock and roll, conservative news junkie, somewhat of a hermit who connects with life-long friends via social networks and email. I decided on a kindle upgrade and frankly,I couldn't be happier. I made an excellent and affordable choice. One of the factors precipitating my decision is how much I value the state of the art customer service i have already come to experience with Amazon.I am not a techie, so I can't tell you how great the specs are, but for ease of use, dependability and efficiency, I couldn't be happier.I'm 63 years old now and I appreciate the simplicity of operation as well.Five stars easily. I requested a refurbished device but they sent me a brand new one at the refurbished price.lucky guy! I think Amazon is attempting and succeeding at providing flawless customer service which counts a lot with me.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for TV and movies
Reviews.Author: Tes Got It
Reviews.Content: I have the Kindle fire. It used to be just for reading, online stuff. Then I found I could watch TV shows on it. As far as I'm concerned this is the only way to watch TV and movies. However with very limited space it became frustrating. I researched the different tablets, price compared, ratings. I don't believe I'll ever be an Apple Imac purchaser. I am very happy with Amazon's android connection. As to the reason for my purchase, I can download now with what seems unlimited space. I actually don't know the limit because I watch and delete. The size had taken some getting use to, it's quite a bit larger than the Fire. The charger I think is in an inconvenient spot. However, the picture is amazing. It's quite a bit faster than the Fire. My Ipad friends are quite amazed too. I'm no techie, but I know what works for me. And come on.... $200-$300 less for the Kindle. It really was a no-brainer.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: Phyl Worm "Ultimate Book Worm"
Reviews.Content: Love my new KINDLE FIRE and so glad I went with the BIGGER size!  I'm 72 years young and just love this product! So easy to read and easy even for me to work with!

Reviews.Title: Using the Kindle
Reviews.Author: Irene Orino
Reviews.Content: It sometimes gets stuck and you can't move on.  I have to go to another game .  I do enjoy playing with this at night and am really glad to get so many games to try out free.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product
Reviews.Author: supersun45
Reviews.Content: I have this Kindle Fire for a couple months now. I bought it with some of my graduation money. A friend of mine has an Ipad so I used to get on his, but they're too expensive for my price rang. I actually like this better. It's just as good as an Ipad, and way tougher. The screen hasn't gotten scratched once, and this is with no screen protector. I did buy a case, but that's more for standing it up when I watch movies and shows. Overall, I am blown away by this. The picture is incredible, and the sound is amazing. It's like HD sound. The Wi-Fi speed is great as well, perfect for streaming. Speaking of, the battery life is astounding. With a full battery, I can watch Netflix for well over eight hours. I haven't used Skype at all so I can't say anything about that. The touchscreen is amazingly responsive.Even though this device is tough, it's still lightweight, which is the best thing I can ask for. I'll be keeping it in my backpack when school starts this fall and I don't want something heavy weighing me down. Basically, it's perfect. Now, the screen is a little smaller than an Ipad, but that is not a con in my book. If anything, it just makes it easier to hold your hand, especially when your reading.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire for me
Reviews.Author: Tammy McCray
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a tablet with a bigger screen that I could carry around with me but wouldn't be too heavy.  I have a regular Kindle which I used to carry around and read books on.  Like I said, I wanted something with a bigger screen and also something that I could connect to the internet, read emails, etc.  After comparing the Kindle Fire HD with iPads, etc. the price was just to good to resist.  I love my Kindle Fire HD.  The only thing I do not like about it, is that the camera is front facing only.  I'm still trying to learn how to take pictures without being in them!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Product:
Reviews.Author: Curt Cleancut
Reviews.Content: I've had my Kindle for a few months. My family loves it. I was worried that the Kindle wouldn't stand up to the Ipad but it truly does. It's half the price and virtually offers the same services. Amazon allows users to "backdoor" Android apps. That's a huge plus. There are TONS of apps available between both Kindle Amazon and Android. My son is almost 2 and we've loaded preschool apps for him to use as well. He's literally learning to count and has pretty much mastered his alphabet with some of the apps. I'm getting my wife one of these soon before I deploy. Lol I'm scared to leave her and my son without it when I leave. We'll be able to Skype without me having to lug around my laptop overseas!!!!I'm obviously happy with my investment. It was a solid choice.

Reviews.Title: Needs design changes
Reviews.Author: Patricia Moore
Reviews.Content: I would have given this a 5 star rating if it weren't for a couple of things. One - the camera is on the wrong side. It is very difficult to take pictures and videos when you can't see what you are taking the picture or video of. Two - there is no indicator light to let you know when charging is complete. I still have lots to learn but don't expect any other problems. I kinda wish I would have waited til they had been out a while to see if the inconveniences were addressed.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire Expectations
Reviews.Author: marcblue
Reviews.Content: I gave the "Fire" a Five Star rating because after performing a thorough review of the product before purchasing, I knew exactly what I was getting. As a result, the "Fire" either met or exceeded my expectations. I've read a number reviews that criticized the device for not having Adobe Flash. Evidently, these commentators did not read other reviews explaining that Adobe (NOT AMAZON) was no longer supporting Flash in mobile devices. However, other users provided a step by step workaround solution that works great! Others have complained that photo taking is next to impossible. Evidently, they did not understand or did not read the "specs" that the camera was designed for Skype (rear lens only) and no front lens for taking photos. The more I use the "Fire" the more adept I have become. I find the typing and the word completion relatively easy. I've downloaded movies and watched TV shows from Comcast, Netflix and Amazon without a problem. There is even an app that I installed that allows me to transfer documents from my PC to the "Fire" for personal reference. I've downloaded my personal videos and transferred music that I purchased from Apple  to the "Fire."The only decision that I may have 2nd thoughts on was purchasing the 32 gig instead of the 64 gig because not be able to add memory.All and all the "Fire", "especially for the money" has met all of my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Kindle 8.9 - UPDATE 01 10 2014
Reviews.Author: Lady with the Fidz
Reviews.Content: Having bought the first Kindle that came out - this was an upgrade for me.  I went with Amazon's since I have such a large Amazon library.I'm updating my review as my first Kindle stopped charging.  The sent a replacement - we will call it #2 for this review.#2 arrived and it's refurbished.  It would not download ANYTHING and constantly would start with the "orange circle" during videos - it was 12 times in the first two minutes of a show I had DOWNLOADED.  So, Amazon is okay, we will replace.#3 - this was GROSS.  The screen was so FILTHY and GREASY that I had to clean it three times to get it even to an acceptable point.  (Might I point out it was in a clean and new bag.) Then the color of the screen was a very dull BROWN (and no, I'm not color blind), the software update was really out of date and it would not allow me to update it.  Plus, there were features MISSING on #3 - and of course, it again didn't download.  So, Amazon is okay, we will replace with a "new one that will be perfect" - it arrived today.#4 - software is out of date but I have since learned how to do that myself.  The screen is again is a dull brown but that's not the worst part. This one on the left hand of the screen (no matter what orientation) has about 2 1/2 inches of darkness and a line going right down it. UNACCEPTABLE.When plugging it in to charge (to the Kindle Charger) the top part where it plugs in and the upper back left of the Kindle gets so hot you cannot touch it comfortably.Downloading and streaming videos if you don't mind only seeing part of the screen - well, doesn't work for me. I prefer to see the whole show....not part.However, the hot space from where it is charging and the area at the back of the Kindle does keep me warm.I was asked to give it one more try.  So, okay, Amazon, this is your LAST SHOT at getting me a Kindle that WORKS.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9 32GB
Reviews.Author: wrhalver
Reviews.Content: My first experience in the Tablet world. Have had my Kindle for about three weeks now. I am accustomed to Android Smartphones and therefore Google Play. As mentioned in many of the other reviews, the world of Kindle does not include Google Play. But every app I use, or a similiar version of the app, can be found in the Amazon App store and 1 Mobile Market. And by the way, OfficeSuite and ES File Manager work with Google Drive. Other apps like X-Plore require a Google account, and some apps have partial functionality without the Google account. Also, the onboard Silk web browser does not support Flash. But nowadays many browsers don't. The Dolphin browser supports Flash and works great with my Kindle. I use the Dolphin browser most of the time. Learned this from my experiences with the Droid 2 and 4. My Kindle is protected with the Manvex cover. I am typing this review using the KT-1167 keyboard, and I use a capacitive stylus. If you have thick fingers the stylus will be used often. Still looking for a separate bluetooth mouse. Really don't want to use a trackpad that is part of a keyboard. I have made my investment into the world of the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 and so far I am not disappointed. Right price, right size screen, good audio quality. And when I don't have an available Wifi connection, I use FoxFi on my Droid 4. Very happy with this product, and my overall business relationship with Amazon.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loovve my kindle fire HD. I waited over a week to do this review because I didn't want it to be compromised due to my overall excitement. I was tied between a kindle fire HD and an iPad mini. After doing some research and making my pro/con list, kindle won due to its affordable price, I even got the 32GB. I am a huge fan of amazon and already own a kindle keyboard. Not really a fan of apple, the only apple product I own is an iPod touch that I got over 4 years ago.The display of the kindle fire HD is AH-MAZING. I was blown away at the crisp display. It makes everything look good, even the font! I find myself watching movies/shows on it rather than my 46 inch screen TV because I am just mesmerized by the display. There are plenty of apps. Since I don't own many apple products I don't have anything else to compare the apps too, but I am satisfied with what is given. Reading on the kindle fire is amazing as well, I am an avid reader so this is a huge plus. Upgrading from the kindle keyboard to the fire's back light did take some adjusting but after a day or two of reading I was comfortable with it. It has pretty cool features too such as seeing how much of the book is left displayed on the bottom of the screen and it also states up many more minutes till the next chapter! As well as some other new kinks. The speakers are nice and clear, although I wish they were a bit louder, I understand it's not suppose to be a stereo but slighter volume would of been a plus. The web experience is very nice, but it does lack flash. I heard there is a way around that, but it doesn't bother me (yet). Since I got the kindle (about 8 days ago) the web page crashed only once and that's because I had a lot of things going on at once (7+ pages open + pandora)...They don't include a charger in the package which I think was a HUGE mistake on amazons part. The Amazon Kindle Power Fast adapter is a NECESSITY unless you want to wait 16+ hours to get your kindle charged. I used my other kindle adapter and only had it changed at 50% after 9 hours and drained to 15% after two hours of use. The very next day I went and got this charger, now it takes 6-7 hours for a full charge and the charge can last an entire day to two days depending on what you are using the kindle for.Since I got the kindle fire HD I also signed up for amazon prime to get the full experience. There are plenty of free shows and movies to watch! I just wish the kindle lending wasn't restricted to one book per month :(Overall I give this product a 4.5 rating and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE My Kindle!
Reviews.Author: Delisa Renideo
Reviews.Content: I've had 3 other Kindle's and loved them all, but this one is great for the way I use it.I still use my original Kindle Fire when reading in bed because it is easier to hold than this bigger Kindle.However, there are some wonderful things I love about this Kindle. I use it as my portable computer.  I take it with me into the kitchen and I can listen or watch various webinars or other programs I subscribe to. I hook it up to a speaker system in order to hear it better, although the speakers in the Kindle are much better than the ones in my Kindle Fire.I use it to check my email, and I can also easily respond to my email because I bought the Belkin Keyboard and Case, so it's much easier to type on it than with the virtual keyboard.One thing I DON'T like is that it isn't designed to be able to use Flash, and I use that a lot to access the videos in the webinars.  I was finally able to access Flash using a work-around. I had to go to YouTube to find out how!  I ended up downloading Dolphin as my browser so I could download Flash. I now have it and it works great, but it sure seems like it should have been integrated into the Kindle from the beginning.I love the portability of the Kindle, especially since I use it as a computer much of the time.I also love that this model includes the text to voice feature, so I can have my books read to me while I'm working in the kitchen or driving.It's easy to use, and easy to get around. I find it quite intuitive.  I wish there were better instructions that came with it, but I was able to download a Kindle book of instructions for a small price -- about $2.99 I think. That was helpful.As I said in the beginning, I still use my other Kindle for some of my reading just because the smaller size is easier to hold. But when I'm traveling, this Kindle is perfect as I can read my books (or listen to them) as well as access email and the Internet. I love it!

Reviews.Title: Great device
Reviews.Author: Donald W Savage
Reviews.Content: We have earlier Kindles, but purchased this one for myself because of the larger screen and the ability to stream movies from our Prime account.  It has lived up to all my expectations.  Have also loaded serveral great apps...Weather channel, CNN, USAToday and the MapsWithMe.  Used the Kindle on a recent trip to Europe instead of taking my laptop (never missed the laptop...the Kindle handled everything).  Great riding on a bus in Croatia and understanding everything about our route from the MapsWithMe.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet and Content Universe
Reviews.Author: M.Worrell
Reviews.Content: I don't like committing to sticking with one company's proprietary content when purchasing electronics. To me it's like buying a record player that will only play one label's records. Here's why Amazon won me over:- I can sideload apps. Barnes and Noble forced my switch from a Nook Tablet to the Kindle Fire when they updated their device to block sideloaded apps. I hate being chained against my will to a company's logo, and being told what I can do with my own tablet. If you've invested in a library for the Nook, you can read those books on your Fire via the Nook app. Most other apps I've tried that for whatever reason are not in the Amazon app store seem to run fine.- I can sideload legally purchased content I ripped/stripped myself, and it's easy. If you're up for learning how, you can find a way to get all your existing content onto the Fire, with covers that show on your shelf, etc.- Amazon is simply the best online bookstore. If you have Prime, with all the accompanying perks, you'll be very happy with Amazon's content on other fronts. And with free shipping you can save a lot of money on ordinary purchases.- The performance of the Kindle Fire hardware is excellent. Lightweight, looks great, sounds great, very responsive.The only reason I gave the device four stars instead of five is the interface. The "carousel" is just a big, dumb nothing, and it's right in your face. I would MUCH rather have a few screens that I can populate with my favorite apps and content as I see fit, and have the carousel accessible but otherwise hidden.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Mother's Day Gift :)
Reviews.Author: eaks0719
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for my Mother for Mother’s day. I wanted to get her a tablet that had a great HD screen, was easy to use and wasn’t too expensive. My mom is not tech savvy so I thought getting her a higher-end more competitive tablet (ipad, surface, etc.) would be a waste because she wouldn’t use it to its potential.She absolutely loves it!!! I spent time setting it up and helped her understand how to use it. This does not come with a paper manual, but it has a quick tutorial when you start it up and there is a manual on the tablet if you need one to use.`The Short Answer:Yes, I would recommend this tablet to someone who is:a.New to tabletsb.Someone who is not tech savvyc.Someone who wants an excellent eReaderd.Someone who casually uses computers and would like to have a tabletDon’t get this tablet if you must have the latest and greatest in apps (the app store is limited & no Google play store) or you want an android tablet that you can customize to your own preference.I would also let someone know while recommending this tablet that it does NOT come with the wall charger only the USB chord to connect to a computer to charge and the charging time can be a long time. But if you want to wait and see if you must have it or need it I have seen them for sale at the big box stores that sell kindles (I saw it for sure at office depot and at best buy), so if you don’t get it, it shouldn’t be too difficult to get it should you decide it’s something you need.Also, it comes with ads that show on it and you can remove them for an extra $15 either at the point of sale or later. Since this was a gift, I left the ads on there (as I understand some people don’t mind them while others are very against them) but I did include an amazon gift card so if my mom wanted to remove them she wouldn’t have to spend her own money.How I decided on this tablet:I did some research online – the biggest selling point was the screen. I figured that my mom would use it more to read books and watch movies & TV shows, she may play some games from the app store but nothing too complex.The next thing I did was go and find one to try out at a major box store. I watched some movie trailers and played some games, went through the demo, read some paragraphs got on the internet and it was wonderful for what it would be used for. I wanted to get a good idea of how it would function and run so that when my Mom got hers and we fired it up I would know if it was working fine or not.I cannot stress “try it before you buy it” enough.  If you aren’t sure or do not have any experience with tablets go to the store and try them out! If you have questions, ask – even though this isn’t as expensive as some other tablets, it is still a major purchase and you want to make sure you make the correct decision.

Reviews.Title: love hate relationship
Reviews.Author: Michael Gray
Reviews.Content: Got this for Christmas and wanted to wait 6 months before reviewing. Not so sure we will make it that long, so here goes.When everything works properly I love this pad. Just the right size, great sound and good color.Battery life is OK some of the time but can be inconsistent. That is the first problem. I have gone to bed without charging, as I thought there was plenty of power left, just to wake up to a dead unit. Charges pretty quick, but I like to be able to use it first thing when I get up.The second major problem is the browser. It constantly tells me tabs are not responding and offers to restart them. Most of the time there appears to be no problem with what I am viewing, but the notification pops right up in the middle of the page blocking what I am reading. Sometimes this will happen several times while attempting to read a single paragraph of text.Finally the pad will sometimes just freeze. This mostly again seems to be related to Silk when using the browser directly or when redirected by some apps. Keep in mind also that there are limited apps available and many do not seem well developed to work with the Kindle Fire or it's browser.In the last month or so all of these problems seem to be getting worse so that is why I thought it wise to review at this time. We still have some good days but the devices performance is just too inconsistent to warrant more than 2 stars.Update 7/31/13After writing my review I was contacted by Amazon customer service. They had some suggestions and talked me through them. They said they would call back in a few days. They never called back. What they had me do wiped all my data from Silk. Their suggestion to turn the device off to save battery just makes the pad less convenient to pick up and use and has done nothing to improve battery drain in use or efficiency in charging. The final problem has been that frequently when using Silk the pad will just reboot.Now the good news. Did a little online research and found that some Google apps can be side loaded. I now have Google Chrome for my browser and the Maps app. I'm not a big fan of Chrome but it does sync with Chrome on my PC and android phone. The pad no longer reboots for no reason. Still get an occasional freeze but rarely.I would consider adding a star if I had not been required to fix all this myself. Also the battery problem has not improved much. I am trying the new battery saver app for Kindle but so far I don't think it's doing much. I'm also using the new Mobile Desktop app and love it. You still have to go through the carousel to get to it but from there it's great.If this thing makes it to a year I might add a star yet. If Amazon would admit they have problems and make efforts to correct them they could get another star for sure. They could start by allowing all Google apps and play store.

Reviews.Title: First Class
Reviews.Author: Marguerite Wihby
Reviews.Content: I have used an I pad before. This far exceeds my expectation. It is also much cost effective.I like that I can stay connected to facebook, Skype etc;I highly recommend.My only down side is the quality of the audio used in Skype.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9 Review
Reviews.Author: Sprkymrt
Reviews.Content: I already had a Kindle 3G with the 7" screen, so I wanted to get the Fire 8.9 with the larger screen and color.  This has exceeded my expectations and I am very well satisfied with it.  I have the one with Special Offers, and while that can irritate some people, I have ordered a few of them.  My Kindle has mostly music and books on it, and speaking of books, this is great for getting ones that have any pictures, maps or diagrams in it, which held me back on the other one, although that is fine for reading novels and books that don't contain photos.  The speakers are very good, and I can download content  from the internet and Amazon without any trouble.  I have my email on here and get a notification whenever something comes in.  Games can be had from simple ones for kids to the more complicated ones for teens and older people.  I have a few of the larger games on mine but right now I seem to be stuck playing mahjong, but that will wear off eventually.

Reviews.Title: An amazing choice for school-aged children for classwork
Reviews.Author: csm
Reviews.Content: We need this for our school district and boy, are we ever glad that we bought this over the Ipad.  When the kids take this thing to school, the kids with the ipads wish desperately that they had this 32gb Kindle just based on all that it can do.  Particularly if you're looking for something for kids to learn on, you really go wrong with this, especially for the price.  I just wasn't too thrilled about coughing up $800 for a device that was going to school every day.  This thing, however, outshines that ipad and the teachers are so impressed with it that they are suggesting that the rest of the classroom purchase these for use.Check the above comparisons to make your final decision. Plus, there's a guy on here that reviewed this and said to just get the 32gb over the 64 and keep your cell phone separate because this is awkward to use as a phone.  SO helped my decision!  And really, the 32 is the best bang for your buck, hands down, unless, of course, you're a high gb user and need the 64.  The huge screen on this thing is awesome - it works like a dream and we've been nothing but pleased this entire time that we've been using it.  It's a great choice for classwork, from elementary up to even college and if you buy an Otterbox cover for it, it's virtually indestructible!This goes everywhere now, from school to Sunday school to the grocery store, you name it.  And with that Otterbox on it, I have peace of mind and know that it will last.  SO glad I did the research on this and made this decision.  Oh, almost forgot - when you put this in your shopping cart, amazon recommends an adaptor for $10.  Be SURE to order that as well to recharge your new Kindle since it does NOT come with one.  Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: I am so grateful to have gotten this kindle
Reviews.Author: Shari Riley
Reviews.Content: I already have the kindle fire 7" and love it to death, I take it with me everywhere, it's always in my purse. Now for the 8.9 wireless, I love the size but for different reasons, I read mostly and play the games I can without internet on the kindle fire 7", but the kindle fire 8.9 I can now watch movies, go on the internet, play games that require the internet, so it's kinda like a small laptop without a dvd player at half the size. For example I am planning on spending a lot of summer days at wet and wild in las vegas so I need the internet, so I'm not just stuck reading, but can also check my facebook or watch a movie.  I do have a smart phone but the screen is to small for my eyes, so that's my opinion of the fire HD 4G. I also bought the Bear wireless keyboard, and cover which is really nice if you hate typing on the screen and a waterproof cover to protect my kindle from water. Going to be a great summer in Vegas!!!

Reviews.Title: Ahem.....flash? But that is a common problem.
Reviews.Author: J.B.
Reviews.Content: I have to say I do love the Kindle Fire. When I decided to get a tablet, I researched all options. I checked out a few tablets at Costco and also looked at reviews. My priorities are/were: reading, videos, games. I didn't really see myself using the tablet as a laptop substitution or else i would have purchased a laptop.PROS:Easy to set up. No thought process whatsoever.Anything Amazon is amazingly simple as far as Kindle and Amazon are concerned.Sound is fantastic.Graphics are fantastic.Wifi is super fast.Structurally, IMO, it's a solid piece of equipment.CONS:Doesn't play nice with Google sometimesTHINGS BEYOND ITS FAULT:Flash. I know this is a common tablet problem, however.There are ways around any limitations you find. I don't regret my purchase at all, my friends who have tablets that were more expensive don't really have anything more than I have.I actually have since recanted my "no substitution for laptop" resolve and purchased a keyboard. The Kindle and keyboard paired wonderfully and while there's no DVD drive (but who really needs one), it's pretty much like having a laptop :)

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: Francis K. Doughan
Reviews.Content: Everything said about this mobile device by amazon is true. I bought it for my wife who is almost always on the move and it has excellently served its purpose so far. When out of town or country, myself and the kids are able to get in contact via skype.  She does not have to use her laptop while riding a train (equipped with wifi) in europe.  No one knows when she is reading her bible app and praying silently on the train,bus, and airplane. The stunning HD screen is superb. Being an avid movie lover, she watches movies free of charge to ward off the alone times.The only setback is that the camera could be upgraded to both front and back for more 'freedom'. I always can't wait to see my wife's beautiful face via skype when she is in Europe, thanks to Kindle Fire HD 8.9".

Reviews.Title: Good Stuff, No Make That Great Stuff
Reviews.Author: kaitiaki
Reviews.Content: March 30, 2013Kindle Fire HD 8.9" showed up yesterday. Just checked it out and so far everything is ka pai. First, without a case it fits quite nicely in my man purse. Second, and more importantly, copied a PDF report from my computer hard drive to the Kindle document folder. Eminently readable with the Kindle's native PDF reader. So far I like. Seeking recommendations for a case/stand that's fairly compact.April 6, 2013The Kindle Fire HD 8.9" is now clad in a purple i-Blason case/cover. Loaded several PDF reports I didn't print out. Readable with reading glasses. Case works well in preventing fingerprints (never realized how greasy I am) but probably won't do much protecting if I dropped the rig. But case doesn't increasing dimensionality significantly so I can still lug it around in my man purse--a feature more important to me than protection. Don't have wi-fi access so haven't loaded any apps thus cannot attest to the Kindle Fire HD's versatility. At present it is a fine PDF viewer which will always be its primary use.April 14, 2013IMPORTANT NOTICE FOR AARP MEMBERS: I found out too late, but there's a 10% discount coupon for Kindle readers on the AARP pages. [...]April 21, 2013Love affair with Kindle Fire HD 8.9" continues unabated. If anything, the flame burns brighter. No more stacks of GBC-bound documents cluttering up the place--well, no new stacks anyway. And an impression--now that I have some styli that work more effectively, I think the Kindle's form factor speeds up my reading--I can gobble up entire paragraphs without scanning side to side or up and down within a paragraph. And tapping the Kindle with a stylus is a lot faster than turning real pages. And colored graphs and charts appear to be more quickly comprehended. Couldn't afford to run color copies of documents. One downside is that I need to remember to rename PDFs on the desktop before copying them onto the Kindle. Also, without hard copies in hand, I find that I am not entering cataloging/indexing data into the Access database.

Reviews.Title: Very impressive device
Reviews.Author: D. E. Keith
Reviews.Content: One of my better purchases. I do love my Kindle Fire HD. It is very user friendly, handy and entertaining. A vast array of Apps and games are available. If I have any complaint with my Kindle, it would be with the Kindle speakers. They are seriously lacking, but there is an App available to remedy that flaw. A simple suggestion to Amazon, consider boosting speakers  or sell external speakers so I can listen and adjust the volume separately.

Reviews.Title: A review from a book reader
Reviews.Author: Thatonegirl_xoxo "ThatOneGirl_xoxo"
Reviews.Content: Purchase date: 3-1-13 I bought the Kindle Fire HD mainly because I ran out of room on my Kindle Fire. I only had 8GB available and with the things I read it didn't take long to fill but anyway...As for picture and sound I'd give them both a 10/10. I haven't had any problems with glares even when I'm outside. I do have a screen protector on mine but even with the screen protector it's still glare free. I'm a huge fan of watching Hulu and Youtube and it streams things perfectly.Books 10/10: What interested me the most in purchasing the HD was the whispersync feature. When you purchase a book it gives you the option to add voice to it for a couple extra dollars. And it turns the book into a professionally read audio book. I do recommend this option because the normal voice that you get without paying the extra couple of dollars is a very robotic GPS type sounding voice. In my opinion I don't mind if I pay a couple of extra bucks if it's a book I'm really looking forward too. The option is entirely up to you but sense I'm a big on books it's something I always consider.Web Browsing 9/10: The only reason I'm not giving this a perfect score is because I wish it had Flash. Yes, it is fast. Almost faster than my laptop but if it had Flash it would make it much better. I would like to be able to play Facebook games.App's (7/10): There were a few apps that were not available on Kindle HD that were available on my ipod. But it's not a big deal to me because I didn't buy it specifically for the apps I bought it for books.Look and appearance (8/10): The HD is a lot lighter than I expected. And I love having the bigger screen but it is a little clunky to me if you compare it to the Kindle Fire 7 inch. But it's just a minor adjustment that I've already gotten used too. In a way it reminds me about the size of a hardback book if you really think about it.Battery life (7/10): I can go several days without having to charge this device. But I gave it a 7 because I only got a USB port in the box and no wall charger. This turned out to be a big pet peeve with me and more of a pain. I tried to charge it through my computer but it didn't work. I had given my Mother my old Kindle Fire so I had to go out and purchase a separate wall charger. Why wouldn't you guys include the wall charger? Not all of us want to sync through our computers. Not to mention if we're going to invest in this much money there should be a wall charger included. So if that's the only complaint that I have about this device that is it that they don't include the wall charger.Side note: I know there isn't really a category for this suggestion but one thing I've noticed when searching for cases for my HD that there aren't very many yet. Maybe I'm just too picky but I was looking for a zip case one and I just couldn't find one I liked. I would like to see more cases for the HD other than just online. And Best Buy had a very few to choose from.Other than the charger issue I'm a happy Kindle Fire HD owner. I do think it is worth it to upgrade to the new version and I'm glad I did. I've had it almost a week now and I'm a happy camper. I like having a bigger screen, and I use the whispersync more than I thought I would. Above all I love having all of the extra room for more books!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Truessence "True"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" for my husband. I must say very impressive. I have the lastest Apple Ipad, and must say I still a fan of the Kindle Fire. So if you prefer not to spend the extra money on an Apple Ipad, this product can stand on his own. Money worth spending, plus my hubby is a happy man which is must important.Great Product!!!!

Reviews.Title: Questionable feature integration
Reviews.Author: Edwin A. Matzner "Edwin M"
Reviews.Content: None of the more advanced Kindles support the strong features of the original keyboard version.  Thus, Kindle for PC and Kindle Cloud cannot "search my items" (the global search in all books), and there are other weaknesses of the different operating systems.  Worst of all, the Kindle Fire does not support the "collections" feature, which I find very useful if one has many books, and on which, for my 450 books and some 25 "collections," I spent many months.  It was thus reluctantly that I had to return the Kindle Fire.  Otherwise, I would give it 5 stars, but to have to start collections again from scratch due to system incompatibility is hard.  Better feature integration would help.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Curtis Ray Brown "Mindy Brown"
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire.  I do have a concern about the amount of battery life on my Kindle.  It does not seem to stay charged more than 24 hours.  I like to read all the time, I would rather do that than watch TV, so that is the only complaint I have about it.  I love how all the functions work.

Reviews.Title: Loving the Kindle
Reviews.Author: mommy2girls
Reviews.Content: I fell down some stairs. Borrowed my daughters Kindle to read and watch Downton Abbey. My daughter needed hers back for school. So I took the dive into tablet research and decided to add another Kindle into our family. I got the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" with 32 GB.  I am so glad we did! Great for traveling. Only need my Kindle and one magazine to get me through a flight now. Great for convalescing too. I could read books, magazines and watch TV shows or movies without moving from my nest on the couch. Very helpful.I think I slightly regret not getting the 4G Wireless 64GB. I am doing well with WiFi only, but there are times when I could see being wireless would be good. the 64 GB would be nice. We hate how movies stop while buffering on flights. So we downloaded a movie---my memory probably can only take one at a time. So what do I do with that movie eventually? Can't store it on the cloud it seems. So we have one movie that will play no problem and all the rest will have to buffer.Also, there are not many cover choices for the 8.9" just yet.But I am so glad I bought it!

Reviews.Title: Great choice to read, search the Web and enjoy magazines.
Reviews.Author: LGR
Reviews.Content: My Kindle Fire HD is outstanding and I have only had it for a month!  I love the beautiful color display and the ease with which apps, books and music can be purchased and downloaded.  I now have access, at no additional charge, to many of the magazines to which I subscribe - no more dragging the actual magazines along to catch up on my reading!  I look forward to finding many other benefits of my Kindle Fire in the months ahead.  Of course, I loved my original Kindle with free 3G, too.  I used it for two years before moving to the Fire.

Reviews.Title: I'm enjoying this at the newly reduced price.
Reviews.Author: John Yungton
Reviews.Content: The price difference between the 7" and 8.9" was only $50 after upgrading to 32Gb's, don't know why the memory is priced higher on the 7" Kindle.  I've been able to install most everything needed thru 1Mobile website, so there truly isn't much reason for another $200 bucks for a Nexus 10.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9 exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: SL Dawg
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 last week and I can't put it down. The amazon app store has all the apps that I love and if they don't I simply change the setting allowing non amazon apps to download. The screen resolution is remarkable. I love watching movies and reading on this tablet. I knew going in this was a media consumption tablet. I have used the office suite and it works just fine. I LOVE the swipe feature on the keyboard. Wow is it a timesaver.This fits my needs, as a prime member, that I cannot see getting another tablet.The only con is the weight. The tablet starts to feel heavy after holding it for a while.

Reviews.Title: A Senior loves it!
Reviews.Author: Becky Giroux
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my Mother who is home bound taking care of my Step Dad. She loves it! Everything is right at her fingertips. She even pays her bills online. Not bad for a 75 year old.

Reviews.Title: Great buy for a tablet newbie.
Reviews.Author: BAS "BAS"
Reviews.Content: I have had my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 for over a month now and I am so happy to have it.  It has fine screen clarity and good sound and it has been easy to learn how to use and download apps.  My purpose in purchasing a tablet is because we are looking at spending a lot of time in doctor's offices in the near future and wanted something to while away the time and keep up with email.  It has been easy to connect to WiFi at various locations.  We have Amazon prime so have access to lots of movies for free and certainly helps us while away the long waits at the hospital.  So glad we made this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9 or 7" size toss up
Reviews.Author: J. Bondy
Reviews.Content: My wife likes the KF HD 7" for purse travel. However, I like larger screen of the 8.9 for several reasons.The 8.9 is hard to beat on the lectern for notes.  When using a blue tooth keyboard it seems to be a better fit to the screen.  Magazines work better on the 8.9. Of course the movies are a better view on the larger screen too.  The 8.9 is not that much larger to stick in brief case or pack. Finally, overall I just like to pick it up and have the larger screen. Maybe it's related to my idea of a  pickup versus a small car. I will always like larger size and take the truck. Both of the HD's are working great for us. Thus my vote is for the 8.9.

Reviews.Title: I am in AWE!!!
Reviews.Author: Angela Ross
Reviews.Content: I write this review, just days after receiving my new Kindle Fire HD....First off...Amazon is da bomb...really...I ordered the Kindle Friday and received it Saturday!  I was suppose to receive it Tuesday....boy I was shocked and giddy...like a kid in a candy store.I must say that I read tons of reviews before I decided to purchase my Kindle, I had a Kindle Fire (a graduation gift from my sister) that I gave to my nephew because his tablet crapped out on him.  He really enjoys the kindle instead.  This was my cue to upgrade and purchase the new Kindle Fire HD.The picture quality of the HD is awesome...I watched several movies on it this past weekend and I felt as if I was watching my 47" HD TV in my living room.  The sound is good (wish I had purchased a case for it so I can watch hands free) laying it flat on certain surfaces affect the sound quality.  I had to figure that out the hard way....plus my son the genius told me so.I am very happy with my purchase and I highly recommend it.Thanks Amazon!

Reviews.Title: New Owner
Reviews.Author: FRB0807
Reviews.Content: I'm a new owner of a tablet and I love my kindle. My only concern was getting AT&T; service because I had some really bad service from them in the past and I vow to never return as a customer. I was glad to find out my current internet service offer 4G so I decided to purchase the kindle. It's so easy to download books and games. I also like the library feature. I would recommend purchasing a screen protector.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical at first just like any good buyer since you usually get what you pay for, and when you compared the price of this to say the IPad your paying a lot less. Fortunately you get everything and more! This was a great buy it has a quick start up, very child friendly (I have a 2 year old) whom plays with it everyday, and also suits my needs for work and school. So I would absolutely recommend this to anyone that wishes to buy a nice tablet for work, play, or anything else that someone can think up!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9 4G Wireless
Reviews.Author: wendy
Reviews.Content: This is the best purchase I have ever made, it does everything it is supose to do. Clear pictures. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a Kindle.

Reviews.Title: The right choice
Reviews.Author: mommywsej
Reviews.Content: I was trying to decide between a kindle or an ipad. I wasnt very familiar with a kindle at the time. I had used an ipad and liked it ok. One big issue was price. An ipad is very expensive. The kindle is a great value that offers as much or more than the ipad. I am glad I chose the Kindle. I got the 8.9 inch kindle fire HD. I made the right choice!

Reviews.Title: Excellent piece of technology better than an I pad, very good dolby surround sound.
Reviews.Author: Vivek Mehra
Reviews.Content: I am fully satisfied with this Kindle fire HD as it is a nice piece of technology & it has good surround sound , i like it more than the I pads people have been carrying around me....excellent product , value for money, definately would refer to my freinds

Reviews.Title: OMGoodness!!!
Reviews.Author: Wraith Kitten "Spooky"
Reviews.Content: Having the original Fire, I fell in serious crush mode. Then I got the HD 8.9 in my hands...I fell in love and am so glad I splurged, I treated myself to the 8.9! The screen is so clear and crisp, the touch screen works better with a stylus and the sound is awesome. Watching movies is more engaging, games are realistic and did I mention the sound quality.I highly recommend the HD 8.9 as a more versital Tablet, the Fire HD is not just for reading anymore!!!

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect
Reviews.Author: Michael Avallone "Obiwopkenobi"
Reviews.Content: I knew I would love the Kindle Fire HD. I have now put it through its paces over the last couple of days and can only come up with two minor things that could have been done better. The first thing is the charging input. I would have put this on the side since when I have it in its case the charging cable is in the way. I actually have to flip it over and sit the case the other way so the cable is now technically coming out of the top.The second thing is taking pictures.
