Since this baby takes pretty nice pictures, why on Earth do I have to point the screen at the subject? There should be a second camera on the back of the Kindle. I can't for the life of me understand why this was left out. It couldn't have cost that much more to add a second camera. My thinking is this will get an upgrade down the road.Other than that the Kindle rocks.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Amber R Burkhart
Reviews.Content: Awesome! Thanks got this for my hubby as an anniversary gift. He's an OTR truck driver. He loves it! :)

Reviews.Title: Love, love, love it !!
Reviews.Author: Robert Pizzino
Reviews.Content: I finally took the plunge after vacillating for a couple years over a tablet. Very glad I chose the Kindle Fire !

Reviews.Title: yeah
Reviews.Author: famof5
Reviews.Content: Been doing count down until I could upgrade to kindle 8.9. Now i have it and love it twice as much as my first kindle. Amazing speed and picture. Loved my first worship my new one. If you are addicted to amazon as me then kindle it now!

Reviews.Title: More than happy!
Reviews.Author: smey2183
Reviews.Content: My husband got the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 for me for Christmas. I was super excited! But i noticed from the moment i started using it that something was wrong with the power button. It kept sticking and sometimes i couldnt even press it to make the screen turn on and off. I contacted Amazon and they were more than helpful. No questions asked, they sent me a new Kindle and it arrived 1 day after i called. I boxed up my old one and sent it back. And the new one they sent me works perfect. It was a very smooth transaction. And since they didnt hesitate to send me a new one, that made it even better. Graphics on the Kindle are amazing. Couldnt be happier with everything that if offers!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Gayle Patton
Reviews.Content: I love it!  The picture is so awesome.  I love watching movies on the Kindle HD!This is a great product!

Reviews.Title: Love my  Kindle
Reviews.Author: Ron A.
Reviews.Content: I have never owned any form of tablet before, this is my first. I was not really in the market for a tablet until I played around with a friend's iPad. So after doing much research I decided on the kindle fire 8.9. Is the kindle as user friendly, efficient, smooth or have as many apps as the iPad, no!! But, and this is the big But, my Kindle was$269.99 at Staples, this is much, much cheaper than an IPad. The Kindle is awesome, streaming is fantastic and the picture and sound are incredible. I use my droid charger to charge my Kindle. I will probably opt out of the special offers or advertisements as I like to call them.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: gongshi Zhang
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, it is much more better than ipad or ipad mini for someone who is getting tired of the ipad series. First of all, it impressed me when I first opened the box. It's black but looks really good. Don't forget the price. You paid the money less than an ipad mini and gains the experience as much as an ipad 4. So far, I am satisfied with everything about it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I own a Kindle DX, Kindle keyboard, Kindle Fire, Kindle Fire HD and an iPad first gen.I'm not going to do an indepth review because so many others have. I believe it's sufficient to say that the Kindle Fire HD compares favorably to the iPad in most ways. The added advantage of Amazon Prime makes owning this little gem very easy. I can do nearly everything with the Fire that the iPad can do. I like them both, but the Kindle Fire is my favorite for reading, apps, games and movies.edit 30 days later;Just one crazy thing about this tablet, the front facing camera is awkward. I can't take a photo in front of me at all. Plus the software doesn't come with it. This quirk didn't occur to me initially because I have the iPad 1st gen which has no camera, so I didn't think of it.

Reviews.Title: Love love love
Reviews.Author: ashley
Reviews.Content: I'll say it again, love love love.  It really does have as good of a resolution as the Ipad with retina, but I honestly believe it's much better.

Reviews.Title: Pleased
Reviews.Author: Plainfield317
Reviews.Content: I bought this having only had experience with an ipad 2nd generation. I believe the screen resolution on the fire is equal. The sound is better. I agree that the placement of the power button is not ideal. I accidentally turned it off a couple times. Maybe a portfolio case will help me not to do that. Not any reason to avoid this device. I also agree that a camera that faces both directions would be ideal. I don't want to take pictures of myself. But, this is a super convenient way to Skype. Recently figured out how to get all my music on cloud player. Found a ton of free apps. Most of all, the screen functions well for reading books. It is as easy to set screen preferences on the Fire as the ipad. Change for reading in the dark, enlarge print, easy peasy. I think that for the price this is a big value. They will get me to spend money here, which is why the kindle is more affordable than other devices. But, Amazon has things that interest me. Obtaining content is effortless.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Henry A. Dyson
Reviews.Content: WOW! Kindle Fire exceeded my expectation! Wonderful! I love the books and the Bible commentary I purchased, the games, the music  and when I get on line for the News I love that also. I highly reccomend it for any age. I am a very senior citiszen and I love it.

Reviews.Title: I'M FIRED UP!
Reviews.Author: Eileen Leon
Reviews.Content: Completely captivated with the best Christmas present ever, the Kindle Fire HD.Can do most anything that my desktop computer can do,and in many cases,do it faster and better.Along with its countless practical applications comes a whole lot of FUN !

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle
Reviews.Author: M Dunsmore
Reviews.Content: When viewing the different Kindle's available, I wanted one of the cheaper ones. My husband talked me into this one and I'm so happy he did. As for the ads, I've found them helpful and they are not the least annoying at all. I'm also not a tech person whatsoever but am able to manage the operations without reading the manual. Also, make sure you get the fast charger, you'll be glad you did plus it's only $9 if you purchase at the same time.

Reviews.Title: A REAL WINNER!!!! THANKS AMAZON!!!
Reviews.Author: Lois L. Jezek "jezzika"
Reviews.Content: DEAR AMAZON YOU HAVE OUTDONE YOURSELF. THE KINDLE FIRE HD IS SO FAR BEYOND WHERE YOUWERE AND WHAT WAS PROVIDED... THIS IS JUST GREAT... THE COLOR, SHARPNESS EASE OF USE,THE RESOLUTION OF THE PRINTED PAGES AS WELL AS THE CLARITY OF THE GREAT SCREEN TAKESYOUR BREATH AWAY... YES WE HAVE IPADS, BUT THIS FOR MY HUSBAND IS PERFECT...  HE LOVESYOUR BOOK SELECTION AND VARIETY OFFERED BY AMAZON AND WE MADE THE MOVE FROM B&N...;THEY ARE GREAT AND HAVE DONE WELL...BUT YOU HAVE IT ALL... WELL ORGANIZED AND TERRIFIC.THANKS, AMAZON.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Tablet
Reviews.Author: M. Bailey "mom of 5"
Reviews.Content: I was not sure about making the purchase of the Kindle Fire due to a number of people who seem to dislike this tablet. I am so happy that I ended up buying it. I have a son with special needs who loves playing games on the ipad (used at the hospital he stayed at), but I didn't have the money for one. I thought that since most of the games he likes can be downloaded that we would see how much he liked playing on this Fire. What a great little machine it is! The games work very well. So far we have not had any issues with download anything and the apps are so colorful. Now my only problems is trying to pull it away from him long enough to enjoy it myself. I would like to note that we don't own an ipad or any other tablet other then the Kindle Touch, so it is hard for me to say how much better one is over the other. I also opted to get the plug-in for the outlet to charge with over just using the USB port. I also do not mind the ads, they aren't that much of a bother. If you are on the fence as to buying or not, if you know you like the use of a tablet then I don't think you can go wrong with this Kindle Fire for the price!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful resolution and a great price
Reviews.Author: Charles R. Boddy
Reviews.Content: The new kindle fire hd 8.9 has great resolution at a great price..i would recommend this..the bigger size screen is definately worth the extra price

Reviews.Title: Excellent Choice
Reviews.Author: Jamie Brown
Reviews.Content: I did my homework before finally breaking down and buying a Kindle. I am incredibly pleased with the speed, user interface, functionality, graphics and sound! This little guy is awesome - I highly recommend it to anyone searching for a tablet who doesn't want to spend a load of $ but still wants the convenience of a computer/laptop replacement to-go.

Reviews.Title: Bought for my husband.
Reviews.Author: Supermom3
Reviews.Content: I love the large screen. We have (2) 7 in and (1) 8.9.I will say that after 45 days the 8.9 HD stopped taking a charge. I called Amazon and they sent me another that day. Excellent service. The reason it stopped charging no know cause. I recieved the new one within days. Thank You Amazon<<<<<

Reviews.Title: kindle love
Reviews.Author: dallasgirl67
Reviews.Content: This is my third kindle. I started with the kindle keyboard, purchased a kindle fire in November of 2011 and today I received my fire 8.9 HD. I am very happy with all my kindles and highly recommend them to anyone looking to purchase a tablet.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely love it.
Reviews.Author: manuel
Reviews.Content: I bought it for $269 ($30 V-Day discount). I had owned a Nexus 10 which although has the larger screen (and feels faster) the price of $400 just does not compare.  Saved me a ton of money for pretty much the same Android experience.  And with Amazon's easy integration and specially with Amazon Prime it is easy to love this device all the way around.

Reviews.Title: Kindle died after 1 month of use
Reviews.Author: Alexis
Reviews.Content: I received my Kindle Fire HD (8.9" Wi-fi, 16 GB, without special offers) as a gift in December 2012. After one month of use, the entire unit died. As we all know, the KF HD does not come with a normal power charger, just a USB, so when I contacted Amazon customer service, they offered to send me the Powerfast charger for free ($30 value). They suggested that it was a problem with charging the unit, and if this did not resolve the issue then they would send me a new device.As I had a feeling it wouldn't work, but didn't mind getting a free charger, I waited 2 days to receive it and charged the Kindle for about 6-8 hours. Still nothing.Customer service sent me a replacement model very quickly. I am now using the new device but I am a little doubtful as to the quality and longevity of this product. Fortunately, all of my apps were saved in the Cloud so it was pretty easy to restore the device. A little more annoying was having to configure all of my settings all over again.+1 for Amazon's quick turnaround on replacing the item. And I really like the device itself, though it took a while to get used to navigating through it and the swype typing (which I LOVE). I also received a stylus which has been very useful.Hopefully this unit lasts a little longer!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Sonia Johnson
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle for the ease it gives me in carrying around what im reading. It fits in my handbag easily and in the leather case it is protected from scratching. I have still yet to download songs and videos or use the skype features. If you are a book worm this is a great buy and the size is good and the quality and clarity of the pictures are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: A perfect gift
Reviews.Author: Mags
Reviews.Content: I got the Kindle Fire HD for my son for Christmas and it has more than exceded my expectations for it.  I have a first generation Ipad and am thinking of replacing it with the Kindle Fire HD.  I had gotten my daughter-in-law a Kindle a few years ago and she carries it in her purse everywhere she goes and he use to make fun of her now she teases him about not being able to part with his Kindle HD.  Thanks for having such a great product for a reasonable price it sure made this Christmas bright for my son.

Reviews.Title: Love It!!
Reviews.Author: Doris Jones
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9 is awesome -- I can't get anything done because I'm having fun with Kindle!!  Love it.

Reviews.Title: Super product
Reviews.Author: D. R. Clark
Reviews.Content: Great display, easy to use.  We're still exploring possible uses, but so far everything works beautifully. I've streamed a couple of free movies with Amazon Prime.  Lost the signal once but with all the systems in the channel it is surprising that it only happened once.  Deliberately stopped and restarted a couple of times and it never missed a beat.  My wife and I are reading the same book on this and on the older Kindle and the system doesn't get us mixed up.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I just got my kindle fire hd and I must say I LOVE IT!  So easy to use and has all the features of a tablet.  Sound is great,screen resolution excellent... this is the best buy I have made in a long time!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Norma Morrow "norma kindle fire"
Reviews.Content: I really like the Kindle Fire I received as a gift.  The two things I would like changed is: the power button shouldn't be where you grasp the Kindle when holding it, I am forever accidentally turning it off; the sound keeps decreasing. I will be watching a movie and 3/4 the way through the movie the sound level drops and I have to turn up the volume to maximum and can still barely hear it. I called Amazon and they fixed it temporarily but I am having the problem again.

Reviews.Title: Great choice
Reviews.Author: Diane Boston
Reviews.Content: Got the 7 inch Kindle for my sons for Christmas and they love them.  When I decided I wanted a tablet  I went with the bigger Kindle for myself.  Love it!

Reviews.Title: I absolutely love it....
Reviews.Author: Valerie J Reyes
Reviews.Content: I have gone through several other Kindle devices and I've always been satisfied. I have to say I am amazed at this Kindle HD 8.9. I absolutely love it and will recommend it to all my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: Toots
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about my Kindle Fire HD 8.9"  I have not had another tablet and did look at several before buying.  It is wonderful, I love it, love it, love it!!

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Gil L Nicholas
Reviews.Content: THis is a really good quality item and has a lot of great features. The wifi works well and it is easy to read on and is a great purchase. The only drawbacks I have with it is I wish the camera could take pictures without doing it from the face and the speakers arent to great.

Reviews.Title: Kindle is on Fire!
Reviews.Author: Gary C Warner
Reviews.Content: Fantastic product!  It is easy to operate, and offers so much...  Also, you can take it everywhere and can conveniently store it while traveling.  Can't say enough great things about this product.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Julie H. Rogers
Reviews.Content: absolutely love the Kindle Fire HD. Will probably buy another as our children argue over who gets to use it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: R J Tracy
Reviews.Content: It is everything I had hoped it would be.  At times hard to figure out where to go to perform a function but with playing around with certain areas I can figure it out.  Display detail and size of screen is perfect as I am older and prefer the 8.9" screen.  Definitely a step up from my Kindle Keyboard :)  Wish the battery life was longer, though.  Feel like I am recharging it too often but maybe that is because I am on it for hours on end when reading a book.  Thanks Kindle for a great product.

Reviews.Title: Really great little tablet!
Reviews.Author: Georgia
Reviews.Content: I bought this primarily for reading and games and web browsing. It meets these three needs perfectly. The screen is very sharp and clear. There are still not quite as many apps as I would like...but they are adding more each day.  I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for handy little tablet.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9" 4G
Reviews.Author: Jan
Reviews.Content: LOVE IT, LOVE IT, LOVE IT, Did I mention that I love it,, if you are in the market for a tablet this is the one you want, it does everything....

Reviews.Title: My new best friend!
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: My wife had the original Kindle Fire and for Christmas this year, I was going to upgrade her to a 8.9" Kindle Fire HD and I was going to start using her original Kindle Fire.  When it arrived, she wanted me to keep the new Kindle Fire HD and use it because I do more streaming of video content and music than she does, and she is familiar and used to her Kindle Fire.  Wow!  What an awesome present I just gave to myself...luckily, I had given my wife several other things for Christmas, so no, I'm not that big a jerk!  The functionality of the Kindle Fire HD is outstanding.  I purchase a great deal from Amazon and they are my exclusive music source now through their MP3 store, so it was only a natural fit that I would get and use the Kindle Fire HD.  I was considering an iPad, but I'm so tied to Amazon with my music, shopping, videos, and books (both e-books and audible books), that I really didn't want to pay more money for a product that would not do everything as easily as my Kindle Fire.  Don't get me wrong, I don't have any problems with Apple, in fact, I have an iPhone 5 and love it as a phone.  I just really love the functionality of the Kindle Fire and how seamlessly it integrated all the services I use from Amazon.  I turned it on and all my libraries were there.  My kindle books and my audiobooks were instantly available and easy to get to.  It really lets me take full advantage of my Amazon Prime membership.  Bottom line, Kindle Fire HD is a great product and Amazon is an outstanding company.  I've enjoyed my Kindle Fire so much, I bought one for my son for Christmas.  He loves it and uses it more than his laptop computer now.  It's also great that since I added his Kindle to my account, he can use all my e-books and audible books.  Thanks for a really great product!

Reviews.Title: Better choice than IPad
Reviews.Author: MumsyMom
Reviews.Content: This app has everything I need, plus it is so much lighter. Picture is great and I can sync with my Kindle Fire.  Compared both the IPad and Kindle Fire HD and the Kindle met all my requirements plus was cheaper. Screen is a little smaller than the IPad, but still quite big.

Reviews.Title: I checked out the Ipad first
Reviews.Author: katherine d brown
Reviews.Content: Comparing the Ipad to the kindle fire, this is a real bargin. It cost $200 less and does just about everything the Ipad does.

Reviews.Title: Great Product for you and the Kids
Reviews.Author: MadMan
Reviews.Content: My wife loves to read in bed, but the light does bother me sometimes. Plus the stacks of books get a little out of hand. Believe me Bookmans does not except that many books. I got her this Kindle so she can read any book she wants without having to store the hard copys. Plus with all the Apps. you can download I no longer have to watch Top Chef or Project Runway again --Hint Hint to all the guys out there-- One piece of advise BUY THE CHARGER, it takes forever to charge it through a computer USB port. Also it does not charge the battery if you are using it while it's plugged in to a computer, or if the computer is turned off. It's also great for kids. I bought the Kindle over an IPad on the advise of my son. My 3 year old grandson uses it and is very good at it making it a great teaching tool. If you have young children do yourself a big favor and get one they will love it. I only gave it 4 stars because I think the charger should come with it. For me it is like buying a new car and having to pay extra for the tires.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful!
Reviews.Author: S. Macnicoll
Reviews.Content: This is just like having your desk top computer on your lap! I have been reading books, going on the internet, etc. I notice that some apps that I have on my I phone are not available for the Kindle, so if you're a Gaberlunzie fan,  you are out of luck! The screen is large (good for my senior eyes) and there is a feature which I just discovered where you can touch it and it gives you an enlarged pop up of the screen. It's in the upper left corner and lol looks like a pair of eyeglasses. My battery ran down a couple of times and I realized that I was not shutting it down but just putting it to sleep. I'm smarter now. There are probably tons of things that I don't know still but will find out, since I just got this as a Christmas present and it's the end of January. Now I can sit in the living room and do what I want on my Kindle while my husband watches his shows. I can look at my email, check my bank account, read books, etc. right on my lap. The colors are lovely and there are lots of great apps!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for mom who cant get to use tv because kids are always on it or time to get to library etc etc
Reviews.Author: Lydia J. Hegge
Reviews.Content: It is pricey, but slim, awesome HD display, i cant complain. I can use internet, skype because of camera (nook doesnt have one), e-reader is nice size at 7 inches but i bought the 8.9 because i watch movies or tv shows when the kids are hogging all the other gadgets and tvs. The other awesome thing is when you are reading an ebook, you can click on a word and it will give you the definition right there in a text box!! I believe the nook doesn't do that. I am educated, but my vocabulary has always been a stumble block to my love of reading. I never bother to look up in dictionary because it gets to be so time consuming. Theres no b&n; in my area, closest is 90 miles. So I dont really shop there. Its really a personal lifestyle decision, but I am so happy with this gadget fitting my needs. There's lots of sites with kindle vs. nook.[...]This one I liked. Also I love saving money on amazon on many things that are pricier or unavailable elsewhere. :)

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: kpc001
Reviews.Content: Did I need the tablet with ATT service? Probably not, as I find myself in wireless environments and really don't use the ATT data plan that much.  The wireless connectivity on this device is superb.  I never drop a signal, and connection with wireless networks is very easy.  When I use it, the ATT network works well in my area.  Video streaming through Amazon and Netflix is very good, and I don't notice any lag or jerkiness in the picture.  I find reading on a tablet more tiring than on a dedicated e-reader.  That's not the tablet's fault; that's personal preference.  But other users may find that to be true as well. I'm very pleased with the Amazaon App Store selection, and I have no problem "side loading" apps from Google if I need them (there are a few newspaper apps not in the Amazon store that I like to have access to).

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: kdm91
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle fire I got it as a gift from all of my family and I bring it with me everywhere couldn't have asked for a better present!! the quality on the picture is so much better than I imagined I am very happy with my kindle

Reviews.Title: the best tablet ever
Reviews.Author: sir.best_reveiwer
Reviews.Content: this is the best tablet!!!! you need to buy this its perfect.  its just like an ipad but BETTER a:its cheaper  b:its hd etc i could go on forever it works great!!  its sooo fast and tere is not 1 issue.  dont listen to the 4 3 2 1 star reviews only the 5 becasits the best tablet that is out there.

Reviews.Title: Better than I expectwed!
Reviews.Author: Lawrence Harman
Reviews.Content: I have a 3rd generation iPad, which I really like.  I find the new Kindle to be much easier to read than the old black and white ones. And, it is easier to hold while reading in bed than the iPad.  Also, its wifi capability is faster than that on my iPad.

Reviews.Title: Update to earlier review
Reviews.Author: carl
Reviews.Content: I have been using the Kindle Fire HD 32gb for a few months now - and it is a good device - don't compare to other tablets - I received as gift and my needs in a tablet are reading books, entertainment with Amazon Prime, HBO GO, and download apps for reading newspapers, magazines.  As far as the App store - certainly limited as compared to IPAD, however - it's easy to sideload APPS from Android APP stores(go on Google or Youtube to learn how to do this.  As far as the browser - higly recommend downloading Dolphin Browser HD - much faster and supports Flash!!  Screen clarity is really good and sharp resolution.  If you want to run with the in crowd, and be like everyone else, get IPAD and waste your money!!  This device is perfect for my needs, recommend it highly

Reviews.Title: Love this Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Jan, the Reading Teacher "Jan"
Reviews.Content: Okay, I love books - the feel, the heft, the texture. I had used the Kindle app on my Droid, and completed a few books there but just not in love with that size.  But now I am loving my Kindle 8.9 so very much.  How wonderful to be able to carry one item and yet have entertainment, email + web access (from a hotspot) all in one slim package! It is perfect when I am here at home - easy to pick up and carry wherever I can get comfortable.  I am readying for back surgery and love that I can prop my book and  read to my content.  Plus I can get books with narration that pick up right where I left off!  The screen is easy to read for these senior eyes.  Plus, I confess, I am enjoying the silly games that my grandkids said to load - Where's My Water? , Cut the Rope.  Fun and challenging.  Thanks Amazon for making my book addiction even more fun!

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT, LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: njn "Voracious reader"
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire HD!! It is so much fun to do all of the things that I couldn't do before. I still love my old Kindle,[2 yearsold], but the Kindle Fire HD is a great companion piece. You don't have to ignore one for the other. I carry my old Kindle with me in my purse to be able to read where ever I go and then when I come home I open my Kindle Fire HD and enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome and fantastic product.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Annette"
Reviews.Content: I know I wax eloquently in the title, but the more I use my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" , the more I find out more what is possible in this th amazing product .  First let me say that I am not considered a  " tech savy " person, so please consider this review as from an ordinary lay person who LIKES technological devices.You can be sure that the Kindle Fire HD is not a device that you'll need a lot of technical expertise to operate. It is very straight forward and the options are easy to understand. At this point I have owned at one time or another a Kindle, I have a Droid smart phone and my husband has an I Pad from work, so I also have had a chance to compare the I Pad with the Kindle Fire.  The Ipad devices do have larger displays than the Fire HD, but the crispness of the images on the Fire is every bit as good as the Ipad. If you regularly shop on Amazon , the Kindle Fire excels in being integrated with the Amazon store with the options of getting videos and audio very easily. From what I saw and experimented with on my husband's Ipad, there is no such easy integration on the Ipad.I know that the IPad is one of the most highly regarded tablets on the market,but I have to say that the price difference PLUS the easy integration with Amazon's huge library of content makes it a strong competitor and for me the price difference plus the easy integration with Amazon was the deciding factor for me and this was BEFORE I bought the device. Since I have had it in my possession, I can only say I have absolutely NO regrets!Also I find it easy to find great apps. The Android operating system allows you to install any app you want. The Amazon app store is the default app provider for the Kindle Fire, but if you want to get something else, you can manage, it takes a bit of doing to accomplish this though.I am also a prime member and this has made it a breeze to watch many videos and movies for free that you would have to rent if not a member. The Cloud feature  is also a great feature because for Amazon content, the cloud storage quota is unlimited!I would say that in the entertainment category, this device is phenomenal. You will be able to download and access many types of entertainment, such as music, books, videos, apps, the web, Docs, the newsstand etc etc. I could go on and on about this and the more I learn, the more I am so glad that I decided to get this device.I would recomment to download the Kindle Fire HD manual, especially if you are not used to an android device. This manual has been updated for the Kindle Fire HD and even if there is a bit of difference in locating the options, it will be easy to figure out. Another good reference is " Help Me! Guide to the Kindle Fire HD: Charles Huges" . They both have a wealth of practical information. I downloaded these two to my Kindle Touch, so I could follow the directions when they were side by side and not have to flip back all the time.As far as any cons:1.  The power button seems a bit awkward in the portrait position because if you are holding the device with both hands, it is  easy for your hand to hit the power button. It might be better to have that button closer to the left of the volume button.2.  The directions for the web searches seem somewhat cumbersome  but once you go through the instructions, it gets better.I might have to update this review later on, since I have only had the Kindle Fire HD for a little while. I am going through the two manuals page by page and learning a lot. So far I am very impressed with what this device is capable of. That said, my husband loves his Ipad, but he uses it mostly for his work and does not deal with Amazon as much as I do. I do think though that he is coveting my ability to access Amazon so easily plus the video and audio capabilities!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Virginia Acosta "9erfan"
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire, 8.9".  It is the perfect size.  I have numerous Kindles because I love the product and even though I was enjoying my 7" Kindle Fire, it was a little small for me in terms of surfing the internet.  In my old age (LOL), I prefer to read web pages on a bigger screen and the 8.9" totally fit the bill.  LOVE!!

Reviews.Title: My Kindle Fire HD "8.9"
Reviews.Author: chas. warren
Reviews.Content: What do I love about it?Everything:Wi-Fi: SuperbSpeed: BlazingGraphics: Outstanding color and clarity.Sound: Stereo, SuperbApps: What can I say? Fantastic!Weight: Just right.Amazon Cloud: Flawless and accessible .Conclusion: I tried the one with the fruit on it and decided that it was not what I really wanted. I saw the great price and features offered on the "Kindle Fire HD 8.9" and decided it was the one for me . Besides, when it arrived I used the money I saved to purchase some really great apps. Five Stars all the way. Thanks, Amazon. You're the best.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9
Reviews.Author: bigtrout
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical about purchasing the new Kindle Fire HD based on some of the negative reviews.  Boy, am I happy I didn't listen to them.  I love my Kindle.  It does everything that I wanted in a tablet very well.  You don't need a manual.  Just use the Amazon help pages.  I quickly learned how to use all the features using the Amazon help.  I think the picture quality is great and the sound is more than I expected from a tablet.  I have an older Kindle e-reader, but now I do all my reading on my Kindle Fire.  I watch videos on Netflix and Amazon and listen to music on Pandora.  The apps for news, weather, and games are all that I need or want.  I find that I am using it every day.  It has become a great source of entertainment.

Reviews.Title: Not new to tablets, have had a few...heres my take on this one
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I received the 8.9 Fire as a present from my girlfriend for christmas. The tablet is fast, smooth and looks like the OS is Gingerbread. The keyboard gives it away but there are suttle takes in other places that could be ICS. regardless the tablet is very nice, the sound coming out of it is AMAZING. My computer speakers dont put sound out that good! time to upgrade those next, there only complaint i have here is it does not have Google Playstore on it, you are limited to Amazon app store, unless you want to sideload apps which is not that hard at all, just gives you a couple more steps.For cases, you should go ahead and spend the extra money to get that 54.00 case that amazon specifically makes for it, with the flip cover and all. it def protects it and they have a few different colors available, it fits very snug and secure...i should go leave that review on that page..but you should also pick up a stylus..that makes this thing so much fun to deal with.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE KINDLE  PRODUCTS!!
Reviews.Author: Gail
Reviews.Content: WOW!I literally take my kindle with me EVERYWHERE I Go. I started with the first one that came out, and loved it so much I bought my daughter one also. WELL, as newer versions became quickly available, I purchased those also. I was really excited about the newest KINDLE HD, I could hardly wait to get it. For Christmas 2012, I also bought my daughter the new KINDLE HD. We both never leave home without them. My entire family has enjoyed the benefits that come with having a PRIME ACCOUNT. "What else can I say?"....we're HOOKED!!Thanks,From Gail, the e-happy gal....

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: zerel
Reviews.Content: Great item...fast shipping and just as described buy seller Recommend to all,great packing,fast friendly service  - A+++ seller...would buy from again

Reviews.Title: OkI
Reviews.Author: Vern
Reviews.Content: I also use my wife' s IPad.  At times the IPad is easier to use.  I do like it for reading.

Reviews.Title: I'm very happy!
Reviews.Author: Beth Walsh
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet. I have waited a long time and looked around at several other possiblities. I am not a "high Tech" kind of girl, however I do feel it is important to keep up with the times.My new Kindle Fire HD 8.9 is really great! I am learning how to use it and all the cool features it offers. The price is excellent and the size of the screen is perfect. The price is a real selling factor.I highly recommend this product. It's beautiful to look at as well.Thank you.

Reviews.Title: New Kindle Fire is better for sure
Reviews.Author: H. Huang
Reviews.Content: Last year I bought the 1st gen Kindle Fire since I never wanted an 10in iPad, and the 7in fit my need well. It served me well since I mostly used it for browsing and read books. When the iPad mini came out I decided to give it a try and I liked it for it has many apps I liked (which I never bother to try with the Kindle since I was not an "apps user"), on top of that, for it can do Chinese input so well, and the mini is indeed very light in the hand. With that experience, I tried to see if Kindle Fire could do what iPad could with apps. I was able to find most of these apps I liked on iPad and installed them on the old Kindle Fire. But I could not install Chinese kbd app w/o "rooting" it", which I did not want take the risk.I bought the Fire HD 8.9 (on the day it was offered $50 off) with one main purpose: to stream video to TV (with HDMI) when I needed to. I had it for 3 days and initially found it was too big for my taste but I slowly more and more like it while discovering more positive aspects of it. The display is truly beautiful and great for reading PDF books (I love reading old books) with it high res display, and that is far better than the reading experience one would have using the 1st gen Fire or the iPad mini (both are at the iPad 1 screen res). Best of all, I found (by surprise) one can easily install a Chinese keyboard app to fit the need for Chinese text entry. That made me very happy. Now I think I can happily let my wife take the iPad mini since the Fire HD with it new Chinese keyboard is a better Pad for my needs overall.One strange issue bothered heavily me early was that the Kindle HD 8.9 seemed dropping Chinese character in browser or apps in the 1st day or so of use (not to a degree one could not read the page since it only dropped very few on a page), but it seems has learn to do it right now somehow. I am still not sure. Will give update on this.

Reviews.Title: Great product!!!
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review on my Kindle. it is just great! excellent build quality, wonderful screen and unbelievable sound! I like it!

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: ali09
Reviews.Content: I just received my Kindle fire HD 8.9 today.  I have not been able to stop playing with it.  It is fast, color is spectacular!  I am so happy i purchased this.  I have always been a huge fan of kindle products and could no be more pleased with my new edition.

Reviews.Title: Blows the competition out of the water
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: My wife loves it.  Not only does it do an amazing job with e books, it also works phenomenal as a tablet for browsing and playing games.  I would gladly purchase more amazon electronics in the future instead of that price inflated, hipster loving Apple garbage.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: shelby
Reviews.Content: This prduct is a new version of something on the market. However, the larger screen size makes a huge difference. People can't put it down.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Shopaholic99
Reviews.Content: Bigger screen, awesome wireless card, and with 16 GB of space is more than what you need. I read papers or books or articles on this baby before going to sleep every night. The auto brightness feature actually works like a wonder. Backed up by Amazon's 1-yr warranty, one of the best tablets out there

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!
Reviews.Author: Terry Collins II "Denton Rugger"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as an early (and unexpected) Christmas gift for my wife.  I had bought her the original Kindle Fire tablet last year, which she loved.  She had hinted at a possible upgrade a couple of months ago to be able to add a keyboard and for better performance with a bigger screen.  I was considering the possibility of the upgrade to the larger screen version when her other tablet was lost/stolen about a month ago, somewhat forcing my hand.  I still consider this an economical tablet, even the upgraded version, and she is very pleased with her new toy.

Reviews.Title: I absolutely think this is the best tablet out there
Reviews.Author: Suntobeach "sunandbeach"
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kindle-- I upgraded my Kindle Fire to the HD.  There is no comparison.  I am amazed on the upgrades made since the Fire.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet from good company
Reviews.Author: janice399 "JM"
Reviews.Content: The first generation fire I had was used all the time and I did not want to upgrade. Then I saw one of these 8.9 fire hd in a store an was hooked. This 8.9 hd fire is easy to use because the touch screen is a huge improvement on my last fire. The typewriter responds accurately and it was used type this review. Videos look and sound great. I have only read a page or two in my book so far because I keep wanting to explore the applications.

Reviews.Title: My New Kindle...
Reviews.Author: DONNA M GILCHRIST
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle, still learning more about it everyday...I love being able to put it in my purse and take it to work or on trips.

Reviews.Title: Xmas Gift for our daughter
Reviews.Author: sunsine
Reviews.Content: Just set up her account so it's all ready for use when she opens it in 13days!Seems to work great, arrived fast.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Wilcie
Reviews.Content: I like it but I'm still trying the different "Apps". I have read several books.Today I downloaded the camera.

Reviews.Title: awesome kindle
Reviews.Author: Teracia Loretan
Reviews.Content: awesome product however it should come with an easy start up  guide just to give you a few quick tips and by that i ment on paper not e book

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: I really love this product (and the Kindle Fire basic from last year)It's convenient that it connects to free games/books using Amazon services and is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: New Kindle HD
Reviews.Author: Stephen Piersall
Reviews.Content: LOVE IT! The bigger screen is better to view everything you do. A bit heavier but then again it's bigger. Battery life is longer then the original Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: wow this is Amazing technology
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Griffin "jeepbob1"
Reviews.Content: mine landed yesterday and in 15 minutes we were completely operational along w/ 40 books and other stuff from my kindle DX sooo thanks and we r sooo happy w/ our investment n Merry Christmas dev team :)

Reviews.Title: A Must Have for Travelers
Reviews.Author: Bizzle
Reviews.Content: I fly twice a week. I needed something compact but was put off by the ipad's price point. The screen is a beauty when streaming in HD. It's a really great way to integrate all of your amazon media and I like the layout. Silk is still a bit buggy but I expect that will improve. Hoping to see more apps get incorporated onto the platform. Speakers are pretty excellent and the hdmi socket is a huge plus for connecting to hotel TVs. Battery live goes quickly with movies and depending on your charger, you might have to put your kindle to sleep. If you're not a Maccolyte, the kindle's price should get you what you need.

Reviews.Title: Good tablet
Reviews.Author: C
Reviews.Content: App store smaller than Apple or Andoid.Some apps do not seem to be optimized for this platform that well - i.e. cannot switch from landscape to portrait views on "word scramble with friends"Have had some Silk crashing when streaming - since that is the main purpose I got the tablet, this is concerning.All that being said, these are pretty knit picky items.  The overall quality is good especially when considering the value and the data package with the modem.

Reviews.Title: Just as advertised
Reviews.Author: Ira
Reviews.Content: My unit arrived a bit sooner than projected. I am a Prime member which has been quite a value add. The screen is awesome. I did much research before choosing and each mainstream tablet offered in the market targets distinct options which makes neither one better than another just different. Evaluate your personal desires and know that if you choose a KD Fire 8.9 you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Nice device generally, but buggy email app (client)
Reviews.Author: Happy2B
Reviews.Content: A nice device in general; however, I bought it for only a few main uses, such as email. Unfortunately, the email app (client) supplied doesn't work for other than the major email hosts. I use rt66.com which requires a complete setup. Once done, it works fine ONCE (until you turn off the device). Upon restarting and checking email, nothing shows in the inbox and I must, again, reset up the account (using identical settings) to receive email. Sending email is fine, though. Many others have this same problem. Until this is fixed, I have returned the Kindle Fire HD 8.9". I await new email software upgrade to fix this problem. In addition, there is no indicator light for use when recharging and I have found that the recharging time takes much longer than with my original Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: SKL
Reviews.Content: Love device but silk browser is not good. Constantly stops on facebook and has to reload. Also crashes other applications making me rethink my purchase

Reviews.Title: Quality wise, this product is the worst tablet I've used.
Reviews.Author: Dexter ";-]"
Reviews.Content: Quality wise, this product is the worst tablet I've used.  I work in an office building and the Kindle has spend 95% of it's time in an indoor, friendly environment.  I've owned my kindle for over a year now and wished from day one I went with a different option.  I choose the Kindle as I'm a big Amazon.com fan and trusted they made a good product. Here are the issues I've been having:If you jump from different applications (i.e. Amazon Videos to Kindle books, Internet browsing), the Kindle freezes up as it doesn't know how to manage the memory properly.  Amazon.com customer service says this is a known issue and recommends holding the power button for 20 seconds to fix the problem.  This is a hard reset and may cause you to loose app data, save points, account history and other information.The touch pad often responds slow or not at all.  This has been the most common issue I have and happens almost every time I use the web browser for more than 5 minutes.  This must also due to poor memory management as Amazon's customer service fix is the same:  Hold Power button for 20 seconds to reset system.Speakers are rear facing.  Not a big factor for me as I use a Wi-fi headset.  If you do wish to use the speaker, you will have to remove it for any case you are using because they cover the speakers and muffle the sound.Charging the Kindle has now become a very serious issue.  I use the recommended Amazon.com kindle quick charger.  Within the year, the kindle connection has become very loose.  Now, I have to make sure the charge is connected just right and hope it isn't bumped.  Many times I've picked up my Kindle after charging, only to find the battery is too low to turn on.  This shouldn't have become an issue as the kindle has always sat flat on my desk or table when charging.This tablet is also not usable outside.  I've attempted to access the web and view movies while spending my lunch hour outside.  It is simply not possible with any kind of sunshine.If you want something to read book with, get the less expensive Kindle.  I can not recommend this product for any of the other functions.

Reviews.Title: This is the 7th Kindle I've purchased and it is a piece of junk
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Miller
Reviews.Content: I have loved all the Kindles I have purchased.  I have given 2 as gifts but the 8.9 is terrible.  They have replaced it 2 times and all 3 of them have had the very same problems.  The screen freezes up and it has to be rebooted.  Silk does not work properly.  You can't increase the screen size on Silk without it freezing.  The kindle will shut off for no reason.  The keyboard types whatever it wants and the things it types in no way resembles what you have typed.  This is not your normal "spell check" corrections.  Instead of putting  "ING at the end of a word it will put "NGUYEN"  This is just one example of the garbage it types.  AMAZON NEEDS TO RECALL THIS PRODUCT.  It is garbage.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Value for money
Reviews.Author: naresh raghavan
Reviews.Content: I am a total Apple fan and have an Iphone, Ipod, Ipad and Apple TV. However, since I travel frequently I wanted  a second tablet to use when away from home. Paying $400+ for another Ipad seemed way too high so I settled for the Kindle Fire HD. I have to say that I am extremely satisfied with my decision- at around half the price of a Ipad the only thing I am missing is my ITunes! I was able to download Netflix and start streaming movies easily. Resultion is very good. My ebooks were also easily downloaded for reading. I was able to use many other apps too with ease. I recommend this product as a brilliant tablet at a very affordable price.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't connect to ceratin kinds of WiFi
Reviews.Author: Emmet's Dad
Reviews.Content: Buyer beware: The Kindle Fire doesn't connect to certain types of Wi-Fi.  When you are trying to join a Wi-Fi that asks you to accept the terms and conditions (not requiring a password), it brings you to an error page.  The Kindle Fire will display the Wi-Fi icon but there will be an X through it.  While accessing this same Wi-Fi connection w/an iPhone or an iPad, however, you're immediately connected.  So clearly, the issue lays with the Kindle device and not the Wi-Fi connection itself.  The Kindle Fire does work in a Wi-Fi where there is no password, and also in Wi-Fis where there IS a password.  for some reason, the type of Wi-Fi which asks you to accept its terms and conditions doesn't work with the Kindle Fire.  I just got off the phone w/the Kindle Support people and they confirmed that the software in the Kindle Fire is not compatible with these types of Wi-Fi connections and that there are no plans to change this.  He said that the settings in the Wi-Fi router would need to be altered to accept the Kindle Device, but if you're a guest of the Wi-Fi, you don't have the capability to change the router settings.  I didn't learn all of this bad news until after the 30-day return window, and they refuse to accept it as a return because it's technically not a damaged item.  So I'm stuck with this device that doesn't work where I need it to!  Had I known this was a potential problem, I would have maybe driven around and tested it out in various Wi-Fi environments.  I do want to re-iterate that in these places where the Wi-Fi doesn't accept my Kindle Fire, it DOES accept an iPhone and an iPad just fine.

Reviews.Title: Is a  Kindle
Reviews.Author: J. Maldonado "AZL205"
Reviews.Content: Pro: The Price is reasonable compare to other tablets with similar specs. This is the third Kindle device that I bought for my wife and she loved them all. This is just an improved version of the other two. Cons: Wifi wont stay connected. This occurs several times a day. I know is not my router or internet provider because all of my other devices work fine while the Kindle continuously drops the WIFI connection. The only solution that I found so far is to turn the device off and on again. Very annoying. No charger included: Lets get real Amazon. How can you sell a tablet with no charger. It include a USB cable but the device will not charge when connected to a computer. It needs it's own power supply. The price for an Amazon OEM Kindle charger $20.00 dollars.Another bad feature: You have to pay 15.00 to remove the add-ware, or what ever you want to call them . Really!!!!Packaging; Amazon needs to ship this devices in an unmarked box. The kindle was nearly stolen by a postal employee. Item arrived at post office and was put aside by a postal employee. After two days of questioning the postal employee the kindle miraculously appeared. Shipping a Kindle in a black box with the word KINDLE printed on the outside is like shipping cash in a clear plastic container. Not very smart. I saw several post online about how easy it is for people to re-register stolen kindles.

Reviews.Title: I Love, Love, Love This Tablet
Reviews.Author: J. A. Silvasy "IT nut"
Reviews.Content: I especially love being able to take it anywhere without worrying about finding a public wi-fi connection, which is insecure. I can read my crocheting magazines on screen, and zoom into the illustrations and pictures. I also like reading my Kindle books on it, although I also still have my original Kindle e-book reader.

Reviews.Title: Really good hardware wise...
Reviews.Author: Benjamin T. Horne III
Reviews.Content: Beautiful device. Great sound.. Really like it for the hardware...Only problem is the apps... A lot of really good apps are out there for android and ipad...  However, it seems most apps are really  slow in coming to the Kindle (if ever)....This is a shame and I think it will ultimately be the downfall of the Kindle.As an example, just subscribed to Verizon Fios. Verizon has a really good app for accessing live tv for tablets . It is available for , of course, the android and ipad market.. The one available for Kindle is severely limited and, quite frankly, sucks..It is not the same one as for the other platforms.I am seriously considering buying an android tablet so I can use all of the good apps that come available.What's the good in having state of the art hardware if it will only run a subset of the available apps....

Reviews.Title: NOTHING is compatible with this thing
Reviews.Author: Moe
Reviews.Content: Pros: Amazing screen resolution and easy to use. Videos and pictures play beautifully.Cons: Webs browser and insanely slow and freezes up frequently, but its manageable. The thing I hate the very most though is that even though its an android product, NOTHING is compatible with this thing. Want any of the latest, popular games (CandyCrush, Mini Golf Match Up, or Words With Friends)? Too bad. You cant download them, and if you do they wont run. Want to rent free books from your library using the M3 e-reader? Nope, not happening. Whats the point of having a tablet that made its name as a reader that you cant read actual books on?I asked for this as a gift thinking that it would be like a giant Galaxy, but I was sorely mistaken. If I could trade it in for an iPad at this point I would in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: I was disappointed
Reviews.Author: KMD
Reviews.Content: As a diehard Kindle fan, I could barely wait to get my hands on the Kindle Fire HD.  An affordable tablet with fabulous color, Dolby sound, and a reasonable price?  What was not to like.I wish I could say my excitement lasted once I got my hands on the device itself.  Unfortunately, that wasn't to be.The first device I received froze up time and again, but Amazon, true to their EXCELLENT customer service, sent me a replacement.  The replacement almost never freezes up.  So why don't I like it?  Keeping in mind the fact that this is one user's experience, here are the pros and cons as I see them.Pros:* The e-reader can't be beat.  A great visual experience and the almost seamless ability to purchase/borrow books.*  The Kindle Fire is first-class when it comes to downloading and watching videos, especially if you're an Amazon Prime member and have lots of free videos to choose from.*  The HD experience is A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!*  Plenty of useful apps for download, many of them free.*  The size is really nice.Cons:*  Amazon Silk is herky-jerky at best.  Crashes frequently, even after reboot.  Links are often unresponsive.  Doesn't support Flash.*  Hate, hate, hate the carousel.  Cluttered and ungainly and pretty much useless.  Would much rather be able to put my favorite applications on the home screen.*  Actually, this brings us to one of my biggest gripes against the Kindle Fire HD, i.e., the lack of personalization options.  Amazon has pretty much locked you into their concept of usability ... and brother, it's not mine!*  The Dolby speakers ain't all they're cracked up to be.I guess my biggest problem with the Kindle Fire HD echoes a problem I have with Apple products, namely, the user doesn't seem to come first here.  The business plan comes first.  Selling stuff comes first.Basically, I would say if you're after a terrific e-reader and a device you can use to watch videos in glorious color, this would be a good choice.  If you're looking for a tablet, I would say look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste you money if you want it for browsing
Reviews.Author: Shadowmarten
Reviews.Content: Silk is the worst browser.  Incrediblely slow and unresponsive.  I read "help" files from support dating back to Nov 2011, and the problem still has not been fixed.  If you like apps, the selection is much less  for the Kindle HD than for android.  If you want to watch movies, the resolution is excellent...if you can get the file downloaded.

Reviews.Title: Clunky, lots of extra costs, and not an iPad alternative,
Reviews.Author: Brit Anderson "brittles"
Reviews.Content: I wrote a much longer review that appears to have disappeared, but I'll cover the high level issues. First the positives though:Good:It's a somewhat cheap device for accessing the internet and amazon content.Bad:Basically everything else.1. Wi-fi connection speed in my home was awful... I could load webpages 4-5 times faster on my iPhone 5 and even my old iPhone 3GS. YouTube videos for the most part just wouldn't load. On every other device, iphones, ps3, ipad, etc... no problems in the same room.2. Touchscreen was having all sorts of problems. Typing was an exercise in futility at times. I'd press the same letter key dozens of times before it was recognized. And it seemed to not be an issue with one location on the screen... just generally unresponsive.3. The absolute worst is the content. Paying for a service like Prime, you'd think would be similar to Netflix since they are positioned as a competitor. It's nothing like Netflix. The available TV and Movie content (PAID content, mind you) is miserable. There is no use for getting prime unless you constantly read books. The worst thing is that they have a MASSIVE catalog of movies, but they have their own rental and purchase prices ON TOP of prime. Some of these go for as much as $20 for HD. That means there is no excuse for not improving the selection of Prime content. I really don't understand why they don't boost their prime content to make it more attractive and leave the new releases as pay per view.Conclusion:I think the best think about the whole situation is that Amazon really does have amazing return policies. That sounds like a backhanded comment, but really if you are interested in trying it out Amazon will give you 30 days to do whatever you want... even give you a trial of prime. Could be worth it to see if it does enough to warrant not springing the extra and getting an ipad with tons of extra features and a much better ecosystem (itunes/facetime/messaging/etc).

Reviews.Title: Love my new Kindle
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I had the first Kindle Fire for a very long time and I loved it.  I went to my sister's bridal shower recently and left it on the plane.  I was heartbroken.  After several days, when I knew I would not be receiving it back from the airlines, I started to go through my options.  I am not an apple user, as my phone is an android, and I have every type of google account you can have.  All of my apps are either from Google or Amazon.  My other option was a Nexus (either 7 or 10).  My boyfriend has the Nexus 7 and enjoys it a lot.In order to decide what tablet I would go with I started to list the things I did on the tablet:read bookswatch video (Amazon Prime is amazing)play a few app gamesread the news and look up recipes using Flipboard and Pinterestsurf the web (but not as much as I do on my computer)Both the Kindle HD Fire and Nexus do all of those things except the Kindle has two bonuses:Kindle Lending LibraryAmazon VideosSince I do have Amazon Prime, I watch a lot of my tv shows through that as they are free.I received my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" (if I was going to upgrade I will go big) and was immediately happy that I got it.  It is very beautiful and works extremely well.  Yes there are a few cons (web browsing is a bit slow, typing is somewhat awkward, limited apps since can only use the Amazon app store, interface is not customizable) but I bought it knowing these things.  It does the job I wanted it for and it does it looking good.

Reviews.Title: GRRRR...needs replacing after 2.5 months...
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to enter into the "world of tablets" when I got my new KF HD 8.9" about 1.5 months ago. I had done A LOT of searching, reviewing, and comparing other tablets before purchasing this one. I finally decided that though the KF HD lacked the latest Android OS, and would be centered around the Amazon universe (no Google Play apps, etc) this would be a good beginner tablet. I wasn't wrong about the ease of use and I don't particularly mind not being able to download apps from other than Amazon, especially since everything appears in the Cloud and I can easily delete/retrieve apps at will.However, I was NOT prepared for all the problems I have had with the device since almost day one. I initially had issues with the device locking up all the time and the battery life seemed waaaay short for the time usage. I did my homework and learned to shut down the device by the hard/cold reset. Thought I was home free for a couple of days til the device would no longer charge at all even though there was nothing wrong with my charger. Spoke to customer service for the 3rd time and they sent out THEIR rapid charger because obviously mine was inferior (not her exact words, but that's the gist) I will admit that the tablet absolutely charged better and even performed better with the rapid charger. I was really starting to enjoy using the tablet and happily played games/read my books with little problems for almost 2 WHOLE weeks...until today.I was in the middle of playing a game when it suddenly froze. I had no choice but to shut it down via the hard reset. When I powered it back on, the load screen ran continuously. After an several hours of trying to resolve it on my own, I grudgingly called CS again. The guy was really nice and tried to remotely reset the device (or something to that effect) but when that failed, he offered to replace the device.I am REALLY hoping I simply had a DUD because there are several features i really liked about this tablet. 1.) the screen brightness is awesome for bright days - not so good for battery life but you can really see the screen well.2.) the auto-sleep sensor is awesome when using a case that supports it.3.) size is perfect for me due to poor vision, I felt the 7" was too small and a 10" was just too bulky 4.) the gorilla glass screen is really durable and sensitive to the touch. I had a screen protector but took it off when the stylus had too much drag for sketching/drawing. 5.) the carousel is nicer than I thought it would be, keeps the apps and books easily accessible with a simple flick of a finger.Time will tell if the replacement KF HD will perform better than my first one. I will be happy to change my rating! The only reason I didn't rate it lower to begin with is because I really enjoy the tablet when its working and customer service has been quite good, albeit a little stubborn at times.UPDATE July 2013: The replacement KF HD 8.9" is performing MUCH better than my first one, therefore I will now give the device 4 stars. There are still some issues that prevent me from giving a 5 star rating.  For some weird reason, my carousel will randomly disappear and I am left with a black screen with the menus at the top. Luckily the menus are still there and I can simply  There really seems to be no rhyme or reason for this and in all fairness I haven't spoken to CS yet to see if there's a resolution. Another thing is there are often errors when I download apps from the app store and I end up having to redownload them. I don't know if this is a device issue for certain, but it is annoying.As an added note, I had the opportunity to play around with an Asus 10 " tablet a few weeks ago and was jealous she could have an animated background that changed with the times of day! But unless there's a way to enlarge the icons on the opening screen, I admit I like the big ol' carousel (when it isn't hiding) as my eyesight is deteriorating.

Reviews.Title: A 21st Century Must Have Tool For Living
Reviews.Author: Alan Batten "promoman"
Reviews.Content: Until I purchased my Kindle Fire HD 8.9", I had been resisting getting an e-book reader as well as something in addition to my iPad 3. Well, the light weight and versatility of the Kindle beat out the perceived advantages of my Apple tablet. I love the clarity of the images and text on the Kindle as well as the ability to look something up at a tap in the text. I've read several books on the Kindle and found it to be very convenient. I'm also an Audible member, so I can use the Whispersync feature when I wish or listen to one of the audio books in my cloud library. The Dolby audio is crisp and clear as I play music from my Amazon Cloud Player.  Another great feature is the long battery life. Minor problems with finding particular aps for the Kindle Fire have not been too bad.  Over all, I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: The Kindle Does What It Was Design To Do Very Well
Reviews.Author: Ivy J. Frazier "Cadillac Joe"
Reviews.Content: I just got my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 yesterday and am very pleased with it out the box.  I read comparisons between the Kindle, IPad and Nexus 7 for weeks and the bottom line is people i.e. reviewers like what they like and it doesn’t take long when they are comparing the various devices to see if they are IPad, Nexus or Kindle fans.  You can compare processors, screen contrast, memory, etc. until you are blue in the face; I personally can’t see anything in the way of speed, sound and display when using the Kindle that would cause me to switch to an IPad or Nexus.  I will say I’m not a big fan of Apple; they seem to nickel and dime you to death and are rarely competitive when it comes to price.  I am an Prime Amazon consumer i.e. I buy everything under the sun from Amazon and like the idea that the Kindle is tailored for their website and products.  I like the idea that Amazon does offer the consumer books and magazines for FREE; if nothing else it is a great gesture from a retailer to a consumer.Last night I streamed a movie, surfed the web, listen to my music as well loaded roughly 5600 mp3 to the cloud last night (It took about 8 hours) so that I can have them at my finger tips with the Kindle.  The entire Kindle experience was satisfying.  Being a man that doesn’t carry a purse, backpack, clutch or anything along those lines, I decided on the 8.9 inch version; the 7 inch wouldn’t fit in my pants pocket, so what was the point in passing up a larger screen for roughly the same price as the 7 inch.  Women on the other hand carry a suitcase around daily so the 7 inch may be better, if you are considering portability.If you like one stop shopping the IPad and Kindle are what you are looking for.  If you want to be locked inside a room with only a front door and no key, I would say stick with Apple products and buy an IPad.  If you would like the option of a locked front door and an unlocked back door then I’d say go with the Kindle and Amazon’s products.  If you want a front and back door with a window and a key to lock and unlock both doors, then go with a Nexus; you will however have to find independent sites to buy your movies, music, books, magazines, etc.  Personally, I don’t have the time or desire to go from site to site trying to find media and audio content for my entertainment device.Lastly, I own 3 PCs, 1 Netbook, 1 Apple Mini computer, 1 Barnes and Noble Nook,  a Kindle DX and now the Kindle Fire.  I believe in buying the right tool for the job.  If I wanted the fastest CPU and was doing serious multitasking on the go, I would buy a notebook computer, not a tablet that is designed for pure entertainment which both the IPad and Kindle are really design to accommodate.  I hope this review helps you in your decision making.

Reviews.Title: Amazon Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Erin Fuhrhop
Reviews.Content: This is a very good product for the price.  Make sure you do research and look at reviews before you decide which tablet you want.  I am a big time facebooker and gamer and was very disappointed after I bought this and found out you cannot download the facebook games to the kindle fire hd or play them.  As far as getting on the internet it is easy and is very fast.  I love to watch netflix movies on it and it has great picture and sound.  Skyping is great.  Downloading apps from the android market is quick and easy.  Love reading books on my kindle.If you are looking to buy one that plays all those facebook games, might as well spend the extra $$ to get an ipad so you can do that.Seems to freeze up more times than what seems normal.  Not sure if this is just mine or something that happens to all of them.  I guess with all computers there is a chance of that.Overall- good product for the price you pay for it.

Reviews.Title: Have one and ordered another today
Reviews.Author: Brad Bradsher "silverlake"
Reviews.Content: I got the 7" Fire a few months ago and then purchased the 8.9" HD a month or so later.  My wife has taken to using the 8.9" Fire and my son has confiscated the 7" one; so I ordered another for myself tonight.  The color on all is outstanding, and we are an Amazon family.Having Prime and ordering like we do on Amazon made getting Kindles a no brainer. Both my wife and I are retired and can use the Fire for anything we want to do. Movies are easily and quickly streamed on WiFi with no stutter, etc.  I would highly recommend this to anyone who is heavily invested in Amazon, as we are!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD  7"
Reviews.Author: Alene
Reviews.Content: I bought my Kindle last December. I'm 83 love to read but don't see well so books are out. My Grandson set it all up for me. There is nothing about it I don't like except for the adds!!! I'm a Prime member I don't think I should have to be bothered by the adds. They blink on and you can't get rid of them till they are ready to go.Some are very bad but all are a nuisence. Get rid of them for Prime ussers!!! Alene

Reviews.Title: A Pretty Amazing Device
Reviews.Author: S. Rhodes
Reviews.Content: Over the years technology has changed so much.  And so quickly.  I still remember when the first Kindle came out and pretty much changed the world.  It was a revolution for book readers.  And then other things happened.  The release of the iPad, for instance, which caused everyone to jump up and make a tablet.  Now there are so many to choose from that when I considered buying a tablet I wasn't sure what to go with.  In the end I went with the Kindle Fire HD.  The price was good and I've been a part of the Amazon community for years on end.  I haven't been disappointed in my purchase one bit.  There are a couple of small gripes that add up, but nothing much.I won't spend much time talking about the technical specs of the Kindle Fire HD.  I have the 16GB one that's 8.9 inches.  It comes with a USB cord, but doesn't come with one of those actual chargers.  This isn't too bad, because if you already have a smart phone that charger will suffice, but if you don't have a charger already it's kind of silly that you get the cord but not the charger itself and you immediately need to pay $20 on top of this.Setting up your kindle is pretty simple.  If you've already got an Amazon account you can connect to that easily.  If you are not an Amazon Prime member you can start a free trial.  If you have a Kindle, however, I urge you become a part of Amazon Prime.  It'll be a good decision in the long run.  It not only gives you some pretty decent shipping prices, but for people who own a Kindle Fire you'll be able to have access to a few things you wouldn't otherwise, such as television shows on the IMDB.  Or you can "borrow" books for free from the Amazon Library for as long as you want without having to pay a dime.  If you have a kindle, you might as well get prime on top of it.  It's not bad for a years time.The tablet itself is extremely light and feels pretty nice and sleek.  There are two speakers on the back near the bottom that give off some good sound, but you can always plug in head phones or a speaker if you want.  There is also a camera that should be at the top if you hold it for a landscape view, and on the left if you're holding it like a book.  The orientation will adjust automatically (though you can lock the orientation if you so choose to), but some applications and games will have a preset orientation you cannot change.  Likewise, I would highly suggest a case and a screen protector for your Kindle fire HD immediately.  It's light and simple.  Perfect for on the go stuff.  All the more reason to have a case.  And if you're going to constantly be having your fingers on it a screen protector will do nice so that the screen doesn't smudge.The display itself is pretty crisp.  Everything being displayed in fine HD.  You can adjust the brightness in the settings menu if you want just about any time you want with a pretty easy interface of a menu.  Even if you're in the middle of an app or a book you can access the settings by sliding your finger (or stylus, as I prefer to use) down from the top and it allows quick access to things like your settings, notifications wi-fi access, etc.  The user interface of the Kindle Fire HD is pretty easy stuff.  And no matter where you are it's easy to return to the home menu at any time.Any time you leave a program, app or book, it will be on display in your "carousal" which allows you to go through every item.  Recently downloaded items also appear here.  If your carousal gets too crowded you can always hold your finger (or stylus) on the item and select to remove it from the carousal.  You can also put it on your favorites for easier access.  The carousal is a good idea, but I've found that mine gets crowded a little too easy.  I use a lot of apps and read a lot of books and from time to time browse the web.  Every now and then my carousal gets too full and I have to go through removing stuff from it one by one by one.  There is no option to universally clear your carousal.There's Bluetooth and Wifi on the Kindle Fire HD.  I did not purchase the one with 4G so I can't tell you about that.  It's pretty easy to connect to the internet.  And it'll be able to store all kinds of wireless networks in its memory.  The only problem that I have is that the web browser itself is not that good.  More often than not when I'm surfing the web and read news stories or going to certain sites that no application exist for, I'll get a message that the browser has stopped working or that the tab I'm using has stopped working.  These messages are not infrequent in the slightest. I would highly recommend downloading a different browser as opposed to using the default browser.  Most other browsers are a lot better.Of course, one of the biggest tenants you're looking for is probably the apps.  And there are a lot of apps to choose from on the Kindle Fire HD.  Cheap as well as expensive.  The good news is that you can always get a sense of what you're in for because there are always reviews for each app.  They download fast (most of the time, if they're not too big).  There are 16GB of space available on my tablet (there is a 32GB one available, if you wish) and even that feels like a lot.  Apps and books are pretty small and take up nearly no space whatsoever.  In fact, most of the space on mine is occupied by the professional narration on some of the books I have.  Case in point, unless you're feeling like you'll download tons of movies or things which take up whole gigabytes of space, the 16GB hard drive is more than enough to satisfy.When you download movies they come up very crisp indeed, but I don't download a lot of movies to my tablet.  I use my Ultraviolet account a lot, but that uses the internet to stream from my collection (and a handy little application called Flixster for that).  It's the books I'm more interested in.  There are LOTS of classic literature books you can download for free.  When you download books you can add professional narration to them as well.  Sometimes it's free and sometimes it isn't.  It's more or less like putting an audiobook version to your standard book.  Most times the professional narration is unabridged.  I've yet to find an abridged one.  For some books there is still an option to tap to hear text read aloud, but since it's not the "professional" narration it's just a robotic voice that really drones on (and it's boring... very boring).  So if you feel the need to listen to your books, the professional narration is pretty amazing.  If you feel like reading, however, you can adjust the settings by changing the background, font size and even the font itself.  But the best feature is the ability to "X-Ray" the book.  You can see certain terms used a lot and how often.  You can read about certain things that other kindle users highlighted.  But you can go deeper and read about the author himself or herself.  You can look up terms and locations.  You'll instantly be taken to the web if you see something you may not know about and you're curious to learn.  It's overall pretty handy to X-Ray a book.  You can also make as many notes as you like on your book.When you're finished with a book (or when you X-Ray) it always offers suggestions of where to go from there or what to read next.  It's always offering suggestions and you can always find reviews if you like to help you out.You can use that USB cord to connect your Kindle Fire HD to your computer at any time and put documents from your computer or even a few other things if you desire.  Sometimes this is pretty nice.  I was able to transfer documents to my Kindle from my laptop pretty easily.  This includes music and movies if you want them.  And the Kindle can read quite a few formats.There are a few things that can be urksome about the Kindle Fire.  Some are little and some are bigger problems.  The first is that it isn't easy to access the files.  Unless you download an outside app for that.  You can get into the basic stuff like your music, books and movies.  But if you want to go just a little deeper you have to download an outside app for that.  Likewise, it's difficult to move things from one folder to another.  If you put a document on your Kindle Fire and it automatically puts it in the books (I'm not sure why mine did this) it's not easy to move it over without going onto your laptop to do so, or downloading a document manager app of sorts.  It just seems strange to me that management type options wouldn't be built into the Kindle itself from the get go.  Instead you need an app.  It's a free app, but why should I have to do this?Another strange problem I've run into is that my kindle, from time to time, freezes or just goes blank for no apparent reason.  Then it'll suddenly start rebooting.  I'm not sure what happens.  This doesn't happen often, but it happens often enough to be noticeable.  There were also times when it lagged so much that I wasn't sure if my clicking on certain links, apps or books was actually registering.  Come to find out that sometimes it registers just a little too late.  And other times it just so happens my Kindle has frozen on me and I have to shut it down and restart it.  Again, not too often, but often enough to be noticeable.  I have also run into times when it can't seem to seek out the wireless network in the area.  The solution is--you guessed it--I have to shut down and reboot the Kindle Fire HD (although for this little problem sometimes putting it in sleep mode and then bringing it out works just the same).  Like the other two issues, this doesn't happen often--but it happens often enough to be noticeable.Overall, though, I like my Kindle Fire HD a lot.  I wouldn't trade it for anything.
