Not an iPad or a Nexus 7 or any other tablet.  The problems I've encountered aren't big enough and it's very possible that no one is experiencing some of the things I experience at all.  I've been enjoying my Kindle Fire because it's made a lot of my life simpler.  Particularly when I travel.  It's nice to have all my books in one place without having to have a bag full of six or seven when I'm out.  And I can also get magazine subscriptions and go to Youtube or whatever without hassle at all.  If you're looking for a nice, inexpensive tablet, then the Kindle Fire HD is a pretty good deal.  You'll end up having to splurge a few extra bucks for some much needed accessories (charger, case, screen protector and stylus are the ones I recommend most) but in the end it is definitely worth while to do so.  It's a solid tablet, and I give it a four.

Reviews.Title: Ah yes! Better than it's competitor from a famous company named after a fruit
Reviews.Author: Brigitte Pauli
Reviews.Content: Stunning HD. Actually very decent stereo sound. Great when connected to my Subaru sound system in the car. Works fantastically as an e-reader (finally in the perfect reading size for books AND magazines). I was among the first people on this planet to "fall" for the original iPad, which is still have. This fall the option was to buy its smaller successor or the larger Kindle. I opted for the latter primarily because of the fantastic price. When I got it, it already had all the basic info on it. Within seconds, I was wirelessly connected and ready to use all of my Amazon cloud content. Amazing what my friends at Amazon have done for so little money. You are my electronic heroes! New slogan for you guys: Amazon delivers amazing once again. You aren't the inventors of normal, you're the improvers of supposedly perfect.

Reviews.Title: Fire HD 4G: not bad, but there ARE a few bugs... ..
Reviews.Author: Markus B
Reviews.Content: Well, we've had this for a couple of weeks now, and overall, we are pretty happy with them (we got two).When We got ready to buy a tablet, I did a lot of research, and decided that most of the useage we would have for one would be media consumption(movies, TV shows, books, etc.), and web surfing, checking emails and the like. After comparing most of the popular tablets, I was down to the iPad and the Fire 8.9 HD 4G. The iPad was a bit more expensive, and had more features and more apps, but the Kindle allows you access to a lot more free media if you get an Amazon Prime account, which we had planned to do anyway.(Honestly, if you want productivity and real-world WORK capability, like document production, etc., buy an iPad, or really, buy a laptop. The laptop will be cheaper.)The screen is bright,clear and the video and audio quality is very good. The touch screen can be a bit balky at times, though. I'd recommend buying a stylus. It is far smoother with that than with your finger.Make sure your hands are clean and not sweaty or greasy.The loading is fast...VERY fast if you have either a good WiFi signal, or are connected to 4G. Which is another issue. 4G is not always available...if you are on trips, driving, like we do, then you will find a lot of areas where you will find yourself hooked to 3G or Edge instead, which is much slower. Grrrr.Forget streaming video if you are on Edge. It's too slow. However, you CAN download content, and then play it back at your leisure...but some HD movies are larger than your memory, unless you have the 64Gb memory, so there's another issue.Also, you cannot play ANY Flash content, like, say, a lot of YouTube videos, and some commercial websites. This is not Amazon's fault. Adobe no longer supports ANY mobile devices, including phones or iPads.Don't worry...there is a work-around. You just download the ES File Explorer from the app store(which, believe me, you are going to want anyway. It's a super useful app.) and then you download the Dolphin web browser, and then (finally!) you can go get Flash Player 11 for mobile devices, which runs with Dolphin, but not Silk. (Silk is the web browser that comes with your Kindle.) Supposedly, in the future, this will not be an issue since most websites are supposed to be switching to HTML5.Bottom line: We pretty much like it. If we had it to do over, we'd still buy two more Kindle Fire's, in spite of the above noted glitches. It still has more upside than downside. The huge availability of media content of all types makes up for the shortcomings. We just can't give it five stars, so...four stars.Very good, it is.Perfect, it is not.

Reviews.Title: Battery drains too fast
Reviews.Author: M M
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Kindle 8.9 for Christmas and do like the quality and feel of the device, speaker sound and screen resolution.  I have only placed two apps on it, along with 4 songs I bought via Amazon.  I have not used the device for games or viewing videos and have only used it to access the internet and I have also played the songs I bought.  Even so, the battery drains at a very rapid rate and does not provide anywhere near the 11 hours of support advertised for the device.  I had read a comment from another customer who had a similar problem and he stated that his device was replaced immediately, and with the new Kindle already loaded with the same apps he had on the defective device.  I called customer support and was told my problem was not one that they do a replacement for and that I could do a return and then turn around and buy the device again.  I had agreed to wait for the Kindle techs to analyze the data logs sent from my Kindle so they could provide a fix but decided that I should not have to wait for a fix for a device that came to me already defective.  So, I'm doing the return but will have to do some serious thinking about ordering another one.  Including my recent purchases for this Christmas and last, I have bought a total of 7 Kindles.  You figure customer support would have gladly done an exchange in order to keep me as a customer.

Reviews.Title: I think it's better than Ipad
Reviews.Author: chunhui liu
Reviews.Content: The color of this product is very good.I like the most is that its MOBI format the function of the books.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice
Reviews.Author: penny kendall
Reviews.Content: I am new with thing tablet, but what I have seen I really like. Just the right size, a little heaver then I figured the longer I held it, but I know I will enjoy it. Thank you honey for my Christmas gift....

Reviews.Title: Definitely worth giving a shot
Reviews.Author: Daniel W. Grilley
Reviews.Content: The kindle fire HD is probably the best value tablet you can buy, but it does have some shortcomings.  The build quality of the device seems as good as the iPad and I don't notice any major differences there.  If you follow some of the you tube videos it is possible to basically turn this into a full service andriod tablet.  Right out of the box it is somewhat restricted because you can only go the the amazon app store.  Here are the what I find to be the advantages/disadvantages of the kindle versus the ipad:ProsPrice - the best priced tablet on the market, especially after the deals amazon has be running.Build Quality - Found it to be on par with the ipad.Picture Quality - Sitting next to my Ipad 2 I find the picture quality to be better on the kindle.Configuration - There are a lot of ways to tweak this product and unlock features that aren't immediately available.HDMI port - Unlike the ipad this thing has an HDMI out which mirrors the dispaly on your tv.Super Fast Wireless - It is very fast and reliable.Parental Controls - Best of any tablet.ConsPower/Volume Button - The power button and volume are hard to find with your fingers.  I typically have to look.Location of USB/HDMI - Really bad design and I can't believe no one caught this in development very annoying.On Screen Keyboard - The return key is often missing and it makes working with some apps difficult.Lacking Device to play through wireless? - Have not found a way to mirror this over wireless (like Apple TV).I found most apps I use on the iPad to be available either at the kindle store or via adding another app store.  My issues with the power button were mostly overcome by adding a case because now it comes back on automatically when I open the case so I only need to find the power button if I need to turn the device off completely(almost never).  My brother and I both bought the kindle at the same time and I love mine overall, but he was so annoyed about the issues with the on screen keyboard and the fact that twitter doesn't allow copy and paste in their andriod app that he will probably return his.  I don't use twitter, but this was clearly not a fault of the kindle.  Overall I would definitely buy it again, but I do see some users having a different experience depending on what they use the tablet to do.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat the functionality for the price
Reviews.Author: pasadena201
Reviews.Content: I used to have a gen 1 iPad, which I loved, but I think I love the Kindle even more. It's less expensive, looks great, has the same apps - except iTunes, but I have an iPhone, so I don't care about that. I use mine the most to watch Netflix and Hulu as I wander about the house doing things. It's so portable!  Doesn't need extra speakers, the sound is great as is. Someday I might even read a book on it.

Reviews.Title: I am IN LOVE
Reviews.Author: Jose Garcia
Reviews.Content: ahhhh the Kindle Fire HD 8.9/ What can I say about this beauty. This is Very well made. Doesnt have that cheap plastic feel to it like other tablets and phones do. It is pretty thin, but heavy enough to know its durable. Very sexy look to it. I love the HDMI out feature. Battery life is decent. screen resolution is AMAZING. very very clear. I could watch it all day. Screen is a great size too. I don't have anything bad to say about this besides the obvious lack of apps and games (since it uses the amazon store and not the google play store) but it has more than enough to keep me entertained for a long time. combined with amazon prime, this tablet is a keeper for me. AMAZING DEVICE.

Reviews.Title: my 4th kindle
Reviews.Author: MEH
Reviews.Content: I JUST GOT MY FOURTH KINDLE.  KINDLE FIRE HD 8.9.  I LOVE IT!  MY FIRST TWO KINDLE'S  (GENERATION ONE AND TWO), WENT TO MY KIDS, THEY UPGRADED AND GAVE THE FIRST TWO TO THEIR KIDS.  MY THIRD KINDLE, (KINDLE FIRE) WENT TO MY HUSBAND, WHO BY THE WAY SAID HE DIDN'T NEED ONE, WOULDN'T USE IT,  BUT SPENT THREE HOURS ON IT LAST NIGHT AND REFUSES TO PASS IT ON.  MY KINDLE FIRE HD 8.9, 16 GB HAS FANTASTIC COLOR, DIMENSIONS, GRAPHICS,  AND FEATURES (BUT) THE INSTRUCTIONS ARE SOME WHAT HELPFUL BUT NOT DETAILED ENOUGH FOR ME FOR SO I'M GOING TO GET THE COPY FOR DUMMIES.  TRANSFERRING AND DOWNLOADING TOOK A FEW CALLS TO AMAZON BUT LIKE I SAID I NEED DUMMIES INSTRUCTIONS.  I DON'T LIKE THE SUGGESTED ITEMS WHERE THEY ARE BUT I DO LIKE THEM.  I MISS THE BOOKCASE LOOK ON HOME  PAGE BUT NO BIGGY. THE BIGGEST ISSUE TO ME IS LACK OF THE CLICKING SOUND WHEN YOU TYPE ON THE SCREEN KEYBOARD BUT I STILL LOVE IT

Reviews.Title: Gorgeous display.
Reviews.Author: M. Kirst
Reviews.Content: I'm in love with this tablet. The display is crisp and beautiful, the browsing is fast. This is the tablet version of getting into a brand new BMW. You know how all the little details have been thought of? I really like the ways it changes screens, accepts setting changes, switches modes, etc. They've thought of the esthetic experience as well. (We also have an iPad 3). Really really nice tablet

Reviews.Title: If you are a E-reader Purist.....
Reviews.Author: T. Washington "BADelta"
Reviews.Content: then this device is not for you.  I have been a Kindle owner since the first one, you know the white one with the clicky things on the side.  I have upgraded with (almost) each new device.  When I owned the original Kindle I read all the time.  With all of the features on this device, the last thing I do is read.  It started with the Kindle Fire, now its full blown with this upgrade.  Not bashing the device, I love it as a tablet.  We have a "family" I-Pad and I rarely use it because of the limitations with certain programs/websites. I am not an Apple hater,  I have an IPOD but I can do basically everything I can do on a laptop with this device. My job requires me to be in the field alot and while waiting on appointments  I can check emails, Facebook, do info search on the web for my appointment, play apps....everything but read!  The resolution is amazing, the responsiveness of the touch screen is great. The web is very responsive.  I like the fact that I can jump between free WI-FI when available and AT&T; when WI-FI is not available. Like everyone, I am concerned how much this luxury will cost me when the year is up.  But for now I am pleasently pleased with my purchased.

Reviews.Title: IT IS BIGGER THAN I THOUHGT!
Reviews.Author: K. Ulmer
Reviews.Content: After my first Kindle Fire, I thought I would like the bigger one.  Didn't take to mind that 8.9 is the size of the screen, that the actual tablet is REALLY BIG inside my case. YIKES!Took a bit of getting used to figuring how to maneuver, but think I have it figured now. Easier to use now than at first.  LOVE the speakers, WOW, what sound, no need for my ear phones, and I am hearing impaired....My 3 CONS---the button to turn it on, is HARD to find by feel, so I placed a little sticker on the border where it is!  The other thing, before, there is a button with a light when the Kindle Fire is charging, this one has NO light , so I just plug it in at night.  Still last a LONG time on one charge.My last con....my first Kindle Fire, had a GUIDE book that came on it.  This one has nothing like that.  Odd.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: TIM_IA
Reviews.Content: I would say overall a few improvements in picture (HD) and generally in the speed of everything thanks to the newer processor - I own an original Kindle Fire also.  The front camera is nice and Skype works pretty well (in low light however it struggles).  Sound is nice - not sure I'd describe it as loud even at peak volume.WiFi is nice and fast and 5GHz compatible with my N router which is nice.  The touch on the screen is nice and responsive - we are using a stylus also which I personally find easier.Don't need the fast charger ($19.99) if you have a PC with a USB port - it includes the cable to charge with a PC.There is no mini HDMI cable included - so if you are hoping to output to a TV screen or monitor - you'll need to order a part to do that.Overall as solid and responsive than the original Kindle Fire.  Built in microphone and camera are a big plus.

Reviews.Title: I love my fire
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HD 8.9!  Everything works as advertise!  Great video playback on Amazon Prime.  No drops in video with the wifi.  I love the Immersion Reading and I have been looking for something like this for a very long time.  If you have a disability and can work a stylus, then a this tablet is for you.  Hooking up to an HDTV is very nice and works great.The only bad thing is where the cables plug into if you are using the holder.  You have to make the camera on the bottom, so the cables are on top.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: DLM
Reviews.Content: I have the 8.9" 4G model.  I already have a Kindle Keyboard that I love.  This is my first tablet, but I am familiar with an iPad from work.  I love my Kindle Keyboard so much that I decided to go for the Kindle Fire. It does exactly what I need. It is a quick way to access the Internet and check e-mail.  I have downloaded a few apps so far and am satisfied with that. It is solidly based in the Amazon World obviously.  It is light and the screen is so clear it is wonderful. To address a few things that people have complained about:1.  Ads:  The ads are on the lock screen and I do not even notice them!  They are also supposed to be on the bottom corner of the home screen, but I have never noticed them!2.  Charger: I have at least 3 plugs at my house that accommodate the Kindle Fire charger.  I am perfectly fine with the fact that there was not a charger in the box.  Plus, I knew there was no charger in the box since I had read the description before ordering! Thus, it was not a surprise!3.  Setup:  Yes, it was a bit confusing when I took it out of the box and there was no directions and no clear on/off switch.  But I took the included USB wire and plugged it into a charger in my house and let it start charging.  After a few minutes, I was able to start using it while it was charging.  It took me maybe 10 minutes to set it up...very easy.Overall, I am pleased. I am not yet a Prime member, but plan on joining.  I am just waiting to start my free month till I have something I want!  I am still figuring some things out but am enjoying the tablet so far.Here are my reasons why I did not give it 5 stars.  And there is the chance that some of these things I just have not figured out yet!1.  I do not like the carousel.  I like the idea...but I wish I could put things in folders.  All books in one folder. All Apps in one folder (or subdivide them once get a lot), Music in one folder... I feel like I am going to forget about things that "fall" to the back of the carousel.2. E-mail.  I am not sure if I am missing something, but I wish there was some kind of notification of when I get new e-mail.  The iPad beeps just like my computer.  As far as I can tell on the Fire, the only way to tell if I have new mail is to go in and check it.  Am I missing something?3.  Apps.  While I am satisfied with the apps, the number of apps is much smaller than what I am used to on an iPad.4.  4G.  I tried registering for the $50 4G plan from AT&T.;  But when I put down that I am already an AT&T; customer it didn't give me the $50/year option.  It gave me several other options, all of which were more expensive than the $50.  I have not tried again yet.  Thought I would wait a few days and see if I figure out how to do it from reading other people's reviews.  But very frustrating that it was not simple!Overall, it is not perfect.  But it works for me!

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: K. Kressenberg
Reviews.Content: I've been sitting back, waiting to buy a tablet. I do own an original Kindle, which died 2 weeks ago.Well, that pushed me right over the edge. I determined in short order that the new 8.9" form factor and HD screen moved this away from simple e-reader to tablet. Also, as I live in the boonies with just one broadband card for my desktop, plus I travel frequently for work, plus my addiction to the NY Times; I felt that 4G was a must. So I went all in, except I did stick with the 32GB memory.It arrived almost a week earlier than I'd been warned at the time of purchase and so far so good. It was a little cranky to get my subscriptions sorted out (NYT can only be "bound" to one device, and I had to get support to assist with that.)I did not realize it required an AT&T; plan at the time of purchase, I had assumed it was like my old Kindle with the WhisperNet thing. Still, the intro deal at $49.95 for 12 months is fair. When I see what it goes up to after that, I may scream bloody murder!! In any case, the AT&T; deal was easy to set up and works flawlessly.I think this thing is a winner. EMail is great, Silk works well and quickly, and of course there's the improved layout of NYT and other pubs over the text-only view on my old Kindle. In fact, along those lines, with my old reader there were books, such as biographies, which if I suspected had lots of pictures I would still buy as a physical book rather than the Kindle version till now.

Reviews.Title: WOOHOO!!!
Reviews.Author: Alyce
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire!!!  I look forward to many, many happy hours playing and learning with it.  My lifestyle includes train travel fairly often and childcare in homes that, often, don't have TV.  My Kindle provides me with entertainment always!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle HD review
Reviews.Author: Robert W. Larkin
Reviews.Content: This is a great improvement over the first generation unit.  It imported all my documents and apps over from the old unit.  much better design and the integration of the apps are well done.  I especially like the size of the larger unit but yet it's not at all like an IPAD which I found a bit too large.  I decided to purchase a 32 GB unit with the AT&T; service contract but so far have found that the wireless serves most of my needs.  Love the unit and find new apps I must have each day.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire, WOW!
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Lane "Liberal with bullets"
Reviews.Content: Have had three Kindle's and this is the best!  We had a tablet before and this is a vast improvement on the Galaxy 10.1!  Does everything well so far.  We are impressed with the web experience as well as the reader features.  Seamless setup and very intuitive as well.  Buy one, you will love it!

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: A. Warner
Reviews.Content: Love the new HD 8.9 Kindle Fire.  I enjoy how fast it is on WiFi and the new HD picture and improved sound is AWESOME!  Amazon's Prime selection of books and movies really made this purchase worth it.

Reviews.Title: Upgrade from original Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Peter Thrift
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Kindle Fire hd 8.9 as a replacement/upgrade to my original Kindle Fire tablet.  The display quality is equal to the iPad.  Its Wi-Fi performance exceeds the iPad 4.  I used the Amazon trade-in program for my old Kindle Fire.Well worth the investment!  I would definitely buy again!

Reviews.Title: Beware of refurbished
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: Excellent product for about 120 days - recommend saving ALL the packaging if you hope to return it for service.

Reviews.Title: Has Potential, But limits self
Reviews.Author: Emedtech
Reviews.Content: I ordered my kindle Fire HD with the aspirations of using it as my main weapon of choice for conquering my classes at school. I was going to use it mainly for keeping books and documents on my device and as a medical study tool. I am an avid Google user, so naturally I was torn between the new Nexus 7 FDH and this. Because of an amazing deal that Amazon ordered I decided to go with the kindle. I was excited. Once I received my device, the hidden disappointments began to roll in. Carousel; is pointless and rather aggravating to use. It becomes an endless list that's annoying to continually delete programs from. My other disappointment is how shallow the app base is for the kindle. Very controlling; almost like Apple but without the massive app resources. I can't use Google chrome, google docs (side note: amazon does have their own versions of cloud storage, but I prefer the seamless browsing that google provides) or any google play apps or even Itunes apps; only amazon apps (mainly consisting of paid apps). The tablet is a beautify made and the screen is crisp and responsive. The real power of the kindle comes from the massive Amazon prime account. So if you're not into that, you're pretty much missing out on the true point of this tablet; a media devouring machine. This thing has potential, but Amazon put's limits of what could be an amazing device. Despite it's beautiful screen, the adds, the limited app store, the need to get an amazon prime account to get real use out of it, the useless Carousel option, the lack of support for google made it a no for me. I ended up sending it back and getting a Nexus 7 FDH instead, which is what I should have done in the first place.

Reviews.Title: I like it a lot
Reviews.Author: Willie B.
Reviews.Content: Not somethng you will slip in your pocket, but with the Amazon leather cover, quite comfortably portable (easier and more weatherproof than carrying a book in your hand). If you recognize that this is not intended as a replacement for a laptop Windows computer you will find that, with free or inexpensive apps, you have full access to e-mail, an MS-Office clone, and plenty of gadgets that will carry you through without a full laptop. It even outputs HDMI for a big screen or projector. There are even apps for remotely accessing files on, or even taking control of your home or office desktop. I've been using it for several weeks, and find it my constant companion.The screen resolution and colors are fantastic, and the touch is reliable. Unless your fingers are greasy, the screen does not gather smudges that cloud the display. The user interface is easy to get used to, and, with a 4G account you needn't worry about finding a WiFi hotspot. The only drawback I can see is that there is only a front-facing camera. Great for Skyping, but no way to take pictures or capture video without turning the tablet away from you. For my needs that's not worth taking away a star from an otherwise stellar product.

Reviews.Title: Like it, but a few problems
Reviews.Author: Kathy  R. Portie
Reviews.Content: This is our 1st tablet. Our daughter and family have two IPADs and we were impressed with what they could do. After much research, we decided on the Kindle Fire 8.9.I must say the picture quality is great on the device itself, however, I also purchased an HDMI cable to stream movies from Prime on the Kindle to our TV. This is where it breaks down. While the picture quality on the Kindle itself is great, the picture quality on our TV was horrible. The colors where way off and the picture was hazy. Almost like viewing a 3D movie without the glasses. We were hoping to use this feature when we travel, but it doesn't look like it now.Then there was the connecting the Kindle to my husbands PC to download files and pictures. It never could find the device driver to install, and therefore he is unable to connect and download anything. When he went to the help screen at Amazon, he notice that this is a very common problem. He tried some of the fixes, but nothing worked. He then started a chat with the technical support and that was a joke. After an hour, the tech support came to the conclusion that my Kindle was defective, even though many other customers were having the same problem. He then tried connecting to my computer and it connected right away. He advised the tech support person, and asked where he could get the device driver to download to his computer, since that seem to be the problem. The tech support response was that they don't make one since the Kindle doesn't need it....Really!!! So, now to download files from his computer, he has to download to a flash drive, upload to my computer, then download to the Kindle. Very cumbersome, but it's all we have, since Amazon doesn't have a workaround themselves.If you are only going to use the Kindle by itself, it is a great tablet, but beware of it's shortcomings, if you intend to use it for some other purpose. Also, beware of their tech support, my husband basically knew more than they did!!

Reviews.Title: Definitely meets my high expectations!
Reviews.Author: Cory
Reviews.Content: I love the new Kindle Fire. The picture and sound are amazing, and right out of the box it was so easy to use.

Reviews.Title: My first tablet
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: I am a total fanboi of the Kindle Fire now. I love the size and features it has to offer. It's nice and slim and Amazon has many programs to offer for it. I only go to the computer for serious hardcore games and big work on the computer. Other than that I am on this lovely and portable device.

Reviews.Title: Love my new Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Time to Read "time to read"
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, that I am a Kindle junkie!  I have owned several different versions of the Kindle and also the first Kindle Fire.  When I got the new 8.9 HD, I was so excitied.  First, it's beautiful!  Second, OMG the image is clear, crisp and so sharp.  The Kindle Fire HD is very easy to use with on screen instructions and tips.  It is very easy to connect to all of your social media including, facebook, twitter and my space.  You also have access to all of your yahoo, hotmail and gmail accounts.  The app store is not as robust as Google Play however there are some decent apps out there.I am a Prime member, so I have all of my books, music and movies on Amazon.  I really worried with this one how surfing the web would be as the last fire seemed to be rather cumbersome and slow.  The Fire HD is FAST!  I have a newer Dell laptop core i5 and this new Kindle Fire loads just as quick if not quicker in some instances than my laptop.I have spent about a week now with my new Fire HD and my love and awe continue.  I love being able to do everything online that I need to do, check my bank, check my school work, office work, shop, play games and facebook.  I really barely use my laptop these days unless I have to type something.  I do hope they come out with keyboard case for the Kindle Fire.Now on to Kindle Free time - I have a 5 year old who loves my Kindle.  I started up the free time for him and set up his profile.  We downloaded all of his apps and books and he clicks on his name to see just his stuff when he wants to use the Kindle.  I am rather disappointed that the books that I have ordered for him say text to speech is enabled but it only reads the credit of the books.  I was hoping that he would be able to read along with the stories.  Hope this gets fixed soon!Ipad vs. Kindle Fire HD - I also own and IPad.. and to be honest, I hate it.  It sits here and I never use it.  It's heavy and cold.  I really hate the metal feel in my hands and the price is ungodly.  The Ipad2 is also much slower than the Fire HD.  That being said I was very happy with the price for the Fire HD.  I opted to purchace the one without special ads.  I was really bothered that the Fire HD only comes with the cable for charging and not the actual wall charger.  You have to buy this seperatly for 19.99.So why the 4 star review and not 5 if I love it?  Well for one the fact that I have to pay for a charger.  This in my opinion is BS.  Two, we need more apps... and some of the apps that are out there just don't work, even after uninstalling and reinstalling (slotomania and scramble with friends).  There are also paid versions of the apps that I have on my Samsung Galaxy SIII that I would love to put on my Kindle Fire but that is sadly not available.  Overall, I do love my Kindle Fire 8.9 HD, the size and weight are perfect.  It truly is a stunning tablet/e-reader.

Reviews.Title: So Beautiful!!!
Reviews.Author: Seraphine Flores
Reviews.Content: I love this!  The colors are so gorgeous....the sound fantastic!  I could still hear my movie when our very loud trash truck passed by my house! (Though not as good,of course! :D)  There is a problem with the power button on this particular unit though....doesn't depress.  But I phoned customer service, and they are sending me a new unit immediately! (And I can keep using this unit until then....fantastic customer service!)Anyway, I had the original kindle fire, but traded it in for this bigger screen. And for me, the bigger screen is much easier to use.....to view things and also the typing experience.  Ipad users who use their Ipads for entertainment purposes only....well, all I can say is, I am so glad I have this Kindle Fire HD!  Much prettier....(I could care less about "retina display"...give me crisp, bright, and colorful any day! :D)  Thank you, Amazon!!! :D

Reviews.Title: Very Nice
Reviews.Author: Thomas "curious 1"
Reviews.Content: My third Kindle and they just keep getting better. Great display and very fast. If it gets any thinner we'll be able to see through it. Has the feel of a tough piece of equipment. I really like it.

Reviews.Title: Mostly Love it, but a few Issues
Reviews.Author: Period Movie/Film Noir Lover
Reviews.Content: I was really hoping to love this new Kindle Fire HD five stars worth. Due to a few issues, I gave it a four because it's not possible to give a half star, otherwise I would have given it a four and a half.I've had a first generation Fire since they came out, and loved it from the start. There are some great improvements on this new one that I really love, but there are also a few things that I think could be better.  First, the good:The screen really does look as gorgeous as Amazon promised. The first thing I did when I received it was go to videos and watch the trailer for the movie "Brave", and I must say, I was absolutely blown away at the incredibly beautiful quality of the screen.  It's amazing!  After watching more videos, I am still just as impressed - they look fabulous and run smoothly with no lag. I'm also extremely happy with how spectacular my magazines look.The sound is great, and hugely improved over the first generation Kindle Fire, which makes enjoying video and music all the better.I love the larger size of the 8.9".  It makes the whole Kindle Fire experience even more enjoyable without being hard to handle.  Feels just right, nice and thin, and not heavy to hold.Processing speed is great, and so is Wifi speed.  Screen operation is very smooth, with scrolling much smoother than the first Kindle Fire.Very happy to have the camera to Skype on this Fire - I'll be Skyping with my friend in France who I don't get to see all that often, so for me that's a nice plus.  I know some people are complaining about the lack of another camera, but I knew that before I purchased it, and I don't intend to take pictures with my Fire so it's not an issue for me.Ok, now for the things that need improvement:I don't know what they were thinking when they decided on the on/off and volume buttons - they're hard to feel or see, and I quickly got sick of hunting for them.  However, I just received a case I ordered from Amazon, and now with the cut-out holes for the buttons in the case, they are easier to find.  Also the case automatically wakes/sleeps the Fire, so that's less pressing of the on/off button for me as well.  By the way, you don't have to spend a small fortune for a case - mine is really nice and it only cost about $15 on Amazon.Yesterday when I typed on my new Fire I had no problems.  Today, though I still have auto capitalization and word suggestions turned on (I checked), the auto caps and word suggestions are not working.  I'm going to call Amazon about this, but I would hope that issues like these will be fixed with the next automatic update.The Silk browser crashed several times yesterday as soon as I opened more than one tab, though it's been ok today.  Again, another issue that will hopefully be fixed with an update, as I believe Amazon did for the Silk browser on the first generation Fires (initially I had problems with Silk being unstable on my first Fire, but that issue was resolved).I found Amazon's "recommendations" for me below my carousel annoying, so I got rid of them by going to Settings, then Applications, then Home Recommendations and turning them off.  Annoying problem solved.  As for the ads on the opening screen, they don't bother me as they're only there briefly till I swipe the screen.Based on the experience I had with my first Kindle Fire, I think once there is an update for the new Kindle Fire HD, many of the kinks that I and others are experiencing should be solved (except, of course, for the buttons). Overall, I do love my new Fire, and I hope to be just as happy with it as I have been with my first generation Fire.  Hopefully after fixes, the only thing that would keep me from giving it a five-star review would be the on/off and volume buttons.

Reviews.Title: Nice improvement over the original Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Dave Edmiston
Reviews.Content: I've been using my original Kindle Fire for about a year now, and I've been using Kindle eBook readers since the original version of the Kindle (K1), so I have many years worth of likes and dislikes with the Kindle devices.  I've been using this new Fire HD 8.9" for about four days now and am very happy with it, with a few notable exceptions.  In general though, it's an amazing device and I'm pretty thrilled with it.I'm not happy about the lack of Flash, but that's inevitable based on Adobe's removal of Flash from the Android world.  My bigger complaint is over the lack of autocomplete in the Silk browser. I don't get it. They also changed the keyboard layout a little bit so that punctuation characters like the comma, the apostrophe, the question mark, etc. aren't available by just pressing and holding the period. So between the lack of autocomplete and the new location for these characters, typing text is clunkier than it was on the original Fire.Other than that, I really do love the new Fire.It's super fast. They really enhanced the browser and the CPU speed. Having a larger screen makes it easier to work with too. They also improved a lot of things on the UI to make the experience better.They stopped dumping your entire Library to the Carousel, which makes it a lot less cluttered when you initially start it up.I don't really care for the Related Items below the Carousel though (where the Favorites used to be). It's a pretty ham handed attempt to funnel you back to the Amazon store.The Facebook app stinks, but the screen is large enough and the tablet is fast enough that it's easier just to use the full Web-based version instead of the app or the mobile version.The product Offers on the home screen aren't as annoying as I had expected. I actually like them more than the screen saver images on the original Fire. At least these change up more often and give more variety.I like the new camera and the ability to use Skype.I like the attempts at location services, but it probably would have been easier just to put a cheap GPS radio in it.I thought I would really love the new location for the power button and the physical volume up/down buttons. The buttons are cheap though. I tried pushing volume down + power to take a screenshot (a feature that I was really hoping for), but the key combination never worked for me. This actually caused the power button to get stuck. With the power button stuck, there was no way to turn the device back on. I had to thump on the button with my finger a bunch of times to get it to unstick. I'll probably need to have Amazon replace this unit for me, because that's not OK.The Dolby speakers that Amazon touted so hard are actually really nice. I was surprised how good the sound quality is.For me the biggest and most awesome improvement is in the actual Book reader app. Reading Kindle books on the Fire HD 8.9" is amazing. The larger screen is so much easier to read on. And one very cool feature is that when you turn the device to landscape view, it gives you a two-page view. This is a very comfortable way to read. (My wife says she's had the two-page view in her iPad's Kindle app for a long time.)I've heard a lot of people complain about the lack of power adapter.  You get a USB cord, and the idea is that you plug this into your PC.  If you stick with this option, you will get a very slow charge from your Kindle.  If you have an original Kindle Fire, you are much better off using that charger for the new Fire HD.  I actually like the fact that it comes with a good USB cable.  I have plenty of 2.1A USB chargers around the house, so I'll use the cable with those chargers.All in all, I'm really happy with the fire. I'm still steamed about the quirky text input experience in the Silk browser, but hopefully enough people will gripe about the browser that they'll fix it in another version.

Reviews.Title: Fire OS 3.0; where art thou?
Reviews.Author: Iago "trinity"
Reviews.Content: As per Amazon's PR:Amazon currently has no plans to update the software on the existing Kindle Fire or Kindle Fire HD tablets.It states that Fire OS 3.0 will be "available exclusively" on the new Kindle Fire HD and the Kindle Fire HDX 7 and 8.9-inch models.BOOOOO!  Typical android fragmentation b/s for a mediocre tablet at best.  I don't want to "cry Apple", but seriously, if Apple Inc. can update their 3 year old hardware with a new OS, why can't Amazon?There is no reason to abandon original Kindle Fire HD 7 or 8.9-inch devices, considering that the technologies used are very similar to those in the new Kindle Fire HD!Here's my 2 cents...  Over and out.

Reviews.Title: Great ebook reader. Overall mixed feeling
Reviews.Author: Sonali Barua
Reviews.Content: Things I like about it:1. Great interface. Easy to use and lightweight enough to carry like a small book.2. I like the moving home button. That's one thing that annoyed me about the iPad when I played with it in the Apple store is that the home button was a physical button. The home button is a soft button on the screen that moves around as the screen does. It is at a convenient location all the time so that helps.3. I can now read my tech books while lying down on the bed, which are usually heavy and a pain to carry around. I used my laptop before ( too big) and my iPhone ( too small) too and neither were comfortable for me to read while I was lying in bed or just lounging around at a cafe. I feel like Goldilocks when I say this but the 8.9 kindle fire is just right.4. The sound and video quality is pretty good. so are apps on the Amazon.5. Going to the store and buying the apps/games/books/music/video is pretty easy, smooth and very quick over wireless.Things I didn't like:1. Packaging. I felt like besides that small thin USB cable, it could have included something else. Like maybe an power adapter that should NOT be 10 dollars more. I don't know what the iPad comes with but I have an iPhone and iPod touch and they both came with their own adapters. I luckily , like every other tech junkie out there, already have a belk USB adapter so its not like I was totally inconvenienced or something. Just enough to crib about it on Amazon anyway. I also thought it should have come with its own earphones. It doesn't. you have to get those too. :(. I just think it sweetens the deal, that's all. Then again, I might be totally spoiled by Apple.2. Keyboard. The keyboard is easy enough to use but the response seems to have a little lag and it isn't as smooth as one might think it could be. it has suggested words on top of the keyboard which does help speed up searches. Luckily I'm not going to be using it much for typing.3. Auto correct. I do like features like these when I am texting and it is a great help. Usually, but the auto correct kept correcting my name when I used it as a proper noun in most instances like while entering it in fields like "first or last name" or "username" or other places where you would think it shouldn't matter what you typed in because it specifically asks for uniqueness. iPhone had that problem too but I fixed that by entering it in the address field. Which I felt I shouldn't have to do because guess what? The thing is registered to me and it says so on the top left hand corner too that this is "Sonali's Kindle". So it should stop auto correcting it to Somalia.  I spent a good 4 minutes entering my name over and over again because it kept auto correcting it. It needs to get a clue that after the first try the "typo" was intentional.4. GUI to the amazon store to buy physical stuff is clunky and non responsive. I wanted to buy a cover for my kindle. It just didn't respond to my touch to enter payment information or address and I kept trying. I've also notice some apps like Netflix and facebook have really slow response times and at times they just hang. Since I don't face any problem with response when I use the ebook reader or the app store and certain games, I am not sure if this one can be blamed on the kindle but on the app developers.Overall it's doing what I want it to do. Be an ebook reader with the added perk of some browsing and light entertainment. I will be keeping it.

Reviews.Title: Would be 5 Stars with these three things.
Reviews.Author: John James "johnaz"
Reviews.Content: I would give this 5 stars if it had three things.1.  Micro SD Card Slot.  I have movies that take up 1GB each.2.  The ability to "easily" decide which apps I want to maintain and which ones I want to permanently delete.3.  Being able to turn off "App Updates" when on 4G.  I only want updates when on WiFi.

Reviews.Title: Ho-hum
Reviews.Author: A. Paton
Reviews.Content: I have a first generation Kindle Fire that I'm in love with.  When the refurbished Kindle HDs were offered at a great price, I decided to "upgrade" and give the old Kindle to my eight year old.The product arrived quickly and, from all appearances, looked brand new.  Some people have mentioned the size of this Kindle compared to the smaller one, and while it is a significant change, it doesn't bother me.  What DOES bother me is the terrible, terrible, terrible battery life.  Maybe the one I got is defective, but I think I'm with others who have noticed that keeping this thing charged is a real pain.  So much so that when we travel, I choose the first gen over the HD.If you are always near a plug and want to stream to your TV, this isn't a bad choice.  For me, reading, checking email, watching the occasional video, I'm pretty happy with the older, smaller Kindle.

Reviews.Title: I could not put enough "Loves!" in this title line
Reviews.Author: Miss Barbara
Reviews.Content: I've been a hold out for a tablet but have done a lot of research into which one best fits my needs.  I hate to admit it but price was a major consideration.  The Refurbished Kindle Fire 8.9 HD turned out to be a practical choice but I had no idea until after I had it up and running that I'd basically given up almost nothing over it's Apple counterpart.This screen is bright.  The downloading is quick and efficient.  The operation is intuitive.  I'm going to be 70 next week and use social media to keep connected to the cutting edge of news and events.  With this tablet I can easily take it along with me and never be cut off from family, friends, world events or movies and TV.  = Love x infinity.

Reviews.Title: better than iPad
Reviews.Author: Lisa Malesich
Reviews.Content: My kids absolutely love their Kindles. I loaded educational apps, gamed and bookd on it for them. ALL FREE! I even got one for myself. Lots of free books on Amazon

Reviews.Title: Great product - even better customer service
Reviews.Author: Stacey
Reviews.Content: I had been enjoying my kindle fire very much until 8 days ago when it experienced sudden death.  I suspect that may have been my fault - I guess there's something that comes with the kindle that tells how to take good care of the battery.  If I read it, I forgot what it said . . . . I guess you have to be careful with these types of batteries.  I read that on a forum after I'd already messed it up.Anyway.  I contacted customer service and they were amazing.  Absolutely no hassle whatsoever, very nice and respectful.  They talked me through the trouble shooting and then sent me a free PowerFast adapter to see if that would bring it back to life.  It didn't, so I contacted them again and they immediately offered to send me another kindle fire, free of charge.  It will be here in 2 days, and I can ship the old one back for free in the box the new one comes in.  Both times I talked to them online using the "contact us" button and the conversations were quick and easy.The Kindle worked great right up until I killed the battery.  Very good color and HD, lots of fun game apps, enjoyed reading full-color magazines on it.  I prefer my regular old kindle for reading books because it's not backlit and therefore easier on my eyes, but for anything full-color and for internet and games I love the fire.

Reviews.Title: Worse decision ever
Reviews.Author: kindle user
Reviews.Content: I decided to buy this for my niece thinking she could use it for school. Wrong!!!! The apps that she would need are only available on ipad or android. She couldn't read any of the ebooks she had for class, this is a kindle how is that possible. She used it for about 30 mins and it got so hot it damn near burned her. The quality of the graphic were horrendous. All of the things it brags and boast about didn't happen. It didn't play flash, it wouldn't even show youtube. I'm so glad that we returned it! Do you think amazon tried to do anything to fix my issues, nope not at all. I'm still waiting on a refund and its been almost 2 weeks. Be careful, it seems they are selling refurbished kindles at new kindle prices. Oh yeah and not to mention the charging port was bad and they want you to pay $15 to get their "special offers" of the front of the kindle.

Reviews.Title: New Kindle for me
Reviews.Author: Josie
Reviews.Content: I have a Kindle second generation reader which has been very good, but I can't do audible books or video on it so I bought this Fire HD and so far really like it.  It's lighter than my iPad2 and I can do more with it than the 2nd gen Kindle.  I saved $80 by taking advantage of an Amazon special before Valentines Day.  The special Offers feature doesn't bother me at all.  I'm very glad I made the jump at the price savings time.

Reviews.Title: Wireless printer
Reviews.Author: Lloyd Bullard
Reviews.Content: No one has mentioned wireless printing.  Does the amazon kindle fire HD have capability for wireless printing?No rating yet.  All I want is this info before buying.

Reviews.Title: I have had two Kindles.
Reviews.Author: Bill Lee
Reviews.Content: The reason for my LOW rating is pretty simple.While my first Kindle was very nice - for a while it came to the point where the Charging Port wasn't working and I could not recharge it. I contacted Amazon and found that the Kindle's are not repairable. But that the were willinbg to sell me a new one at a discounted price. HMMM the prices they gave me were the same as at my local store.However I liked it enough that I decieded to move up to the Kindle Fire HD larger version. When I recieved it - the Charging Port was also not any good. I talked to a Friend who had a total of three Kindles for his Wife and Kids - two of theirs had the same issue. Bad Charging Port, No way to Recharge, No way to have it Fixed.When I called the Amazon Help desk I was told that the issue was an unheard of issue and they hadn't hade any issues reported. (Note - my buddy, a Very Senor Engineering Director, told me that he had had the very same response). He went out and bought an Apple - So did I. We both love them.

Reviews.Title: Great Product! Great Value!
Reviews.Author: Brad L
Reviews.Content: Thin, great screen resolution, loads/runs Prime videos without hesitation.Slower on the browser than an iPad, but still fast.I would recommend this over the iPad and save the $200+

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9 is appropriate for my needs. I couldn't afford an IPad but needed something just as efficient.
Reviews.Author: favorbigd@yahoo.com
Reviews.Content: After getting a little help in learning how to get around my new Kindle, I have become quite satisfied with it. My main purpose was to be able to get e-textbooks, do research and complete assignments. I have been able to accomplish all of this. It's great for entertainment, such as games, watching videos, past TV shows and putting puzzles together. I love it.Several of my co-workers have been asking a lot of questions, I have strongly recommended the Kindle to them to meet their needs. You can't beat it for the low price! It's light and easy to carry. It beats carrying those heavy textbooks any day.

Reviews.Title: Was expecting more...
Reviews.Author: Leonardo de Waal
Reviews.Content: It is a nice device and works well within cross-platforms, so I can carry on reading from my smart-phone. The battery life hasn't been an issue and can be charged with conventional smart-phone USB chargers.One of the things I WAS disappointed about was the fact that it doesn't come with the Vocabulary Builder that does come with the more basic version (Kindle Paperwhite). I would have thought that being a newer model it would have even more features - not less! This feature makes the Kindle unique, as opposed to an ordinary tablet!Something else I was disappointed about was the fact that physical books with pictures are utterly guttered once bought as ebooks in this Kindle (perhaps in all Kindles), so you might find a picture a tenth its size, some can't be enlarged, and located at unexpected places.Other than that, I am happy to have bought it.

Reviews.Title: I already want to buy an additional one!
Reviews.Author: legends mommy
Reviews.Content: I purchased the HD 9.8 for my son's 6 birthday present and I have to say amazon and kindle have the most wonderful helpful customer service. I've had a lot of questions and so has my son. They've been prompt and extremely thourough. The kindle fire is awesome itself I want to buy another for me soon

Reviews.Title: Not a negative review about product not working
Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: I can't stand it when people give something a negative review just because they received a defective item, or the shipping didn't come or something that doesn't really tell you about the actual working product. Well, this review isn't one of those.I never thought I would say this...as I really have tried so hard to avoid being one of "those people," but after using the Kindle Fire, it's safe to say, yes, I am an Apple person.Right now I am using the iPhone 5, and the Kindle HD 8.9, and there is just no comparison when it comes to the quality. The following is a brief bullet pointed list of problems I have with the Kindle, that I do not have on the iPhone:- The glare. Oh god, the glare!!! Isn't this device advertised as being better than the iPad when it comes to glare? I don't see how that can be possible, because looking at this screen is like looking in the mirror. That is how reflective it is. And if you should want to watch a movie or tv show that's primarily dark, well good luck, because you're basically going to be staring at yourself for the next hour or two. IT IS TERRIBLE!- Startup. Start up is sloooooooow. I mean, this thing takes minutes to start up. And even then, once it's actually started, it's gonna take another few minutes to wait in order to pull up any of the apps, otherwise they will just freeze and/or crash. Best thing to do when you want to use it is press the start key, and then walk away and come back in another 15 minutes. Then you should finally be good to go.- App availability. It's really unfair to yourself to ever purchase and Apple product and then get a device that is going to use an android app, because let's face it - we all know there are a million more apps for Apple. That said, I thought there would still be a decent enough amount of apps to choose from on the Kindle, being that Amazon owns the other half of our world. Nope. Not even close. I looked up the apps I have on my Apple, and only was able to find about 1/8 of them. Let me repeat - about 1/8. That is unreal, and frankly, unacceptable. The entire device is built around apps, therefore one would expect there to be a decent amount.- App functionality. The few apps I have been able to find and download regularly freeze and crash, and are generally much slower than Apple apps to start up. Some of them were in fact so unreliable that I ended up just deleting them.- Customizable options. Ummm, yeah...there aren't any. At all. Being somewhat tech savvy, I enjoy the ability to greatly customize my devices. I choose different backgrounds, different start up screens, password protect my devices, etc. That I have found, you can do NONE of that on the Kindle. You're basically stuck with that glaring black background, and that stupid "carousel" app display.- Sound. The sound stinks as well. If you want to watch or listen to anything, just plan on having to turn the volume up all the way. And that's in a quiet, child-free household. If you have children or a loud house, just plan on not being able to hear it at all.- Buttons. If you can find the buttons, good luck pressing the right one. Half the time I press the shut down button trying to press the volume because they put all three of them right in a row. I get that they were trying to make the buttons blend in with the device for sleekness, but sometimes functionality over looks is the better way to go.Basically, I will use this thing until I can save up enough for an iPad. That's how terrible I think it is - and it is brand new. Do yourself a favor and save up a little extra cash and get the iPad. You won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Amazonette
Reviews.Content: Because I love my Kindle Paperwhite, I decided to buy a Kindle Fire HD last May before a trip so I could access my email, newspaper, and travel arrangements along the way. I had read dozens of user reviews in advance and really, really wanted to like it. Unfortunately, probably because I was not yet familiar enough with it, relying on it caused me to miss a crucial email and a long-awaited meeting. This one was my bad, not Kindle's.Back home, I started using it more and found it difficult or impossible to access the online versions of my mail subscriptions. A magazine sample downloaded from Amazon Kindle site froze at 48% and did not let me advance. First star lost. Accessing my Gmail account was still cumbersome -- second star lost. For me, it was best for reading books: the vertical page size is about the same as a paper book's, and an off-white background selection is easy on the eyes.Now comes the function that dropped the third star: it goes dead frequently and is a hassle to revive. The first time it happened, the user guide was useless and online instructions did not work. I had to contact Kindle Help who walked me through it on two calls, one hour apart. The second time around, I followed the steps that Kindle Help had shown me. Again, it took an hour to revive it. Too labor intensive for me! I want something that comes to life when I plug it in to recharge it. Preferably something with a clear on-off button and a power indicator like my laptop and my phone.Kindle Fire may be an excellent tablet for most users, just not for me. I need something that makes it easy to read my newspaper and magazine subscriptions and access email. It also has to be available when I need it without an hour-long multi-step revival process. I guess I have been spoiled by the ease of using and recharging cellular phones and laptops. After eight months of intermittent use and comparing notes with savvy friends, I have concluded that an up-to-date smartphone and a 13-inch notebook will bridge all my needs, and I no longer even need a tablet. For reading books, Kindle PaperWhite is still the best.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Jolene Wipf
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire. Kindles are proof of how computers are becoming a thing of the past. For example, desktops were replaced by laptops in terms of popularity because laptops are smaller and more portable. Now laptops seem big and bulky to carry compared to tablets such as the Kindle. Amazon has created the Kindle to do everything a laptop can do. The graphics are outstanding. The Kindle is easy to use with options for everything on the home screen. Examples of these options include books, magazines, the web, and several more.All users have to do is click one of these options and they will get to where they need to go.I predict that people will eventually use only tablets such as the Kindle. In fact, if my laptop ever dies, I will not replace it. Instead, I will just rely on my Kindle.

Reviews.Title: More Kindle to love
Reviews.Author: BigBamBam
Reviews.Content: I had the 2nd generation Kindle Fire HD loved it. Now there's more to love. Added a few more capabilities and larger screen to what I was so happy with in my old Fire HD. Love the available option of having a wireless keyboard at the ready, added convenience. Screen size is ideal, larger but not a 10in tablet, easily fits into my purse. I upgraded to give my son my Fire HD which is optimal for him at its 7.3in size. We're all very happy, very contented with the Kindle and its operating system. An 8in to 9in screen size in my opinion is where its at for portability, weight, and viewing comfort. If your happy with any other Kindle but want a bigger screen, and  more options then this just maybe the ticket. Cheers

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9 inch
Reviews.Author: Tim Risher
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kindle Fire HD 8.9 inch; the first one locked up on the second day and would not come back on. . . even after I followed the troubleshooting guide at Amazon's website. The replacement process went well and worked just as advertized. The replacement tablet was apparently used/refurbished, but it works like it should. I just received notification that the original was received at Amazon.I also purchased the Kindle Fire HD Standing Leather Case. It fits the case well, and as others have noted, it puts the Kindle to sleep when closed. It doesn't appear to protect the Kindle well. I don't plan to drop the tablet, but accidents happen. The less expensive case appears to be sturdier and definitely provides greater protection of the corners against falls. I may exchange the more expensive case for the less expensive case while I still can.

Reviews.Title: WONDERFUL TABLET!!
Reviews.Author: Dizzy Lizzy
Reviews.Content: I think the Kindle Fire is the best thing I ever bought!  It does just about everything (except the camera is not that great) and more! I take with me wherever I go. Even doctors have asked me about it! When I tell them how much I love it, the next time I see them, they tell me I was right and how they don't need a computer when you have a Kindle Fire. Get your Kindle Fire today!

Reviews.Title: Fun and Easy to use!
Reviews.Author: Aubree.Portune
Reviews.Content: Better than an Ipad! I love my new Kindle, works great, has a long lasting battery! Now my whole family owns a Kindle Fire!

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire!
Reviews.Author: Victoria Close
Reviews.Content: My husband purchased this for me for my Birthday, and I am thrilled with it! As an avid book reader, this was the perfect gift! I not only use it to read, but I also use it to watch my favorite shows on Netflix at night (must have a Netflix account) while I am trying to go to sleep. I love the 8.9" size, because while it may be a bit more "bulky" than the smaller sizes, I like having the bigger screen.We did have an issue with the first one we purchased; the Kindle overheated and shut off, and would not come back on for quite some time. Amazon promptly replaced it, and I have not had a problem at all with this second one. (I believe the first one had a faulty battery?)Overall, I am more than happy with my Kindle Fire!

Reviews.Title: excellent  for reading.
Reviews.Author: mike lovejoy
Reviews.Content: Excellent  video and sound,  easy to use,  being able to increase print  size is great. Able to use when away from home is a plus.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied Customer
Reviews.Author: Joan Groff
Reviews.Content: I have an IPAd and I am satisfied with this Kindle in comparison. I feels that it has a lot to offer for the differe nice in price.

Reviews.Title: Not satisfied
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Iron
Reviews.Content: Didn't come with a charger and won't charge with the one I have from a previous kindle. Called to find out what the issue was and was offered a $30 voucher to put toward a PURCHASE of the required charger. Not happy with amazon or the product! My previous purchase also had charging issues.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Amy Lynn Stone
Reviews.Content: This is a great product for the price.  My 5 year old loves playing the apps and watching his favorite shows.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Screen and Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: RN
Reviews.Content: Great!  Better than I thought it would be.  Does just about everything--but not for school use.  Overall--very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Takes about 12 hours to fully charge
Reviews.Author: Brenna Peterson
Reviews.Content: Unless you buy a special charger (sold separately), it takes about 12 hours to charge your Kindle 8.9.  The battery life is about 3 to 4 hours, depending on brightness, etc... and then it is dead and waiting for it to slooowly charge is very frustrating.

Reviews.Title: Good tablet Not Great!
Reviews.Author: W. Adams
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet for my wife at Christmas.  She had previous owned an ipad, but unfortunately, it was stolen in a home invasion and was never recovered.  Since that time, she has occasionally used my kindle fire hd 7" but longed for her own table.  So I decided to purchase this 8.9" kindle fire.  All the same great features with a bigger screen I thought.  How could I go wrong?Overall, I suppose this tablet is okay.  As a amazon prime member, my wife has easy access to all the videos, books, and kindle apps her heart desires.  She has started reading much more because of the convenience of searching for and obtaining books, and naturally the bigger screen just makes that a lot easier.  Unfortunately, however, her experience surfing the internet has not been as grand.Before I purchased the kindle fire 8.9", I had read reviews that warned that this tablet had issues with stuttering while loading pages and generally unexplained slowness.  Since I'd never experienced anything like this with my kindle fire 7" I sort of shrugged it off.  I might have disregarded those problems a little to quickly I've discovered, because my wife has had lots of issues with pages with rich image content not loading quickly, stuttering during loading or just freezing of  the whole tablet.As the tech guy at the house (and I'm using that moniker loosely because I am not that tech suave) I've had to try to find a solution to this problem.  I've read pages and pages of supposed fixes, and I've tried more than I can recall right now.  One thing that has really helped is by using apps for all my wife's favorite websites like facebook, twitter, pinterest, etc. instead of using the web browser to view them.  (I've never had to use an app for these sites on my fire 7".  The web pages work great in browser mode.)But even though we've cut down on the problems, the slowness issues still persistent, though thankfully we've eliminated the freezing.All in all, the kindle fire 8.9" is a great looking tablet at a really good price.  It does work - more or less, and it is really convenient for using amazon prime services.  However, if you are thinking of buying this one, you should take the warning about slowness, stuttering loading pages, and freezes very seriously.  Those things might be a problem with your particular kindle fire 8.9".

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9 inch
Reviews.Author: Joey Purnell
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9 inch is a pretty good tablet. It's not great but it's still pretty good. It has a nice screen with awesome speakers and sound! But it is pretty heavy so it's not that comfortable to hold. It has a nice sleek looking design. But I think the ports would be better placed on the bottom. But probably the biggest negative is the app store. It is very small compared to Apple and Google's app stores. Their are a lot of good apps NOT available on it like Instagram,Google Chrome,Youtube, Google Maps, Google Plus, and the free version of Cut the Rope. Speaking of web browsers, Amazon's silk browser is ok, but the fact that they don't have chrome in the app store just makes you want it even more! The battery life also isn't that great. But some more positive things about the device are, that even though the app store is limited most of the apps on their are really good! The reading experience is better than any other tablet on the market right now. And if you have Amazon Prime you have a lot of great options available to you. X Ray is also a really cool feature especially when watching movies. The front facing camera is also pretty cool to have. But sadly it does not have a back facing camera. Overall this is a good tablet. I would reccomend the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 inch over this because it is simply better but this is still a great tablet especially for the money. Thanks for reading my review and I hope it helped.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: A. Drahos "addicted reader"
Reviews.Content: love the size it makes a big difference on games and movies! and love my book results as well, i upgraded from the 7 to 8.9 in. i wear glasses to read and had to adjust the font size on my 7 but with this one i didnt h ave to and it made it so nice...my only complaint is it takes longer to charge but i have no complaints other then that.

Reviews.Title: 8.9 Model replaced my original Fire gen 1
Reviews.Author: MJS
Reviews.Content: Way better than the first one, better wifi, faster speeds, much easier to manage. I bought this toward the end of 2013. I rarely give 5 stars on products. If you compare the price, features and benefits it was a great deal. Up and running out of the box with no hassle. Transferred my apps, books and other items quickly.Has good battery life much more so than the Gen 1, would recommend especially if you want to save some money. This is our 4th Kindle w have 2 Fires and 2 readers.Will wind up with another Fire I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!
Reviews.Author: John P. Fahy
Reviews.Content: after having 3 i pads in the house, my wife decided she waned a tablet to keep up with Dad and the kids. we decided to get her a Kindle HD for Christmas. She cant put it down and when she does the kids want to use it. Perfect for shopping, internet browsing, paying bills but better than our i pads we can watch movies and read books through our Prime account. I see more Kindles in our future!

Reviews.Title: Took a little time to get used to it.
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Del Checcolo "mamadel"
Reviews.Content: I was hooked on my smaller 7 in. kindle. But after much use and abuse it developed and issue and I was offered this upgrade for a low price so I jumped on it. After I realized that I needed to download the face book app, I was able to unlock the browser and it worked perfectly. Now I use it all the time. I love it, and I am still learning about it. One of the best things about a kindle is the tech support from Amazon. I have purchased 4 now and I will continue to get them. As good as an ipad for me.

Reviews.Title: Non-techy loves Kindle
Reviews.Author: Tea Lassie
Reviews.Content: I am a grandmother and not at all savvy when it comes to computers, but I love my new Kindle Fire that I received for Christmas.  It was easy to use and set up right out of the box.  I didn't even have to ask my husband for help and that is pretty amazing.  I love how easy it is to navigate, and the very bright colorful screens.  I also love how it responds to the slightest touch or swipe.  I use it mostly for reading books, but my grandchildren played some of the games on it and the graphics were so good.  I think it is well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle
Reviews.Author: JayBee
Reviews.Content: Entertainment on the Go. Awesome size screen with HD videos. Ample storage for games and apps. Overall a good product and now a fan of kindle.

Reviews.Title: LOVELY
Reviews.Author: fernon wilson
Reviews.Content: The kindle fire HD has a BEAUTIFUL PICTURE, it's runs pretty fast and it has cloud connected. Would recommend it for anyone, but especially for gamers.

Reviews.Title: Okay
Reviews.Author: JJ
Reviews.Content: Not as impressive as I thought it would be. The battery life is not good. I hardly find the apps I'm interested in. disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Bonnie S. Kenk "parroted"
Reviews.Content: This is my second tablet.  My first tablet was a Google.  The battery needed charging at least twice a day (and I didn't even use it much) and the browser took forever.  The Kindle Fire HD 8.9" is the opposite of this.  I've had it for about a month now, and have only had to charge the battery twice (IN ONE MONTH!).I'm pretty technologically challenged, so I don't really care (or even really understand) that this tablet only has a front camera.  If I want to take pictures, I'll use my phone.But, all in all, I would recommend this to people who aren't going to be using it heavily.  It really is great quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Nekiesha
Reviews.Content: It's a great product but a little expensive for my taste. It's easy to carry around and a great screen size.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use....
Reviews.Author: mitzimae
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle.  I prefer reading on the kindle to my I-pad.  I love that you can control the size of the font and the background is easy to read on.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and sound
Reviews.Author: Steve Brammer
Reviews.Content: I bought the Fire HD just to do e-mails and web browsing because my home computer failed. I found that I enjoyed streaming shows on it quite a bit. The picture is very sharp and the audio very clear. And I am enjoying reading at night more than my old kindle because of the built in illumination. The only drawback is the battery life (I just don't like being hooked to cords....)

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Tablet
Reviews.Author: David M. Loucks
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably cool.  Resolution is unmatched.  I'm an apple guy through and through, but why anyone would buy an Ipad when they could get the Kindle HD for so much less is sheer madness.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: JesseValentine
Reviews.Content: This tablet works great. I can easily read my books on it. The HD is clear and bright, and very sharp. Books, photos and aps download onto it very easily.

Reviews.Title: It's Good But Could Be Better If Access To Android Opens Up
Reviews.Author: ILoveTheUSA
Reviews.Content: So many reviews have been submitted so I probably won't give any new insight.  I like this tablet, the sound is good, the screen is excellent, and for the most part it runs smoothly for a dual core system.  My gripe with this is first, the wifi distance is weak.  On my laptop I will get very good download speeds at almost 50 feet from my gateway roughly 15+ megs per second.  On the Kindle it's well  below that.  When I try to watch Netflix it constantly freezes up and goes into buffering.  On web pages the load time is excessive.  When I am closer to the gateway though, the Kindle runs fast.  My second complaint is the gated community that Kindle users are forced into so we can't use Google Play and download a large number of apps.  Silk is a horrible web browser also.*********UPDATE 12/30/2013: I did research on Google and I guess it's Google that won't allow Kindle in. Also, the Silk web browser seems to be working better now for whatever reason. It's not as slow as before. On the WiFi distance issue I solved that by raising the gateway on a top shelf near the ceiling and now the Kindle picks up the signal no problem. That being the case I would now give it 4 1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: Returned
Reviews.Author: Nikki
Reviews.Content: I had been very excited to get this tablet. I read reviews and ended up purchasing it instead of the iPad air. It arrived very quickly. I set it up and began it play around with its features. Here are my thoughts:I won't get into the pros too much because I'm pretty sure those are quite easy to see: screen, sound, size, price. I just want to get into the reasons why I sent it back.First the internet connection was really finicky when starting it up after it was locked. It would take quite a while to find the connection and sometimes required a restart to connect again.One of the main reasons I bought this was so I could video chat with my family. I couldn't get Skype to function properly. The audio was so quiet I couldn't hear anything people were saying. It would freeze the whole tablet, requiring me to force a restart. It is incredibly disappointing to have to force restarts on a brand new device. I troubleshot it for a couple of days, uninstalling/reinstalling and what not, but I couldn't get it to function. I'm sure I could have contacted amazon for some more troubleshooting, but I decided to send it back before reaching that point.I was really uncomfortable using the carousel function. It was neat to see the icons so big, but that was about it. Other than that it seemed like a huge waste of space to have only one or two massive icons available on the screen at one time.The App Store left a lot to be desired. There just weren't that many interesting options. Maybe I was just spoiled by my iPhone, but it feels really lacking to me.The straw that broke the camels back, prompting me to immediately return it, was something so simple and tiny: I wasn't able to save pictures from my email. How silly. A function that simple should be included without a doubt.In the end, it looks good, feels good, and sounds good. It was the tiny stuff that frustrated me to the pointof returning it. I didn't want to troubleshoot the device just to get it operational. I didn't want to deal with a finicky internet connection. I didn't like the lack off App Store options. Skype was a mess. I went ahead and purchased an iPad air. I should have just done that from the beginning.

Reviews.Title: A great tablet at an even better price
Reviews.Author: Leane Maddren
Reviews.Content: I replaced my first generation 7" kindle fire with this and have been pleasantly surprised and how much different the HD version is.  Wi-fi connection is fast - the only thing I have had trouble with is working out where my downloads are going to!  The size is great for watching TV shows and love the available apps and of course, is a fabulous book reader.  Love this - have not found that much difference between this and my husbands ipad at a fraction of the cost.

Reviews.Title: I wish I hadn't bought it.
Reviews.Author: WashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: This tablet is a pain to use. The Silk browser crashes all the time. It jumps around opening new tabs, etc. I hate it. The tablet crashes and when it works, I am constantly waiting for it to skip back to home page.I first bought the Kindle Fire original. Love it and use it all the time still. It delivers as promised. This Fire HD is just a cheap knock off.

Reviews.Title: Not as  slick as billed
Reviews.Author: M. Eggleton
Reviews.Content: This machine functions as an ok book reader and internet browser. Some drawbacks though.  The touch screen isn't nearly as sensitive or accurate as my HTC evo 4g and find I have to (95% of the time)  touch 3 or 4 times the screen to get it to react or more accurately place the cursor.  Also this is a little too big and heavy to comfortably hold and read a book, it should be laying down for comfort.

Reviews.Title: kindle always agood purchase
Reviews.Author: Bonita R. Delbert
Reviews.Content: The kindle has always been a great idea and a great purchase.  I have loved it since I purchased my first one

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: Mario
Reviews.Content: Totally love it. I ordered the case for it after I recevied it and love it also. Defintely recommends it.

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: R Reilly
Reviews.Content: it is easy to set up and use, plays music clearly, videos and games look great and books are easy to swipe.  very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire is the best!
Reviews.Author: Michelle Costello
Reviews.Content: I cannot live without my Kindle Fire. It is the best present I have ever received. It does it all there's no need for any other devices.
