Reviews.Author: E Perry
Reviews.Content: I got this to bridge the gap between a tablet and ereader and it is that and more. I do not have a smart phone, do not want to pay a lot of money for a data plan, so this really fits the bill. I looked at an Ipad, but too much money. I still have not signed up for the At and T deal but I will soon. That was another reason I got this, the At and T deal for a year is a no brainer. Also I really like reading books on this screen much better than my Kindle keyboard. I like being able to adjust the background. Amazon prime membership also is a good deal for all the video screening shows.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Marcia
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my husband. He loves it. He has trouble reading books, because his eyesight has gotten bad. The Kindle brought the enjoyment of books back into his life. It also helps with his church scriptures.

Reviews.Title: Perfect.
Reviews.Author: George Z.
Reviews.Content: Took about a month to make my mind up. I compared the Kindle, Nook, Nexus and the iPad mini. I was looking for an e reader that wasn't just an e reader. This fits the bill perfectly. If you want to read books, stream or download movies, browse the internet or look at pictures its excellent. I read reviews that said how good the screen and speakers were and they were right. But in the end my view doesn't matter, it was a present for my Wife and she loves it.

Reviews.Title: my kindle fire hd purchase
Reviews.Author: marvin smith
Reviews.Content: all i can say that it was a gift for my wife and she was and still is super happy.

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindles!
Reviews.Author: TheQ's
Reviews.Content: I have multiple Kindles and love them all, especially my new Kindle Fire HD.  I am so happy with it that when my friends were asking me to show how it works I got carried away and sounded to myself like a salesperson!

Reviews.Title: Great for my streaming movies
Reviews.Author: J. Kopchok
Reviews.Content: Have been using this device since December. Bought both the 7 in. and 8.9" to compare and decided to stick with this larger unit. No !question the smaller device was easier to handle and the decision wasn't as simple as I hoped. The faster processor and slightly larger screen won me over. I have side-loaded several apps that weren't available on Amazon and everything works great. I supplemented the  purchase with a Roo Origami cover and it's fabulous.

Reviews.Title: I'm really loving my new Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Daileyk05
Reviews.Content: I have really been enjoying my new Kindle Fire HD 8.9".  I had an older Kindle so my next purchase was going to be a tablet of some sort for playing games and surfing the web, but when my original Kindle died, I decided to invest in the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" and I'm so glad I did!  The color and clarity is awesome and the sound is amazing.  I would recommend this Kindle...it's a great buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: mary pankratz
Reviews.Content: the kinkle was a christmas gift for my son and he loved it.  He is very impressed with the hd screen

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Joy L. Dabbs
Reviews.Content: Love ,Love this Kindle it is great and can stand up to most tablets too. Best part is it is easy to use I am 67 and can figure it anyone can don't let this one slip by again a great value !!

Reviews.Title: love, love, love
Reviews.Author: Anita Tiller
Reviews.Content: My husband loved the kindle fire hd 8.9.  He did not think he would use one but I know him better than he knows himself.  He absolutely love it.  He thinks Santa was great this year.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire 8.9
Reviews.Author: Nicole Rodney
Reviews.Content: love it the only thing that's missing is a camera its kinda crazy that this device offers so much but not a actual camera

Reviews.Title: My Kindle
Reviews.Author: cheryl scibelli
Reviews.Content: I chose this rating beacause I cannot live without it now!  Having so much fun with it, and it goes everywhere with me!

Reviews.Title: GREAT PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Burge
Reviews.Content: THIS WAS A CHRISTMAS GIFT FOR MY SON AND HE'S HAVING A BLAST WITH IT!  IT KEEPS HIM OFF MY COMPUTER AND GIVES HIM TOTAL ACCESS TO EVERYTHING HE NEEDS.

Reviews.Title: Love this kindle
Reviews.Author: MCC Nursing Student
Reviews.Content: My son left my kindle for on top of his car and drive off... It fell off his roof an got run over. He had to tell me the news and I responded with "that's ok, you can buy me the HD and he did :) it's awesome!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I would write a long review on the Kindle Fire, but it would all come down to the same thing...I love it! The display is amazing, the processor is very fast, the audio is excellent. I have had it for about a month, use it every day, and have not found anything that I do not like.

Reviews.Title: Super Size!
Reviews.Author: Karol
Reviews.Content: I have been absolutely pleased with everything about it. I really thoroughly studied  & compared over the internet & in the stores before I made my decision . The size is perfect. I have a few friends that got the IPad and after seeing mine said they wish they had bought the Kindle because they felt theirs was too bulky & not convenient to tote aroun d(not to mention the huge price difference) .& were also as  pleased as I was with the gorgeous color & clarity. It is also very easy to get to all the features such as mail, internet,movies,books & the magazines are a perfect size-display very well on that size screen. Lots of great apps. I don't understand people saying that there aren't that many apps as some others.. Good Grief how many do you need?-they have a wonderful variety!As you can see by the above ,  I would highly recommend it to any first time buyer or anyone who wants to move up to a bigger screen as I did.

Reviews.Title: First of Many
Reviews.Author: Erin
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet ever. Although I have played with a few that my friends own this is by far the best one. The picture quality is awesome, there are 1000 things I can do with it, and I am learning new things every day about it. I am not a techy person so I can't get into any kind of debate over the megabite details and so on, but for the novice person who is not interested in spending $600 for a tablet this one is the way to go. My husband has an iPad at work, once he played with my Kindle he went out and bought one literally the next day.

Reviews.Title: More than I expected for the cost
Reviews.Author: Danny Tompkins
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas present for my tech challenged wife. She loves it. I spent a lot of time comparing it to the Ipad Mini. Main considerations for the Fire HD 8.9" compared to the Ipad Mini1. Cost .2. Size3. Weight, ease of handling4. Screen definition.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire  8.9 inch
Reviews.Author: Dennis Kafka
Reviews.Content: I only have very positive good thoughts about this new Kindle. I mostly use the 7 inch model, but I bought this larger tablet as a gift for my wife. Due to the fact that we both have grown to love the Amazon Company with their excellent supply of products, I saw no reason to change to any other tablet brand. These newer Kindle Tablets are a bit faster and have several other improvements over the very first model. The optional touch screen pens that simulates your finger is a must have item for us.

Reviews.Title: KINDLE FIRE REVIEW
Reviews.Author: CP1
Reviews.Content: I LOVE EVERYTHING ABOUT MY NEW KINDLE FIRE 8.9 INCH TABLET FROM THE VERY CLEAR 1080P SCREEN TO THE DOLBY DIGITAL  SPEAKERS.IT IS VERY EASY TO USE AND THE SOFTWARE THAT AMAZON HAS ON THIS TABLET MAKES IT VERY EASY NAVIGATE TO THE CONTENT YOU ARE INTRESTED IN,THE EMAIL  CLIENT AMAZON USES HOTMAIL, GMAIL ECT. Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Buzzard
Reviews.Content: Very easy to set-up email, Netflix, Pandora, Skype, etc, and of course, Amazon.  Wireless works great from anywhere in my house and even from about 50' outside.  The screen resolution makes everything really pop and the stereo speakers sound great.  With headphones, it sounds even better.I purchased 2 micro HDMI to HDMI cables for it.  One 15' to use at home connected to my TV and a 6' to take with me when I travel to connect to the TV in the hotel.  It's great to have all my streaming content from Netflix and Amazon wherever I go.  I did sideload the Dolphin browser and a version of flash that works with it, so that I can watch other video formats.The APP store is really overloaded with games for kids.  I guess people must use their devices as babysitters.  But I did find some useful free APPS.  I recommend YOUZEEK, which seems to have all the music on youtube in categories, by artist. I am a guitar player, so I can plug my Kindle Fire HD into my PA, fire up YOUZEEK and jam along with my favorite artists while I watch the video (if youtube has the video). I also recommend the PBS video APP, Flixter, Urbanspoon, IMDb, Norton Mobile Security free APPS.I purchased the powerfast charger with my Kindle and it works great.I also bought a rooCase for it which is a great value.  It puts the Kindle to sleep when closed and wakes it up when you open the case.  I also control the volume from the dropdown menu, so I don't have to deal with the hard to locate on/off and volume rocker buttons.  Those buttons are the only thing I would change about the Kindle Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: So Addicting!
Reviews.Author: K.Bnck
Reviews.Content: I have never owned a tablet before, but have played with my mother's ipad often. This Kindle Fire is every bit as user friendly. Navigation is different than the Apple products, but easy to figure out with trial and error. I downloaded a cheap ($.99) user guide from Amazon which was very helpful.Email set up was a breeze, watched my first rented movie and the screen quality and music quality are just fantastic. Nothing took away from my enjoyment of the movie (Pride and Prejudice- highly recommend it!!).The battery life if amazing. Much longer than my Android phone doing the same amount of web surfing, emailing, etc...My son tells me not to charge it until it is dead, not sure if that is true, but I follow his advice :)One thing to learn is that to remove content from your device, you need to log on to your Amazon account and choose "Manage my Kindle" . Of course you can download anything by starting from  your device ("Store"), but to REMOVE items you need to log in to your account. This will allow you to add and delete your Library of books, music, and video. Amazon has an ok selection of movies, but I was disappointed that one movie I wanted was not available for rent or to own. Not sure why this was the case.

Reviews.Title: The Ultimate Fire!
Reviews.Author: Sooner1906
Reviews.Content: I bought the first generation fire a couple of months after it was released, I was happy with it despite some technical glitches and issues...it served its purpose well as a media consumption device. Two months ago my wife bought me the Kindle Fire HD 8.9, and it blew me away. Every complaint that I had about the original fire was addressed, and then some. The 8.9 is great, it serves its purpose as a media consumption device but its size makes it useful for school work also (buy a good BT keyboard). Some people complain about the ads, but honestly I enjoy them, some of the advertisements are pretty cool and some of the offers are pretty good. In my opinion it is not worth $15 to disable them.Pros:-A must have for Amazon prime members-fast and powerful processing and browsing-great screen resolution-Great speakers (this was a major complaint with the original fire I can now watch NBA league pass with the speakers turned up without earphones)-Great price-Great book/movie/app selection-X-Ray (I didn't think i would use this feature at first but it is actually pretty cool. Watching movies and being able to get information and recommendations is great)-Upgraded the silk browser (I didn't love the original silk browser but this version is pretty awesome, the suggestions and bookmark tab is very useful)Free time (love this app, easy to set up and very useful for anyone who has kids)-Upgraded book and magazine experience (scrolling and page turning animations are smoother, pages look crisp and easy on the eyes).Cons:-Customization (This is really a stretch considering the fact that i actually like the UI used for the fire, but it is not a native android experience and thus not very customization)-No memory expansion (this would have taken the 8.9 from 5 stars to 7 stars. I understand why Amazon did not do it but it would have been nice)-No front facing camera or GPS (these are really minor issues, there was only one time where I could have used the front facing camera but I also have a smart phone so no real complaint)I love my Kindle fire HD I would recommend it to anyone. Amazon really stepped up their game with this product!

Reviews.Title: Great value!
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 for my wife as a Christmas present.  She was always complaining that she could never get on the computer because of me!  I will not make this a long review, as others have already done so.  I will say, however, that the Kindle has exceeded all of my wife's expectations, as well as my own.  It was not difficult to set the email account up with Verizon on the Kindle.  She has enjoyed the Facebook app. and uses it daily.  She finds it very easy to surf through the Internet, and equally as easy to send and receive email.  I have had a lot of fun with Amazon Prime watching the old Western "B" movies...movies I have not seen in 50 years--Roy Rogers, Johnny Mack Brown, Gene Autry, etc.  There are an awful lot of movies offered through Amazon Prime that are free to download, and I find this feature to be most useful and a super value.  New owners of a Kindle get a free 30 day membership with Prime, and after that, it is $79 a year.  I expect full well to renew after the 30 days is up.  I did have one problem however;  for some reason I was unable to download videos after 10 days.  I called Amazon service on a weekend, and they told me they would turn it over to the technical department.  I called the next day to see the status of it, and was told it would take up to 3 business days to address my problem.  I received an email from Amazon late the same day, tried the video downloads, and yep, it is now working.  As far as the charger not included with the unit, I don't think that is a big deal.  I purchased a wall charger, cord, car charger and a nice protective leather (like) cover for under $15.00 over E-Bay which included shipping.  So, I was able to purchase the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 for $249.00 on a one day only sale, and I think this was a terrific value for the money.  Knowing what I know now, would I make the same decision?  Absolutely!  There may be better tablets out there, but for the price and the value received, I don't think you can beat the Kindle....

Reviews.Content: My husband is good with computers, but slow to adapt to new technology. Over the past few years he's slowly joined the mobile device age. Before his birthday in October, he said he wanted a tablet for a combination birthday-Christmas present, but he didn't know which one. We both did hours of research on the various options (and boy are there a lot), but in the end, there was only one obvious choice for us: the Kindle Fire HD 8.9".My husband uses it to check his fantasy sports teams while watching the games on TV, so the wi-fi version is perfect for us. Its speed is impressive, and the screen size helps him avoid the mobile versions of his favorite websites (traditionalist, isn't he?). The tablet's sensitivity is pretty awesome, too. We were playing a game app involving rolling balls and navigable mazes, and I swear, I could feel the weight of the pixel ball as it bumped around the wooden barriers.We're Amazon Prime members, as well, so the freedom to continue watching our favorite free shows and movies was a definite factor in choosing another Kindle device for our household.

Reviews.Title: The best budget tablet out there.
Reviews.Author: Thomas Briggs
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations for the Kindle Fire HD 8.9.  I've owned an iPad 1 since it launched, and while I love it, it's recently slowed down and isn't compatible with iOS 6.  So, I had been considering moving on to a more current tablet.  The newest iPad was an obvious choice, but when I considered what I primarily used the iPad for - reading books and comics, surfing the internet while on the couch, watching video - I realized that I didn't necessarily NEED to live within Apple's ecosystem.  Sure, they offer a ton more apps, but I don't use enough of them to justify another $500 purchase.So, I looked to either the Nexus 10 or Kindle Fire HD 8.9.  Ultimately, I chose the Kindle Fire HD because of its integration with the Amazon store.  I'm already a Prime member, I have a vast library of Kindle books, and I use they're Cloud music player because it works with just about any device I'd want.I'm glad I went with the Kindle Fire HD 8.9.  It's a good, not great, device.  When I first received it, and put it through its paces, I was a little disappointed.  It doesn't run as smooth as the iPad, and again, few apps are as polished.  And then there's Silk... the world's worst browser.  It's slow, clunky, and doesn't do anything better than any other browser out there.  Fortunately, the more time I spent with the Kindle Fire HD, the more I learned about it and came to enjoy it.When you get past the fact that it's not the iPad, you can appreciate the Kindle Fire HD for what it is - an amazing e-reader that also happens to be an adequate tablet.  Seriously, this is the best Kindle experience you'll find.  Books are baked seamlessly into the OS, the Kindle UI is excellent, X-Ray is cool, and the text to speech feature works amazingly well.  Not the Audible option, mind you, but the standard text to speech option available on any book.Besides book integration, the Kindle Fire excels at delivering all Amazon content, which should be obvious.  Movies are quick to load, music stored in the Cloud work perfectly, and photos are easily synced with your Facebook account.  Again, it's just a darn good personal tablet.  The fact that it's $200 less than an entry level iPad shouldn't be ignored either.Outside of seamless access to Amazon content, the best reason to own a Kindle Fire HD 8.9 is its beautiful screen.  As someone who owned an iPad before it had a retina screen, I can tell you the difference is staggering.  Everything is clear and crisp.  Reading is enjoyable, and movies have excellent black levels.  For an avid comic reader like myself, the Kindle Fire HD is a godsend.  Even though the size of the screen is slightly smaller than that of an actual comic book, everything is perfectly legible because of the high resolution.In short, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Kindle Fire HD 8.9.  It's not an iPad, but really, you shouldn't have expected it to be.  It's a great reader (books and comics) and video player, and has an adequate number of tablet apps.  Is the lack of specialty apps worth the $200 savings?  I'd say so.  Especially if you're already knee deep in the Amazon ecosystem.  If you're a Prime member, and also use the Cloud Music Match service, it's close to a must buy.

Reviews.Title: just right for what I'm using it for
Reviews.Author: Avery L. Hasty
Reviews.Content: I use my kindle fire for emails and checking on amazon orders.I found it much easyer to carry and operate than my laptop.I can be done by the time the laptop fires up.It also works with my skype account.

Reviews.Title: My First Tablet
Reviews.Author: Jerry Courtney "myrjer"
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to put in my two cents because I have not owned any other tablet to compare with.  So, I will judge it on its merits.  I love it.  Everything is pretty much like the way it is presented. Great resolution,better sound than I thought it would be, touchscreen is easy to navigate, and no sluggishness anywhere even with the Silk browser.  Battery is lasting as advertised and charges back up in 4 - 5 hours.  My niece has an ipad so I was a little familiar with it but I think she may be jealous of my Kindle Fire HD next time she comes to visit.

Reviews.Title: LOVING IT!
Reviews.Author: Donna E Crouse
Reviews.Content: LOVING the Kindle!  I needed help getting it set up from my Nephew...smooth sailing after that, great having it all at using the Stylus!!

Reviews.Title: Great product at a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Virag Masuraha
Reviews.Content: Visuals are stunning and product is greatly improved from its prior version. Model is sleek and has few feathers that were missing in its previous version (i.e. text to speech, camera, HD view, etc). Amazon has great set of apps so product is well supported.Camera is not that great and a few apps give trouble when scrolling but other than that it works just great.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Jules
Reviews.Content: I had a kindle prior to ordering the new one so I knew I would be happy with the purchase. The only negative is the camera not being ready without having to buy an app to make it work.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Char
Reviews.Content: The HD is great I love the clearness of the screen and all the books and music. Still exploring and know there is more!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Joy Davis
Reviews.Content: I have really enjoyed the features it has and the ability to make the letters larger or black and white as I have low eyesight.  It is very heavy which is a problem.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD is assume
Reviews.Author: Joanne
Reviews.Content: Like how you can use it right out of the box. I am a little computer challenged and this was so easy.

Reviews.Title: My New Best Friend
Reviews.Author: Shutterbug
Reviews.Content: I'm still exploring all of its capabilities, but so far it's really great.  It's easy to navigate and go to many sites with it.  I love being able to have it at finger tips and either read books, watch videos, read and send emails or play games on it.  The HD screen is spectacular.

Reviews.Title: Kinle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Verna
Reviews.Content: Who wouldn't be happy with this product!!!  So far it has been everything I hoped it would be.  It is my first tablet of any kind.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: James L. Thompson
Reviews.Content: I have the 16 gb model and I love it. I'm still learning about it. I did get a chess app and it was amazingly easy to use.

Reviews.Title: You Get What You Pay For - Kindle Fire died and so has my faith in Amazon
Reviews.Author: FranTodd
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews thoroughly before buying.  Our Kindle Fire froze on the boot screen just four months after the one year warranty expired and all Amazon could do is offer us a refurbished Kindle for half the price of a new one if I return the old one.  If you read the reviews this is a repetitive problem for Amazon and they are probably making money hand over fist on the refurbished units.  I love saving money, but when Amazon advertises the cost of a Kindle being much lower than an iPad, you have to factor in the cost of replacement.  I've had an iPad for many years with no problems whatsoever.  Granted, I dislike Apple's OS, but the unit hasn't died on me.Amazon refused to replace my unit, even with a refurbished Kindle, to save face with a customer who has given them business since the day they started.  I'm also done with Amazon.

Reviews.Title: you get what you paid for and a lot less than you expected
Reviews.Author: Andrew Edmundson
Reviews.Content: Since the only thing that Amazon seems to be able to dream up in their marketing is that kindle fire has a lower price than other competing products it should be no surprise that it is an inferior product. It is a mediocore performer as a reader and Silk is a joke. Constantly crashing with even the simplest browsing.Amazon should be embarassed by quality and performance of their product and even after a few years of many complaints  from users offered no update to improve Silk.Over a year of frustrating attempts to use my Kindle Fire and still Disappointed .

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Tere
Reviews.Content: I've had people come and ask me what I have.  Can you say green?  People who have other mini-laptops are so green!  I feel sorry for them.  The HD is crisp, the audio is great -- even without headphones that I recommend be used to get the full enjoyment.  As I am a member of Prime, I can tell you watching movies on this is just an incredible experience (especially when husband is asleep next to you and you wear headphones!) and I love it.The ONLY problem I have is wi-fi just SUCKS up the battery charge.  I haven't bought the FAST battery charger yet -- next payday -- but you'll want one.  And probably a keyboard, if you prefer to type rather than using a stylus.  I use this to take notes in class, and it is wonderful!  (See my review of the HP wireless printer, the HP 8600 Premium Pro -- I can print my notes right from my Kindle!)I thought about the HDX, but heard the rear camera wasn't all that great, I can't advise to that.  The special ads I've already learned to overlook them; they aren't that intrusive.  When I bought my model, it wasn't available without the ads, so I just got it. I'm not sorry I saved the money, LOL.  There are more apps than you'll ever need (be careful to read ALL the reviews and take heed as I've bought a few that just don't work!).  If you don't need the rear camera or the "Mayday" key (I don't) then buy this.  Also highly recommended is the extra two year warranty plan.

Reviews.Title: We were lied to and misled
Reviews.Author: B. K. Wallen
Reviews.Content: The kindle is not a bad book reader. Having said that however, anyone with children BEWARE!  First, the default is one click purchasing.  This will usually cost you around $50 if you catch it quick enough.  Much, MUCH more if you don't.  No kid can resist instant gratification with a single click, consequences down the road.  GAMERS BEWARE!  Most free games have many, many add-ons available for PURCHASE (think 'one click' ease).  Recently our device completely reset itself (Amazon blames us). Guess what happens to every purchase (other than books) ever made.  THEY COMPLETELY DISAPPEAR!!  No problem, you purchased these via Amazon one click so they can be restored. Right?  WRONG.  Amazon advised they keep none of this.  Try going to each individual 'developer' of these apps to try to restore your purchases.  We are not sure how to figure out exactly who each developer is as the purchases are listed simply as 'Cuddly Puppy' and such.  No developer info is given and we are not sure which game each add on goes with or how the developer will be able to go back through amazon and provide this for us.  Will their customer service be like amazon's?  Hope not.  No more add on game purchases and NO MORE KINDLES for us.  We are extremely disappointed in Amazons business model for the Kindle.  Apparently it is just an income producing shopping conduit for Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Very disatisfied customer!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Art Liberatore
Reviews.Content: Total BS, you pay close to $300.00 for the equipment  to get, and it comes with a cord and no plug.  If that's a way of doing business, trying to squeeze even more money out a consumer then I want no parts of any anything this company sells.  If I could of given no stars, I would have.  I will tell all my friends and family about this and recommend they go else where!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Donna Lynch
Reviews.Content: I am a faithful Kindle owner, also have several friends I have encouraged to buy a Kindle, so it pains me to say I am disappointed with this purchase. I bought this as a Christmas present for myself. I went with the bigger size, but opted for just the HD because of the price.First off, the larger size makes it hard for me to hold in the palm of my hand (and I have big hands, really).It's really, really, really HEAVY!!!  I knew it weighed more than the HDX (kinda wonder why that is?), but figured it couldn't be THAT heavy...it is.I didn't buy the charger plug, thinking I had just bought a new one and it should work...wrong.  So, I am forking out another $20 to buy the plug, based on reviews I've seen here. Wondering why this wasn't included without the full charger.  Like buying a car without a gas tank.It takes FOREVER to charge, and on top of that it no way stays charged for 10 hours, more like 4.Now I know why I saved $70 on this purchase. Amazon is trying to get rid of this lemon of a tablet.Extremely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: I'm disappointed.
Reviews.Author: Jacquelyn Briggs "carb queen"
Reviews.Content: It freezes constantly and I have to restart.  Also, it doesn't support  flash, which I had on the original 7" Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE Kindles......when they work
Reviews.Author: Motherskiss "PROUD AMAZON ADDICT"
Reviews.Content: I have had 4 Kindles. The first time I received the Kindle Fire (1st gen) I knew the charging design was flawed. Sure enough not 6 months later...charging problems. by that time the 2nd gen was born. I was hopeful all would be well. Nope charging problems. So I am sitting here having gone almost two weeks without my Kindle. I requested a replacement the moment the screen flashed out never to turn on again. That was almost two weeks ago. I have been calling Amazon everyday since. Finally yesterday they agreed my replacement should have been here by now, so they sent out another. Hopefully it wont take a week to get here. i had to actually pick up a paper book to read. Made my earth footprint just a little bigger.

Reviews.Title: Love this Kindle!!!
Reviews.Author: Jorge Salinas
Reviews.Content: I had bought my wife a kindle fire before.  She loved it very much and got great use out of it.  I had no idea what to buy her for her birthday and saw this advertised on your website.  After a little bit of research, I found this would be an ideal gift for her.  At first she was taken back by it being much larger than her other Kindle, but she quickly adapted.  I hardly see my wife anymore, to be honest.  She is lost in the world of kindle.  :)

Reviews.Title: wifi connectin issues.
Reviews.Author: barry massey
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle fire hd and all you can do with it...except for the wifi issue. The device will not stay connected to the wifi. I have to go in and turn off wifi and then turn back on every time I use it. Otherwise it is a great product.

Reviews.Title: Great Value for the Money
Reviews.Author: Malinda
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire is a great product.  The resolution is wonderful and it does run a lot of apps.  The only problem I've encountered thus far is with Skype.  The audio works great, but the other party must download Skype for Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: SO FAR
Reviews.Author: Pamela
Reviews.Content: As stated in the subject line so far I am very pleased with my new HD Fire purchase....I am very capable as far as using software which I am familiar with but very cautious with any new software...my goal is to use any particular piece to it's fullest and thererore patienetly move forward and learn about said capabilities....I have found the help provided with the new "FIRE" most patient and accommodating.I am also becoming very excited with the latest "state of the art"  capabilities available to me through the new "KINDLE FIRE HD" I believe the price is most fair when compared to other devices and to date would recommend this as a very serious consideration to purchase.If in the futurue I find any real problems that I can attriubte to the actual device I will most certainly update my review.At the moment I am very excited (my 6 year old granddaughter is totally enthraled with the "FIRE") and am sooooo looking forward to the endless possibilities it may provide.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Hynes
Reviews.Content: Worked as expected, worth the money. Definitely worth the investment. I haven't had any issues with WiFi, even on my work network. Even my iPad friends are jealous

Reviews.Title: Awesome device
Reviews.Author: shayfurk
Reviews.Content: Being a technology addict, I have a number of different devices, such as a Nook, a smart phone, laptop, a couple of desktop pc's etc. After having this new Kindle Fire HD 8.9" only a couple days, I have to say that I'm impressed. I have a wifi router that is located in a large building, quite a distance from my office, and on a different floor. This device gets far better wifi reception than any other device that I own, including my laptop, smart phone, and Nook. At even this distance from the router, Netflix streaming is seamless, with no buffering at all. Web surfing, downloading apps etc. are also relatively quick. When I am closer to the router, speed is lightning fast. Graphics are very nice as well. I'm very happy with this purchase. About the only thing that I don't like is that every app that I use is automatically added to an onscreen carousel. I really like to keep an uncluttered screen, and manually removing these apps from the carousel is somewhat of a pain. There may be a way in settings to disable this feature, but if so, I haven't found it yet. I do like the favorites feature which is easy to use. Having this feature is a better way of accessing what I want quickly and the carousel of recently used apps seems redundant. To me, it would be far better to only add things such as most recently read books to the carousel. That being my only complaint, I would definitely recommend this device to others

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS KINDLE!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Kat 65081
Reviews.Content: WOW Blown away by this Kindle,-  Kindle Fire HD 8.9", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 16 GB - Includes Special Offers  ,  I have an Ipad and Love this so much better and so do the Grandkids, they are 31/2 and 5 yrs old.. SO had to get another for Christmas, took advantage of the $50 off yesterday :)...............  WE ARE HAPPY HAPPY!!!!

Reviews.Title: My Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: R. Graves
Reviews.Content: I really like this kindle.  It is like having your desktop computer in your hands.  The picture is so clear and sound is awesome.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Norm
Reviews.Content: Love it! Use it everyday for my email, games, photos ....nice big screen and leather case fits perfect...just need hdmi cable.

Reviews.Title: Meets all expectations
Reviews.Author: F. Macli
Reviews.Content: Have used the HD 8.9 for three weeks and it has met my expectations. Vast improvement over Fire 1st gen. Only downside is the slow performance of the Silk web browser. Have side loaded the Dolphin browser to get around this issue. Hopefully future software update will address it.

Reviews.Title: my Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Mary Lundrigan
Reviews.Content: I choose this one because i have the regular Kindle Fire and was very happy with it....I love the H. D. and the speakers are nice...Love to watch movies on it!!!I would recommend this to everyone! So easy to use the color is brilliant! You will love it...

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: march17
Reviews.Content: I am loving my new kindle.  I really like the bigger screen, and it is so nice and clear to look at.  I love it.

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: Suzste
Reviews.Content: Much cheap cheaper than ipad. works as well as my friends ipad. I like the weight and size.  Love it

Reviews.Title: Tablet for the whole Family
Reviews.Author: Asiana
Reviews.Content: Perfect for the whole family specially the FreeTime function.  My 4-yr old loved it and don't want to play with his LeapPad anymore.  I can limit his game time, reading time,and video time without accessing my account.  The best part is I can limit the apps he can access and when he reached his time limit, it won't let him access them.The sound system is awesome, I played a couple of movies and the pictures are perfect.  So clear and vibrant and don't have to worry about battery life. Web browsing is not a problem, very fast.I actually bought one for my teenager as a Christmas gift. He has the original kindle fire and he's upgrading to the 8.9" HD.

Reviews.Title: YES
Reviews.Author: Nancy Sheehy
Reviews.Content: As a older Kindle owner.. I love the ebooks instead of paper bbooks for obvious reasons.. Preordered this one for my birthday present to me!  I ahve found very little to be disappointed from and so much to be so hapy about!  Not only can I read my books, but.. do so much more! I love the internet capabilities, the apps etc.. Did NOT like that I had to buy app for photos, cable for HDMI output and the regular plug in charger as I really think those items should be included.. However.. They do NOT detract from the fact That I LOVE THIS FIRE !  Really looking forward to some updates that may fix some little issues with some apps, but.. not tied to Apple chains and have all the great capabilities..  btw.. my free time has become so much fuller.. LOL

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Nancy A. Gregory
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HD.  I had an older version of Kindle Fire; and love this one so much more!

Reviews.Title: AT&T; Broadband
Reviews.Author: Becky Ogden "bpiggden"
Reviews.Content: My dad has purchased this for my mom for Christmas. He had it sent to my house so that I could have some apps loaded and it would be "straight out of the box" ready to go Christmas morning. How in the world do you get the broadband registered so that you can use it. I am beyond frustrated. He paid the $50 for a year of service and we can NOT get it to register. Can anyone help?? PLEASE!! I know Mom is going to LOVE it. Heck, I love playing with it. Luckily I have WIFI so that I CAN use it.

Reviews.Title: glare problems
Reviews.Author: tony
Reviews.Content: Really a great tablet. I just received it and already enjoy it  much but ... the glare is very annoying. I have not yet found any environment were glare and reflection did not interfere with image on the screen.

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect
Reviews.Author: Angela Dino
Reviews.Content: Perfect for movies, books, surfing and shopping. I use Evernote to take notes easily with two thumbs. It's a great iPad substitute in my already overloaded back pack. My biggest gripe is that the Amazon Android store doesn't have all the apps that I use such as YouTube, Marvel Coming. I have to "side load" them from other stores. The other gripe I have is that pesky back button is too close to the delete key...I'm always pressing it accidentally when I try to correct my key entries.

Reviews.Title: I love It
Reviews.Author: Razan Abbass
Reviews.Content: Was surprised how much I liked it! Moved up from the old Kindle, and was worried about the brighter screen for reading, as I work on a computer for a living. Was thrilled to find that it doesn't bother my eyes at all! Am absolutely amazed at the quality for videos as well.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire Hd 8'9"
Reviews.Author: chris
Reviews.Content: I love my new kindle, I have the orginal, also love that,  But this was well worth the wait. The bigger screen is clear and crisp, great for watching movies and perfect  for reading books. not to big and not too small, its just right. The kindle does everything I need it to do and more.The only thing I would change , is to be able to personalize the lock screen.

Reviews.Title: kindle 4g lte is a great product but for price, wall charger should have been included
Reviews.Author: glory
Reviews.Content: Just received the 4gb lte model and for price paid, amazon should have included the wall charger! kindle weighs less than my ipad and will be my new travel companion.

Reviews.Title: GREAT!
Reviews.Author: Lori Jo
Reviews.Content: Loving this "new baby" - simple learning curve - my only other "device" is the Kindle 3 (keyboard reader) - I waited for this generation and pre-ordered - the only COMPLAINT I have is that U.P.S. delivered it to the wrong house and I had to go searching for it at 10:00 p.m. on the day it said "delivered" - it was delivered to the same house number as mine but on a completely different street in our neighborhood that was nowhere near me - the resident had it, she actually accepted the delivery earlier that day at 6:02 p.m., and then RELUCTANTLY handed it to me, I really feel like they were going to keep it, I was EXTREMELY UPSET.  This was obviously a U.P.S. mistake; but in addition, perhaps Amazon can stipulate "SIGNATURE REQUIRED" on expensive electronics with its shippers - I consider $100 and higher expensive, this item was $299.  Thank you!

Reviews.Title: Issues With New Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Loki Ryan "Loki"
Reviews.Content: I thought my apps from the Old Fire would work the same on the new Fire HD.  But I was wrong. Here are some problems:1. Documents to Go. Nolonger plays powerpoint PPS slideshow automatically. They have to be manually advanced.2. OfficeSuite: Plays powerpoint PPS slideshow slowly. A 4-sec interval slide advances after 20-30 secs.3. CineXplayer, Es Explorer Player nolonger play MOV & M4V. I have to download Movie Player VISTA to handle these files.4. The Built in Personal Video Player plays m4v too jerky to be useful, even though the sound is good. I wish there was a way to select which files it manages, so I don't have to see them on start up.5. No APP to manage built in camera. You either buy one, or use ES Explorer to access the system's built-in camera app.6. No light to indicate that the Fire HD is charging, and when it is complete. Not sure if I should always leave it plugged in?One would think it was a problem with the apps, but when multiple apps have similar problems, then it just might be a Kindle Fire HD issue.Overall I love this new Kindle Fire HD, and I am happy that I upgraded. I just don't have an easy way to play my powerpoint slides shows automatically without converting them to an mp4 format. I can't find any app that works on the Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE MY KINDLE FIRE HD!!!
Reviews.Author: BBs Mama
Reviews.Content: OK, so I am not a tablet guru or anything, and I will admit that this is my first tablet.....but, after much research, I decided that the Kindle was for me.  I am pretty sure I have made the right decision.  It is ready to use right out of the box, just put your personal touches and you are ready to go.  It is very easy on my eyes, which was a concern for me.  The HD is wonderful! My whole family is addicted! I plan to buy one for my four-year-old for Christmas!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: V. F. Taylor
Reviews.Content: My new Kindle is still charging but I was able to set it up before it was fully charged and was plugged in.  I love that it updated and set up with no effort on my part.  The screen and resolution is beautiful.  I know I will love this product.  I am a bit disappointed, though, that the camera is only front facing.  How are you supposed to take pictures of something else?  I would have liked a light that indicates that it is charging.  I was  having problems viewing some of the free videos that come with my Prime Membership.  The engineers worked on the problem and got it resolved.

Reviews.Title: No desktops No widgets
Reviews.Author: petrakis konstantinos
Reviews.Content: The worst menu on tablets ever. No desktops - No widgets. I'm not against the amazon dependance of the device but I can't accept that I cannot have desktops and widgets and the play store as alternative for applications.

Reviews.Title: Amazon Hits A Home Run!!
Reviews.Author: Gina Ladner
Reviews.Content: I wanted to start by saying this tablet meets all of my needs.  Of course, I researched this tablet when it was announced as well as read reviews after its release. This is my 4th Kindle.  I have had my new Kindle Fire for about a month now, and it is definitely a keeper.  I will touch on a few issues below that have been mentioned in other reviews.THE CHARGER (or lack thereof):  I knew from research that it would come only with a USB cord for charging.  I have other chargers (one for the original Kindle Fire) but opted to purchase the PowerFast Charger for the ½ off price of $9.99 which is an option for everyone who purchases this tablet through Amazon.  The location of the charging port on the device does not bother me because I can just turn it upside down while charging and watch a movie easily without it being in the way.FLASH PLAYER:  I’m not going to say much about this except that there is a work-around for this by downloading an older version of Flash.  Read the comments on other reviews for details.DESIGN:  Fabulous is all I can say.  It is just the right size, not too small, not too big.  Thin and lightweight.  I purchased the Amazon Kindle Fire HD 8.9 case for $54.99.  It has a low profile and I like that.  I also have one of those AmazonBasics Netbook Bag for 7 to 10 inch tablets with a handle.  It carries my Kindle 8.9 (in the case I mentioned above), USB charger, and PowerFast Charger, whenever I am traveling.PICTURE QUALITY:  Fantastic, sharp, crystal clear movies and shows.  The high definition is really obvious when compared to my original Kindle Fire.  A++ in this area, Amazon!!WiFi:  I had no problems setting up WiFi.  After inputting my router security code, it recognized it and connected immediately.  I tested streaming a movie in the opposite side of the house where the signal is the lowest.  When streaming a movie on Netflix on my ORIGINAL Kindle Fire, it would sometimes lag and show a “buffering” message, but on the NEW Kindle Fire HD 8.9, there was NO lag or slowdown of streaming the same movie.  Movies and shows stream seamlessly and I have no connection issues, even low signal areas.SOUND QUALITY:  Dolby sound is very nice as well, however, 90% of the time, I use headphones.CAMERA:  For my use, the camera is a nice add-on, but I don’t intend to take pictures with this camera, anyway.  I have an iPhone for that and with this Kindle HD 8.9, it has the ability to import your photos from other mobile devices (iPhone?) and Facebook or Twitter directly to your tablet.  Love that feature!  I would primarily use this camera for Skype, probably.4G LTE WIRELESS:  This seems to be a bit issue with a lot of folks.  I’ll admit that I was attracted to the $49 one-time fee for a year’s worth of 250MB/month 4G LTE Wireless coverage.  But I knew that 250MB would not be enough for me.  We have 3 iPhones in our family through AT&T.;  So I went to the AT&T; store with my Kindle.  I dropped my current family plan and changed to a Mobile Share Plan which gave me 10 gigs of data per month for 3 iPhones and 1 Kindle Fire Tablet.  My hubby and son don’t use much data at all, and I use maybe 3 gigs per month.  So, in my world, this is a win-win and I’m spending only about $30.00 more every month for 10 gigs of data.  As you may recall, the other options given on the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 during 4G setup were 3 gigs for $30 a month and 5 gigs for $50 a month.  I’m getting 10 gigs for $30 a month.  Thank you AT&T;!!!PRICE DIFFERENCE:  OK, stay with me on this......I compared the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 32 gig for $369 and the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 4G LTE Wireless for $499.  This is a difference of $130.  So you pay $130 more for the same high end, 32 gig model just to include the 4G LTE capability.  THEN, the average person signs up for the $49.99 for the first year 4G LTE Wireless for 250MB of data per month.  So you are paying $179.99 MORE for this Kindle Fire HD 8.9 4G LTE Wireless just to get this feature.Now, when you look on AT&T;’s site, to get a data plan for a tablet equal to 250MG per month, it normally cost the average person $14.99 a month for this data plan.  This amount times 12 months equals $179.88.  So, really, AT&T;, is getting their money in the long run because Amazon is probably forking over most, if not all, of the profit they receive selling the 4G LTE version of the tablet to AT&T.;  Amazon probably views this as an acceptable loss because they know that they will recoup this amount plus more when people purchase media from their website.  Of course, this is only speculation on my part, but, it does sound feasible, doesn’t it?So, in my opinion, this tablet exceeds my expectations.  NO disappointments, NO frustrations, and NOT a waste of money, as many would claim in the 1 star reviews.  You just have to know what YOU need in a tablet, and know WHAT you are buying.  This is a media consumption device, pure and simple.  It’s not meant for heavy duty productivity, spread sheets, etc.  I LOVE IT!!

Reviews.Title: Better than iPad
Reviews.Author: C. Stowe
Reviews.Content: This is great and easy to use. I think it is faster and easier to use than the iPad. Love it

Reviews.Title: Decent for what it's designed for
Reviews.Author: Paul Cohen
Reviews.Content: This is primarily an Amazon consumption device.  For that, it is GREAT.  I hav several devices.  Nexus 7, Galaxy Note 10.1, iPad 4, iPad Mini.  I get them for my review blog and to play.  Each one has a uniqueness I like about them.I got the Kindle to be primarily my video, book, magazine, music player while at home.  I have a Roku and Cable, but sometimes I want to chill in bed and consume some media.  I dont care about e-mail or other apps as I plan on using this at home as a multi-media type device.The screen is awesome.  I will match it up with my iPad 4 on most things concernign video.  The sound quality is better than all but the Galaxy Note 10.1 which has 2 front facing speakers!!Reading books is awesome on this thing.  Magazines are even better.  Movie play is great in HD and I can easily have my eyes on the screen for an entire movie and not get strained.It is not the "do everything" tablet you might need.  If, however, your MAIN objective is to be tied into the Amazon system, then this is a device worth looking at.  The screen size is perfect.  It's a little heavy, but still not too bad.

Reviews.Title: My new Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: garriott
Reviews.Content: It's a great tablet. I got the 12 month $49.95 AT&T; 4G plan. Works great and simple to use. I love It!!!!

Reviews.Title: HD in your hand
Reviews.Author: James B Cox
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what was advertised. The picture clarity exceeds expectations. I can not comment on the sound quality because of a hearing problem, but the volume is satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: Nice device except..
Reviews.Author: Tjn
Reviews.Content: Typing is not good at all because it will put spaces where they don't go or replaces what you type with what Kindle thinks it should be (spell check not good). Editing is ridiculous. Kindle doesn't know what copy/paste is either. Battery life is about average. Silk is not a very good browser and doesn't allow for Adobe Flash. A real peave is that there is a camera that faces the user only so if you're into taking selfies only then you are good. If you want to take a picture of someone or something it just doesn't work for that. I guess it's okay if all you do is Skype.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase.
Reviews.Author: CHRISTINE
Reviews.Content: I usually would not buy "refurbished" items but I took a chance on the Kindle Fire HD.  So far, so good.  I don't want to jinks the purchase by bragging.  This makes a second Kindle for my two young grandson.  They each have their own now.

Reviews.Title: Created a monster!
Reviews.Author: Jo A.
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband for when he travels for work. I thought he could watch movies, play his solitaire and maybe even read a book. Reading has never been his "thing". Well- he has used it nonstop. For the man who read 5 books , maybe, his entire 62 years - he has become a reading machine. He has read 5 books since I gave it to him April 1st. He is really enjoying it. The kindle fire HD itself is a great tablet. Very easy to set up email and use. It's even better if you have Prime so you can get free movies and books. I bought 2 of the 7" ones (also refurbished) for my grandsons for Christmas this past year and they love them, too. No problems at all with them being refurbs.  And this "previous generation" has the front facing camera which is nice for Skype.  Would recommend the Kindle Fire HD to all.  Footnote-- I did pay to remove Special Offers on all three kindle fire HDs that I bought. Just don't like the ads and was worth the $15 extra for each one.

Reviews.Title: Gift for Wife
Reviews.Author: Gary P. Goersch
Reviews.Content: and she is constantly on it.  She has no complaints.  well...maybe one....she wishes it supported FLASH so that she could play her facebook games using the browser.

Reviews.Title: unhappy kindle user
Reviews.Author: Rita Knierim
Reviews.Content: I returned a defective Kindle Fire HD 8.9 because the screen kept freezing and the silk browser was not responding much of the time.  The replacement is no better.  I am often shutting down and restarting just to play a game!  Next time I will buy a tablet from someone else.

Reviews.Title: Love the hardware...
Reviews.Author: Mark F.
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth Kindle. I bought it mainly because it was an exceptional value for the price. It's larger than the more common 7" tablets, the display resolution is excellent, dual-band Wifi, HDMI out, decent speakers, battery life, 32 GB memory, etc. etc.But... eventually I felt overly constrained by the restrictive software environment. The user interface is designed to continually try to sell Amazon content. It's not friendly with Google Apps, which I am heavily invested in. The Silk browser is sub-par and the apps selection in the Amazon Store too limited and in some cases overpriced. Eventually I did what many others have - erased the Amazon operating system and replaced it with a generic Android OS. It's given the tablet a new lease on life. I can now use all of Google's apps and any others in the Android marketplace. It also seems more stable and reliable. It's now one of my favorite devices.Bottom line - 4.5 stars for the hardware, 1.5 for the software and restricted environment.

Reviews.Title: when it died it died
Reviews.Author: James M. Trainor
Reviews.Content: 17 months after purchase the battery gave out.no way to replace the battery?eh, what is with that?It was OK when it functioned.  But a black screen after 17 months?Seems like a design flaw to me!Update:Support actually helped!From "Clifford with Amazon Kindle Support.""1. Press and hold the Power button for a full 20 seconds. Your Kindle Fire will shut down while you hold the Power button, which is normal.2. After 20 seconds, release the Power button.3. Press the Power button again to restart your Kindle Fire."I don't know what caused the problem anymore than I know that which cured it.  Something brought the Kindle back to life and now I must eat some crow.While, to me, the unchangeable battery is a head scratch-er, the price benefit ratio for this tablet seems pretty good AS LONG AS IT WORKS. It is now working.  If it continues to do so through the foreseeable  future then it will have earned the 5 stars I am including in this update.

Reviews.Title: back to a good book
Reviews.Author: tom "grandpa"
Reviews.Content: bought husband a kindle to get back to  a good book for relaxation and enjoyment.  the absolute best quality product at an excellent price on Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire (refurbished) is Excellent
Reviews.Author: books for the soul "book lover"
Reviews.Content: Many wonder about that one word: refurbished.  Maybe I can relieve some of that anxiety.  I work in an Electronic industry and canvouch that refurbished does not mean 'bad, less good, only works sometimes, will break sooner, looks bad' or any other worries associated with that word.  Companies have to use that word so consumers don't confuse a 'brand new, out of the box' item with an item that has been returned for any number of reasons, not that it's just broke.  Companies have to verify that the item is in good working order to turn it around and sell back to the public.  My kindle is working fabulously.  No glitches, hitches or harrumphs.  The consumer who is not afraid of the word can almost always save a few dollars on that special item they've been hoping for.  Research the item and learn before you buy no matter what it is, just don't be afraid.  Amazon makes a good product and they have to stand behind it, so buy with confidence.

Reviews.Title: A great disappointment
Reviews.Author: Jean Hilderbrand
Reviews.Content: There were absolutely no instructions for using this gadget.  We could not even turn it on -- there was no off/on switch.  There was no charger included so the thing was worthless and we could not use it.  It was recommended for us as my 84 year old husband can no longer read well because with this item he should be able to enlarge the type so he can see it.  There were no instructions for downloading books or how to do anything with it.  A great disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the brain dead...like me
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Budnick
Reviews.Content: User friendly, easy to understand and easy to navigate.  This quality product provides superior viewing.  In the end, the most notable factor is neither operational ease or quality; it's Amazon's amazing customer service.  Buying from Amazon is like dealing with an honest and reputable  family member.

Reviews.Title: Kindle HD 8.9 is Pretty Darn Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Charissa Comar
Reviews.Content: I have 2 of these AND 3 of  the Kindle HDX .  I purchased them first for my kids,then myself , my husband.  Somewhere along the way the HDX  fatwas introduced, so.......we had to get. Those too!!!  We are all  "Kindled-up" for now and  we love them!!  They are so easy to use!  My 4. year old mastered it in no time. Love those parental controls!!!  I can't tell. The difference between my hd  and my new HDX!  If you're looking f o r  an outstanding product for the greatestvalue get the 8.9 hd.  The HDX is awesome but a bit pricey.  This unit and this size are pretty perfect.  You won't be disappointed!  If you have an iPad- it's going to collect a lot of dust once your KIndle HD arrives,!!!!

Reviews.Title: It is a good reader.
Reviews.Author: Harvey A. Hicks "der swede"
Reviews.Content: I like the size and the sound.However it was adverticed as being able to read in the sun, but it is not much better than my old Kindlefire.  Also it doesn't have a light that tells you when it is fully charged like my old kindlefire, I miss this.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: D. Rusk
Reviews.Content: For years I didn't see a need for a Tablet.  Now that I have the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 I see what I was missing.  I wasn't sure about getting a refurbished product, but knowing Amazon's customer focus I knew I could return or exchange it if there was a problem.  Note that the auto dimming doesn't work like your cell phone;'s (or at least like my Samsung S4).  However, if you get the Amazon case for this product the dimming works OK.  Just close the cover then open it again and it'll adjust to the light.  It won't however adjust dynamically like a cell phone as you move from dark to light or light to dark areas.  Certainly no big deal.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: A&W320
Reviews.Content: I was not happy when my dog jumped on the couch and broke my Kindle. Then came this deal and i was so excited!!! I am so happy with this purchase! I love to read, play games and surf the web.

Reviews.Title: My Shadow
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Jones
Reviews.Content: The kindle Fire is great.  I think it is hands down better than Apple or Samsung.  I would recommend this tablet to anyone that is looking for something easy and convenient and the size is great not to big or to small.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle. Its easy to use. I can read my books...surf the web,,get my email and watch  a movie. What more could you ask for??? Oh how about the skins...which I got too and made my  Kindle all Mine.

Reviews.Title: not convenience enough
Reviews.Author: muggle
Reviews.Content: the system is not convenience enough,  and the battery go down very quickly, i should have bought an ipad instead.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Ray Livengood
Reviews.Content: We have the smaller 7" version as well that my 6 year old son inerrited. What a great device, I love it for the books and periodacles while my son loves the games. For the price, fantastic!

Reviews.Title: Good tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Even though the tablet is used, it seems like new. I had a kindle fire (smaller version) and this one is much easier to read books. Love the size.

Reviews.Title: Wanted to try the bigger Kindle to see if it was any better than the smaller size. Was happy with both.
Reviews.Author: Pamela Gauvin "family girl"
Reviews.Content: Wanted to try the bigger Kindle to see if it was any better than the smaller size. Was happy with both. Would buy again if I needed one.

Reviews.Title: good kindle
Reviews.Author: Doris F Eash
Reviews.Content: I enjoy  the Kindle Fire 8.9, it is the most amazing thing I ever had.I take to work and read my books. thank you

Reviews.Title: Great tablet at very affordable price.
Reviews.Author: Q. Dong
Reviews.Content: The certified refurbished Fire HD 8.9 tablet is virtually new. No sign of wear at all. The high defination screen makes reading really a joy. Very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Lousy Browser
Reviews.Author: William Wild
Reviews.Content: If not for the Silk Browser,  Five Stars.  Constantly hanging up, crashing.  Bummer.  Everything else about the Kindle is great.  'Cept the @&!!#$ Browser.

Reviews.Title: Amazon service A+
Reviews.Author: Beverly Grenz
Reviews.Content: This was a replacement for the same model that I purchased a year ago that failed. So far so good! I do love the kindle when it is working properly. Amazon lived up to their reputation by a prompt replacement

Reviews.Title: SHould Have Invested in A Samsung Galaxy or an Ipad.
Reviews.Author: Kenroy Green
Reviews.Content: Freezes too often...battery doesn't last long and its so slow, this is also a replacement I had so many problems with the original and the replacement is no better. I must say my very first Kindle Fire was great, I gave it to my sister and upgraded to the Fire HD 8.9 and its just a mess been having problems after 2 months of usage.

Reviews.Title: Would not recommend to a friend
Reviews.Author: Edward Barrett
Reviews.Content: HD is excellent but browser is quite slow and often stops working in the middle of something.  I would probably go to a IPad or Samsung tablet next time.

Reviews.Title: Getting to Know the Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Edward Wilkinson
Reviews.Content: I am still learning how to use it. I can share with you that it has a very short battery life by comparison to other tablets. I have to charge if every 10 to 12 hours. I find that not the case with iPad. Could there be something that I could be doing to reduce the battery drain when not in use.Get back with me in another 60 days

Reviews.Title: Refurbished Kindle Fire is Great, just like new.
Reviews.Author: Anne Belot
Reviews.Content: I like the larger size, and so far it's great, I haven't really checked everything out yet. Easy to hold on your lap and read horizontally.Not as expensive as an Ipad.

Reviews.Title: USEFULL
Reviews.Author: Michelle Jones
Reviews.Content: I take this everywhere I go. This is the best investment I had made in a very long time. Thank you for making me a HUGE fan....

Reviews.Title: Died within 7 months
Reviews.Author: James M. Bugno "jimmy"
Reviews.Content: took too long for charge, and many times the charge did not take. My kindle died one night at that was the end of it.  It was only 7 months old.  After receiving my 2nd kindle (through warranty) I decided to cut my losses and sell it (which I did) - I did not want to load it up with pics and songs, and apps only to lose it again.  As the old adage says "Fool me once, shame on you, fool me twice, shame on me."  Nonetheless, when it worked, it was great.  I will be looking at other options. The only way I would recommend this product is if you are willing to gamble that you don't get a lemon.

Reviews.Title: Best deal on a 8.9"
Reviews.Author: robert rooker
Reviews.Content: Thought twice, but after I got this I love it.  No more Pad envy at my house.  If you can find a refurb Don't pass it up.

Reviews.Title: Wonky
Reviews.Author: K.C. Love (kclseattle@aol.com)
Reviews.Content: This is the fifth Kindle I have owned: I hate the SIlk browswer, and the entire Web service freezes up constantly, the battery drains so fast, and the touch interface is off most of the time. It's not easy to use or navigate. I will never buy another of these with the crappy browser per-installed again.

Reviews.Title: Like New
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I had some problems in the beginning connection to my wifi, but the problem was with my wifi... I just wish I would have pruchased one with more than 8GB!

Reviews.Title: Too many problems
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: When its working its fine but it has many problem continuously going off line. Having to continuously restarting the wireless process is a drag.

Reviews.Title: Amy is awesome!
Reviews.Author: bryn
Reviews.Content: My eight year old love's his tablet. He loves it so much that he named her Amy and that's what the whole family refers to her as. I think it's pretty much his first girlfriend. It's adorable! Before this he had a nexus and he never named that one!lol

Reviews.Title: will not purchase another one.

Reviews.Content: Worked great until it kept heating up and cracked the screen after 10 months.  Supposedly that my fault as you cannot crack the glass without a lot of pressure so they say.  Will not replace with another Kindle. Between my kids and I, this was the 6th device.

Reviews.Title: Love my new Kindle Fire HD!

Reviews.Content: I was having trouble deciding what tablet to purchase and with a limited about of money I decided to go with a refurbished Kindle Fire HD 8.9". A coworker has Kindles for herself and her two songs and they all love them, so I figured why not? It was a great purchase! The screen quality is outstanding and streaming movies/videos is a breeze. I can't wait to sit outside this summer and read. I've recommended the Kindle Fire HD to anyone who I've met looking to purchase a tablet.

Reviews.Title: not happy with it at all doing the same thing the ...
Reviews.Author: Katrina White "katrina"
Reviews.Content: not happy with it at all doing the same thing the last one did it freezes all the time i soon as i open it in the fist 2 min its frozen !!!! very very up set

Reviews.Title: A lot of room for improvement.
Reviews.Author: John Wilson
Reviews.Content: No SD card slot. Small screen.  No forward-facing camera.  A sharp edge all the way around which can make it uncomfortable to hold when reading.  The  carousel interface is a pain and there is apparently no way to change it.  The Avia Media Player app will interface with Google's Chromecast, but won't play Amazon Prime videos, so if there is a way to send Prime videos to Chromecast, I haven't found it yet.  There is an HDMI jack so it is possible to play the Prime videos on your big screen tv set, but that is much less convenient than Chromecast. Cannot interface with home network via wireless.  Must be plugged into another computer using USB port.On the plus side: Video resolution and sound quality are great. The touch screen is sensitive and accurate.Considering all the drawbacks and the fact that it has a lock screen that screams "Spend money" every time you turn the thing on, it is way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working right after my mother opened it for Christmas
Reviews.Author: adrakephoto
Reviews.Content: The Kindle started powering off for no reason, wouldn't update.... amazon was nice enough to take it back and send her a brand new one though so I am grateful.

Reviews.Title: Perfect size for me
Reviews.Author: Jerry Helsing "jlhelsing"
Reviews.Content: My wife has an iPad and loves it but I always found it to be a little bigger than I wanted while the 7" Fire was a little small for me.  When Amazon had a deal for this, I jumped at it and am glad I did.  I can watch shows and movies on it without having to squint and I can read my kindle books on it without having to wear my glasses.  My kids like it because it is a great system for them to play games on.  Even my wife likes its size better than her ipad although I would have to pry the ipad out of her dead hands to get her to make the switch.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Michelle Graber
Reviews.Content: I was really excited for my new Kindle. Unfortunately, I'm not impressed. It's slow and apps crash consistently. The battery drains extremely fast even when video isn't being used.

Reviews.Title: The Kindle Fire is a great little tablet.
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: You can pretty much do anything with the Kindle that you can do with a computer. You can even put in a password so no one else can use it.  You can hook up to libraries, music, games, and there are lots of sites for downloading free books. Amazon Prime lets you read one new book a month.  My only complaint is the way the charge port is made.  According to the Geek squad at Best Buy, the charge port isn't braced like those in a tablet or laptop so it cannot move, and the contact points are easily broken just by plugging it into the charger.  They said the charge port is the main reason people bring them kindles, and it's not something they can fix..  I would advise getting an extended warranty if you buy one.  If yours is one with an easily broken charge port, and you have an extended warranty, Amazon will replace it.  Right now I'm on my 3rd Kindle Fire, because of that charge port.  And if the charger goes out, you can't get any personal information, like credit card numbers and passwords, etc,. off the Kindle before it is sent off to somewhere to be repaired and sold again.  If the maker put something around that charge port so it couldn't wiggle and break, I would have no complaint at all but they would probably charge more for it then.  Also, the last charge cord sent with my Kindle is impossible to get in the Kindle without maybe breaking that fragile charge port inside the Kindle, so I don't use it.  I use my old one instead.

Reviews.Title: Silk issues
Reviews.Author: R. Ng "Happy camper"
Reviews.Content: I truly hope the developers for Kindle is reading this. I've owned the Fire Kindle for about a year now, and have a few things to say about it. The following are glitches which I believe can be fixed by a software update:- The silk has been unstable. After surfing the net a little checking out stocks, and reading business news; together with 3 or 4 tabs opened, it freedzes up. If you wait for it to unfreeze, it'll eventually give you the option to 'wait' or 'exit' (i.e. crash out of Silk). This is often frustrating since it happens during breakfast and I'm press for time.- Next, it is just lame Silk cannot play YouTube videos. I'll leave it at that.

Reviews.Title: Im glad i jumped.
Reviews.Author: D M Davis
Reviews.Content: Checking my emails and noticed the opportunity to purchase a refurbished kindle fire 8.9 For fraction of the cost. I had been doing my research and chosen this.model. it was either this or a smartphone. Smartphone was going to continually cost me whereas this was a one time purchase and give me more. No brainer. So far it has been working great. Will continue to critique it's performance.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: don howard
Reviews.Content: Got this for my wife and she loves. Nice upgrade from her original Kindle Fire. Just like new right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Works very well.
Reviews.Author: Scott Antonio "Scott Antonio"
Reviews.Content: I would recommend buying a reconditioned Kindle since i have had it a few months and its seems to be perfect, just like brand new.

Reviews.Title: Great gift!
Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mom to use during her dialysis treatments because she gets so bored.  Now she is able to keep up with her Facebook friends, play games, or read without carrying around a bulky laptop or books.  She loves it!  I wish I had ordered another one for myself.  It was a steal when I got it.  You can't get any kind of tablet that size for the price!

Reviews.Title: Would not buy again
Reviews.Author: Miles Miner
Reviews.Content: The unit is very slugish and glitchy.  This started almost instantly.  I've always been hesitant to buy refurbished products and would never buy one again after this.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Josiah Slade Ficklin
Reviews.Content: I just hate this tablet. The apps don't run smoothly even though I've used less than 5 out of the 16gbs. I can't login to Facebook properly on any games. I can't purchase in-game items on most games. The browser is slow. I have trouble connecting to Wi-Fi. The battery life is terrible. The camera is terrible. It won't check my email properly. I have trouble listening to music from the cloud. Can't get some popular apps due to the limitation on the Appstore. I can't play multiplayer on most games. The only good thing I have to say about it is the display is nice and that's why it got a star but it still doesn't deserve it. I will definitely not be purchasing any Amazon tablets ever again or recommend them to anyone. I guess I'll end this by saying you get what you pay for, you buy a cheap tablet, and you'll get a terrible one.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Wayne c Jetzer
Reviews.Content: It is a good value at the $129 price.  Unlike the HDX it is unable to connect wirelessly with a TV.  That is a big disappointment.

Reviews.Title: This Baby is a Keeper!
Reviews.Author: Rhonda Wills "Rhonda W."
Reviews.Content: I love love love this device.  I have been reading, watching TV shows, playing games and having a ball.  The thing looks like brand new and performs like it too.  A good decision for sure!

Reviews.Title: Do not pay full price
Reviews.Author: Dogcatcher
Reviews.Content: Don't buy at full price.  It's not worth it.  Wait for a sale or a refurbished unit under $150.The Kindle Fire HD 8.9 is a decent piece of hardware that is diminished by its user interface.  People who have never used a tablet may not be bothered by the interface, but those familiar with real Android smartphones and tablets are likely to be annoyed by a design that so clearly promotes shopping and consumption of Amazon's digital content.  Yes, I know, the primary purpose of the Kindle is to encourage more purchases from Amazon, but the sales focus is excessive.When you install a free app from Amazon's app store, you receive an e-mail confirmation of your $0.00 purchase.  Overkill.The special offers on the start-up screen are no problem.  They go almost unnoticed among all the other sales pitches.Other observations: -  The 8.9" size is easier to hold in the hand than a 10.1" tablet, and it is lighter. -  The display is sharp, making it easy to see detail on Google maps, for example. -  The dual-band radio is great if you have a dual-band "n" or an "ac" wireless router. -  Works well with Bluetooth Android keyboard. -  No option to use an SD card, because Amazon wants you to use its cloud for storage. -  Short battery life when in active use; keep a charger handy. -  The real Android OS provides many more configuration options than does the simplified Kindle OS.Fortunately, the Kindle Fire's operating system can be replaced.  So, within 48 hours of starting to use the Kindle, I had converted mine to run as a real tablet with Android 4.2.2.  It's a nice Android tablet.  The excellent screen and decent internals make the Kindle a good value if you can get it for less than full price.  Note:  A DIY conversion to Android is technically challenging.  For a conversion that is almost foolproof, and that can be performed by most users, check out the package offered by N2Acards.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful
Reviews.Author: D Heller
Reviews.Content: Like new!  Love it! Works great and the images are amazing plus pricing was excellant  i highly recommend this unit

Reviews.Title: Great Bargain
Reviews.Author: Robin A. Sipos
Reviews.Content: This really exceeded my expectations.  It was packaged like new, looked like new and is working like new.  Thanks Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Works like new.
Reviews.Author: P. Dockery
Reviews.Content: It works great my husband has a kindle fire 7" that my 3 year old  grandson has taken over and has it filled with games so when I saw the Certified Refurbished deal I couldn't pass it up for my husband.  It took us a little while to figure it out since it works just a little different to the 7" but they are great.  The 8.9" is a little heavier to hold when reading but I guess that is to be expected with the larger size.  We are a family of three Kindles now and they all are getting used and enjoyed.  Thank you.

Reviews.Title: As good as new
Reviews.Author: J-Stroke
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and I chose it primarily because of the low price.  I have been paralyzed by indecision -- there are so many choices -- but the refurbished price plus some Amazon bucks I had accumulated made this a low risk foray in to the world of tablets. I would normally skip a review of this since I try to stick to things I know something about.  But there are two specific observations I have to share.First, my "refurbished" Kindle is as good as new; I can't tell a difference. I am glad I went with one and saved the $70. Second, the screens on these things are extremely reflective, much more so than my smartphone or my notebook which are my only two reference points. I would probably not by another one for this reason alone.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Hope Harrison
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my 75 year old mom and she loves it.  It was everything I expected and more.  I would recommend this to anyone

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Bassel M.
Reviews.Content: I thought I will receive a refurbished item which maybe there is something missing from the accessories ...etcBut I received a brand new item with half the price which is amazing

Reviews.Title: wears out quickly
Reviews.Author: Dog Walker
Reviews.Content: Good the first 8 months. Now it takes several attempts to connect to wireless at home even though my I phone and Dell laptop connect immediately and they are older than the kindle. Also touch screen  keyboard does not always work well.

Reviews.Title: second worst than first
Reviews.Author: tricia walton henson
Reviews.Content: This is my second kindle fire hd and it has been behaving much worse than my first, it continues to shut off while I'm using it. I can't completely read my email, scroll on facebook, or play my game  without it shutting down on me or just freezing.
