Reviews.Content: Didn't feel the need to get the HDX, and I was right. Picture is great. Glad I went with this larger size as opposed to the 7 inch, because we got the keyboard as well for the kids' homework. 7 inch would be too small. The first Kindle that was sent had a defective charging connection, but Amazon is great with returns, no hassles whatsoever. Called on December 26th, got a replacement by Dec. 31. I'm glad I didn't take advantage of the "Special Offers" price, because we have not had any pop-up ads, which I had seen from previous reviews could be inappropriate for children. Perhaps I haven't figured it out yet, but I wish the parental control would also limit what types of books, movies are listed for purchase. Some of the covers, titles are terribly inappropriate for children. We were browsing Christmas titles, only to find some books with scantily clad men or women with Santa hats on…hardly Christmas in the true sense of the word. For now, Mommy surfs the titles with the kids.

Reviews.Title: Freezes up constantly
Reviews.Author: Mark Hannon
Reviews.Content: Sound and picture quality are great, but this Kindle keeps freezing up.  Sometimes, the keyboard will not go away, and that of course is a pain when trying to scroll through a web page.  Other times, the keyboard won't come up at all.  As if that wasn't bad enough, The screen will randomly freeze up and won't let you turn off the Kindle to reset it.  This was a gift for my girlfriend (she now has the original Kindle Fire and this 8.9 inch one) and this newer one is more of a pain than the older 7 inch one.  I bought her this refurbished one for Christmas due to its larger screen, 64 Gigs of memory, and better WiFi.  Unfortunately, her 7 inch, 8 Gig, original Kindle Fire seems to have less issues than this one.  I am dissapointed considering how much I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: Great for all members of our family
Reviews.Author: Beluga13 "Jennifer"
Reviews.Content: All of us use the kindle for different things-- reading books of course, but also playing games (my husband), watching kids shows via netflix (my young daughter). It's easy enough to use too. I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Upgrade
Reviews.Author: c
Reviews.Content: :) My Daughter was very happy with this Gift...( esp. the size of the screen ) she takes it everywhere with her!.

Reviews.Title: No charger. No instruction.
Reviews.Author: Danlami Ali
Reviews.Content: The kindle was for a gift. It did not come with a charger and instruction. I had to purchase one separately. It should at least come with getting started instruction.

Reviews.Title: This is a great product
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: This is a great product sold at a very reasonable price, i would highly recommend purchasing this product from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Love my second Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Joyce M Johnson
Reviews.Content: I love the way I stay connected with the Kindle Fire HD. I can connect with my e-mail and facebook as well as with my bank. Movies are so clear and vivid and the bigger page for the books I read is great.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Ree-Ree
Reviews.Content: This was a birthday gift from my daughter.  I was and am more than thrilled.  I have owned the Kindle 2nd generation for about 7 years.  This Fire HD was something on my wish list for a while.  My only complaint (not a big one) is since I use it so much; it has to be charged almost daily.

Reviews.Title: birthday present from my husband
Reviews.Author: Cheri Simpson
Reviews.Content: I love, love, love it.  The only thing that I am disappointed with is the quality of the pictures.  I am on it all the time.  Best gift ever.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 16 GB -
Reviews.Author: frankazin
Reviews.Content: A fabulous unit!  You will love every feature that the Kindle Fire has and it has a lot of features, apps and functions.  Also there are a multitude of free or low-cost books, music and movies that you can download.  I LOVE Mine!

Reviews.Title: I'm new to tablets but this one is very easy to use
Reviews.Author: Daisy A. Taylor
Reviews.Content: I like the Wi-Fi feature.  The Kindle is small and light enough to be portable but the screen is large and clear enough to read, watch TV/movies or play games easily.  I'm a senior citizen and new to this technology but am finding it easy to use and the help feature really assists me in this regard.

Reviews.Title: Good reader, questionable e-mail resource
Reviews.Author: Bruce Langager
Reviews.Content: I have gone through three Kindle Fires in a period of about years,  The first, a 7" Kindle fire, died after about a year when I tried to re-register it in my wife's name, The second, a Kindle Fire HD 8.9," kept dropping my wireless connection and it was replaced under warranty with a new Kindle Fire HD 8.9" eleven months after I purchased it.  All three of the Kindle Fire tablets that I have had experience with have proven to be very unstable in maintaining wireless internet connections and proved to be very slow in handling e-mails.  Comparing the performance of the three Kindle Fires to my wife's iPad ability to maintain stable wireless connections and the speed of handling e-mail communications, I would rate the Kindle Fire HD's as a very distant second.  After the warranty replacement tablet's performance in handling e-mails decayed to the poor performance level of my first 8.9" tablet in just six weeks I replaced the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" with an iPad.

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Britt
Reviews.Content: I am really beginning to hate the Kindle Fire HD.  This is the second Kindle I have had since June.  I think this second Kindle Fire HD has more problems than the first one.  The apps are the main issue with this Kindle.  The company does not have a browser to support the Kindles at all so I had to go to a third party site to find one.  I found one which is the dolphin browser, however, this browser freezes the Kindle.  So until I figure out what tablet I want, I just use this Kindle Fire HD to read and check my emails.  Watching videos is useless.  If the apps do not work, you loose your money on them.  Amazon is known to cheat on some of these purchases.  If anybody knows a good tablet let me know please.  I love to read and do other things as well.

Reviews.Title: Kindle
Reviews.Author: Sherolyn R Newell
Reviews.Content: I am enjoying my Kindle Fire very much.  It does everything I wanted.  It streams video well.  I've downloaded a few apps that I like.

Reviews.Title: Striking video, but a little glitchy on games
Reviews.Author: J. Hill "reading by ear"
Reviews.Content: I love the video quality (even on non-HD) of the TV show downloads and game graphics, but some days the games are a bit glitchy.  Could be the games themselves, but when it's great they are all great and when hesitates, they all hesitate.

Reviews.Title: great deal
Reviews.Author: Joyce A. Fitch
Reviews.Content: I like the bigger screen and the ease of typing. I appreciate d the prompt and courteous service of Amazon employees·

Reviews.Title: could be better deal
Reviews.Author: Randy Doudy
Reviews.Content: Wish it had a dual facing camera, still getting use to, thought I ordered a HDX model, wish it had a electric plug charger,for 399.00

Reviews.Title: Peggy Ponder -coolmom81884@yahoo.com
Reviews.Author: Peggy
Reviews.Content: Love it but not happy with Amazon because I pay $129.00 plus my old kindle and know they are offering the same kindle I got for under a $140.00 the guy made it sound like I was getting a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Silk browser of Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: sanjay bhatt
Reviews.Content: It was my first tablet after having a samsung smartphone.The looks are stunning, the resolutionis damn good, but my disappointment is with the browser-Silk.Frequently, it stops working and will pops message whether to wait or close, this is quite frustrating, I  got this tablet without a power charger, for which additionally I paid USD 20.00Not worth at USD 249.00

Reviews.Title: It's great
Reviews.Author: Sheryl Asmus
Reviews.Content: A few things are different than my 1st edition Kindle, but I'm learning how to make it do what I want it to.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9", Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 16 GB
Reviews.Author: A. Corrado "Foxyfishtail"
Reviews.Content: This is Awesome!!! I love it! I've had it for a week and been using it every day! The HD screen is Brilliant!! Great Apps! The sound quality is Great!  I can't say anything negative about it. It's perfect!

Reviews.Title: Love my new Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: charlene huddleston
Reviews.Content: I had a regular Kindly Fire and now have the Kindle Fire HD 8.9".  I love the new one for many reasons; but, one particular reason is that it holds a charge for me ALL day.  You see, I read ALL the time (usually 5-6 books a week).  I take my kindle everywhere I go ---  so I need a dependable charge.I recommend this Kindle to all who love to read.

Reviews.Title: really a nice unit... great price
Reviews.Author: JJ
Reviews.Content: Those people hacking on this unit must be very picky or just self serving trolls... this is a great tablet... very impressive how well it works with Amazon prime.

Reviews.Title: Replacement... original went to husband
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My husband got me this one to replace/upgrade from my Kindle Fire first gen. The change over was relatively easy!! He was able to register the original Fire in his own name and I have mine in my name. Awesome!!!! Now to get all the goodies to use with it! Case, keyboard etc.

Reviews.Title: The kindle is very user friendly and the large screen is easy to read.I like the large keyboard and all the tasks that it is abl
Reviews.Author: raymond montani
Reviews.Content: Let's to do. I would recommend this kindle to anyone who is considEring a kindle purchase. I hope this helps others interested in purchasing a kindle.

Reviews.Title: OMG
Reviews.Author: donna meadows
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS I WISH I HAD THIS ONE MYSELF BUT IT IS A CHRISTMAS GIFT FOR MY DAUGHTER SHE WILL LOVE IT

Reviews.Title: Love Love Love
Reviews.Author: Donna
Reviews.Content: Was bummed when my first Kindle broke and I was not sure If I was going to get another kindle but When I was offered an upgrade at a great price made me love Amazon even more.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: It was everything we wanted.  Works great. Easy to use.  We were still using original kindle so this is nice

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd 8.9
Reviews.Author: Nancy Dreiling
Reviews.Content: Speed in performance. Larger size. Easier to read. More apps available.it was a gift - I had a kindle fire 7 that cracked but still worked good.

Reviews.Title: surprise gift
Reviews.Author: rondee
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is what I wanted, gave to someone special and she loves it. She is just staring to get use to it, but can reach everyone with a touch . And enjoys it tremendously, great purchase, I am truly satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Chromecast- HBOGO
Reviews.Author: Katy Snyder
Reviews.Content: I wish the Chromecast with HBO Go was developed  but as of right now but it isn't.  That's really the only gripe for now.

Reviews.Title: Not Happy
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Ann Basile
Reviews.Content: I bought a Kindle Fire( small tablet ) about 2 years ago. I liked it at first, until it was stolen at the school that I work at. Debated, & bought a second one. That one wouldn't charge within the first 3 months. Luckily, under warranty, it was replaced. This one was fine until 3 months after the warranty ran out. Complained to Amazon, & they gave me a small deal on this one, the 8.9 Kindle Fire. Luckily it's still under warranty, because this one doesn't load right, can't turn off or on sometimes, & I couldn't find a case or screen to fit it! Needs a lot of perfecting in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Alya
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mom who wanted her first tablet. She loves it and uses it constantly to read, study and play mind challenging games. She rarely uses media and web features and likes the size of this tablet.Comparing this to the iPad mini with retina, it is frustratingly slow, missing many useful features in the reader forcing downloads of pdf and book readers, and the user interface is clunky and limiting. However, that is an unfair comparison (like comparing apples to homemade apple pie a la mode), since the mini is twice the price.I like the Kindle free time feature for kids and I did subscribe to the unlimited version for the free trial but there were too many choices for toddlers to cope with and I didn't find the subscription necessary at this time.This version of the Kindle is well worth it's price and fun for the oldest and youngest members of the household.

Reviews.Title: Best tablet I've tested
Reviews.Author: Luis C.
Reviews.Content: Surely this is the best tablet I've ever tested! I mean is really fast! sometimes the battery last even 3 days! the quality of the screen is amazing! I just bought another one for my mom cuz'she felt in love with it as fast as I did! Is amazing! I live outside the US, so I was afraid because a lot of people says that if you buy a kindle and live outside US the apps and some other would not work! thats a lie! everything works awesome! It's something useful for my personal usage, my work and my university, and now it would be really good for my moms life! I do not regret this purchase at all!

Reviews.Title: Much better than the first gen.
Reviews.Author: Raju Dev Acharya
Reviews.Content: This is a replacement for my Kindle Fire 7" which I had pre ordered when it first became available. I love it.

Reviews.Title: Didn't expect to love it, but I do
Reviews.Author: anonymousreader26
Reviews.Content: I already own an original Kindle, and decided to buy the Fire HD 8.9" primarily with the idea of using it to read magazines. I have seen and used an earlier generation Kindle Fire and didn't think much of it, but WOW -- I am very impressed with the HD 8.9". It looks beautiful, the sound quality is excellent (aside from keyboard sounds being so faint that I can hardly hear them), the web browser is quick... and yes, the magazines I've tried so far were good-looking and easy to read. It's even fun to look at the ads in a magazine like Vanity Fair because I feel like I'm flipping through a real (non electronic) glossy magazine. Although I'm keeping my original Kindle for reading books because I prefer e-ink, I can envision this device partly replacing my iPhone, which has become difficult for me to see/read after the ios7 update. Amazon has an amazing product here!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful customer support and a great solid product
Reviews.Author: Jackie Brown
Reviews.Content: My son loves his kindle. The one we purchased came with pressure marks at the bottom of the screen. I contacted Amazon's support and they sent me a quick replacement. Wonderful customer support and a great solid product.

Reviews.Title: daughter's family gives it 5 stars
Reviews.Author: mainer
Reviews.Content: Bought as gift for my husband. He didn't use it much as he is technologically challenged but our daughter borrowed it and it hasn't been returned and her whole family now wants one so I would say that is a 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd Kindle.  This is by far the best,  I have been plugging it into my TV to watch free movies.  I am a Prime Member and it provides many benefits.  The movies are great quality on the TV.  I really like this one and I believe that you will to.  Be sure to read the Spec before buying to make sure it has the Micro HDMI input plug. If you have the Smart HD TV it does not matter which model you buy because you can transmit to the TV by WiFi.

Reviews.Title: Terrific tablet for the money.
Reviews.Author: Mr. CHL

Reviews.Content: My family owns a 7" Kindle Fire HD, this 8.9" Fire HD and a 1st-gen iPad.  Granted, it's not apples to apples comparing the new 8.8" Fire HD to my iPad but it's what I got.  The app content on Apple is still superior to that of Amazon (Amazon app content isn't terrible...just not in the same vicinity as Apple).  I'm not a computer nerd but I'm not sure why Amazon hasn't been more aggressive with this.  That being said, the 8.9" Fire HD has a very high quality feel to it.  The screen is really crisp, it's easy to use, watching videos look amazing, etc.  Also easy for kids to use and navigate.If the price was the same, I'd buy iPad's.  But...given the HUGE price difference between the two (a full-size 8.9" Fire HD is roughly $50 LESS than an iPad MINI....let alone the full-size iPad's) I just can't justify more iPad purchases. Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about ordering this device. There was a promotion with back to school that brought the device down to $200. I decided that for that price I would try it out and see what it can all do. I have been pleasantly surprised. I was on the fence about tablets and decided I would replace my recently dead laptop with another laptop. After two hours of trying to navigate Windows 8 on my new laptop I took it back to the store and was once again at square one trying to get a mobile device. I'm so glad I gave my Kindle a try. I want to preface this by saying if you're looking for a true tablet experience with tons of apps this is not the route to go. The interface as a whole is limited compared to a normal Android tablet, but what the Kindle does do, it does very well. I am able to browse the web freely, while listening to music on Pandora, and can also check my various email accounts. There are also some apps that I have downloaded to the device that I use as well, such as Netflix. The app store is not as extensive as the regular Android store, but there are quite a few apps that work very well on the Kindle. For my basic mobile needs I love this device. Anytime I need a more powerful machine I just use my desktop. (I know, I'm one of the few that still uses one of those) I actually prefer my Kindle compared to the IPad 2 that I have for work. I find that I like the user interface better and that the screen quality is much sharper than the IPad. I also like the more compact size of the Kindle compared to the bigger tablets. As a whole I do not regret my purchase one bit. I love using my Kindle and would definitely buy one again. Had I known what I know now I would have just skipped the headache of buying and returning a laptop and gone with the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 from the start. Hope this review was helpful for you.

Reviews.Author: VoraciousReader
Reviews.Content: This is so much better than the Nook that I received for Christmas.  It was my first ereader.  I was happy with it at first . . .But then the charging cord broke. Also, I purchased a gift card through a 3rd party vendor (Meijer) for my Nook.  It was activated correctly but when I applied it to my account online every book I tried to buy was applied to my credit card.  B&N; said it was a glitch on their end but said there was no way to correct it.  They also refused to refund my money or credit my account.  Meijer wouldn't refund my money either (I do not blame them. There is nothing wrong with the gift card.). So I told the customer service 'supervisor' at B&N; to "erase my account, I am buying a kindle TODAY."  I did just that and haven't looked back.  I have found that my kindle works magnificently.  Amazon's ordering process is seamless and easy to navigate.  LOVE the Prime program. Free books are incredibly easy to find.  Perhaps the BEST product I have ever purchased. I love to read & am glad to have the ability to carry my library with me where ever I go - in a dependable format.  Thank you amazon!

Reviews.Title: My wishlist for a better product
Reviews.Author: M. V. Vooren "velvetpaws999"
Reviews.Content: OK, so I ordered not one, but two of these tablets: one for myself, one for my niece. The screen quality is great, comparable to the i-pad. Play-back sound is good enough for every-day expectations. Don't expect it to have the power of a boom box, or a full stereo equipment!I must say it is probably my own fault that I find this product lacking in a few ways: I should have read the specs more carefully.  Why did I not read them? I guess it is so much common place already to have these features even in mini-size smart devices that it never occurred to me that they are not on the Kindle!1) It sucks that this tablet cannot take videos. Photos, yes - but hardly: as long as you take them with the front camera, which admittedly is not easy, if the taker does not want to be in the picture.How much more can it cost to integrate a second camera lens, to allow photo taking? I mean, come on, Amazon, the little i-phone and other comparable tablets have it, so why not the Kindle tablet?2) This leads to point two: No video recording!!! Same as above... it should just have it! I wonder what Amazon is thinking... do they believe people will go and buy an i-pad or a Nexus on top of the Kindle Fire, in order to get these features?These two points are my biggest regrets for the Kindle Fire 8.5, and I find it truly regrettable and disappointing!Other things I wish it had: a software for note-taking and email dictation. Obviously, that goes with the above two points: if they can integrate a camera, they can integrate a software like I have on the iPhone, for instance, to use spoken dictation with the microphone.In conclusion of this, I'd call it a rather passive tablet. You can watch videos, you can see photos you took with another camera, you can play back music recorded by another device... You cannot do any of it WITH this tablet.You can surf the web and look at websites, and you can type (albeit painstakingly) your emails with it, no dictation.I guess the two most useful features I will use are the consolidated email feature, where you can see the email of any number of different accounts (yahoo, aol, gmail, you name it...) in one glance.And of course, reading books. That may be its best feature, since one has access to what... millions of them by now, and lots of them for free. Their number is increasing each day!As for the movie watching, it is OK, but I'd rather still use my laptop for this, since it can load and stream them faster than the Kindle, not to mention that I prefer a larger screen for that.I'd willingly give it 5 stars, if they will integrate the features mentioned above.Sometimes, I'm wondering what those tech designers are thinking when they put together a package.... or maybe they are not thinking much? Without those features, a user has to still have another tablet/smart phone, to do what the Kindle is lacking. Nobody wants to spend twice the money and schlepp two tablets around! What for???~!!!  So, Kindle designers: Please, put those features on the Kindle Fire and keep yourself in the market.

Reviews.Title: Kindle for life
Reviews.Author: kodocat
Reviews.Content: I started with a keyboard kindle and thought this was it! My husband got the kindle fire but besides games it didn't interest me.  When he got me the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" 4G LTE I thought this was overkill.  I almost sent it back too large but decided to give it a chance.  You know some people don't like change.  Well I got a great cover stant and  started with a game, then streamed a show, then went to the apps and I've taken off.  I can do most anything I want on this thing.  I did have to buy wireless air time but I rarely need it as I'm within wireless connections most times.  I also got a supercharger that cut my time for charging a plus it worked on my phone too. I'm not embarrassed to admit we are a kindle family.  I've gifted my daughter one, Next will be the grandkids.

Reviews.Title: Serviceable.
Reviews.Author: CanIGoNow
Reviews.Content: The one real disappointment about this device is the battery/charging situation. It's kind of a complete joke. The battery drains within an hour or two, even when it's plugged in as you're using it. I've had several instances of plugging it in to charge via USB while I'm at work (read: not using it) only to find that it has not only not charged at all, but drained to the point of shutting off. I've also plugged it in to charge overnight in a wall outlet and woke up to find that, again, it hasn't charged but has drained and shut off. I plugged it in to a different outlet, checked it after 30 minutes or so to make sure something was happening, and then left it plugged in for another ten hours. When I checked it before bed, it was charged to 86%. That is nothing short of ridiculous, I'm sorry.I am aware of a special "quick charge" device that you can purchase separately to charge in under 5 hours (Wow, you're kidding! Strap in and put your helmets on kids, this is ludicrous speed! /sarcasm #Spaceballs), but I think it's absurd that you have to buy a "special charger" to make the thing function normally.The picture is fine, the sound is fine, the app availability is marginal, the interface is acceptable. It's hard to care about much else when you can't even use it for any reasonable length of time.In this case you get what you pay for. It was cheap, and it functions accordingly. I wouldn't buy this again, nor recommend it to others. If I need a new tablet in the next year or two (which seems likely), I'll look elsewhere for a device with a less flaccid battery.

I still haven't really explored all the features.  I just found out I can connect a Bluetooth keyboard to make typing easier, which is awesome.  Everything is sharper than the old Fire, which was already pretty awesome.  The larger size makes everything better too.  If you are trying to make the same decision, I would look at it this way: If you want a tablet that can do everything, you will need to pay well over a thousand dollars.  With the Ipad and Android tablets you still pretty much need a computer.  With that in mind, if you look at what you are getting for the price, Kindle Fire HD is definitely the way to go.

Reviews.Title: This is a beauty!
Reviews.Author: rc
Reviews.Content: The display is crystal clear.  Occasionally, while streaming video, the picture gets blotchy.  I suspect it is not the fault of the Kindle, but the wireless systems that are available to me.  On a good wireless connection, the Kindle was flawless.The good parts:The display is wonderful.The display keyboard is actually usable in portrait; even better in landscape.Books, websites, pictures, music and audible books start instantly.  This machine is fast!The cons:I cant find any, but there is an irritant and that is the placement of the USB and HDMI ports especially the USB port.  There is no way I can find to prop up the Kindle in order to use it in Landscape while charging. It is a nuisance, but not a flaw,Given the availability of Wi-Fi , I wonder if I might have spent the extra cost for additional memory than for the 4G LTE.  I have been in a dozen fringe cellular reception areas since I bought the Kindle.  If my Verizon cell phone showed no bars, the Kindle AT&T; showed no bars, either.  In my travels, the AT&T; signal dropped out much earlier with only one exception:  If you are heading to the eastern end of Nantucket, this is the cellular connection to have.If you buy this Kindle, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: 4G doesn't work, Silk doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Mr. David Maguire
Reviews.Content: I have WiFi connectivity no problem, but every time I try to open Silk (the browser) it tells me "Silk is not responding." So no Web surfing, though if I choose to shop Amazon or use one of the other built-in apps (like email) I can access the Web.Meanwhile, I gave AT&T; $30 for 30 days of connectivity and it never worked. Two separate phone calls with AT&T; (approx. 75-80 minutes total) yielded nothing. They verified the SIM card and made me reboot several times (which I'd already done on my own before calling). They wanted me to put my SIM card into my cell phone to confirm the SIM card is the problem. Really? With the Kindle browser not working either, it's not the SIM card.Beautiful device, would love to use it (I love my original non-HD Kindle Fire). But it doesn't work. No Web surfing, no 4G (even AT&T; can't figure out why).UPDATE:Amazon customer service really tried. Had to blow everything away and go to factory reset, but that fixed everything. The reboot did the trick. Cost me about a week and some aggravation, but everything is working fine now. Raising my rating to 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: I love the new Kindle HD 8.9!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Eileen
Reviews.Content: I love the bigger screen, the picture clarity and the ease of purchasing items through Amazon. With my keyboard case, I can perform most computer functions on the Kindle.I am definitely a Kindle Fan!!!!

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Reta Thatcher
Reviews.Content: Its just like an apple iPad but cheaper! Its a good size if you want to read a book or watch a movie. I just love it

Reviews.Title: kindle Fire hd
Reviews.Author: linda Zubrycki
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle fire. Don't know how I lived without it.I love books and I never thought I'd be happy reading on a tabletBut that's all I use now. I also find it very easy to purchase things. I use it for my email and watch different episodes of shows on it. I am very happy that I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Pier
Reviews.Content: I love this device! It absolutely met and exceeded my expectations. So glad I ordered it on Amazon. No ads, and it was already registered.

Reviews.Title: the best
Reviews.Author: priscilla jefferson
Reviews.Content: just don't leave home without it . I live and breathe for my Kindle had a few kinks in the beginning but now cool beans.

Reviews.Title: Just perfect!
Reviews.Author: B. Wolberg "Kindle Krazy"
Reviews.Content: I had the first Kindle Fire when it came out and sold it thinking I wouldn't use it much.  Then I saw this and thought, ok.... I gotta have it.  It is set up to be my on the go computer.  Beautiful display, sound, everything.  Perfect price!

Reviews.Title: My First Tablet
Reviews.Author: Erin B. Parker
Reviews.Content: Just about everything has been written about it already, so I'll just add my two cents worth:I've never owned a tablet, or any Apple product so I can't compare this to anything.  All I can say is from my point of view, I am loving it so far.  I got 8.9 inch about a week ago.  I got a really great deal on a refurbished one.  I was happy to find out the charger for my previous Kindle works with this.  So far, I've used it to watch Netflix, browse the web, play games and read.  Display is beautiful, browser is quick.  Sound is very good.  It has everything I need and I'm very happy I purchased it. I got the MoKo Slim-fit Folio Cover Case and I'm happy with it as well.

Reviews.Title: My fourth kindle
Reviews.Author: Becky Davis
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth kindle purchase.  I had the original kindle for about a year, then bought the first kindle fire that came out.  I loved the first fire because of the back lit screen, and the ability to look at e-mail, etc. I then purchased the kindle paperwhite for reading in the car or at the beach because it is small, lightweight, and the fact that the sun didn't glare on the screen.  I gave away/sold my other kindles when purchasing new ones, but have kept the kindle paperwhite for the above mentioned reasons.  Now, this new Kindle is the bomb.  Amazing screen, love to play games on it, easy to see, fast web browsing, and is even great to watch movies/tv shows on it.  I use my hdmi cord and hook it up to our 70" tv to watch tv shows and it works perfectly.  So many things you can do with it, and it's so inexpensive! Can't go wrong with it.  Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: so far I like it
Reviews.Author: Michelle Adleman-Walker "nutmeg"
Reviews.Content: So far it is fun to watch movies in bed, check email, and do some reading all on the same device. I would of liked a bigger view screen and had looked at a few but I do watch a lot of movies on line and it lets you hulu,netflix, and several others. Loading dofin was a pain in the butt. I guess loading most things are easier to do on computers for me though. Most of the programs loaded already are ok for everyday such things, but i did like that amazon sent me 5$ worth of funds to add on my own stuff. Read reviews before loading stuff, get to know what your money is being spent on before you buy it. Not impressed with product as it is over a year old but like it enough to say i would buy it again. The dual band wi-fi is better than my wifes laptop for keeping things streaming. As for the cam it sucks so don't think it is worth taking photo's from this machine, buy a cam. The screen is sharp and I enjoy the picture quality. I don't know how to do some things on the kindle yet but am learning.

Reviews.Title: really disappointed
Reviews.Author: L. D. Gaines
Reviews.Content: the weight is good, the size is good, the picture quality is good, but i'm not pleased with the fact that is freezes  alot and i have to recharge it alot, and there is no front and back camera

Reviews.Title: Nice Product
Reviews.Author: Jag
Reviews.Content: Love this Kindle Fire HD. Good quality picture and worth money spent on this very nice, easy to use tablet.Very good experience with this product.

Reviews.Title: GREAT Purchase
Reviews.Author: scouzo
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my parents and they haven't really gotten into the new tablet technology or even smart phone technology. Not only did it come very easy to them because of the intuitive design and functionality of the Kindle, but it has been fun and reliable. The size of the Kindle is perfect and it's really sleek and durable. It's also very fast and quick to pick up outside wifi networks. This is a great gift and a fantastic starter-tablet for anyone. I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Dusty Corrals "OneGypsyTraveler"
Reviews.Content: I got my Fire about a year ago and I just love it. it's easy to manage, its the perfect size. I have had many people with other brands of Pads tell me the picture quality is way better than theirs. If you have a Mom or Dad that's afraid of a computer, this is the item for them. Easy to work with  work on and Kindle Support is the best there is BAR NONE. I highly recommend Kindle Fire HD

Reviews.Title: Basically like it but it is slow to respond
Reviews.Author: Judy Carlsbad
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Kindle.  The touch screen does not respond as well as my smaller Kindle.  Right now I cannot get it off the greeting so I will have to turn it off and put it back on again and I have only had it for a little over a week.  The plug is in a terrible place as I keep it sideways all the time and as a result the plug is in the bottom so it is hard to use this Kindle while it is plugged in.  Also I am not happy about having a camera in it.  I wish there was an option with no camera.  The videos and sound are very good on this Kindle and email is easier.  Right now I am unable to access the home button as it shows up nowhere on the Kindle.  Unless I press full screen I would really like it better if the home button was available at all times.  It was very easy to set up and most of my cloud apps were there but not all that I thought I had.  I did not realize that some of them would stay on my other Kindle and not appear in the cloud.  I use both Kindles and since I found a good case at Staples I probably will be happier.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Nice!
Reviews.Author: Dollup
Reviews.Content: The wife loves it! Bought it for her birthday! Now the kids can show her how to use it. She wishes it was more intuitive and that web layout was not so small, tiny font. All in all I would rate it at 89%, not bad for the price...

Reviews.Title: Great Reader!!
Reviews.Author: Ken M Cottrell
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoy the Kindle Fire HD.  I'm an avid reader & started with a regular Kindle.  The 8.9"& backlit HD screen made it come alive.  I never thought I would not enjoy holding a book to read it but now it seems like drudgery.  I love being able to touch the screen to turn a page. Also, having Wi-Fi is great when I'm away from my computer.  I don't necessarily like the carousel but can live with it.  I would rather have icons on 1 screen.  Only problem I had was a battery that seemed to go bad.  I read up & other people that got this Kindle when it first came out had the same problem but Amazon replaced it right away.

Reviews.Title: Excellent buy for the price!
Reviews.Author: cinji
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire 8.9" is a great value.  The screen resolution is stunning, reading is enjoyable, and apps are easy to use.  Is it an iPad killer?  Not exactly, but it will do most things.  You can still check and create email, do Facebook, and play some games, but as others have said, the Amazon apps are limited.  I like that I can watch both Netflix and Amazon Prime video (Android tablets like the Nexus 7 have issues with Amazon Prime--I think it can be done, but not easily for the non-tech-savvy. Of course it's a problem on a Nook since they are the competition, which is too bad because the Nook tablet has an amazing screen).The size is a nice in-between the 7" and 10". For the money it's hard to beat.  I gave it a 4 because of the limitations of the apps and because I'm not a fan of the carousel, but those are not deal-breakers.  This tablet is perfect for the value-conscious person.

Reviews.Title: my third kindle
Reviews.Author: Joan Harper
Reviews.Content: Had the seven inch kindle previously and like this larger size screen more because it is so much easier to read and the larger pictures are great especially for videos , hd quality very good..

Reviews.Title: The Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Lisette
Reviews.Content: This is a great buy.  I am very satisfied with everything the Fire Kindle has to offer.  The only reason I gave It four stars is because it is quite heavy compared to my ordinary kindle.  I know the Fire Kindle is larger than the first Kindle Amazon came out with.  I would think the Fire Kindle could be made lighter.

Reviews.Title: Great as a reader and for video, OS is substandard
Reviews.Author: moose_of_many_waters
Reviews.Content: I bought this mostly as a pdf and MS doc reader for book-length manuscripts.  The 7" tablets and 6" eReaders that are out there have too small a screen for me for extended use.  At the price a refurb of the 8.9 HD was offered on sale, I thought it would be worth trying out.  It's a pretty good reader for pdfs, although there isn't any ability to change font size unless you try to convert pdfs into Kindle format via email, which is a hit and miss process.  The screen is fantastic for reading MS docs, very sharp and the 8.9 size makes reading long docs a breeze.I also looked at the ability to watch video (TV and movies) through my Prime account.  The screen is great for that as well, but apparently you can only stream free content.  You can't download unless you pay, which makes this device less desirable for airplane viewing.  Google Play on my 7" Android tablet seems to have a more interesting selection of movies for rental.So the Kindle Fire 8.9 HD is a very good to fantastic device as an e-reader and a pretty good device for watching TV shows and movies.  But as a tablet for apps it isn't good.  Basically, Amazon has defanged the Android OS to make this device work best as an Amazon product delivery system.  Standard apps for Android, like Google Navigation, aren't available.  There are many key apps I use on my Android 7" tablet and Apple iPhone that aren't available.  Everything seems to be oriented toward buying books, movies, TV shows, and apps through Amazon.  It's more than a bit annoying, and the OS used isn't nearly as slick as you'd find with a pure Android or Apple tablet.I'll be happy to use this as a reader for book-length manuscripts.  The quality and size of the screen hold a lot of appeal to me.  But I'll keep using my iPhone and Android 7" tablet for apps.  This device comes up short in that department.

Reviews.Title: What was I waiting for?
Reviews.Author: Suz
Reviews.Content: Well, actually, I was waiting for a good price cut on the Fire HD models, while continuing to use my old first generation 7" Kindle Fire.Last week, Amazon ran a daily deal featuring seriously discounted certified refurb Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablets, so I bought one (32GB).I don't, strictly speaking, or even loosely speaking, *need* this thing. But I certainly like it. It has drawbacks, mostly the stupid carousel interface. I just splurged another fifteen bucks to get rid of the "special offers" so maybe the interface will be less annoying now.However, the display is fine, operations are quick, sound is good (through headphones or small external speakers), and I'm enjoying streaming Amazon Prime video on the FIre HD. I've been able to load (by USB) some instructional video files and some photos onto the tablet, which I like being able to view without needing to be online.I knew it would be an upgrade from my old Kindle Fire, but have been delighted by the improved performance.I was able to snag the Amazon Kindle Fire HD 8.9" Standing Leather Case, Saddle Tan during a Lightning Deal on the same day I bought my discounted refurb HD, which was a lucky buy. It's a really good case, but even at the discount not exactly cheap.Overall, I'm not sorry I waited, but am also not at all sorry I finally bought this Fire HD in the larger size.

Reviews.Title: Silk is a good reason to not buy a Kindle.
Reviews.Author: Karyn Best
Reviews.Content: For emails, books, games and many other reasons I like the Kindle. For going on line, you have to deal with Silk.  I am sick and tired of seeing the message that Silk has stopped working.  If you are using a tablet mostly on line, which I do not, investigate your options. I cannot even use google maps without Silk locking up.

Reviews.Title: Really love my Kindle!
Reviews.Author: Ronald D. Jones
Reviews.Content: I've bought a lot of neat electronics over the years but this is by far the best. The preloaded web browser and email client work greatand reading a book is very nice with the ability to choose text sizes and brightness. I'm most impressed by wireless streaming of videos thru this device to my HDTV...just beautiful! The problem others have mentioned about a lack of 'Flash' video hasn't been a problem....it doesn't work but it hasn't kept me from anything except commercials I didn't want to see anyway! I'm planning on paying for Amazon Prime as soon as my free trial is up.

Reviews.Title: Still Having Issues with the Device
Reviews.Author: Kenneth M. Atcherson
Reviews.Content: I'm currently on my 4th Kindle device based upon the issues that I've had since my purchase at the end of April 2013. When the device works, it's a great device to use.  The size is just right without being bulky.  I also like the ability to download videos & documents from the cloud and to have apps store there without clogging up the device.When problems start with the devices I've had going into sleep mode on the own right during the middle of working on it tends to cause issues when using it for work.  This also becomes frustrating if in the middle of a game and the device goes into sleep mode when you're just about  to hit the high score.  Another issue I've had as been with the Silk Browser.  After utsing it over time it tends to get slower.  There aren't any other browsers available for use unless you want to rig the device and void your warranty.It Kindle can resolve these issues and  open up to more apps that can be accessed in Google Play, you would have an awesome device.  Not sure how the company plans to make this more of a work device versus just an entertainment device.  A free fully functioning application with MS Office would be great.

Reviews.Title: 8,9 kindle 4G lte 64
Reviews.Author: Michael K. T. Huie
Reviews.Content: I like it but slower than the 7in. wifi, would have been better with charge plug on the side, the first one had a problem and was replaced quickly

Reviews.Title: Exactly What I Needed from a Tablet
Reviews.Author: Kristy Lange
Reviews.Content: I had long been debating whether or not I actually needed a Surface or iPad, and came to the conclusion that I did not. If you don't need all the bells and whistles of a much more expensive tablet, the Kindle Fire HD may just be for you! I wanted something that could hold a good charge, I could check my emails on, browse the internet, write the occational paper, take notes, and read easily. This definitely does the trick. So much more affordable than other tablets (of course, they can do more) The Kindle Fire HD was the perfect choice for me.I still don't know why, after all this time, Amazon has not made a Kindle Fire HD user guide, but that's not a big deal. You can basically search the internet for anything you need to know or download one of the many free or cheap Kindle Fire HD userguides that have been put up in the app store.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: scotty parnell
Reviews.Content: I really like this, never had one .I would recommend this to anyone ,it is easy and convient.really easy .

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9" 4G LTE Wireless
Reviews.Author: gourdland
Reviews.Content: I already had the KFHD 8.9" without the 4G. I use it for games, surfing the net, and watching shows on Amazon Prime. I purchased the 4G and the $49.99 data plan so that when I go to secluded areas without wifi, I am (hopefully) connected. I used my first KFHD about 18 hrs a day until I got the 4G. I now use the 4G about 18 hrs a day and the other KFHD maybe 6 hours a week. I like my KFHDs and just wish Amazon would make a device to download more movies, shows I've purchased so when I go camping (and don't have wifi) I will still have access to ALL the programming I have purchased.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable!!!
Reviews.Author: Hootiewoo
Reviews.Content: The 8.9 is a must have, light weight, easy to use, and it just looks great! The only thing I wasn't happy with was it didn't come with the new update, but it was fine after that, go get the Kindle Fire 8.9!!

Reviews.Title: Loved my first Kindle Fire and..........
Reviews.Author: Patsy F. Shinn
Reviews.Content: My HD Kindle Fire is even more loveable!  Have downloaded books which I really enjoyed reading during my recent 7-day cruise.  Also, love playing card games and "Words with Friends".  Lotza fun with this Kindle HD Fire!

Reviews.Title: My greatest reading/viewing toy ever
Reviews.Author: Mark F. Braun
Reviews.Content: I bought a slightly used Kindle Fire 8.9 16 gig and what a lifechanger! My TIME subscription is an easier, more blown-out read on the Kindle, and with a short stack of library books on it, I can see how people read multiple books at once (well, think back to school and multiple textbooks; you'll now regain that ability and love it). Yes, email's great, although I've changed to another browser and also added a minimal bunch of apps that allow for comic book reading (CRZ/CBR files) as well as periodicals (Zinio is insanely good for world magazines).I didn't exprecto fall in love with the Kindle for TV shows, but it is an intimate viewing experience. Fast wifi. Get the leatherette case to make it stand; the microUSB is easy to get extra cable for ($4 anywhere). Easy to charge, Kindle has converted this old-fashioned reader into a newer media fan. Bring on the newspapers and ROLLING STONE. Make the TIME cover story on bees go BZZZZZZ and throw in pop-up FYIs to help me understand who and what is what.Oh, and certainly add on the FREE antivirus app and beware of "bloatware" that can just eat up space on that 16 gig drive. Yes, you can use the cloud, but be careful and enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: HD Fire into my eyes
Reviews.Author: Justin D Meierhenry
Reviews.Content: Ordered this yesterday with the Promotion price and the Certified Refurbished unit.Super fast next day shipping.Beautiful video streaming, don't even have the HD setting turned on.Fast fluid menus.App store is not the best but this is something I already knew. But with the way Prime Instant Video has evolved over the past year (Which lead me to finally cancel Netflix in favor of Prime.) I am sure the app store will be on par within a few years or sooner.The sound that pumps out of the tiny speakers is pretty great, much better than the Ipod dock I have in my bathroom with a built in sub. Which doesn't speak to highly on that product at all, But it was cheap, you always get what you pay for.This will now be a solid edition to my desk at work (Which I have currently hooked up to my Logitech Speaker System Z623, which if you are in the market for great desktop speakers with huge kick I would highly recommend these. I got mine originally from Newegg.com but I'm sure Amazon sells them also.After I signed up for prime I've wanted to get a Kindle. I snagged the regular fires last year for my Nieces for Christmas (Which they love by the way.) So I figured I would pop for the big daddy Fire HD 8.9. This will make reading much more easy on the eyes instead of using my Galaxy Note with the Kindle app.All in all, I have only had this item for going on 4 hours, But my work is done, and The Goonies is playing by my side so all in all... Today was a victory. Thanks Amazon. Shut up and take my money!!! :)

Reviews.Title: Doesn't hold a charge.
Reviews.Author: S. Lodge "book lover"
Reviews.Content: I was a bit disappointed at the amount of time the Kindle will stay working throughout the day.  It seems to lose energy really fast.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: amy
Reviews.Content: I love it- bought it for reading and playing some games, it does great for both. Really nice HD and color. I haven't tried watching movies on it yet, but am planning to.

Reviews.Title: My granddaughter is very happy with her Kindle Fire, she said is amazing.
Reviews.Author: chito
Reviews.Content: My Granddaughter is so happy with the Kindle Fire 8.9". She has also the small one, but she told me that  this one is amazing.

Reviews.Title: So great
Reviews.Author: PATRICIA Espinosa Ruiz "crazy for shops"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my grand pa cause hi cant read small letters and this ítem was very confortable for him

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire HD 8.9!!
Reviews.Author: Rodney E.
Reviews.Content: Just what I wanted!!! Does everything and more than I expected. Thank you Amazon Warehouse you made my birthday perfect!

Reviews.Title: Good tablet!
Reviews.Author: Brenda S
Reviews.Content: Received this as a replacement for a broken 1st Gen Fire (power port issue)and love it.  Great size - not too big and not too small.  The HD picture is awesome for movies\videos\games\etc.  The sound is an improvement from the 1st Gen I had but could still sue some tweaking - love to see the speakers make it to the front somehow.  They are currently on the back side which means the case can cause some interruption in the quality of the sound.  If you use it without a case you have to be careful where you set it to not block the speakers.  The only other change would be the camera - it is currently located on the front (for use with Skype)which makes it very difficult to take pictures and videos are out....  They need to enable to camera to flip like the iPhone so you can use skype or take pics\video.  If those changes were made this table would be a 5 star piece of equipment.  JMHORecommed!

Reviews.Title: Dropped the ball on Next Day Delivery = Goofed by pre-configuring tablet with full open account access of buyers account.
Reviews.Author: Steve Fields "fields24"
Reviews.Content: After ordering the item I requested, next day shipping, (AmazonPrime) as a present, It was not SHIPPED UNTIL the NEXT DAY. Needless to say it was not received in "next day manner" but after 4 days. And I also found that the item, « to be given as a gift » was already pre-configured  with my account access and account history, with ability to order from MY Amazon account.This was nice to find out thanks to the fact that at least it for was for my adult daughter who warned me just after she booted it up and logged on.  Amazon needs to take more care in how they ship a desired item in such as a way since if someone else had picked up my delivered package from the porch they would have had full access to my Amazon Account. And had a field day with my account. They did at least refund the 3.99 for the special shipping. Thanks!Even if I had meant the tablet to go to a nephew or friend I still do not think that the things should be sent default , turned on,  and then find that they are in the Purchaser's account and ready to order more things FOR FREE.  Amazon Please fix this!!!!Besides all this: She loves it and is presently checking out what all it can do and laughing as she finds new features.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD!!!
Reviews.Author: Chas Mac
Reviews.Content: Best thing I bought in a long time,been using it for about a year can't put it down still after all this time.I do everything with it,music,video,apps,web,books This is a great one Amazon can't wait for the next one.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase!
Reviews.Author: Runhiker
Reviews.Content: My previous Kindle Generation One was stolen after several years of use and had to be replaced. I had noticed the three options in obtaining a new Kindle reader so when I saw this refurbished Kindle Fire HD 8.9 4G LTE with all the bells and whistles, I went for it and have not been disappointed. I still don't know or have used all its features but every now and than I try something else and am amazed at its capability. I decided to subscribe to Prime and that has added additional features that make my Kindle Fire even more amazing. I highly recommend it and I am quite pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE MY KINDLE FIRE
Reviews.Author: Likes DS games "Ollie"
Reviews.Content: I bought a KINDLE reader with a keyboard when it came out and I loved it. Then Kindle Fire came out and I bought it and loved it. Then Kindle Fire HD 8.9 came out and I thought for 2 seconds "Do I need this?" And my answer was "Yes!" And I have enjoyed it every day since! I have Amazon Prime and watch shows. I look up things on the net.I have many apps games, stories for my grandchildren etc. ( Amazon offers a free app a day!) I check weather daily for home and other areas.I take it when I travel. I hardly ever turn on my computer. There are so many things it can do, just like a computer. I listen to my music. Read my books.  Check my mail.The screen is beautiful, the speakers great. You can Skype. As much as I love the first Fire, I love this more. Any age would enjoy this and find other uses I don't mention. Amazon help if you need it is EXCELLENT! They are always there for you. You can't go wrong with this item.

Reviews.Title: easy on the eyes
Reviews.Author: Poppy "est. 1998"
Reviews.Content: ...Have the 7" version.  Love the refurbished 8.9" model.  Had a couple of days when the WiFi connection was acting squirrely. Amazon support was patient and helpful.  May have been interference from a nearby neighbor, but the 7" model had no trouble.  Problem seems to be history.  Have received a new OS version as well as a new version of Silk.  The device is fast and easier to see and use vs. the 7" model.  Very happy, happy, happy.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Texas Jim
Reviews.Content: As expected it exceeded  my two other Kindles in every manner but one, and that was battery life. I'll adjust to that and it will not be a problem. Its like carrying around a small flat screen TV. Great sound, picture and easy to use.It is used like a Lap Top too. Would recommend this to people that have children in Grade School.

Reviews.Title: a great deal
Reviews.Author: bcso59
Reviews.Content: I use my kindle hd 8.9" every day.  It's easy to navigate  and doesn't take long to get accustomed to.  I hardly get on my laptop or use my iPad anymore.  (Just purchased the 7" kindle fire hd to keep in my purse.)  Would definitely recommend the kindle fire hd.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: patricia mashek-aras
Reviews.Content: Love it, its very touchy, have to get used to the touch screen. battery doesn't seem to last as long as I thought. Picture is sooooo crisp and clear.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Cindy Tommervik
Reviews.Content: I had the original kindle and it served my purposes just fine. I bought my Granddaughter the 7" Kindle Fire and when I saw what that one could do I decided to jump to the 8.9" for myself. Wonderful performance and versatility. Our other Granddaughter stayed with us for a week and fell in love with the new 8.9". She will have a Kindle Fire under the tree at Christmastime.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful!
Reviews.Author: Sandra Starich
Reviews.Content: This was purchased by my daughter and she loves it...especially the Internet capabilities.  A great price for a great product!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9" Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 16 GB
Reviews.Author: Amazon lvr
Reviews.Content: I love almost everything about this Kindle Fire HD! The one thing I am so very disappointed in is when you are typing in something. It CONSTANTLY skips spaces and never types what you want. The one thing that works is when you use the Swype. I was going to get an iPad and went with the Kindle Fire HD instead (because I had the original Kindle 2nd Generation and LOVED IT!!!)I wish the typing aspect was as pleasurable as the rest of the Kindle!

Reviews.Title: Their were no instruction, written, to get started with. I did not find it easy to work my way through all the apps.
Reviews.Author: Don Dunlop
Reviews.Content: Their were no written instructions to help get started. I did not find it easy to work my way through the apps. I wanted to use, I am a computer novice. I think I should have started with just a reader and then taken the next step to the fire.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire 8.9
Reviews.Author: allison robertson
Reviews.Content: FIRE  HD 8.9 don't like at&t; everything else is great. does what it says it wil.l have had no problems

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: You Know
Reviews.Content: I LOVE IT does everything you need perfect size, scene and device. The apps are great with slot of free ones to pick from.

Reviews.Title: Bigger is better
Reviews.Author: DmC
Reviews.Content: I already had a 7 inch Kindle Fire and I must say that the extra size makes a huge difference in usability. I just keep this one at home and it's basically eliminated my need for a separate computer.
